summary_comment: Prof. Cravens-Brown is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, making her class both enjoyable and manageable with ample extra credit opportunities. Students find her genuinely invested in their success and appreciate the minimal workload, though some note that lectures can be somewhat boring. Overall, she is seen as a supportive and entertaining instructor who fosters a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Cravens-Brown is a passionate and engaging instructor. Her class is manageable with lots of extra credit opportunities. The content is interesting, and she genuinely cares about her students' success. unstuckstudy was a helpful study tool alongside the readings and lectures.

Weekly homework: chapter reading & reading assignment (usually 30-45 minutes). Lectures were interesting & engaging. Attendance tracked by top hat questions (2-4 per class). NO EXAMS. 4 application assignments (~15 questions). Participation in research program is required; took up time outside of class but was easy. Minimal work. Highly recommend.

She's great! The lectures aren't necessarily mandatory but there's solely in-class activities that make it more encouraged for students to attend class. There was no final exam for us which made it stress-free. She has a somewhat strict no phone policy and a laptop zone in the lecture hall but it wasn't a big deal since notes weren't required.

Please disregard my grade because I missed far too many classes; otherwise, I would've gotten closer to an A with minimum effort. The lectures can get pretty boring. She does have her TA's watch for people getting off-task (on phones, on laptops, talking, etc.) so if you cannot help yourself with that kind of thing, maybe choose another professor.
She sure has energy! Its a fun class but if you don't really like psych it can be a drag. She is super entertaining and keeps the students engaged.

I'm obsessed with Lisa CB, she is so funny and really wants to keep her students interested in the material. You can also tell she genuinely cares about all her students and wants them to do well. She's super kind and there's not a ton of outside work, I would definitely take her as a professor again!

Easy to get a good grade. Provide 12 extra credits. Use Tophat to take attendance and ask questions. Can miss a few lectures and recitations based on your grade. No final exam, but optional quiz point make up exam(score will add to quiz category as extra credit.)

READ THE ENTIRE SYLLABUS. I didn't and it put me behind a lot on REP credits. But CB does a good job keeping students informed of deadlines. Very funny and interesting person; lectures weren't bad. Extra credit! Lots of points are from in-class. This isn't a class you'll want to skip if you want an A. Weekly quizzes are just vocab, pretty easy.

Such an easy and interesting class! LCB is a very fun professor and is very approachable. There is plenty of extra credit throughout different sections, and she sets the course up so you can earn more points than you can get, basically giving you points to throw away.

Dr. Cravens-Brown is so cool. I had my intro to psych class in a lecture hall of 600 and was still able to learn the content and do well. She's easy to contact outside of class and is always straightforward with grading. Overall I'd highly recommend taking a class with her!
Vocab quizzes are given every Tuesday but super easy! I would love to take her again!

She is an easy laid back teacher. We have weekly 5 point quizzes that take maybe 15 minutes to study for every Tuesdays. She goes through a lot of case studies and examples when she lectures. She does top hat questions which are like general questions for points every class.

Dr. Cravens-Brown was awesome. This class was about psychology podcasts and was mainly a discussion-based class. She was very interesting and intelligent and it was a very engaging class that felt like a community. It's very easy to get an A as long as you show up every day and do the discussion posts.

She's friendly and approachable, and I enjoyed taking her class. No textbook, but a lot of reading in her class, mainly research articles for group projects. Be prepared to communicate/work with many different people in the class; almost every day is a group project with a randomly-assigned group. Graded on completion of assignments and attendance.

Conflicted about her - very good, high quality prof who's passionate about clinical psych. but her teaching style is unorthodox - no lectures which means no notes/slides. Class title is deceptive - not actually about clinical psych. Exams are essay for better/worse but lots of extra credit opps. grading is strict. nothing is hard but unfamilar.
She made class fun and interesting.
She made class funny and interesting. I never skipped this class. There aren't any major surprises on her tests, just study the material and you'll do well.

You need the book for the online exams. I can't imagine trying to do those without it. Participation matters a lot, it's like 30% of your grade, but she's hilarious so it was rare that I didn't want to go to class.

Definitely the best professor I've had at OSU! Couldn't bring myself to skip her class because it was so fun. Exams are all online, and a decent amount of your grade comes from attendance/participation. She makes topics that are sometimes seen as taboo really easy to discuss. Show up and make sure you get the textbook and you'll pass.

Dr. CB is awesome! Super engaged in lectures and gives really relatable/funny personal stories. Makes the topic of sex very comfortable and fun. Uses random tophat questions for participation points. Exams are all online and decently easy. Buy/rent the book. Definitely recommend taking her and this class, you won't regret it!
She is just wonderful. So engaged in class with interesting material to lecture on. She doesn't lecture on what is on the textbook so that part is up to you, but the textbook is an easy read.

Lisa was a professor that cared A LOT about what she taught, as well as having a good relationship with her students. This class style is different than others in the way that there were no exams, almost all of the points came from in-class participation and assignments. Its a good filler class, but there is work during class unlike others.

I learned so much from Lisa in my gender class. For one, she didn't teach a regular lecture(slide)class. The students were communicating with each other, and the conversations had a lasting impression on me. I find myself talking about the content of the course to everyone I encounter now. Thank you for this delightful experience, Lisa.
I thought I didn't like her for like a good month or 2, but turns out she is really cool. I just didn't  how it sounded as if she was getting smart with me when I spoke to her.
I loved this class. The professor is super hilarious and makes the class engaging. Easy A if you take notes.

I love Lisa!! I've taken two of her classes and she's been great for both of them. The tests can be a little tricky, especially for this class. (But I also didn't read as much as I should've.) Her lectures are fun and interesting, and she's very approachable and loves to help you out if you go to office hours.

Dr. CB is my favorite teacher I have ever had. The subject material is my academic focus, so I'm biased in saying that it is super interesting, but I think most people agree, it rocks. The tests are entirely based off of in-class lectures, so you have to show up, but you'll want to come anyways because the class rocks.

She is one of my favorite teachers, you can tell she loves what she does.   She also does a great job at making lectures interesting.  But make sure you attend class, she does a lot of participation points

Professor Cravens-Brown was amazing!! A lot of particpation so attendance is a must!! But you'll find yourself wanting to go to learn about the day's discussion and subject! She was always bright and cheery and really made the class quite delightful!

SO many in class assignments, hard tests, but she was a good teacher and stats was required for a psych degree so if you have to take this class then I would take it with her because I was actually able to understand the content

Dr. Cravens-Brown is an extremely intellectual woman, and I recommend taking her Human Sexuality class to anyone who may be interested. She's very clear about grades from the get-go and attending class is paramount since almost all of the exam questions are based on lectures (maybe 15% come from the book, so you need to have it as well).
Great instructor but as far as exams go, 90% of the material on the exams is from the lectures so good notes are key.
Lisa was AWESOME. Assignments and Exams were all online. Allows you to use notes. Lectures were fun and active. Nothing really bad to say. I would recommend her class!

LCB is a good teacher, but you will be very dependent upon the textbook for most learning. Reading is essential. HW every week and easy exams. I studied <1.5 hrs per exam and scored very close to perfect. 5% total extra credit also helps. TBH, I didn't pay attention too much in class and did well. Only took class for the minor. No major complaints.

Dr. C-B is a very enlightened professor. She does more than deliver information because she challenges the student to think for themselves. Some people may get offended because she is very research based, but take it as a grooming lesson. Especially if you wish to go to grad school or do research. She's down to earth and great at what she does.

Though everyone I've talked to says they loves her as a teacher, She can not teach this class. Nothing makes sense. Her slides are useless. I am surviving in the class by learning everything from the book, not her. Take this class with another professor!
She is a brilliant teacher. It wasn't hard at all to pay attention in her 8am class. Loved every minute of it.

She is a breath of fresh air! I talked about loving her class so much my friends started coming to her class just for fun. She is wonderful. If you come to class and do your work, it's an easy A. Online exams, attendance is extra credit and the online reading assignments are fascinating! TAKE THIS CLASS.

Great class, many easy extra credit opportunities, online exams. You can tell Lisa is knowledgeable and passionate about the subject, but she also adds in humor to her lectures. You'll need to go to class to do well, but I didn't purchase the book and ended up with a high A.

She is an extremely interesting teacher, and I enjoyed her vibrant personality and sense of humor. She knows how to teach and she does it well. The tests were all on CARMEN and timed, but it helped that I was able to glance over my notes if I needed them. Overall, she is a solid teacher, and I would recommend taking a class with her.
This professor was alright. The class in general was pretty easy (it was mostly just a vocab centered class).

I was really excited to take a class with her due to all of the good reviews.  boy was I wrong. She comes off as very rude, and has no problem failing you on the group project if she doesn't like the topic you chose. She also spends a lot of time telling boring, personal stories that don't relate to the material. The tests are easy though.
Best teacher ever!!!

This class was really easy. She let us redo 2 tests (so that you can get up to 100% on them). However, I was not one of the people to actually like the teacher herself. Every single time I asked a question, she'd reply with, "Oh, I can't tell you that." She did this 3 separate times. So I went to the TA and she would answer my questions.

I stumbled onto Prof Cravens-Brown out of a mutual interest in subject matter. Doing an independent study is pretty difficult but she made it soooo fun. She would have me in tears sometimes because she is so funny!!! She was able to communicate the difficult material in a very clear way. She is a wealth of knowledge and will keep you on your toes!

MOST AMAZING TEACHER AT OSU! Human Sexuality is the most interesting and fun class and Lisa is truly the best teacher I have ever had! She is informative, makes class fun and is really passionate! If you get the chance to take her class, DO IT!
Stats in Psychology may be a boring subject but she makes it very interesting and is very helpful its a somewhat difficult class but she breaks everything down very well.
She is the best lecturer! She is so helpful, clear and interesting. Take every class she teaches, you will not regret it.
Awesome professor. She's hilarious and her lectures are enjoyable
I absolutely loved this class. Very helpful teacher who loves what she teaches and it shows in how she conducts herself during classes. Could not recommend this woman enough!
She was the best professor I have had at OSU. She is energetic and makes material interesting. There is no busy work in this course and options for bonus points.

She is literally the best prof I have had at OSU. Her lectures are extremely entertaining and you learn a lot. She uses a lot of humor and stories about her family/life to keep class awesome. Take her for whatever class you can. This class should be required for the major!

Dr. Cravens-Brown is a great professor to have. She tells great stories about her children and family that relates to class. She also shares things about when she was doing therapy. She made boring and sad topics entertaining and easy to learn.  Great class to take.
Enjoyed the material and the attituted she had while teaching us. I would recommend this class to anyone even semi-interested in this subject.

She is an awesome teacher. Very knowledgeable over the topics she teaches and is very genuinely interested in helping people and see them succeed. The class is very interesting and she is very entertaining in her lectures and incorporates interesting media. I would 100% recommend her as a teacher.

Interesting class and the perfect professor to take it with!  She is very clear and enthusiatic about what she does and there will never be a boring day in class. Homework reading material is even interesting.  I have learned and will be taking a lot out of this class. Highly highly recommend!!

very entertaining! topics are interesting and she tells fun stories at the same time. tests are simple if you study. attendance isn't mandatory, but you'll want to go and get the notes... she also gave extra credit to those with high attendance.

Very eccentric teacher - fun to listen to. Had one issue with my project grade - she told us after we turned in the project that if we did what she asked us, we would get a B, and only by doing extra will you get an A. Otherwise nice teacher.

She's a lecturer, so her main focus is to teach, which is a very nice change from many professors in the psych department. Class was fun and interesting with plenty of extra credit. Definitely my favorite class this quarter.
Awesome, awesome class. Lisa was a very enthusiastic, interesting and helpful professor. This class is pretty easy just make sure you go to lecture, a lot of info on the exams come just from lecture!

She's very very good! I like the way she arrange the schedules and she's very helpful if you have questions. lectures are very important even though she will let you make up attendance by finishing extra homework, going to class very helps a lot! take her class.
Makes class very easy and entertaining.
attendance isn't mandatory but there is a sign in sheet every class - if you attend all of them you get bonus points. really fun teacher, tons of stories and always an interesting class to attend
very good attitude toward teaching! Makes stats easy to understand.
Awesome professor, relates subject matter to real events and stories from her life, couldn't imagine a better prof to teach a class on sex.  and you'll learn a lot!

Lisa is such a fun and exciting teacher! I love her! She will make you burst out laughing in an 8am class. Lecture is mandatory since she doesn't post any notes. Grade comprised of 5 carmen discussions, 3 midterms, and a non-cumulative final. Go to class, study a little, and you will have no problem. I highly recommend taking a class with her!!!!!!
She is awesome..very recommended
Lisa Cravens-Brown is extremely dedicated to her students. Her class is full of hands on learning and humor.

The class was great, Extremely interesting.  I enjoyed the subject and she kept me awake for an 8:30 am class.  The only issue i had with her was that she is opinionated and pushes her views on the class as FACT. She claims to be open minded, yet she only considers her own ideologies to be correct and dismisses all other possibilities
Loved her.  She was the most interesting professor I've ever had.  Great sense of humor, made me want to go to lecture.

I think Lisa Cravens-Brown is an awesome teacher who communicates the subject matter very clearly and thoroughly! She is very passionate about the subject matter which makes the class atmosphere very inviting and relaxed. It was an 7:30am class and she made it so interesting that it was almost impossible to fall asleep in class! Awesome teacher who
Very helpful and extremely enjoyable class environment! You can tell she loves her job and that's what makes a great teacher! Very clear and is quite funny! :) You'll enjoy this class!
excellent and very easy course. quizzes online with the book and periodic projects. no midterms, and no final if you do well on the quizzes!
Great teacher, not very difficult. This class was a lot of fun, but there were so few points that if you missed a few, you were in a bit of trouble. Would definitely recommend, though.

Great teacher, enjoys teaching students and helps keep classes interesting with stories about all of her experiences in therapy.  You do lose points for missing a class, but exams are based off the notes with maybe 3-5 questions from the text.  Overall she's great and I'd recommend any of her classes
Professor is really funny and helpful!  My all-time favorite class at OSU!

She is awesome. One of the best, most passionate professors I have ever had. Attendance was mandatory, but that was no problem, I love going to class. She has a great, fun, goofy personality and really know her psychology. She definitely goes out of her way to help her students and has helped me out a lot. Love her.
She is fantastic! She's a great teacher and she's really funny. The class is already interesting and she makes it even better. Take this class!
Very very good teacher. She knows what she is talking about!

Pretty decent class, you have to attend to get the attendance grade (20 points). Also, there are 4 exams, 30 points each plus 6 extra credit homework assignments worth 1 point each. Pretty easy class if you attend lecture; she doesnt post the notes or outlines online or send them to you via email, even for an excused absense.

Attendance is required.  If it weren't, the only people who would be there are the girls who love to giggle ecstatically as she brags about how great her two kids are.  I aced every test but got a C on attendance (reading the book is much more enjoyable), which is telling of her teaching abilities.
Awesome class! She's an awesome teacher and makes lecutres hilarious.  This is the only class I look forward to going to... def take her 333.02 class on human sexuality!

She was great! She is very very liberal though and she devotes much of the class to homosexuality and not much to heterosexuality.  Overall she was funny and the class is very easy! Only textbook question on a test was a bonus no need to buy.
She makes her Psych 333.02 class interesting and funny.  She also has a lot of stories.  The exams are not the easiest, but she offers extra credit.

She's fantastic! I took both 540 and 333.02 with her and loved both. She's very personable and engaging, as well as incredibly helpful. Exams are not the easiest but don't let that scare you away because you will enjoy learning from her. She is definitely my favorite professor at Ohio State.

Puts outlines on Carmen that follow the notes in class.  Just print the outline, come to class, fill it out and you have an easy A.  You could also get by with filling it out yourself via the textbook, but it was easier to go to class.  The exams came directly from the class notes.

Extremely interesting lectures.  However, her tests were somewhat hard, but she curved significantly at the end of the quarter.  One of my favorite professors at OSU.  Make sure you go to office hours...it helps out a lot!

She is very energetic and makes the class interesting.  I think her 530 class was easier than it normally would be because I took in summer quater.  There were 4 exams.  Each was multiple choice and 30 minutes long.  She also provided extra credit opportunities.
She grades her homeworks easy, do all of the extra credit. Her exams however were very lengthy and sometimes difficult.
Great, nice, and helpful teacher.

Laura is an AMAZING professor because she is so personable and  very organized. She relates her real-world experience to what she is teaching and makes the classroom experience relaxed and enjoyable. Probably the BEST professor that I have ever had an Ohio State and I'm not even a Psychology Major. She made it worth getting up at 8:30am.

Everyone should take this class! Its so fun, interesting and not too difficult. Homework is easy, test arent too hard (if you study)and there are lots of opportunities for bonus (do them). GO TO CLASS and you wont need to read, however, this is the greatest book you will ever have for a class.

I thought she was wonderful, and I sincerely wish I could take more classes with her. Her lectures are all power point, and everything is explained in complete detail. Absolutely NO NEED to buy the book, as she only will quiz you on her class notes. The quizzes are fair, and HW is graded easily. You do not want to have to do the 4th h.w. (its hard!

Hit or miss.  Material was interesting, a few too many personal ancedotes, and she likes to use semi-tricky questions on quizzes.  She is incredibly knowledgable, and I took a lot away from here.  I got a B from just going to every class and never touching the book.

She was a pretty awesome lecturer. Kept up with current research and told us alot of side stories that help in remembering the material. Very helpful professor, clear and interesting lectures. I would definitely take her class again and recomend her class to anyone else interested.
The lectures are very interesting and she has alot of fun stories to go with them! I thought the quizzes and homeworks are very fair and information is very interesting!

Had her for 333 and 530.  Both classes were relatively easy.  Lectures go right along with the book, and tests aren't too hard if you come to class.  She's funny and often lets class out early.  Overall, a really good professor.

Probably one of the least sympathetic people I have ever met. Lectures were boring, homework was pointless and she doesn't grade them herself. All together worse professor I've had here. My greatest sympathy's go out to those of you who have class with her
Very interesting class, and she is willing to help you succeed on the tests. Very approachable and lectures were easy to follow and went right along with the book.
Tests are a little hard but keeps class fun and interesting.

Great class, great teacher! Didn't mind the class starting at 8:30a because the information was so interesting. She told great stories about her kids and was very willing to answer questions. No need for the book, quizzes are pretty easy if you study and the final isn't much worse. Highly recommended!

I adored this class and this professor.  Quizzes are easy if you attend class and go over your notes. The text book is totally unnecessary. This professor is funny and makes lecture fun to attend; I managed to make it to class nearly every day for an 830 lecture.

Very helpful teacher. She is also very kind and funny. The class material is not very exciting but she does a great job to keep you interested (considering it is a psych requirement). Homework is not too difficult and she grades fairly. Tests arent super easy but they arent too hard. She likes applied questions rather than definitions.

took human sexuality with her.  class was interesting and humorous at times.  assignments were not very hard and graded fairly.  sometimes she took a long time to return our graded homework.  don't need to read the book -- nearly all of the material is presented in lecture.  just attend class and you'll be fine.
Really good teacher, makes class fun and interesting.
Great professor.  She's very helpful, informative, and fun but you will definitely have to study for her tests.
No Comments
You rock girl :)

She is an awesome teacher.  There is not a lot of work either.  There is reading but you do not have to do it because her notes are so good and her tests come from her notes.  She is available for help if need be.  She also makes the material very easy to understand.  I highly suggest taking any class with her.
She's fantastic!
LISA IS AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!! The best prof in the department

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on the Teaching of Psychology

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on the Teaching of Psychology

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on the Teaching of Psychology

summary_comment: Dr. Turner is highly regarded for his teaching quality, known for being understanding, humorous, and engaging. Students appreciate his clear explanations, funny jokes, and participation incentives like his in-class tophat. However, his exams can be challenging, requiring significant memorization and preparation.

Ratings.comment: I loved this professor. I was having a lot of issues with my accommodations, and he was nothing but understanding. A super chill guy, and his exams are just effort. You gotta go to class and learn. He explains everything well, and has funny jokes and references.

Dr. Turner is an awesome professor. The main thing you need to do is ATTEND LECTURE. Not only is it important, because some of his slides are pictures and you need the in-person context but he's genuinely so funny and tries his best to keep us engaged and participating. Love that man and would highly recommend!!

Dr. Turner starts off the semester saying he's not comedian and more of a researcher, yet consistently made every lecture enjoyable. Super straightforward exams just go to lectures. I also appreciated his movie references.
As long as you go to class, exams are easy and straightforward questions straight from lecture and slide. By far the funniest professor I've taken, even when he's not trying to be.

Very solid professor. Super nice and funny little jokes here and there to keep the class awake. Definitely go to class, the powerpoints dont have enough text to get by just downloading them and not paying any attention. Also, in-class tophat is pretty much just participation points. Study a couple days in advance for exams and youll be fine.

Intro to ERP was a difficult class only because the concepts were very in depth, but he and the TA went easy on the grading because of this. I really felt like a lot of information was cut out because it was so detailed. This probably could be two or three classes. You will also learn how to code.

Dr. Turner's class exams were RIDICULOUSLY difficult. He expected you to recall examples from class from MONTHS prior to the exam without informing you that it would be on the exam. His test is strictly memorization and less about learning the content. Good luck trying to get a meeting with him because he is only in Columbus 2 days a week.
He is pretty good. I'd recommend him. My only complaint is he wears sweaters a bit too often for my taste. I think it's unhealthy.

Can be confusing because he doesnt always have text explaining some slides but if you go to class you usually get what he means. Likes to focus on studies behind concepts which is nice. Has some relatively easy hw assignments to help your grade and his exams arent too bad. study 1-2 days for them. Super helpful with questions.  Nice guy.

lectures are lengthy and sometimes cause info overload. he really is passionate about cognitive neuroscience but his lectures are tiring. simple assignments and few and far between but article readings are long. be prepared for awkward silences to ensue during lectures.

Sometimes is a bit unclear or a bit dry in lectures, but all in all, he is a really smart dude and really enthusiastic about cognitive neuroscience. The class wasn't very hard to begin with, but he was always very willing to help students and to ensure that everyone succeeded.

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Techniques and Topics in Cognitive Neuroscience

summary_comment: Based on student comments, Professor Pino is generally perceived as either highly effective or extremely challenging, depending on the student's perspective. Some students found her lectures drawn out and overly detailed, while others praised her clear expectations, caring nature, and willingness to accommodate students. Common criticisms include mandatory attendance due to TopHat and Respondus usage, which can impact grades, and the perception that the class treats college students like elementary school children.

Ratings.comment: Horrible professor, DO NOT TAKE. Treats us like we are kids & explains stuff that is COMMON SENSE down to the detail. Attendance is mandatory and will tank your grade if you don't go. Everything you learn in the class, you can learn by yourself by reading the textbook. LONG BORING lecture, she doesn't care abt anything but her class (1/2 Post)

Dr. Pino is really nice & probably a good person, but her classes are so painful, I wouldn't recommend them to anyone. She treats college students like elementary schoolers, continues lecturing past scheduled time, uses tophat to track attendance every class, uses respondus for exams & knowledge checks, & schedules exam reviews outside of class.

Attendance is mandatory due to TopHat, and it can drop your grade if you aren't there each lecture. Material was not difficult, but lectures were very drawn out and felt over explained. Knowledge checks are open book, which was a plus. The 3 exams were not terrible. She's a hard grader on missions. Not a terrible class, just hard to pay attention.

Dr. Pino was great. She has clear expectations and outlines the class in a consistent way. I averaged a B on exams (without much studying) which weren't too bad. Reading the textbook isn't even necessary if you show up. However, do NOT skip her class. She does not post lecture slides. TopHat and knowledge checks count for a lot! Just show up!

Dr. Pino was a great professor, and I would love to take another class of hers! Her exams are pretty straight forward and easy to study for and she's a pretty easy grader when it comes to the writing assignments. Attendance does matter for knowledge checks, but otherwise she's very accommodating and has great late work policies.
She's very nice and her exams are easy to study for. She does knowledge checks only available during class time and it's locked by a password so attendence is pretty much mandetory.

Dr. Pino is an exceptional professor! She really cares about her students and truly sets everyone up to excel in her classes. She gives plenty of resources and is very organized in her teaching style. I would love to take another class of hers. She, in my opinion, is the ideal professor. She's very accommodating and compassionate, too!

Dr. Pino was a great and understanding professor. Yes, her lectures were slow to get through but she made sure everyone understood the material. She is easy to reach for help on issues. Tophats are a big part of participation so, come to class! Overall Dr. Pino cared a lot about her students!
Easy class but the lectures were a drag to sit through and you had to go for points even though the material is all common sense.

She really cares about her students and always tries to get you to engage in lecture. There is a lot of reading, but lectures are straightforwards, but she moves through them slowly and over explains stuff. Attendance pretty much required to get points on tophat and not miss in class assignments. Accommodating and SLDS friendly.

Interesting class but over explained everything. Had guided notes so if you missed class could not get them, and always did tophats. Exams are pretty easy and there is extra credit. Really nice professor just did too much sometimes.

I'll give everyone a crash course. The lectures are long, but you must go as questions for a grade are taken there. Dr. Pino is a tough grader on some written assignments. Study for exams and you'll do fine. Dr. Pino is kind and generally helpful, and it isn't her fault the class isn't set up well. Dr. Pino is easy to reach by email too.

A fantastic person. She is the first professor to have treated me like a human at this large school. She realized the pandemic was hard on us and gave us all of the help she could. The class is pretty light. Main thing is to get the experiments done early and study for the tests.

best professor ive had here so far. She is so caring and wants to see her students strive and succeed. The exams were a bit challenging, but she made class fun. Didn't get much homework and she was always there to help. You can tell she loves teaching, she is always happy and cheerful. Just an angel and so generous and kind. Def. recommend.

Class experience is great, shes very organized and certainly knows what shes teaching. You can tell she really cares about the success of her students. The tests are tough, especially the final but if you study hard and read the books youll do fine. Participation is necessary if you want a good grade too.

You could tell Lauren really cared about the success of her students; she puts in a lot of work for her students' success. However, her lectures are a bit dry, but paying attention and taking note of the examples is very helpful. Work hard throughout the course and study hard for the final; it was much harder than the midterms.
She was a pretty good teacher but very quiet. The assignments were laid out well. You had to be in class everyday to get the notes you needed unless you ask a friend. Attendance is marked.

summary_comment: Dr. Jamie is highly regarded for their exceptional teaching quality, known for being respectful, knowledgeable, and engaging. Lectures are well-structured, making complex topics accessible and interesting, and the course load is manageable with consistent effort. Students consistently recommend Dr. Jamie's classes, particularly for their fun, interactive, and structured approach.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Jamie is my favorite professor in all of the Psychology department! They are respectful, understanding, caring and incredibly knowledgeable in the course content. Their lectures are engaging, often funny and easy to follow. The course load is super manageable so long as you are attentive and engaged in class!
Good prof. Class was graded by 3 tests (each worth 25% of your grade) and a final project (25%). class was well structured and lecture content was heavily based on homework readings
I love Dr. Jamie They are an amazing professor that made class fun and interesting everytime we had class. Would recommend PSYCH4555, Adolescent Sexuality, with Dr. Jamie.

Dr. Jamie is great. Class is engaging. Usually, the homework is to read the chapter and any additional readings before class. The grade is 75% exams and 25% final project. No extra credit or homework grades. But, if you study well, you'll do well on the exams. Jamie makes the topics interesting and the class is set up well. Definitely recommend.

This class is organized so that you read your weekly assignments before that week of class so that everyone can participate in class discussion. Sometimes it is lecture, but the format of this course is definitely collaborative. It is not a ton of work, Dr Jamie is a treasure.

This class was extremely easy, got a perfect 100%. There is a ton of reading, 24 journal articles (20pg avg) and then a worksheet for each one. Attendance is mandatory as there is a participation submission at the end of every class. Take the class for an easy A.

summary_comment: The professor's class lacks organization and structure, with lectures being disjointed and quizzes and homeworks being relatively easy. Despite being somewhat entertaining, the professor provides most of the answers in class, leading to poor retention of material. Overall, the class is easy to pass with minimal effort.

Ratings.comment: This class was wild. There is no structure, lectures are all over the place and it is so disorganized. Definitely an easy A if you just go to class. You have a confusing quiz once a week, 3 homework assignments, and a presentation, but if you go to class he basically gives all the answers. He is pretty funny but I retained nothing from this class.

summary_comment: Professor Rizzi is highly engaging and passionate about his subject, making classes enjoyable and interactive, though some find the material can be dry. He assigns substantial work, including quizzes and readings, which he adjusts to accommodate busy schedules. Students generally appreciate his efforts to clarify complex topics and provide extra credit opportunities, though some find the workload and grading criteria challenging.

Ratings.comment: Professor Rizzi is very passionate about what he teaches, he makes the class enjoyable and keeps us engaged in the lectures. If you are very interested in psychology I recommend taking him. He gives a lot of quizzes and tests but it helps you actually learn the material. I would definitely take him again!

Professor Rizzi is patient, caring, and passionate about what he teaches. He breaks down the material. If you suck at math then this is the professor who is more than glad to help you. Lots of work but that's any PSY3211 class.

THIS GUY IS GREAT. No seriously, he is a really cool guy especially if you're passionate about behavior analytics. He cares for his students and will try his best to help you understand the material and pass.

Lectures were either interesting or so boring the class would fall asleep. He would go off on tangents in class and we would end up having to learn the material ourselves. There were quizzes assigned online for each chapter before we even went over it in class, but he does take into account our busy schedules and change the game plan accordingly.

Rizzi is very energetic and engaging but i just can't seem to stay awake in this class. The material is pretty boring but he tries to make it funny and relevant. The material itself is pretty self-explanatory and stuff ive heard in literally every psych class ive taken here. Just read the book, take the quizzes seriously and actually go to class.

Dr. Rizzi's lectures are very entertaining. He makes dry content interesting and provides lots of examples in class to clarify concepts. Attendance is part of the grade, and there is a weekly reading assignment that is timed and graded, but pretty easy. He has plenty of extra credit, and for being a mandatory class, it is great. No complaints.

He's not a bad guy but assigns way too much work. Online quiz assignments, with a 25 min time limit with a range of questions from 13-21. Not enough time to actually read the question and make sure you get the right answer. Grades way too difficult on homework assignments.  He's one of those angry grad students that think his class so important

Sometimes the material can be a little confusing, but Professor Rizzi does a pretty good job of working through it. There's only 3 homework assignments, but a quiz every week (timed, about half an hour each). He has bonus points on his quizzes and his exams, as well as a couple other opportunities for extra credit. Definitely would take again!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, evident in his genuine care for his students and clear communication. He is known for his approachability, humor, and willingness to help, making complex topics accessible. His flexible approach, including minimal homework and straightforward tests, supports student success.

Ratings.comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. You can tell he really cares about his work and what he is teaching. He is cool and really understanding, and he is very open to answering questions and repeating himself.

TAKE HIS CLASS!! He is so funny and relatable because he is young. He is super understanding and clear when lecturing and does so much to help us out. No homework or assignments aren't extra credit and the tests are easy if you take notes and pay attention. Going to class not necessary if you take good notes and use common sense.

I have almost finished this semester but I would recommend taking this class with this professor to anyone! The expectations are explained from the start and he is very understanding. The lectures are engaging but he does not expect you to make it to all of them. Recently graduated so he understands what it is like to have a large courseload.

summary_comment: Professor Ryan is widely regarded as one of the easiest instructors, known for his understanding, flexibility with deadlines, and willingness to provide extensions. Students find the class straightforward, particularly if they engage with the required textbook and take good notes. While some appreciate the relaxed atmosphere and personal touch, others note that there is substantial reading and note-taking required, which can be intensive despite the overall ease of the course.

Ratings.comment: one of the easiest classes ive ever  taken . Professor ryan was super understanding and sweet gave extensions on assignments. Easy class does require a textbook as long as you read the textbooks youll do fine in the class

Ryan was a good professor and a nice person.  He was very considerate about work and flexible with deadlines.  He would go off topic somewhat frequently in his lectures. This class was very easy if you went to class and took decent notes.  For the "exams," I recommend just skimming the textbook and looking at the notes you have taken.
Interesting and easy class. Professor is a great guy!
Easiest college class I've ever taken. Highly recommend. I will admit that it may be due to my strong neuroscience background and the fact that I've been in therapy for years.

Very easy going and very understanding. Lectures were goodish although the exams leaned towards the harder side and being open note didnt make much of a difference. very nice about extensions and looking back at low grades and changing them.  no attendance grade and uploads video lectures online. very very nice guy

Dr Hansen is so sweet. love him. I did not go to his lectures a lot and ended with over a 100 in the class. Some assignments took a little too long, but the assignments were interesting. As long as you do the work you will do great and learn a lot

Bro easiest A I have ever got. Literally so many options to get extra credit. My grade is over a 100%. I ended up not doing his last 2 assignments cause I would still be at an A. I took this in the summer, in the 2nd session. The class goes by fast but if you stay on top of things you should be good. If you email him, he will give you extra time

Professor Hansen was really interesting, but there was a ton of reading in the course, like a ton. He had us submit our notes for that reading, so there is no getting out of it. It is a good class though. I wish there had been areas touched on more in depth, but its an intro psych course so I can't expect that much. He allowed it to feel personal.

Dr. Hansen is extremely caring and understands that we are humans, not everything goes our way. At the end of the semester, he gave everyone two weeks to turn in anything they may have missed. Also, there are 14 "exams" which consist of roughly 20 questions. If you do the assigned readings, these will be easy A exams. Great class overall!!

Dr. Hansen is the most caring professor I have had while in college. At the end of the semester, he gave two weeks to turn in anything that you may have missed. I do have to say, there was a ton of reading, but was worth it when the "exams" were easy. The exams are after each chapter, no more than twenty questions.

Dr. Hansen is willing to help students. There are a lot of readings which take a huge amount of time but that is definitely necessary to learn psychology. A quiz every single class but it ensures that you would read. Exams are not hard, and there are extra credits.

There are daily top-hat quizzes for attendance but he is very understanding and will let you take them if you miss class. Read the assigned reading before class and you will ace the tophats. He is so kind and understanding and genuinely cares about you and has a passion for teaching. tests are open book and online and are easy if you read.

This was his first semester teaching this class so it was kinda disorganized, but still very easy A. He had all the exams take home, open note, online so that was nice. Honestly learned more from the book than class, but he does easy reading quizzes every class so you have to show up.

AU14: Lectures can be helpful but if you read the textbook it is basically the same thing. I read the text for every chapter which was time consuming but made everything easier. Lectures not mandatory, hes a nice guy, grades things easily, tests are department tests, no quizzes or homework. Tests are hard so you better make time to read.

Very enthusiastic about psychology and really engages the audience. I took his online class and he posted videos of all his lectures and the powerpoints he used. He could not have been more clear of what was expected from the students.

Ryan is amazing! He knows what he is talking about, is absolutely willing to give extra help, and makes sure everything that he says is clear as day. I would definitely take him again if he offered another psych class. Love him!

Loved this course and this instructor! Material was easy and instructor is extremely helpful when you have any questions. Midterms are straightforward- as long as you read the text and study the material, you'll be fine! :)

Dr. Hansen is a nice guy. Really dedicated to his students and their learning. Lays class out clearly, easy to contact. Tests are very straightforward. Study your online lecture notes and you can do well. There are flashcards on studyblue which are pretty helpful if you don't have time to make them. Study hard, stay on top of things and it's easy.

Very friendly and easy to contact. His job and his students are his #1 priority. He made video lectures for his online students and gave us tons of helpful resources to study. Without discipline to study, the class can be hard because there is a lot of information. Be warned that you need extra time out of class to do the REP credits.
He was the nicest prof I have had. He genuinely cared about the subject and the class. He gave many extra credit opportunities and always pushed back due dates!

This professor is awesome!!! Dr. Ryan Hansen taught at Ohio State University and at Dominion University. One of the best lecturers I've ever heard and he is very enthusiastic. He gave clarity and refreshing life to an ordinarily dull subject. He was VERY helpful and one of the best teachers I have ever sat under. Awesome with an A+

This guy's awesome. One of the best lecturers I've had here and he's very enthusiastic. If you didn't understand anything he would help. He made psych pretty interesting actually. Study the bolded words and you HAVE to ace this class. (He also made a flashcard app you can use that is helpful).
Very helpful! Best instructor of Psych 100! If you want to get A, choose him!

This class was SO easy I could have aced it without going to lecture or actually reading the book (just study the bolded words). However, Ryan Hansen is one of the most enthusiastic and fun lecturers I've had. He should be teaching something MUCH higher level than Psych 100.
Clearly cares about the material and tries to make lectures funny. He is an all around good guy and a pretty good teacher.
Great professor- he wants to help the students.  He does a wonderful job and is very thorough in his teaching and explanation.
Very committed lecturer. He really wants to help his students. Will go the extra mile.

summary_comment: Dr. Kirby is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, particularly her focus on exams as the sole grading criterion, which simplifies the workload for students. Her classes are structured to accommodate busy schedules, and she provides ample support to help students succeed.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Kirby is a GREAT professor. She structures her class in a great way for a busy college student: four exams are your only grades, so you don't have outside mandatory homework or quizzes to do. It is really up to you to learn the material-and she wants to help you. Midterms aren't mandatory and can only help your grade. TAKE this class with her!

I loved this class. I did it online, she talked so fast I needed to watch recordings, but regardless of long lectures, they were interesting! Great job of preparing you for exams, which is the only thing the class is graded on. She only counts your final exam grade, but if any of your 3 midterm grades would improve that score, she also counts them.

summary_comment: Dr. Cook is known for her engaging and passionate teaching style, particularly valued by students who appreciate her interest in creativity and social psychology. However, her grading can be challenging, with tough exams and unclear expectations, leading to mixed reviews. Students generally find her approachable and supportive, though some find her lectures somewhat repetitive and prefer a different instructor for certain classes.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Cook is one of the only professors I've had that I actually could have seen myself talking to outside of class. Her lectures are pretty interesting, but she'll admit herself that she's not super interested in topics outside of social psych. Very tough grader for an intro to psych/GE course. Difficult exams, but a fun and engaging professor.
Extremely unhelpful and condescending. When you have questions, she tells you to figure it out yourself. Super nit picky grader and is not always clear in her grading. I do not recommend.
For an intros honors class the amount of work and time required for this class is ridiculous. I suggest taking this class taught by a different professor as it is much easier.

She's passionate about creativity. Have 2 books to read. We have a one page paper due every week connecting stuff learned, super easy 5 points each week. Extra credit available at the end of the semester. Always tends to bring into conversation about the people that "work for her"-at her day job which is kind of annoying, saying she is the boss.

She is a great lecturer and really nice. She is horrible at explaining what she wants for her papers and most people in my class felt like they deserved better grades than they received. She is very understanding that outside circumstances can affect class attendance, and I would definitely take her class again.

Dr. Cook is a decent professor. Her class was very easy because I came to class, skimmed the readings, and did the homework and extra credit. The exams are the basic "take-aways" of lectures. She is a talker and lecture can be kind of boring. She believes in group work to the max, so maybe not the class for an introvert - but I made it through.

She is the best professor that I have had at OSU. She makes class very interesting and truly cares about her students. She will help you work and get whatever grade you need. I read the book for more information but if you go to every class you won't need to. She is a really cool and helpful person and I would recommend this class to anyone.

I had her last semester for social psychology and I could really tell that she knew what she was doing and loved it! Attendance isn't mandatory but strongly suggested, some class discussions. Her lectures are really interesting and getting an A in the class isn't hard but you learn a lot!

Just a really cool all around person. She works for a non-profit and only teaches part-time, and her passion for teaching really shows. She is always willing to help out one of her students. Interesting in class examples, too. I would definitely recommend her class.

Honestly and amazing professor and person. Very helpful in class and always willing to take time and explain things to students who don't understand it. Works a day job and still went out to lunch with me to discuss potential careers in psychology just because I had asked. Reading the textbook does help prepare for the lectures.

If you've ever wondered about psychology, take this course. Lynette is one of the best professors at this school and makes the material absolutely fascinating for psych majors and non psych majors alike. Her tests are totally fair and if you pay attention in class you could get away with skimming the book.

I thought Lynnette was a really great teacher. While she was quite a difficult grader, she was extremely helpful and you could tell that she genuinely cares about her students. I would definitely recommend her, but don't expect and "easy A."

Best teacher I've had in college. She's very personable and wants nothing but the best for her students. She is a bit of a hard grader on the papers, but eases up after the first two. Dont really need the book if you go to EVERY lecture.
She is awesome! Super nice, really helpful, and knows what she is talking about.

Lynnette was one of the best teachers I have had! She was very enticing and really cared about the material. She cared about her students as long as you cared to voice concerns. I really enjoyed attending her lectures and the material. The one negative about the class was that it was hard to get an A but easy to pass but it was of no fault to her.

She is a very good teacher but this is a difficult class. She tells you attendance isn't mandatory but you should attend. Exams aren't just regurgitating info, you have to apply the concepts. Keep up on assigned reading and attend class and you will do fine.
Nice teacher but impossible grader!
Really helpful and nice. Class was best ive had so far.

Lynette is a good professor overall when it comes to teaching. She has great examples to help further explain the concepts. However beware, she is an extremely hard grader! Midterms are straight essay pretty much 5 out of 7 questions. Final is the same way only longer. Class graded on a curve, but still she is hard.
Lynette is really funny. She makes the class really enjoyable, but you still learn a lot.She is also really cool about letting you leave class early.
Lynnette was amazing.  She is very intersted in what she is teaching and it comes across to her students.  She is very helpful and responsive to emails.  Wish I could take another class of hers...

Great experience! Lynette was sooooo funny and down to earth! Really has a desire for people to do well in the class! She knows what she is talking about and is also passionate about it! I could not imagine a better experience! GET HER AS A TEACHER!!!
Awesome Prof! Funny, good examples and useful lectures. I am trying to schedule another class she teaches as a matter of fact. I would rec. this prof to anybody!

Enjoyed her class, lectures where very interesting, make sure to always print off the guided notes. Midterms where not to bad, but there where many questions on the final that I felt we never covered in class(never missed lecture), so reading the book might help. Class discussions were always worth while and interesting so attend class.
A very entertaining and interesting prof .. Class discussions were always pretty funny. The only downside: No curve.
she was an awesome teacher, very smart, very helpful, the tests were not that hard and and everything was always explained well.  i would deffinately recommend her class.
She suucked..
Such a good teacher. Her class is interesting. She is the most helpful teacher ever. I even had to call her at home once, and she was so understanding and helpful.
She a very nice lady. She's a good teacher.

summary_comment: Dr. Osher is highly regarded for his effective teaching and flexibility, especially during the pandemic. Students appreciate his willingness to help and make the material engaging, even in large classes. While some find the content challenging, many praise his enthusiasm and supportive approach, leading to positive outcomes for those who engage with the material.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Osher was an amazing professor. Very flexible due to COVID and easy to contact outside of class. Cared about his students and the material he was teaching. Offered a lot of extra credit and took extra time when needed to review confusing topics. Made a relatively boring class much more interesting, the best psych professor I've had so far!

LOTS of terms. Heavily learning about anatomy of different senses and how they work, which gets confusing. Class is huge and so not a huge opportunity to learn. Online lectures and the groupme were my best friend. David is super nice and understanding. He really does care about his students but class is boring and difficult if you don't like it.

He is amazing! The class itself wasn't the most fun, but he tried his best to get people engaged and make it enjoyable. The exams were pretty easy and one of them gets dropped. As long as you do the work you should get an A
I really enjoyed this class and learned some really cool stuff! he is a kind and helpful professor so definitely reach out to him if you need any help or questions.

Dr. Osher was awesome. Although I was not interested in the course content and only had to take it for my major, he made it not horrible throughout the semester. He was always willing to go out of his way to help, and also mentioned he will likely make his in person exams open notes. You can tell his enthusiasm on teaching the subject
You need to watch the lecture videos for points, but the exams are completely open: youre even allowed to use Google. As long as you put in minimal effort, its easy to get an A.

Love this dude. He's super chill and helpful, and he very clearly loves the work he does. His lectures were a little difficult to get through online even with 2x speed, but overall, his class was almost always the highlight of my week. As long as you keep up with the work (there's not a lot) and study before tests you should do very well with him!

I'm really glad I took his class. For some psych majors it might seem a little difficult since there is a good amount of bio/neuroscience, but I enjoyed it a lot. He covers all kinds of interesting and unexpected things about perception and I learned a lot. He's really enthusiastic and eager to help outside of class. The final was pretty hard

The material could be considered difficult to grasp but his lectures, study guides and overall enthusiasm for the material made it incredibly easy to understand/learn. Not a crazy amount of work outside of class, over all really enjoyed his teaching style/enthusiasm for the subject! 10/10 would recommend sense and perception with him!

summary_comment: Sarah is known for her sweet and approachable demeanor, making her class both easy and enjoyable, with a focus on friend-making and low-stress learning. Her exams are straightforward, and she offers extra credit and review sessions. Similarly, Instructor Prieto is described as sweet, personable, and passionate, providing additional support through review classes and flexible grading, though the specific structure of her assessments is less detailed.

Ratings.comment: Sarah is very sweet and her class was not difficult at all. I made two of my best friends in her class. She gives extra credit and brings in candy. There were 3 exams (60 mcq I think), and they were not very hard. there was some homework, but they do not take long at all. highly recommend her for an easy A!

Instructor Prieto is very sweet, personable, and lenient. She's very passionate about what she is teaching and willing to admit and research further if you ask something she doesn't know the answer to. She makes sure to host review classes before exams to make sure we're ready, and the exams were online.

summary_comment: Mark is highly regarded for his dedication and care towards his students, though his online classes can be less than ideal due to technical challenges. Students appreciate his interactive approach, frequent group work, and straightforward grading, often finding the course manageable with minimal extra work required. Overall, he is seen as a knowledgeable and supportive professor who helps students develop their own ideas and earn easy As.

Ratings.comment: Mark is a very good professor and really cares about what he does. He is not the best with technology, so taking his class online was not my favorite, but if you can take his class in person I would definitely do that! He loves talking to the students which is fun. A lot of group work, a quiz biweekly, 2 papers.. overall easy A

This class was online and he was very relaxed about it, we even met his cats. Sometimes he forgot to post his lectures for the quizzes, but if you sent him a reminder he would have them up by the end of the day. All the material covered on the quizzes is on the PowerPoint. There are weekly group homeworks that take about 30 minutes to complete.

Dr. Polifroni is awesome. No textbook for the class, so almost all of your learning is done through his lectures, which was nice. Group HW assignments almost every week, but they were pretty easy, and so were the quizzes and DB posts, and there weren't that many of them. Two papers that were also simple and straightforward. Strongly recommend him!

This dude is awesome. This is my second class with him and he did not disappoint. This isnt an easy course (none of his courses are), but if you put in a little effort, its not a problem. He wants everyone to form their own opinions and ideas about the course material!

Dr. Mike is such a great and inspirational lecturer to have. Hes super helpful and understanding, and challenges you to think for yourself. The class was heavy in terms of coursework (it was over six weeks) but very manageable. If you do the readings and attend the lectures then youll learn a great deal from this class and earn an easy A.

Dr. Polifroni is an incredibly sweet professor who truly cares about his students success, and is clearly loved by a lot of students. Unfortunately, I found his lecture slides to be dry and confusing to follow, which made studying for exams a bit difficult for me. Aside from the exams, he's a pretty easy grader on papers and discussion boards.

I really enjoyed Mark's class. His lectures are very straightforward and the exam questions are taken straight from his powerpoints/lectures. I felt like his explanations during class were very helpful so I recommend going to class. Not too work outside of class either. I recommend Mark!

Mark cares about his students and knows what hes talking about. He listens to feedback from the students to help us out. He gave us 3 extra points from unfair test questions, as well as 5 easy points EC (if one other person in your group did it, he gave it to all of you). Not mandatory, but going to class is needed to get in class activity points.

He was a good professor. Only "was"! He changed the syllabus before the final exam. Even he did not send any message about that. The syllabus change increased the percentage of exams from 73% to 80%!! That caused many students to gain lower grades... A terrible professor...

Mark's class was super easy, 4 quizzes and 2 papers. I enjoyed the material we went over and Mark clearly really cares about his students. Lectures and grading were super laid back and it was a very easy A. Occasionally had in class assignments but I still did fine missing a few days. Would highly recommend taking any of Mark's classes!

Emotion psych is not about emotions rather people who study them - disappointing. Lectures are unorganized, he goes off on tangents. The content is easy but the lack of organization makes things hard. The guy really likes philosophy which is annoying for a 4 level science class. If the class had more psych in the psych class it would be better.

He is the most hilarious professor I've had; I always laughed during his lectures. He is great at taking dense material and giving relatable examples that are easy to remember. He can sometimes read through slides too quickly, and he tends to get political at times. All in all, I would definitely take another class with Dr. Mark.

Easy class with 4 exams, an easy paper, and 3 discussion posts. Attendance isn't mandatory and all notes are posted online. He is a great guy who is really funny as long as you don't mind his clearly liberal views! Highly recommend.

Mark is my favorite professor I've had at OSU so far. He is funny, thoughtful, and overall a great teacher. I would highly recommend taking any class with him because he is very passionate about the subject. The class is a bit hard... study for the exams! The content is taken DIRECTLY from the lecture slides nearly verbatim.

Dr. Polifroni has easily been my favorite professor so far at OSU! Even though attendance isn't mandatory, I never miss his class because he makes lectures so interesting. The exams aren't bad, there are three midterms and a final. As long as you study the lecture slides you can get an A.

Professor Polifroni is a very nice dude and cares about his students, and his class is easy. Sadly, lecture slides are very unorganized, and he goes off on political tangents every day that rarely have anything to do with the content (and if they do, they are forced connections). It almost seems like he uses class to get out his political anger

His lectures are so engaging; he often references his own research. There were two research papers in the class, one of which was challenging to read but he is not a difficult grader. Final is not cumulative, just memorize the slides for each exam so you dont have to buy the textbook. This class was an easy A as long as you memorized the info.

Dr. Polifroni is amazing. He's one of the only professors I've had who is truly open-minded and respectful of all students, even if someone disagrees with something he said. His lectures are unbelievably interesting, funny and he's a great storyteller! He's also easily approachable and I can tell he truly cares for all his students, which is rare.

I cannot rave enough about Professor Polifroni. Best teacher I have had in my 4 years at OSU. He just gets it. He is so clear about his expectations and his exam questions are taken straight from lecture notes. Also super easy to reach if you do not understand something. Definitely take him especially if you are a psych student!

Mark is a great, funny professor to have and his class was enjoyable to have for my final semester! I hated missing class because I enjoyed the material & his teaching of it. The material is very comparable to Intro to Psych, with a little bit of Abnormal Psych maybe. Not a challenging class, and made easier by Mark's explanations.

I actually feel bad when I miss his lectures because he is so interesting. One of the best professors I've had hands down. Super passionate about what he's saying, too. Pretty easy to pass as long as you review slides.

If you want to listen to him talk about the paper mill and not make ANY sense all semester- this is the class for you. 4 exams and group project that he gives ZERO rubric for so good luck figuring out what you're suppose to do. Wouldn't recommend and my least favorite professor after 4 years here.

Professor Polifroni is single-handedly the best professor I've had at OSU. He is super funny. I am in my second class with him now. I have horrible test anxiety and he really is a strong believer in being engaged in the material without having to take impossible exams. Only class I have ever gotten straight A's on exams in. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!!

Don't buy the book, I did not end up using it at all. The exams come straight from the lecture slides, word for word, even the short answers, they are not bad at all. As long as you really study the slides and understand them, you'll be good. There are random in class activities, which effect your grade a lot, so its important to attend lectures.

So he gives out random group projects in class-- so make sure you attend every class. The tests are easy if you study the powerpoints-- word for word. Reading the textbook helps for misunderstanding, but not necessary. STUDY THOSE POWERPOINTS. He is an easy grader and very nice. He lectures with A LOT of opinions though, a lil annoying

He is clearly very passionate about the material he is lecturing about; however, gets very off topic and distracted. He does not have a typical grading skill in regards to papers and group activities. It is an easy class but miserable to sit through lectures. Very boring and monotoned.

I took this class over the summer, so it was a smaller lecture, but  I still absolutely loved it. Mark is such a good professor, and he really knows this material. He has so many stories from all the different people he's met or jobs he's worked. He was very upfront about his experiences and opinions, and they actually really added to the class.

Mark is somethin. He often makes up data & theories and uses the classroom as his own personal counseling session delving into unnecessary parts of his experiences growing up. He occasionally does have some good stories that relate to the class. I've taken 3 classes with him and all I can say is don't come into these classes thinking you'll learn.

Funny teacher and knows a lot. Only 3 exam that as long as you study for you should be fine! Really really interesting material. Puts powerpoints online so don't need to go to class, but gives good examples in class

Dr. Polifroni was a great professor! His tests are pretty tough just because they cover a lot of content, but everything is straight from his lectures which he provides on Carmen. Don't buy the textbook! His power points are more comprehensive and cover the same material in greater detail.
One of the best professors at OSU

Mark is one of the most entertaining professors I've had. The content was very interesting and taught me a lot about the modern court system.  He encouraged class discussion which always led to good stories.  Attendance wasn't mandatory, but was helpful.  Tests were tough and study guides led me to study a lot of material not on the exam

His tests are hard because they consist of LOTS of truefalse, few multiple choice, and A TON of short answer questions. Mark his a GREAT story teller and has a lot of interesting life stories that add to the course material and make it more interesting. You could easily skip class but I always went to hear him tell his stories.

Mark was an amazing professor! He made the material so interesting! Even though you may be fine skipping class and learning most things from the book he assigns, you learn it more thoroughly when attending his lectures!! Plus he explains it in such a way that REALLY helps to stick in your mind when you are working on his exams!

1)This course is not hard 2)The course is very helpful for psych major students 3)Mark is the best psychology teacher I've met so far. He's hilarious too. 4)Lots of extra credits 5)Flexible with deadlines. Amazing teacher. He's mastered what he need to teach and he can easily help you understand the course material. Definitely 5 Star.

Mark is awesome! Understanding, thorough, and an all-around chill guy. Textbook use was virtually zero, so if you're strapped for cash don't buy it. Take good notes during lectures and you'll get an A on the tests.
Best Professor at OSU

Mark is a great professor. Though I would have been fine not going to class, I found myself going to class just because I didn't want to miss out on what he had to say. You don't need the book at all and though his tests are mostly essay, the questions are fair and he is a lenient grader. TAKE THIS CLASS! I absolutely loved it.

Dr. Polifroni was an amazing teacher! I had no interest in the subject of Law before I took his class, but I became fascinated by it because of him. I would recommend this class to anyone who has a chance to take! It was definitely one of my favorite classes at OSU.

He was great, but he got extremely angry when he found out some misconduct. and he decided to punish the entire class. and then after two weeks telling us to study 8 chapters for final, he said he was changing it back to normal (i wasted 2 weeks studying things not being tested). it would have been great without all these drama.
Mark's great and this class was super easy - I got a 100%. I highly recommend it as a GPA booster.

What a wonderful professor. Extrememly helpful and extremely easy to talk to. Easiest class I've ever taken at OSU. I got a perfect score of 100%. There are 3 exams which are open-note, open-book and the final was a paper we wrote at home and the otehr half of the grade was our comments on ppl's presentaions. We had to do presentations, but if you'
One of my favorite classes at OSU. Definitely take it!

One of the best professors at OSU! I recommend taking this class and psych 485 as well! He actually made going to class fun and interesting! Do not have to buy book but I found it helpful for short answer tests
very good teacher. keeps your attention during lectures. at least once every class i have to remove myself because im laughing too hard. goofy guy.

Took Psych 462, 522, and 485...all very interesting classes and well taught. does a great job of keeping your attention. I got near 100 on all my exams just by studying for a few hours the night before. Missed an exam and he was very helpful and let me retake it. Best teacher ive had at OSU.

This is the class to take!! Very interesting and Polifroni is a great prof!! You don't need to buy the book, but if you do want it as a reference when you study it's on reserve @ the library. Exams can be difficult b/c they are short answer, so study the main concepts in your notes and have them down well and you will be fine!

I love this class! I highly recommend it! Class is fun, we all have a great time discussing things.  Tests can be a bit tricky, but go to class and study, you'll do fine.  You need to take this class! Polifroni is great, funny and entertaining.
best teacher i've had, makes you think for yourself, but not in an extremely demanding way

We worked on group research projects for most of the quarter. Overall, he is easy to get along with and lets you know what to do to succeed in the class. The project took a lot of time and you really have to work hard, but if you put in the effort you probably will get an A.

easy. 3 exams and semi-comprehensive final. exams are a mix of short-answer, T/F (if unsure, pick false), and multiple choice. they're pretty short too. lectures are interesting enough to keep you awake, especially the discussions in class.
I have had Mark for 3 classes in 8 years and he is one of the best teachers at OSU.  I recommend taking his class over any other.  Great sense of humor and very easy to talk to.
Great professor!  Class was very interesting!  Likes to joke with students and trys to keep the atmosphere lighthearted and fun.  Probably my favorite professor in 3 years at OSU!!!

Mark is a good person, very understanding!! but he's a tough grader. The material isn't hard, but his grading is tough. I took all the tests thinking I was going to get A's and B's but got D's. Lectures were good and bad, but thats because he posts the notes on carmen before hand. I recommend Mark, but I suggest you not take the tests lightly.STUDY
Awesome professor.  Excellent class, clear, concise.

He is a hilarious professor, and he has a great attitude. You can tell that he is cocky though. His grading is what kills you. I have always been graded well in writing, and I have been told I'm an excellent writer. I can't seem to get above a C+ on his papers though.  There goes my GPA.
Awesome.  His class was interesting.  He was extremely willing to help students.  He even set up study sessions before exams in his office so he could answer questions.  I highly recommend him!

I loved the group work in this class.  This professor is always engaging and encouraging discussion, which is not always easy with possibly 50 people in the room.  He made it very clear teaching was extremely important to him, and it shows.  I also took Psych 485 taught by him, excellent.

Great professor!  Very open minded and easy going. If you study for the exams (know your notes from the lectures well) you should do well in the class.  I got an "A" by doing just that. I highly recommend him!
Was WAY hard. Grading was incredibly frustrating.
Very unprofessional, rude, hypocritical, unpleasant, disgusting, crass, and cocky.
Extremely helpful, good teaching style.
No Comments

HE is a really laid back, easy going guy. He is very willing to help, and an "A" in the class is definately possible if you go to class, and read. His grading can be frustrating, but he is getting you ready for the real world.

summary_comment: Dr. Beauchaine is a nice individual but has received mixed reviews for his teaching effectiveness. Some students find his class challenging due to difficult exams and a significant amount of material, while others appreciate the use of "The Wire" to contextualize the content and find value in the detailed lectures and discussion posts. Overall, while his approach includes unique elements like using television shows for educational purposes, the practical application and exam difficulty have led many to struggle with the course.

Ratings.comment: Horrible professor. Reads from notes, provides no practical value, doesn't know the requirements the course is supposed to meet or modern statistical packages. Spends tons of time on things which "you won't use this" (his words). I'm worse off for having spent a semester trying to learn from him. I hope he's a good researcher; he's an awful teacher

Prof Beauchaine is a nice guy. However, I personally hated everything about this class. Exams are pretty difficult. There's a lot of material. He doesn't do anything to help you prepare/study for them either. To be honest, I found watching The Wire to be pointless as it took up 50% of our class time and only made up about 0.5% of exam questions.

Dr. Beauchaine is a really nice guy, but I did not enjoy his class. Exams are pretty difficult but discussion posts and The Wire (watched once a week and one day lecture) did help. Lots of numbers and specific details from his notes (which he posts online) but overall a difficult class to get through.

Dr Beauchaine is very nice. He lectures one a week, then shows an episode of The Wire for the other class day to get a perspective on what we're learning. Learned a lot from his class! Watching the Wire really helped solidify the information. Test questions have lots of numbers rather than info, pretty specific. Discussion posts each week help too.
