summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making the lectures both informative and entertaining. He is known for his knowledge and fairness in assessments, often providing clear guidance on exam content and ensuring tests are not overly challenging. However, his teaching approach is largely lecture-based with minimal class interaction, and students find him somewhat distant and difficult to approach for help.

Ratings.comment: He has very interesting stories to keep you focused on the lectures. However, there's virtually no class activities and few class discussions. It's mostly him just talking the whole time. He is very difficult to approach to ask for help, and often appeared to be in a hurry to leave quickly after class. Knowledgeable, but not relatable.

Had this prof several times in undergrad and would sign up for his class even if I didn't need it.  Very interesting, responds to all questions-if he doesn't know the answer he will get back to you.  VERY fair, goes over tests to make sure there were no errors or unfair questions. Doesn't require you to purchase the book. Great sense of humor.
Exams are easy - only take 20-30 minutes. Book not even required. He tells you everything you'll need to know in class.

I LOVE THIS CLASS!!! It's definitely my favorite this quarter...Fournier is so funny and he knows the material really well. He knows how to relate to college age students. He always lets us out early, which kind of bums me out since I love his class so much. The tests are easy, the lectures are informative and entertaining, the prof is great!!

Jody was an outstanding professor!  Easily the best professor I had my first quarter at OSU.  The course was not difficult because there were only three tests and a paper alongside the REP program, and Jody is such an excellent professor that learning in his class 'comes naturally' if you attend.  Work your schedule around Jody, he's worth it!

Best professor I've had so far in college.  Extremely energetic, funny, and knowledgeable.  Exams are always fair, and he never misguides you on what will be on it.  No need to buy a textbook as long as you go to class and take notes.  Overall, I LOVED this class and Jody!
One of the best instructors I've had at OSU.  He makes the class interesting and entertaining, while clearly and effectively conveying the material.  I highly recommend taking one of his classes!!!
One of my favorite Professors ever. Interesting, helpful, funny, clear, and intelligent.

BEST TEACHER IVE EVER HAD! DEFINATELY RECOMMEND THIS CLASS. I ACTUALLY LOOKED FORWARD TO GOING..BUT ATTENDANCE ISNT MANDATORY. HE MAKES CLASS FUN! AND THE MATERIAL IS ACTUALLY KIND OF INTERESTING! I PRETTY MUCH LAUGHED THE ENTIRE CLASS TIME. WHICH WAS REALLY SHORT. AND SOMETIMES HE LET US GO EARLY JUST BC WE SAID WE WERE TIRED.. GREAT PROFESSOR!!

Definately recommend this class. Buying the textbook would be a waste of money cause it's never used/needed. The tests are easy as long as you put the time in and study for them. Very straightforward class.

Absolutely AMAZING! I wish he tought other classes than just H100 because I would sign up in a heart bean. He cares about what he teaches and the students that he is teaching to.  The book is not needed but go to lecture because he tells you a lot of information.  His lectures are VERY entertaining.

Jody is the definition of cool. The class was scheduled to be an an hour 48 minutes, but it averaged about an hour each time. No textbook required and no final. Grade consists of 3 midterms and 1 psychology experiment study which were all 25%. Before each midterm Jody would tell us exactly what we needed to know. Funny, smart, imaginative.
Awesome! Might I say that he has the most incredible usage of swear words I have ever heard in my life! Great stories, ask him about the "Picnic Basket" its hilarious.

Loved his class.  Even though it was at 8 in the morning, I went every time because he's an entertaining professor.  Grade was based on 3 midterms, which were pretty easy.  If you go to lecture, it's not hard to get an A.  Plus, there was no textbook, which saved time and money.  Overall, great professor!
Awesome instructor. Funny beyond belief and explains everything wonderfully. Textbook isn't required at all.
SUCH a great teacher.  this class led me to declare a psych minor, and i plan on taking every class from him that i can.  funny, helpful, and very fair.  i loved going to class!

I Love Jody! I wish I could take every psychology class with him! He is so funny and so nice and incredibly helpful! I ALWAYS looked forward to going to his class!  You don’t even need the book. His lectures are so entertaining and he explains things in such a way that everything is interesting! I also loved his stories and examples!

The first day set the stage. We went to the library to view a giant sloth and he took a picture with me in front of it! He let us out of class early and told us the book would not be needed. He reviews with us for the midterms and is just a friendly guy. He makes learning fun because of all of his stories.

Everybody's said it already - hilarious, easygoing, helpful, intelligent, and opinionated - jump at the chance to take this class. I waited to take 550 until I could take it with him, and boy was it worth the wait. He's a teaching god.
Really good class.  Had us cracking up every class.  Sometimes he went a bit too fast, but for an honors class it was really easy.
Funniest professor I have ever had!  Makes class easy not because the material actually is, but because he's very clear and has an awesome teaching style.  If you have the opportunity, take him!
funny guy, exams were right off of the notes.

I absolutly hated Psych 100, and didn't want to take this class, but I needed it for my Speech Science major.  He makes this incredibly boring subject sooo much more interessting!  He always has the class laughing.  Exams are fairly easy, still need to study!
GREAT teaching style. Very interesting class as well.
Jody is the best professor I have ever had!!! He has a great sense of humor and makes class incredibly fun.

I LOVE HIM!!! His class was so much fun!  I had it in the morning but it was an awesome class to start with.  He's hilarious and communicates the material very well.  Go to class, pay attention (it's not hard), and study the notes.  I never had to read the book he communicated so well.  His tests are VERY fair and straightforward.  He's awesome!

Jody is hilarious and the classes are great.  Just go to class because he tells you everything you need to know in class and you will not be bored.  Just review your notes for the test and you will do fine.

Jody is a really awesome teacher. He makes jokes throughout the class and talks to you like you are a grown up. He is always willing to help and will answer any question you have, and if he doesn't know it, he will find the answer. Anyone who has the chance to have him as a teacher definately should
Really good teacher and an interesting guy.  He gives fair tests and is pretty funny.  Recommend taking any class with him.

Great teacher!!  Funniest one, I've ever had by far.  He really did everything he could to make the material as interesting as possible and if you needed help he was right there to help you with whatever you needed.
Great guy.  Take any class you get a chance to with him.
Easily the best professor I've had at OSU. He's very funny and makes the material intersting and easy to learn. Great job preparing students for exams.
Jody is the best! He has a great personality and a great sense of humor! I highly recommend him.
I love Jody!  He's funny AND knowledgeable.  Great combination.  Highly recommended!
He's really funny, but he's still good at getting his point across.  He's a great professor, and his tests are fair.  I love him!!!
No Comments

He is one of the funniest men I have ever come across in my life! I have NEVER skipped a class of his because he is so interesting.  Not only do I pay attention in class, but I actually remember almost everything he says!

Loved him, loved him, loved him. I would take his class everyday if that was the only time it was offered, if he is available to teach your class TAKE IT! There are 3 exams and he read the "topics" of each question the lecture before the exam. Do what he says: don't buy the book.

GREAT!! Funny, helpful, clear and easy. I always went to class and so did almost everyone else. Pity he's at Capitol instead of here, but very glad to have met him and taken his class. HIGHLY recommended.
Awesome teacher. Makes class fun and content interesting. He is hilarious!!!! Class was always full.... didnt want to skip it!
GREAT PROF!!! if only they could all be like him. helpful, FUNNY, learn a lot, too!  he is very entertaining and wants you to succeed!! HIGHLY rec. him for ANY class he teaches!!!!!!
This class was fabulous.  He is an excellent prof.  It is too bad he does not teach more classes at osu. I actually looked forward to going to lecture in the morning.  Highly recommended.
Awesome. Very energetic. Witty. And hilarious. Greatest class. Wish he would teach more on a fulltime basis here. And the bald head.... excellent touch.

Exams weren't bad just study and you should get an A.  Dont by the book inless you want it. ask him anything in class and he will find the answer if he doesnt know it. go to lecture, and be prepared to laugh like your at a chris rock show.
I highly recommend him!!!  Best class, interesting professor... never wanted to skip this large lecture class.  Hilarious.

At first his tests seemed somewhat hard, but after a while they were predicable and easy to ace.  Definitely recommend that you take any and all classes you can w/ him.  Funny prof that makes class a blast.  (humor is somewhat sexual, so if you’re easily
He is great!
best professor i ever had, he is so funny you'll want to go to class just to be entertained
Yay for Jody!! I definitely recommend him to anyone who wants to learn a lot and have fun!
He's Awesome!

Take any and every class you can with this guy.  I have recommended him to every one I know.  He's hilariously funny and really smart.  I promise you will learn so much from his class that you will take with you after its over.
Go to class and he will tell you what will be on the exam!  He's hilarious, easy and awesome!
SOO FUNNY! MAKES THE CLASS VERY ENJOYABLE!:)VERY KNOWLEDGABLE IN HIS AREA AS WELL...
Best teacher I've had! I would take another class by him in a heartbeat!
One of the best teachers I have ever had!! I learned soo much from his class and his way of teaching it makes you never forget. He rules
great sense of humor!  he may be hot, but that's not my area of expertise.
He's awesome!!
Dr. Fournier was an excellent, fun, and interesting professor.
Fun, interesting, informative
Great teacher with alot of experience to share with the class

summary_comment: Heena is a highly regarded professor known for making her classes engaging and easy to follow, with a focus on lecture videos and guided notes. Her exams are primarily multiple-choice and application-based, requiring students to apply concepts effectively. While she is described as friendly and caring, some students find her courses challenging, particularly without reading the textbook, which is crucial for success.

Ratings.comment: I took this class online AU20 and Heena organized the class to make it really easy to succeed. I never read the textbook -- just watch the lecture videos and take notes instead! The assignments aren't hard, but the exams are all multiple choice and application based.

Heena was super nice and friendly, but this is easily one of the hardest Intro to Psych courses offered by the school. My friends taking this course with other professors have easy quizzes that are easy 100s. I'm lucky to get an 85 on Heena's exams, which count for 180/284 points and require you to apply concepts to really specific situations.

Heena is a really fun teacher and a nice individual. Classes are really energetic and engaging and you always go away from them with a sense of having learned something. My only complaint was that she was a little too personal with us, and for some reason got angry with certain student over their attendance. I say, let the kids fail on their own.

Heena is a very nice professor who cares about her students. She gives you guided notes for class. The exams are easy as long as you memorize all of the terms from the notes. I never read the book and was fine, but it is probably encouraged that you do. Definitely one of the better Psych 1100 professors.
She is chill but you HAVE TO READ THE TEXTBOOK. The things she goes over in the slide barely glaze over the text book. If you rely on just the lectures you won't pass
Heena was really cool, and the class wasn't too hard for what it was, an intro course. I would definitely take her again, and she is really nice too.

summary_comment: Dr. Wenk is an exceptionally knowledgeable and engaging professor who makes lectures interesting and relevant, though his classes can be demanding, requiring extensive reading and preparation. Students appreciate his fairness and thoroughness in exams, which are detailed and comprehensive but based directly on the slides and lectures. Despite the workload, many find his passion for the subject matter and willingness to help through office hours make the experience rewarding.

Ratings.comment: He is good lecturer but the class is VERY EXHAUSTING. you'll have to read over 300 SLIDES PER MIDTERM(this is no exaggeration). Tests r REALLY DETAILED (70 questions long) and final (which is about 140 questions) is CUMULATIVE so you'll have to review 800 SLIDES. btw NO CURVE cuz avg is 88. Only take it if you have the time to study for it.

Dr. Wenk was great; he made the material incredibly interesting and very easy to learn. The overall grade is intimidating because it's only based on two midterms and a final, but his exams are very fair and straight out of his slides. He and his TAs offer lots of office hours for extra help and he is one of the most personable professors I've had.

Dr Wenk is wonderful! His class was really difficult for me, but he is hilarious and makes the content relatable. Definitely go to class, it helps to hear him explain it rather than teach yourself from the slides. Only grades are tests, so gotta study a lot, for days beforehand in order to do well. I would definitely take another class with him!

Dr. Wenk is by far one of the most incredible professors you will ever have. He is a tough professor, but it was 100% worth every second. He is absolutely hilarious and you learn so much. Take him if you have the chance

Dr. Wenk is very knowledgable and down-to-earth with his students. Lecture is pretty important, as he explains a lot that aren't in his slides. You could probably pass without going to lecture, but I wouldn't recommend it because they're just so interesting. There's also just a lot of material covered in this class, so going to lecture helps.

Great Professor. Made lectures very interesting, and always was willing to answer questions. He really cares about his students and what he is teaching. Exams were fairly tough and detailed, but everything was from the slides.

He is truly amazing. He knows just about everything to know about neuroscience. He has amazing stories and gives great lectures. You have to study all the material and remember a lot, but the class is awesome!

Absolutely loved this professor. He was always able to keep lectures interesting and would work in funny stories and examples. Difficult class because the only grades are tests, but overall I still enjoyed the course.
Go to the the lectures, memorize the slides and you will get an A.

You will do very well if you study. Grades are determined by the tests. All the material is based off of the power points and what he says. Going to office hours will help because he repeats content from lecture then.

If you love the brain, you will love Dr. Wenk's class! His class was by far my favorite and I looked forward to going every time. I recommend taking advantage his office hours, because he is amazing to get to know. To succeed in this class, attend every class and take as many notes as you can for reference on some of the vague slides.

First thing to note: this class has a different grading scale: A  88%, A-  85%, and so on.  Second thing: he doesn't go off any textbook, instead using his own PowerPoint slides.  My advice: either print off the slides and take notes on them during lecture or take notes on your laptop and transfer them to printed slides to study.  Helped a lot.
Dr. Wenk is one of the best professors at OSU. Very knowledgable and funny during his lectures. Exams are tough but fair because he usually curves them.

Easily one of the nicest people I've met and he cares a lot about his students and the subject. You absolutely have to go to class to do well, his lecture slides he posts are very vague if you don't have your own notes from him elaborating. There is a lot of information too and you have to study a lot and hard to understand it all.

Serious love/hate relationship. He is very entertaining and you will learn a lot and love neuroscience. He is very knowledgeable and can/will answer all questions no matter how annoying you are. However, at times he can seem to be degrading towards doctors and anyone that is not him. Large/earned ego, but it can get to you sometimes so be prepared

Dr. Wenk is the best professor I've had at OSU.  It was a pleasure to be in his class.  His tests are fair, but attending lecture is key.  This man is a genius, take advantage of all of his knowledge in office hours!  I would go out of my way to take another class with him.
Awesome professor - most definitely will make you interested in the brain
If you're even slightly interested about what goes on in your brain, take this class. He'll make you want to change your major to neuroscience.

I thoroughly enjoyed Dr. Wenk's class! His lectures were very informative and fun. The textbook was not necessary because his powerpoints covered everything tested, but some of his powerpoints/slides could be confusing. Exams were challenging, but not impossible. Overall, a great professor!

Quick paced but very interesting lectures. Would take him again, want to take his psychopharm class! I didn't find the class that hard, but some did. I think it really depends on your interest in behavioral psych and previous knowledge of basic brain anatomy, psych, etc.

I studied by butt off for this class and still received a D (I passed the first exam, failed the next two, and barely passed the final). Some kids found this class extremely easy, but I was not one of them. The tests are reasonable in length, but I felt like there was too much material crammed into one. Also, the only grades are from exams.

Dr. Wenk is honestly the best professor I've ever had. He is so inspirational and passionate about Behavioral Neuroscience. I highly recommend this guy, he is great! He teaches us by using power points and they are very helpful. This class was my most fun class!

He is probably my favorite professor I've had. He's extremely knowledgable and makes the class very fascinating and presents the material in a way that's both easy and interesting. The exams are 100% from his slides and lecture, so you most likely won't need the book. If you go to class and study, you will ace all his exams.

He is a great professor.  Dr. Wenk makes sure that he answers everyone's questions and doesn't worry about rushing through the lectures, he wants to make sure you understand all of the information.  But definitely need to study a lot for this class
Wenk is a very smart guy who is fun to talk to during office hours. This class requires a lot of effort to pass but you will learn a lot too.  Do not skip class!

Disclaimer: Wenk is a super nice, funny, and knowledgable guy. Additionally, I am a straight-A student. But... This class covered so much specific content I didn't know what to do with myself. I studied so hard and learned so much, and still got a C (59%) on his adjusted grading scale. If you're up for a challenge, go for it. But be warned.

This guy rocked! Great lectures that kept my attention. Wenk found interesting ways to make the material interesting and relevant. Still, the course was about drugs so how hard could that be anyway.  Sorry that I could Take more classes from him.
The best prof I've had at OSU.

Professor Wenk save my butt! He spent time with me outside of his office hours. Without his help I never would have passed this course or graduated.  I greatly enjoyed his lectures - I do wish that I'd attended more of them. He truly wants his students to succeed.

Dr. Wenk is by far my favorite professor at OSU. His class is difficult because it is a lot of info to take in, but if you put the work in, you'll do just fine (especially 4305). His exams can be tough, but they're not there to trick you, the class is just detail oriented, so be ready to study. He is super helpful, easy to talk to, and funny.

Wenk is brilliant.  He rarely said "I don't know." He stays on top of stuff. His lectures were fun and are critical if you want to pass.  This was the best course that I've taken at OSU in the past three years.  Just come prepared to work for your A.

Wenk makes the class interesting and fun to attend.  Overall, he tries to be fair to everyone. His office hours are always worthwhile.  No question during class is ignored.  He was very patient with some annoying students.

By far Dr. Wenk is my favorite professor at OSU. His lectures were amazingly clear, organized and information.  More importantly, he is funny and charming in class. Be sure to attend the lectures because he always reviews the material from the last class at the beginning of every lecture.
Dr. Wenk is totally brilliant. His lectures were fun as well as education. His sense of humor is odd but often entertaining. Must attend class or you will miss critical information for the exams.
Dr Wenk was very accommodating to my request for additional help outside of class.
Really cool dude
Extremely intelligent and funny. Great lecturer and my favorite professor so far.

Dr. Wenk's knowledge is truly amazing. He has a great sense of humor and makes class enjoyable. That being said, don't miss class and carefully look over the PowerPoint lectures. Voice recording his lectures and visiting his past behavioral neuroscience lectures on YouTube was SUPER helpful for anything I didn't happen to catch the first time.

Dr. Wenk is an extremely intelligent man. He delivers lectures with enthusiasm and insight, providing you with new knowledge and wonder. With this being said, his exams test whether or not you listened to what he had to teach through his detailed lectures.

Dr. Wenk is a wonderful man who cares for both his work and his students. I spent many hours in his office going over the material and just engaging in conversation. His exams are not "easy" but if you study, your scores will reflect. There is a very generous grading scale and he removed unclear questions from our final to make the grades even.

Dr. Wenk is by far my favorite professor. He is very easy to understand and has an awesome sense of humor. He puts almost everything on the powerpoints, which is nice for studying. His lectures are entertaining & extremely helpful, so coming to class is worth the effort. If nothing else, go for the inspiration. He is greatest.

Dr. Wenk is by far my favorite professor so far. He is absolutely brilliant and I enjoy listening to him in lecture, even if they are long. He is always willing to answer questions and help when needed. He also has a very unique sense of humor that the whole class finds hilarious.

Professor Wenk is the greatest professor I have had and will ever have. He is so knowledgable in his field and has such a desire to help you learn. He is willing to help in whatever way possible and loves to talk about the material after class and go into more detail. Wonderful man!!!

By far one of my favorite professors. Wenk works humor into lectures which otherwise would be dry. Everything needed for test comes from lecture - don't eve bother with textbk. That said, while the PowerPoints are posted online, Wenk adds more info about each slide during lecture so you MUST attend every time. Very relaxed prof who's test r fair.

He's a really interesting professor and he likes to crack jokes and liven up his lectures with funny comments. He's really intelligent and no doubt knows what he is talking about. If you study, the you'll definitely pass.

Really great professor. An absolutely brilliant man, one of the top in his field. Dr. Wenk keeps lectures entertaining and is very open to questions and going off on interesting tangents. Attending class is a must; lectures are PowerPoints and exam questions are based off them. Definitely my favorite professor at OSU so far.

He's an extremely knowledgable professor that does research on the side. He used to teach medical students at Ohio State, and knows what he's talking about. All of the material is given to you in lecture powerpoints, and test questions come exclusively from the notes.

The best professor on campus.  One of the most knowledgeable doctors in the field, his class is taught very well.  That being said, you need to come to class, take good notes, and study hard for the midterms.  If you put in the effort, his class will be one of the best you will take while at OSU.
Funny guy, interesting class. Can come off as a bit of a jerk sometimes, but overall a very intelligent guy

I was very entertained with his teaching. An insanely smart man. However, he never seemed very interested in his students' success. I felt as if I was bothering him during his office hours. Although he's a friendly man, he's intimidating to approach. I'm conflicted about how I feel about him. I earned a B+ in his class.

Dr. Wenk is a great teacher, but there is A LOT to learn so he speeds through it. Study with someone and ask questions. He is very patient in explaining concepts. Tests are straight forward but you need to memorize a lot. Book is not required but is useful for reference. Final grade out of highest students' grade so its curved. DO NOT SKIP LECTURE.

Dr. Wenk is an amazing professor! The man knows what he is talking about, he is one of the best in his field. He makes it very easy to understand the whole brain and helps you connect all the different parts of it. If you're a neuro major take his class because it shows whether or not you are cut out for it.

I loved Dr. Wenk! He was very knowledgeable about the material and makes it interesting. He also loves taking time to answer questions, even if it takes up a lot of class time, and is super helpful in off hours. Genuinely wants to help. The exams get progressively harder and are based off of his lectures (so you should go and add notes to his ppts)

Hands down the best and most qualified professor I've had in 4 years. Gary was a fantastic professor, and although the information was difficult, he did a great job of relating it back to things that we know about everyday life. I attended his office hours every week, and was able to take away so much information from this class.

Dr. Wenk is a great teacher! The class is not hard, especially if you're a neuro major (it will be one of your easiest neuro classes). He really cares about how you do, and is willing to help if you go to his office. A very knowledgeable man who is very good at explaining things. No, he doesn't give study guides but come on we're in college now

This class is not as hard as people seem to make it. Test are black and white, not too difficult. I do however dislike his teaching style and how he has no interest in your success in the class. Says that he will teach as if you know nothing about the brain but does not. He acts as if you already know most of the material and speeds through.

He is one of the smartest people I have ever met. This class is very hard especially if it is the first time you have heard any of the stuff. But dr.wenk tries really hard to go through things and explain them as well as he can. You don't need the book but you have to go to class to have a chance at a good grade

Dr. Wenk is clear, reasonable, and so very intelligent. If you go into the course with the mindset that it will be a challenge, you will likely find it to be very rewarding. I was thrilled to have such a quality instructor for neuroscience. Truly a world authority on the subject.

Dr. Wenk is awesome. His tests are ridiculous but the stuff he teaches you is the foundation for every other neuro class. His lectures are more for just knowledge, you really have to study the slides outside of class because anything can show up, but he has great office hours and will explain anything 2-3 times if you go. The effort is worth it!
He's completely out of his element when it comes to teaching.

Ridiculous course, but my major complaint is his grading . He says he grades on a curve, but it's not a true curve. Moreover, he doesn't use the standard grading scheme, which would be fine if he informed you of this on the syllabus.

Miraculously I passed this course by a hair, but I wouldn't encourage others to take it. To put it into terms prospective Neuroscience students may better understand, I would rather be lobotomized than suffer through this class again.

Gary is a poor excuse of a college professor. Yes he's intelligent and clearly knows what he's talking about, but that doesn't make one suited for teaching. He should stick to his research and leave the instruction to his superiors.

Admittedly, this guy knows his stuff. He's just clueless as to how to teach it in an accessible manner. It is an intro level course after all, but he approaches the material as if we're PhD seeking students.
Seems amiable enough in class, but personally I found him to possess a contemptible smugness in the way he carries himself. His class is an unpleasant experience as well.

Don't take him for any course. Powerpoint slides are problematic unless you happen to enjoy studying every petty detail. Even worse, you have no idea what to study for exams. You're better off reading the textbook. Don't take anything taught by this guy.

A considerable portion of students wisely dropped out of the course more than halfway into the semester if that's any indication of what to expect from the class. My advice is to take this class with Torello if you can.

I was originally enrolled to take Neuroscience with Professor Torello, but for whatever reason he decided not to teach it a day into the semester. Subsequently, everyone enrolled in his class was dumped into Wenk's class. Immediately should have dropped it when this happened.

Avoid this guy like the plague. Only grades are four exams, including a comprehensive final. Doesn't offer study guides.  Expects students to have already established an understanding of the material. Overall, way too demanding for an introductory course.

I would recommend any other professor for this course. He's an alright guy overall, but for an introductory course he expects you to have already mastered many of the concepts before you even begin his class.

Dr. Wenk was a great lecturer and had very fair tests.  The key to his class is to study smart. All of the lectures were posted online, but additional notes are necessary to do well. All of the test material is from the lecture, not the book. My only complaint is that he was not very good with answering emails. Overall, excellent professor

He is one the more difficult professors, but his class is definitely doable. He tests completely off his notes/lectures (not book), and it is definitely beneficial to actually attend the class. The class is curved to the highest score that someone has in the class. The class is based off of tests, no HW.

This was a introductory neuroscience course, and the teacher did not teach on that level. If you don't have knowledge on the subject already , do not take him. He does not curve, and he's tests are extremely difficult.He does have a study guide that deems worthless for the examine. Most people in the course have C grades.

He was very nice and easy to talk to but his slides are hard to follow, and notes are super hard to take because when it comes to the test, you never know what he's going to use. There is NO study guide. The test questions are worded differently then slide information. Everything is Vague and he doesn't take attendence, and no extra credit or work.

He's a really nice guy.  The tests are difficult, but he's always in his office willing to answer questions and help out. He also lets you look over old exams and the keys, which is very useful for the final.  only 2 midterms and a final though, no room for extra points but don't worry. if you do well on the final you'll be fine.

Overall the best professor I've ever had at OSU, in every category. His tests are challenging, but because he presents the material in such a captivating and interesting way, that studying for his class has always been fun. Plus, he always reviews before exams and gives us pointers. He TRULY cares about his students, and is very approachable.

Genius. Exams are difficult, so don't be surprised by that.. all multiple choice, but he expects you to know a lot of details. His classes are very interesting, though, and he is good teacher to learn from.

He is an excellent teacher.  All his exams are based on his slides, it is not necessary to go to class, however highly recommended.  He is always in his office, and willing to help you.  He repeats slides often to make sure students understand the material.  Two midterms and a final are your only grades in the class, no extra credit is given.

He is a GREAT teacher and a funny guy. If you come to class and take good notes you will do fine. He is very sraightforward in regards to his exams. Everything is from the lecture material. He also does a review session before each exam which is very helpful.

Material was overwhelming and basically impossible to study. He is very chemistry based in his lectures so unless you are really into that I would not take the class. He was not clear about the exams either. Since the final was cumulative there was over 700 slides to study. How does he think that is possible?

ridiculous class was not easy at all and he makes the material so difficult acting like this is the only class in which you should study. I think that it is somewhat intersting but other than that the class is not easy to comprehend at all.

Dr. Wenk is very nice but there was just too much material presented in the class.  Two midterms and a final, no room for additional points.  He did not provide any sort of guideline for study purposes either.  Difficult material and overwhelming.  I would not recommend this course unless you are already somewhat familiar with neuroscience.

Very nice guy and the material was interesting.  Going through his Powerpoints was a bit of a chore though; he frequently types in all-caps and repeats a bunch of slides, so I recommend taking your own notes while in class.  Not an easy A but the material may be interesting enough to make it worth your while.

Dr. Wenk is a great teacher, and his lectures are really interesting. Everything on the exams is either covered in lecture, or posted online. Focus on the neurological aspects of the material, a lot of the questions on the exam come from this. Attendance isn't mandatory but helps in overall understanding.

Dr. Wenk was a very interesting professor to listen to during lectures, and the first couple weeks I really enjoyed his style, until we took the first exam.  His lectures are completely disorganized, you will not know what he's going to put on the exam even if you go to every class,read the book, and understand everything.  Good guy but bad prof.

Dr. Wenk is a fabulous teacher. Very easy to understand and is quick to answer questions. I would recommend this teacher to any student needing to take this class. No book neccesary. The lectures are fun!!!

I'm a neuroscience minor and for me this class was disorganized and rather unscientific.  Dr. Wenk is not interested in teaching introductory biological psychology, he is more interested in doing a performance for an audience.

Dr. Wenk is an amazing professor, enough said.  305 is extremely interesting even though the material is not.  He tells a lot of stories that relates to the material so def go to class.  1 midterm and 1 final, thats it.  grading system is pretty cool too.  the highest grade is equiv to a 100%.

Dr. Wenk makes lectures very interesting and I always looked forward to going to this class. I took 305 without having taken 313 and I got an A. So you don't need neuroscience for this class, but I'm sure it would help. His tests are tricky but as long as you go to class and study his slides you'll be fine.

Gary was definitely a great professor.  His lectures were a little dry at times, but he typically inserted his twisted humor, which always made me laugh.  1 Mid-term, 1 Final and that is it, so study and go to lectures, because it is definitely a TOUGH class.  I probably wouldn't take it if I didn't have a good understanding of neuroscience...

Dr. Wenk is my favorite professor, he's a great guy. 313 was not a difficult class for me at all, and this was due in part to my being very interested in the material, but mainly to the way it was taught. All the material is on PPTs posted online. The exams are all MC. The grading is 'your grade'/'the top grade'. GO to class, it's very informative!

Fascinating class. Wenk clearly enjoys teaching and does it well. He posts his powerpoints to follow (this does not mean you can skip class, you'll miss a lot.) Tests are absolutely not easy and the material is detailed. I worked hard for my A- (one student clearly wanted to ruin curve for everyone else.) Highly recommend the class and the prof
Really funny, twisted sense of humor, but he uses a bit too much jargon as he lectures, especially for just a 300 level class.

love this dr., he rocks at teaching. class very intresting, but the test aren't easy, like it's not an easy A class. the hardness of the tests is okay/ normal. concepts are easy to grasp, i enjoyed studying for the class since it teaches us some pretty neat stuff. dr. wenk is my fav teacher at osu through my 3 and a half years here.
very much recommended, Dr. Wang is by far my fav. prof at OSU. Class isn't easy, but it's very easy to grab all concepts and fun to learn the material. My class grade was divided by 3 exams.

His classes are NOT EASY.  That being said, he is an amazing professor.  This class wasn't even required for my major; I just took it b/c he was teaching.  Dr. Wenk is very interesting and incredibly intelligent.  You'll have to work your butt off for an A though.  This is not your typical Psych class.

Incredible teacher who really gave me an appreciation for what I was learning.  He always had someway to relate it in a way that made sense.  Lectures are NEVER boring!!  You can tell he really loves teaching and genuninely wants his students to succeed.

Dr. Wenk is a great professor, though his jokes can sometimes take an different sense of humor to fully appreciate. Oh, and if he doesn't mention it in class, be sure to ask him what the strumus is, because it WILL be on a test.

Team taught class; Wenk seemed ok but got off topic a lot and it was hard to tell what was going to be tested.  Tests were overly hard (more like an upper level neuro-biology class than a GEC).  I do not recommend this 597 but the prof might be ok for other classes.

Class was very interesting and teacher was very approachable and helpful. Must admit, the class was not easy and I had to work hard to obtain a B. If you really want to do well, ask him questions and read the book to supplement his notes. Also, attend class because he tends to point out what he thinks are important points. Multiple choice test too!

Fascinating class.  Brilliant professor. Pretty engaging and entertaining even early in the morning.  Not an easy A, but he curves to the highest grade which helps a lot.  Don't bother buying the book, he tests from his (posted) power point slides. This class is worth taking just for the information alone.  I highly recommend taking his class.
This professor is brilliant and has a real sense of humor (unlike most professor's dry humor).

somewhat hard class, lots of information and lots of notes. notes are printed for you though which is helpful. he is really cool and easy to talk to. definitely a cool class, but you will do better with knowledge of psychobiology.
fun, interesting, and dashing.  take a class with him, even if you don't have to.  your life will be better because of it.

The only problem with his class is that he is too smart! Sometimes he moves a little too fast because of this. But he is very willing to help students and is a very nice man. He's been involved in tons of research. Focuses a lot on psychobiology and brain anatomy. I suggest you brush up on it before you take this class.
very knowledgeable instructor,learnt a lot from him. very nice guy,but quite a lot of memorization and not easy A.used to be in Johns Hopkins.

summary_comment: Stephen is an excellent professor known for making even early morning classes engaging and enjoyable. He effectively explains complex concepts and often relates them to real-world clinical scenarios. His course structure includes three short papers, two exams, with opportunities for extra credit and participation to enhance learning.

Ratings.comment: Stephen was an awesome professor who made class engaging and fun (for an 8 am class). There are 3 short papers and two exams, but opportunities for extra credit and participation grades. Stephen did a great job explaining the concepts and really related them to real clinical examples.
good

summary_comment: The professor offers flexible attendance policies but emphasizes the importance of studying the material for success, suggesting that students who do so can likely achieve an A. Overall, the teaching quality is considered adequate but not exceptional.

Ratings.comment: Not bad, you can go to class or you don't have to - but study the material and you will probably get an A.

summary_comment: Professor Heath's teaching style is demanding and requires significant self-study, with no provided study guides or PowerPoint presentations. Students must read extensively and prepare for frequent group case studies and pop-up attendance work. While exams can be challenging, they are curved, and Professor Heath is described as both knowledgeable and funny, though some find her class more difficult than necessary.

Ratings.comment: Be ready!!! no study guide, no ppt, no sample exam: you have to read lot of textbooks and still don't know how to prepare for exam. Also, every week you have to prepare for group case study and pop-up attendance work. exam is a bit of difficult. You have to work hard for the class. beside that, Prof Heath is nice and her class style is awesome.
No study guides for test, based on broad amount of information, work heavy, assignment heavy.

Her class was pretty easy to do well in if you pay close attention- she stresses reading the book but I kind of never did that (she gives 16 points of extra credit which is huge). Also her tests are a little tough but she curves them. Lecture was super interesting, but no phones/laptops in class- I mastered texting while making eye contact w/ her

Avoid if you can. Class material was interesting at times, but exam were overly difficult. Some questions came straight from lecture while others were random, obscure numbers you had to hope you memorized going into it. Assignments were manageable but often felt like points were getting taken off without any feedback as to why.

I like Dr. Heath as a person, but not so much as a professor. She is really funny and her lectures are interesting, but the exams are much harder and detailed than her lectures. Be sure to read the book if you want to do well. She does random in-class activities, so this is not the kind of class you can skip a whole lot.

She makes this class much harder than it needs to be. She also doesn't let you use any electronics to take notes and moves through the slides way too fast and then doesn't post them on Carmen. You need to read the textbook if you want to do well on the exams. She's a really hard grader, but I'm sure if you went to office hours she'd help.
Prepare for approximately 40 pages worth of reading each week, random in-class activities, talks about things in the book... almost like you are teaching yourself. Hilarious though

Jackie is a cool lecturer. She cares a lot about the material, and she knows her stuff. She is also occasionally pretty funny. The class is very fair, with plenty of opportunities to boost your grade outside of the exams. The exams themselves are fair too. It is a decent amount of studying, but definitely doable.

Dr. Heath is very funny, which makes her lectures really enjoyable. Your grade in the class comprises of two midterms and a final, 5-point chapter quizzes, REP participation, the occasional in-class activity, and a short paper. While her exams are fair, you definitely have to read the textbook carefully in order to do well.

While she is a generally nice person and a relatively good teacher, her grading is tough. Her critiques on papers are almost excessive and vague. Definitely need to attend class and take notes to pass the tests. Her lectures are enjoyable. The downside of this class is her tough grading on papers. Thank God for extra credit.

Dr. Heath is funny and her lectures are enjoyable. However, you HAVE to read each chapter to do well on the quizzes and exams, even though she constantly talks about how terrible the textbook is. Also, her exams are extremely difficult and ask very specific questions rather than questions testing your general knowledge of psychology concepts.

I honestly did not like her. She forces you to read the book outside of lecture despite her saying that she hates it. Also, the quizzes are pretty hard and you only have 5 minutes to finish them. She gives no study material for the exams, and you have to go to her office hours to get them back. She also constantly mentions the fact that she's a PhD

She is a hilarious prof and really knows her stuff. However you HAVE to read each chapter to do well on all of her quizzes and she makes the exams unreasonably difficult. Take this class if you're willing to put in the work

So funny! loves answering questions and is clearly passionate about what she talks about. She does make you work for the grade though. A pretty tough grader when it comes to papers and you NEED to know the information for the exams. She really does care about you knowing the information though so going to her office hours will help tremendously

She's awesome. Always makes time to meet with students, and ready to help if you think you aren't doing as well as you should be. She's funny and comes up with plenty of options for you to get extra credit if you need it. I'd definitely take her class again.
Dr. Heath is a great professor, she is very knowledgeable and explains things well. This class only had a few grades but there were a lot of extra credit points. She is hilarious.

Good professor. Doesn't give you powerpoint slides so you have to scramble to write everything down because she is a very fast talker. She is funny and interesting to listen to but sometimes hard to keep up with. Very hard grader and tests are hard. Papers are relatively easy. Not a lot of work.
very tough grader. is interesting to listen to in lecture and is funny
AWESOME professor. Very funny and kept the class engaged. Gives very detailed slides to take notes off of. Very helpful

Jackie is the best professor ever! I would go out of my way to take her again. She is so laid back and funny. She makes learning psych easy and fun. She will tell you exactly what to study because she writes the tests. Love her. TAKE HER CLASS!
She was helpful, pretty easy, and cool.

GO OUT OF YOUR WAY TO TAKE PSYCH 100 WITH HER! Jackie is young and funny. keeps the class very interesting with the slides she makes. class is chill and open for questions. she helps you make up stuff. didnt really use the textbook but who cares? the slides were sufficient. TOP PROFESSOR A++
She made the class lively! I recommend taking her class. You will learn a lot from her!

One of the best teachers I've ever had and definitely the best I’ve had so far at OSU. She is super funny and makes every class fun and interesting. She has slides for her lectures that you fill in and are great for studying, and since she’s the head TA she knows what is going to be covered on the tests and stresses it in class.

Psychology was a super interesting class in general. Jackie had power point notes for us and every lecture we basically filled in the blanks while she went thru notes and gave us lots of examples. Overall, a good instructor :)

summary_comment: Andre is widely praised for his exceptional teaching skills and engaging approach to psychology education. Students consistently highlight his passion for the subject, his accessibility, and his innovative methods to make complex topics relatable and memorable. His classes are described as easy to follow with minimal homework, provided students attend regularly and engage with the material.

Ratings.comment: He is such a nice professor!! I was in his introductory psychology course, and he was really passionate about teaching psychology. He was very accessible outside of class. He tried to make his lecture less boring which he succeeded.

Andre is an AWESOME lecturer. As long as you go to class and follow along with his guided notes, you don't have to study the hard for the midterms/final. The way he explains the material through real world examples is usually really interesting and relatable. This makes the content so much easier to learn and remember. I highly recommend this class

Andre is a great professor overall. He is very engaging with his students and always looks for new ways to improve his lectures. He puts in the extra effort whenever a student asks a question he doesn't know and gets back to them by the next lecture. Very little homework, passable with an A if you pay attention, take good notes, and come to class.
Hes really nice, chill, funny and cares a lot about students and what he teaches.

Andre is a pretty cool guy. Easy going, but really knows his stuff. Pretty engaging too. Class attendance is taken and you'll lose points if you don't show up. It was a pretty easy class. 1 online Carmen quiz a week(6 questions, 0.5 points, open note/book), 1 half page paper at the end, midterms were tricky but as long as you study, you're fine.

Andre is hands down the best professor I have ever had. From posting cute pictures of his dog in the PPT, to relating the material we cover to everyday life, the man does it all. He provides us with guided notes, and always keeps class interactive. I genuinely look forward to going to this class (not even because he's so good-looking!) Take it!!!

If you have to take PSYCH1100 and haven't chosen to take it with Andre, wyd. This is by far one of the coolest classes I've taken thus far and he made it that much better. Go to class, take the notes (he even provides guided notes) and skim over the textbook and you'll easily get the grade you worked for! Awesome class with a super cool professor

One of the best instructors I've had at OSU. If you use his guided notes and show up for the attendance points (you can miss a few classes without penalty), you'll be more than fine. He's very clear in lecture and answers any and all questions you may have. Definitely recommend his class!
Andre is a great professor. He keeps the class entertained and the class is super organized, Overall very easy as long as you go to class and take notes.

Take this class! While this is a class with lots of material, Andre breaks it down into portions and language that is easy to comprehend. There is no need to buy the textbook, if you plan to go to class and take notes. If not, then you're in for it... Go to class, and you'll pass. Simple.

Amazing professor and an amazing person! Tests are easy, there's tons of extra credit opportunity, and he's really engaging and makes lectures fun! He cares about his students and makes sure to personally care for each and every students individual needs. I would 100% take this class again if that was an option lol

Great professor! Really cares about his students and their success in the class. Attendance points are taken every class but it's just one point a day so you won't fail if you skip a few classes. My class had a free e-book but it wasn't used very often. As long as you do the assignments and follow the rubrics, you should pass this class.

Andre has very engaging lectures and actively tries to involve the students in discussion. He is interested in student feedback and improves the course based on it. He also has some stylin facial hair.

Andre is the best professor I've ever had at Ohio State. Psych 1100 was a breeze with him as long as you go to lecture and review before the tests. He keeps lectures extremely interactive and interesting. If you have any interest in psychology or need credit for GEs take his course.
Andre is an excellent professor. He made the content interesting. The course is easy with extra credit built in. I would highly recommend this class for anyone needing a GE credit.
he's a great teacher and provides guided noted which makes it easy to follow along with his slides.

He is an amazing teacher. He clearly explained information in his lectures. He was honest, and if he could not answer a question, he would make an effort to research an answer so he could answer it. If you have to take this class, Andre Plate is the instructor to go with.

Andre is a great professor!! He is very interactive and relates most of the material to real world examples. He takes daily attendance, but I would recommend going cause the lectures are interesting and he makes them fun.

He made the class fun even though I am not a PHYCH major. He knows a lot about the material and if he doesn't know the answer to a question will find one out of class for you. He's a great person over all and I highly recommend him to everyone.

Andre is an awesome guy and instructor! He makes the material as interesting as he can and presents it in a clear manner. He uses real life examples, which is helpful. He is always willing to help students, and he emails back in a timely manner. He is just overall a good person, honestly. Highly recommend!
Amazing teacher! Would recommend him to everyone, just pay attention in class and do the assignments and you'll pass with an A/B
Andre is a great Psych professor! His information is very interesting, clear and applicable. His notes are so good that if you just know them you'll get As on the tests

Andre is a great teacher who genuinely cares about his students. He is willing to meet outside of class to go over past exams and give more examples. He does give you participation points by doing BrainTeasers, but these are questions like those on the exam and are very helpful. Overall, an interesting course taught by an enthusiastic teacher.

I like the exmaples the instructor give for us to understand the concept in class, very interesting and helpful. I also like the well-organized lecture, really clear, and the lecture notes really help.

Andre was a great teacher. The material is very interesting and he applies it to your everyday life. If you print out the notes taking notes in class is easy and you can follow along with the slides. Exams are manageable and there is multiple opportunities for extra credit. Highly recommend he is very attractive.
Andre is a really nice teacher who cares about his students success. If you show up to class and take notes you will do well.

andre is a nice guy, and he clearly tries to make his lectures enjoyable and engaging. very lenient grader on the written assignments. attendance wasn't technically taken, but a daily in-class activity made up a part of the final grade. easy overall, didn't need to use the textbook, just show up to the lectures and take notes.

He explains concepts well and puts pictures of his dog all over the lecture slides. Doesn't post the lecture slides online though (which annoyed me), so got to go to class everyday and write quickly. As long as you do the work and study, it's an easy A.

Hey me again, trying to recover from my grammatically incorrect review. Andre is a great professor and connects the material with our everday lives which is super helpful and helps with the tests. Also, sit in the front because he's hot af.

Andre is a great teach and really connects with the students. He makes jokes all the time and actually connects the material to what we are learning which is super helpful for mnemonics and such. Great teacher and 10/10 would recommend. Even though he just got married,  still recommend  sitting in the front because he's hot af.

Andre is an incredible teacher and wants you to succeed.  He provides plenty of extra credit opportunities and doesn't hesitate to meet one on one and discuss your performance. I came into his class a business student and left with a different perspective on things. Truly inspiring. My recommendation, go out of your way to take his class!

Plate is a wonderful professor. He is always welcoming  to even his more reserved, quiet students to ask questions and appreciates feedback to improve his lectures. His obviously caring personality and his want for his students to pass with flying colors is admirable making it motivating to want to learn and participate. Plus, easy on the eyes.
He gives out guided notes. No need for textbook. Still need to study to pass exams because they are standardized online exams, meaning he does not make the exams. AND So good looking!

Class is easy. Look over your class notes and you should be fine for the exams with minimal studying. He's extremely attractive and makes a lot of jokes and talks about his dog a lot. There are daily brain teasers which are essentially an attendance grade but going to class isn't hard because it's really fun and he's very nice to look at.

summary_comment: The professor is generally praised for being approachable and providing clear, useful guided notes. However, lectures can be boring and difficult to hear from the back of the room, focusing heavily on vocabulary with minimal engagement. Despite occasional tough grading on homework, exams are relatively easy if students know the vocabulary and attend review sessions.

Ratings.comment: Very nice guy and his lectures were peaceful. Posted guided notes before lectures. Most of the course was just vocabulary. Extremely light studying got me good grades on exams.

Lectures were difficult to hear if located in the back of the room and often were just reading off of PowerPoint slides. Doesnt post slides, but there are guided notes posted which are literally verbatim from the slides with some blanks to fill in yourself.

Can be a tough grader on the few homework assignments we did have, but not terrible. Lectures are VERY boring but you need to go or you get points off. Tests were super easy, just know the vocab and how to apply it to situations. To do well on tests just go to other teachers' review sessions. Lots of extra credit.

Hunter is an amazing professor who you'll be lucky to have for your psych class. This was his first year teaching, and he did amazing. He gives tons of examples in class, lots of super easy ways to get extra credit, and he'll always be willing to help you go over work you may not understand. If you get his for your professor, praise the lord, lol.

summary_comment: Yoolim is an engaging and humorous professor who uses stories to keep students interested in her lectures. While her English can be challenging at times, her clear powerpoints and guided notes make up for it. She encourages attendance for participation points and review sessions, and exams and projects are generally easy and straightforward.

Ratings.comment: Yoolim is a hilarious teacher and her stories will make you want to come back to lecture week to week. Shes not the best at answering questions, but she is willing to help. Come to lecture so you can get your top hat points, and do extra REP's for extra credit. Not really any homework . Definitely attend her review sessions, study via quizlet.

Yoolim is a great professor. She has a little trouble with English sometimes, but her powerpoints and guided notes are clear. She tells hilarious stories and relates class material to real life. Exams are easy, projects are easy (and easily graded), but come to class for participation points. She tells you to read the book but you don't have to.

summary_comment: This professor effectively uses TopHat for engagement and grading, ensuring consistent attendance and preparation. She delivers clear and engaging lectures, even on complex topics, and demonstrates a strong commitment to her students' success through timely reminders and accessible office hours. Additionally, she leverages TopHat as a valuable study tool, providing practice questions to help students perform well on exams.

Ratings.comment: You do TopHat everyday and it counts for a pretty big chunk of your grade, so just show up and youll be fine. The exams have questions you wont cover in class so get an A you will have to read the book some.

Teaches the content through interesting lectures, as well as clearly explaining even the most complicated of concepts. Cares a lot about her students and gives reminders for assignments in advance. Not many assignments. Is very accessible outside of class. Utilizes TopHat, which is a great study tool, and offers practice questions before exams.

summary_comment: Professor Madeline Doran is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, which emphasize application over rote memorization, preparing students well for exams. Her lectures are well-structured and engaging, though attendance is crucial for note-taking. Students find her approachable, caring, and passionate about her subject, though some suggest reading the textbook can fill in gaps.

Ratings.comment: Professor Doran was a great instructor. She did not focus too heavily on rote memorization but rather application questions. This prepared me for exams and I got 100% on all the midterms for this class. You don't need to attend lecture AND read the textbook. I got away with not going to class at all in the final weeks. She is amazing and sweet, too

Madeline Doran is a professor that actually cares about her students. She is very easygoing and understanding as well as relatable. Her lectures are well structured and worth attending. She prepares you well for the midterms and final. The textbook isnt a must but it does fill in any gaps in lecture & can be a good source to preview the material.

Very thorough during lectures, and uses real world applications to make the concepts more clear. Always willing to help after or outside of class. Exams are easy as long as you attend lecture OR read the textbook. Very pleasant person to be around!

She made psych interesting and was passionate about what she was teacher I didn't do that well on the exams (87, 89, 92) but I used extra credit to my advantage (do your REP extra credit and prof doran gives out a lot of extra credit by itself however only in the summer tho) Prof Doran is also a great person to talk to in general about anything

Fantastic lecturer!! Her lectures and teachings flow so smoothly I can't believe this is the first class she's teaching. Really caring and responsive, always showering us with candies and interesting stories. But you've got to attend lectures and take notes from slides as they aren't available in other forms. Her slides are pretty comprehensive
She was a great professor, especially for this being her first year! She's super cute and caring, and easy to talk to! She gives good lectures and really tries to make you understand the lectures!

Great Professor. You must show up to class to get notes because they aren't posted online. But, you don't have to read the textbook. You have to study for a good amount to get an A but overall she is really good.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his comprehensive coverage of empirical evidence in psychology, particularly beneficial for students interested in clinical psychology and pursuing advanced degrees. While lectures can be somewhat dry, the material is considered essential for developing critical thinking and research literacy skills, and the assignments are generally seen as valuable rather than busywork. However, the class requires significant time commitment and can be challenging for those with heavy course loads.

Ratings.comment: This class should be a requirement for all psych major. The articles analyzed and discussed are eye-opening and definitely changed my perspective on the field of psychology. If you find the science component lacking from other psych class, take this class as we go over empirical evidences and why it matters. Lectures can be dull though.

If you are wanting to pursue graduate school/ phD / PsyD in clinical psych, take this course! I found the material to be absolutely fascinating. Looks at a lot of research, identifies key problems in the growing field of clin psych, prepares you for furthering your education. A good amount of reading, but never just "busy work". Smart and nice prof

Dr. Vasey's class prepared me for grad school, and he's a wealth of knowledge on clinical psych. There's much to do for the weekly readings, but they're opportunities to practice critical thinking/research literacy skills rather than busywork. Lectures could be hard to follow, but worth going to if you're interested in clinical psych topics/issues.

Do not take his class if you're a full time student and have limited time to study. His class is very boring and he's a very though grader. in order to do good in his class you need to consume a lot of time preparing every week. He gives pop-quizzes. I do not recommend taking this class while taking other hard courses. He's very boring.

You definitely need the textbook to do well on the quizzes (4, worth 10% of grade) and some of the exams have book based questions. The exams have a ton of free response essays but he's a very fair grader, it's just a bit tedious. If you're going into the psych profession at all you neeeed this class.

Essential if you are considering on becoming a Clinical Psychologist, he teaches you how to critically evaluate research, most of the material is about logic. Rarely used the textbook (just rent it from the library for the assigned readings). Had 5 quizzes at the end of the semester from assigned papers (not textbook). Exams have like 6 essay :(

Brilliant professor... and provided a completely new perspective on psychology that I would've never had unless I took this class.  Very beneficial because the field is turning to evidence based practice and he's obviously a strong supporter of it.  Personally don't think you should graduate with a psych degree without taking his class

A very interesting class. If you like clinical psychology, this class is essential. It's mostly about evaluating clinical research, ethics, and policy, not a basic continuation of abnormal psychology 3331. If you like research and clinical psychology, you should definitely take this class. It helped me develop research reading skills too.

Went to office hours and got a lot of help. One of the few psych professors that made me feel like I actually learned something. After his class I feel remotely competent in the field of psychology which is something I've not felt before because most courses cover the same studies with the same dry memorization approach.

I loved this class!  All essays, long and hard but if you attend class, you will be fine and you will have the choice to not take the final. Which I think was the best news ever! The material is very interesting and he makes the class so much fun. He is very funny. Take this class, you will love it.

Great class from a great profesor. Should be required of all psych majors, simply because Dr. Vasey delves into important issues in psychology that you'll never hear from your advisors. He helped me in & out of class to better decide what I really want to do in psychology and where I should go for grad school. Hard tests, but class is worth it.
The exams are hard and all essay questions. But he is very helpful.

Dr. Vasey is an incredible professor. You will feel so much more prepared to make decisions regarding psych and your future plans after taking this class. He is also very genuine in wanting to help his students learn and make good decisions in their careers. Understanding, intelligent, and entertaining, you can't go wrong with this prof!

TAKE THIS CLASS!! Should be required for ALL psych majors! Dr. Vasey is incredibly informative and helpful. The subject material is interesting and sometimes even astonishing. Attend class, because most of the material on the tests comes from lecture. Tests are all essay, but if you attend lecture and do readings and they should be fine!

Dr. V is the BEST professor at OSU. He is fun, witty, interesting. You will walk away from this class satisfied. No textbook, but daily article readings (not that hard). Exams are a bit lengthy, but just know your stuff and you will do fine. Lecture attendance is mandatory, he goes over what he wants you to know for exams. TAKE THIS CLASS!
I love Dr. Vasey, awesome class, have to take it if you are a psych major, he is my honors advisor, and I could not have asked for better..!!!!!!! :)
IF YOU DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS YOU SHOULD NOT BE ABLE TO GRADUATE AS A PSYCH DEGREE

Really cares about what he is teaching.  Tests were all essay, but everything on it was discussed in detail during class, the format makes sure you have a working knowledge of the material, and the grading was very fair. A little bit of effort goes a long way in this class.  Overall a great class.

Loved the class, loved his critiques, but the tests are in essay format and really difficult (and I love essays!). The TA we had graded all of the exams, and  for some reason, was a total nazi about it. We were allowed to justify our answers to get more credit, but we had to go in to argue with her.
Great class, I learned a lot. He really makes you think critically ! A nice guy too.

I loved this class. I learned so much. Dr. Vasey makes you think like a scientist and look at information critically. You were really able to apply things learned in 331 in a practical sense. Tests were all essays...so know your stuff well.
the best psych class i took...he makes the class very interesting and easy to learn....if you're interested in counseling as a career, take this class
Great Professor, class is great, learned a lot out of it.  A must take class for all psychology students.

summary_comment: Dr. Munneke is highly regarded for his excellent teaching and kindness. Students find his lectures clear and engaging, and he is patient in answering questions. The course is manageable with three exams based on lecture slides, and there are multiple opportunities to improve grades through group projects and extra credit.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Munneke is a great professor. He is very kind and fair with grading. There are 3 exams, and they're based on the lecture slides, which are also posted online. If you learn the slides well, exams aren't bad. There are lots of opportunities to bring up your grade, and it isn't a very hard class. Group project at the end of the semester as well.

He is a great and caring professor, and he makes this course really easy to understand. You can ask him questions in the homework session and he always answers patiently. The textbook is not required but can be useful if you don't understand anything in the lecture. I didn't go to the learning lab but it is a way to earn extra credit.

Definitely recommend having him as your prof! He is such a nice person and is extremely patient with explaining material and answering questions. Attendance isn't mandatory, but definitely recommend going because he gives great lecture!

Dr. Munneke is a great professor. Very clear lectures. There is a book but only refer to it if you are confused. You have to do a group project and write a group research paper, which he does not grade hard if you meet the clear criteria provided. He is engaging and gives extra credit here and there because the course is not graded by many things.

Overall, loved the class and professor. As long as you come to class prepared, I think you'll be fine. He was very flexible, and tailored things when a previous activity didn't go as well for most people so that we could better understand future material. He's pretty easy to talk to if you have a question/concern about anything.
This course was very interesting! My one issue is that I really wish there was a textbook associated with the class. I think it would have been really helpful in solidifying course content for me.
Great prof! Explained the course material very well and there was a lot of time to work on problems in class, so it was super easy to get any questions answered.

summary_comment: Dr. Petrov is highly regarded for his passion and depth of knowledge in his subject, making even challenging topics engaging and interesting. Students appreciate his organized approach and commitment to ensuring understanding, though they note the class requires significant effort with extensive reading and frequent quizzes. While some find the workload demanding, many praise his effectiveness in teaching and his dedication to his students.

Ratings.comment: This class was the hardest class I took this semester but also my favorite. Dr. Petrov is genuinely passionate about the subject and very knowledgeable, he's also pretty funny and manages to make even the most boring topics interesting to learn about. It is a lot of reading/taking notes but if you keep up with it it's not too bad! I'd recommend it.

I loved this class even with all the quizzes. The little check in quizzes every lecture really helped me learn the material. You can drop 8 quizzes and one exam(including the final). He really cares about what he's teaching and it is a super cool class if you're interested. If you want an easy A pick another prof, but I loved learning from Petrov

Despite the ratings here, I think Professor Petrov is one of the best psych professors in OSU. He ensures that you truly understand the material, and spares no effort in teaching you. He's extremely passionate about the subject. His syllabus was very well organized and his grading was fair. Anyone would be lucky to have him as a teacher.

I was intimated to take this class due to the low ratings on here, but I actually really, really enjoyed him as my professor. He not only was funny and kind, but could teach the material in a concise way and made everything very objective so that there was no confusion with grading.

I love Professor Petrov's class. He's always ready to help, provides great resources, and his lectures are engaging. The quizzes are frequent and the pre-class readings are many, but they prepare you well for the exams. His passion for the subject and dedication to his students is what makes this course amazing. Overall, he's a great professor.

Not sure if it is a cultural disconnect but Professor Petrov is very verbally disrespectful to the attendees of his lectures. Insinuating a lack of basic knowledge to a room full of people is not very conducive to a healthy learning environment. 
Read the textbook and required readings and you'll be fine.

Dr. Petrov assigned almost 50 pages a class, and we had a class quiz every class and an outside quiz after every class. Exams were not that hard if you came to class & paid attention, but it was just A LOT of reading & work. He expects you to memorize charts & schematics (of memory paths, for example) I'm not a math guy, so the cog. part was hard.

Man I didn't expect his rating to be so low here... I've had difficult profs but he is definitely not one of them. Detailed study guide, well prepared & organized lecture & materials. On the overlapped content with my PSYCH3513, Dr. Petrov's explanation is better. He is one of the few professors that can catch my attention throughout the lectures.

- The quizzes he gives to start every class can be very specific and it is hard to remember such details from the required reading
- The lectures are long and cover some irrelevant information

Other than these criticisms, Dr. Petrov is a good professor. If you follow his instructions on how to go about learning the content, you will do fine.

Very enthusiastic professor, but course was very content-heavy. In-person lectures were a waste of time; the content we were tested on was in recorded lectures (which were hours longer than the amount of in-class time every week), the textbook, and additional videos/readings. You are expected to memorize everything; I truly mean everything.

He's intelligent, funny, likeable, and most of all, a sadistic grader. Grades grad students less harshly than undergrads. Exam averages are C-; not a single grad student got an A and he still didn't curve. Gives 6-8 lectures per week including recorded ones and extreme expectations for time commitments. This is basically a 6 credit hour class.

Content is the most amazing thing, but undergrads only had 2 exams, 45 ques 90 points each. total points in class only 280. rest of the points come from lame online quizzes that don't help you but you'll get 100% on most. Doesn't finish the material in class, so makes us watch his online video lectures, read the textbook chapter, and do discussion

I dropped this class 2 weeks in. I saw these ratings but needed the class so I gave it a try and quickly regretted it. His lectures are messy and hard to understand. The content was so dry and he made 0 effort to make it bearable. After the quizzes, I dipped. Don't even bother with this guy, take a different prof.

This teacher is possibly the worst teacher that I have ever had the misfortune of having to be taught by. Petrov was never consistent with the due dates of his modules, which was contradictive of his syllabus. For example our final module was posted on Friday 12/4/2020 and due on Saturday along with the previous weeks module. Don't take his class!

Yeah, this class is not it. Try to get a different professor for 3312. Gives quizzes at the beginning and end of every lecture, and his lectures are incredibly confusing and uninteresting. The content is already a little confusing to begin with and his explanations do absolutely nothing expect make it more confusing. Would not recommend.

He is literally all over the place when he teaches. He goes back and forth on all the slides. Then there are not only 1 quiz but basically two quizzes every day in class, one is at the beginning of class and another at the end. Im sure he knows what he is talking about and seems like a nice guy but is just such a horrible educator.
