I really hated his class. He quizzes on the material he is supposed to cover in class, before class. The quizzes aren't easy, so you have to understand the material before coming. They are a big part of your grade. Then he spends too much time explaining easy things and makes them over-complicated. It's more confusing to pay attention than to not.

This class was a nightmare. Make sure to read the book and review the slides before class because there are quizzes at the beginning and end of each class that ask specific and advanced questions. Study literally every assigned page of the textbook for exams because he asks about topics that were never discussed in lecture but appeared in the book.

This class is not worth the stress, I would not recommend. The professor is all over the place and makes no sense. If you zone out for five seconds you're lost for the rest of the lecture. The book is boring to read, but important because he asks questions on exams that were not covered in lecture. He also gives a quiz every single day of class.

Alex is knowledgeable and funny. I took the intro and advanced cognitive science class with him in 2012. I was a computer science major so some of the stuff many people find difficult was probably easier for me.

NOT easy, but not impossible. "Pop" quizzes nearly every lecture, but they also count for extra credit once you hit a certain amount. Tests are challenging. HAVE to go to class and keep up. I went to class, reviewed every lecture, and I did fine. Not a walk in the park but not as bad as it sounds. Drops an exam and grading is curved significantly

Dr. Petrov is very knowledgable about cognitive psychology, but tends to be all of the place when teaching. The material itself is not hard, but lectures are all over the place and difficult to follow. Tests cover specific topics that may not have been covered in lecture, only in the book.

Lecture heavy, but he is so passionate about the course that it makes it enjoyable and interesting! Has a great philosophy of how putting in the most work can guide you to an A. Would definitely recommend taking this course!

Had to retake this class because I didn't take it seriously the first time, but he really is not a bad professor. He is passionate about psychology and it shows in class. Lectures are almost entirely being lectured at, and almost every class has a pop quiz at the end. Read the book, take good notes, ask him questions if you have them! Nice guy.

Ridiculous. Avoid at all costs. If you are taking him for an elective, find someone, anyone, as a better choice. He snaps at people and he uploads 50+ slides a lecture and makes it to slide 22,then assigns 20 readings for exam on top of the slides he didn't get to. You cannot even apply what he teaches to any aspect of life. Huge language barrier.

Incredibly smart, and teaches a hellishly fast-paced course. If you don't care about the material, you will fail in a week. If you love the material, you will learn a ton and STILL almost fail, but enjoy it the entire time. Would only recommend him (and the course) to current or aspiring graduate students, though.

I was pleasantly surprised by Prof. Petrov's class compared to his ratings; although his lectures are long, you can honestly see that he enjoys teaching the material. Read the textbook and attend lectures, and you'll do just fine in the class.

Gives pop quizzes almost every lecture. His lectures are long and always go over. The material is dense and sometimes confusing, especially when he goes on a tangent about a topic. If you read the assigned readings and review before class, the pop quizzes can help your grade. I did well in his class because I reviewed the material almost everyday.

He's nice and has an interest in the subject, but every lecture is 80 minutes of constant lecturing, hardly any chance for questions, and no in-class/group review before a test. There is a pop quiz after almost every lecture that's supposed to be given during the last 5 minutes, but he talks so much it's usually the last 2 minutes. READ THE BOOK!!!

He really likes what he is talking about but he talks for way too long and can be confusing. Lectures always go over time. Pop quizzes almost every lecture. He doesn't test on specific concepts, so you have to study every single little thing. Instead of a study guide he says to read the book, lecture slides, and other required readings.

Alex is comical. The class was extremely tough,and he doesn't go over exams. (Only one question that everyone missed). The book was so helpful. Go to class because those pop quizzes really save you. I thought I was going to fail the class, but a miracle happened. (I don't even know how). Drops one exam grade. And I really enjoyed what the class.

Don't take this class if you hate reading. Students who work hard are rewarded; I did the  assigned readings after every lecture, studied material before class the next day in case of a pop quiz, and ended up doing well. Highlight things he emphasizes in class- it will be on the exam. You can earn extra credit through extra pop quizzes.
GO TO CLASS! If you are an average student you should go to class because the pop quizzes saved me this semester.

Dr. Petrove is very interested in the subject, but unfortunately he is not good at teaching. He talks the whole lecture, and he usually takes minutes after to finish; however, he does not use the lectures much in his exams. Dr. Petrov unlike all professors, he refuses to give any helpful information for exams; furthermore, he says that everything (
Pop quizzes in class but not too bad if you've gone to lecture and reviewed the material a little. Textbook heavy class but doable. Very interesting subject material though, and I learned a lot!

Do  not take him if unless you are ready to be bored, frustrated & unrewarded for hard work. This guy gave a pop quiz almost every class. There was no way to guess what was on the test & he tested on things not focused in lecture

Gets through about 20 of his 50 slides each lecture but still tests you on what he didn't cover. Extremely boring and hard to pay attention even though the material is hard. Don't take this class if you don't have to.

Boring ! Not an effective communicator. My section would struggle to stay awake. Hard to follow at times because he can't deliver his lecture effectively. He knows he is boring and doesn't care. Exams are hard because you don't really know what to expect out of the 200 pages you just read this makes him smirk. Class Average 1st Mid 71% D.

If you are interested in Cognitive Psych you will enjoy this class. There is a wealth of info in the readings and Dr. Petrov posts additional readings for those really interested in the material. He is a pleasant guy and offered help to students who needed it. The exams are difficult! He gives 30 points for simply attending classes though, so go!

Alot of work for a class..He tends to use some of the same slides for both the 612 and the 312 if that gives you a hint as to how hard it will be. I studied for a couple weeks before the tests and ended up getting C's as well. I usually get A's. I like the guy but material is not explained well and you are not sure what will be on the test.

His class was terribly unorganized. He took four weeks to grade the first assignment, which was a mere 500 word summary. His tests are unfair and require memorization of, mostly, the graphs and charts he uses in his lectures. No one finished the first exam because he had 12 essay questions and gave about 30-45 minutes to do them.

Class was not mandatory, however there was role and the extra points are deffinetly needed to help your grade. Tests were very difficult, I read every sentence in the book and still came out with two Cs on each test. The hw were time consuming and hard. If u have to take this just do everything to get every point possible I came out with a B.

absolutely HORRIBLE professor.. i felt like he felt he was better than everyone. i asked for help on the 2nd day and was basically told to do it on my own. homework was graded way too harsh by TA, and tests didn't even follow the notes. just try to get a C and move on.

Gets annoyed easily.  5 homework assignments with medium difficulty. 2 exams with unexpected information covered on them. neither professor nor TA very helpful. subject matter is very dry and difficult to understand at time. also, petrov has a pretty thick accent

A very likable guy, but I agree, don't take this unless you are a computer sci grad student. Even though the grading was easy, it was miserable to sit through the incomprehensible, mandatory lectures. Intense essay exams. Seriously, unless this is your area of interest and you know computers, stay away!

Petrov is a SMART man, but sometimes he jumps around too much... Hard to understand if you don't already have a good general understanding of the material. DO NOT take this class if you know nothing about computer science. On the plus side he's a VERY lenient grader!

I took this last quarter with another professor (shulman) and had to drop it because i could not understand anything he was talking about.  Petrov is WORLDS better.  He's interesting and funny, he's an expert in the field, and he really wants you to learn.  Go to class!  Lenient grading scale too, 86% was an A this quarter.  GREAT PROF.

summary_comment: Dr. Krajbich is highly regarded for making complex subjects engaging and interesting, as evidenced by multiple students praising his ability to spark enthusiasm and curiosity. His classes are described as straightforward and easy with a focus on effort-based grading and completion of problem sets. Overall, students find his lectures stimulating and recommend the class enthusiastically.

Ratings.comment: The most interesting class I've taken here at OSU. Dr. Krajbich consistently makes the content interesting and engaging. The course is stimulating and made me want to pursue this field in the future. Couldn't recommend this class more.
Great professor. Class was straight forward and homework graded based on effort. Exam short answers are based on homework problems.
Great class. Great prof

There is a midterm and final exam each worth about 30-35% of your grade and then there are optional pop quizzes that you can opt-out of at the beginning of the semester (about 5%). the last 30% is based on problem sets that are based solely on completion. All in all the content in this class is very straightforward and this is a pretty easy A.

Really interesting lectures, in a really interesting subject area. This class was mainly an overview of current research in the field. Dr. Krajbich does a great job of creating excitement for his subject within others, and he is sometimes pretty funny.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her dedication to student understanding and passion for teaching. She offers extra credit opportunities and makes it easy to catch up if you miss class, though exams can be challenging with many students performing below average. Her teaching style, while fast-paced, is accommodating to those who need her to slow down, and she focuses primarily on exam performance for grading.

Ratings.comment: She is awesome! She really cares to see if you know the material and understand what's going on. She acknowledges that she's a fast talker so if you need her to slow down she will. Grade is based on 3 exams and tophat homework. You don't need to take one of the 3 exams if you feel good about how you scored on the other 2.

An amazing prof!! Really cares that her students actually understand the material and you can tell how passionate she is about what she is teaching. Most of your grade is determined by how you do on exams but when a lot of people did bad on the first one, she gave a great extra credit opportunity. If you miss class, it is super easy to catch up.

Super nice lady who is passionate about teaching but I took this class for a GE and it turned out to be my hardest class. Lots of extra credit and points from TopHat but exams were confusing and most people did bad on them. Exams are in person while the other psych class exams were online. It was not the worst but not enjoyable.

summary_comment: The professor is known for his relaxed teaching style and easygoing demeanor. Students found the course manageable with just one short paper and three online exams that encourage critical thinking. While attendance is not mandatory, participating in in-class polls can earn points, making it worthwhile to attend.

Ratings.comment: He is super chill and easygoing. There was 1 paper and it only had to be 1-2 pages long so nothing terrible. 3 exams, all online and aren't too difficult but challenging enough to make you think and apply what you learned in class. Attendance isn't really mandatory but you do get attendance/participation points for in-class Tophats so I would go.

summary_comment: Brooklynn is a highly effective and thorough teacher who engages students during lectures and ensures they are well-prepared for quizzes and exams.

Ratings.comment: Brooklynn is a very thorough teacher who is engaging during lectures. Always felt prepared for quizzes and exams.

summary_comment: Professor Courtney is highly regarded for her caring nature and effective teaching methods, encouraging participation and providing clear explanations. She emphasizes the importance of staying on top of course material and offers support through office hours and detailed note templates. However, her approach can sometimes complicate simple tasks and lacks detailed guidance on complex assignments, making consistent attendance crucial.

Ratings.comment: She is a caring professor. She encourages participation, so try to raise your hand once or twice. She lays the topics out clearly and is happy to talk to you about any issues. My biggest tip for 1100 is get your REPs done early and go for the extra credit with them. Also go to class! She explains her slides well and provides note templates.
Does not respond to students in online courses.
She was a great teacher, she used tons of examples during lectures, which helped me a lot. She does rely quite a bit on the textbook, so make sure you have it!

Read the book, her lectures are pretty good and she really cares about her students but this class can be tough if you don't keep up with the content. Concepts are easy to understand but make sure to do some reviewing as her tests could be pretty tricky, at least that's what I thought.

Courtney is a good teacher, but she sometimes makes simple tasks way more complicated than they need to be. Not as much guidance on the assignments that are actually complicated. You need to attend class, only 1 unexcused absence for the whole semester. Group research project lasts entire semester, but individual paperwork a lot of the time.

Dr. McGinty is the best professor I've ever had. I thought this class would be awful because of the group work and the challenge of doing my own research, but it was awesome! She truly cares about her students and is excited about teaching them how to do psychology research. She tries really hard to make groups that work well together, too.

Courtney is awesome! The class is challenging but so worth it. I am so glad I picked this over the Cognitive Psych Lab. I learned so much and had so much fun doing research. Courtney was always a huge help. Definitely recommend!
Courtney is a competent professor and offers just the right amount of guidance for this very independent class (4520). She's very nice and willing to help if you ask.

This class was pretty easy but boring. Grade is based on a group research project, attendance, group peer evaluation, research paper, and poster presentation. However, I don't think she is very knowledgeable of the subject, and not very helpful.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her easy and laid-back teaching style, which makes the class accessible and enjoyable. She is known for genuinely caring about her students and for clearly explaining concepts in her lectures. Students find her exams manageable as long as they attend her classes regularly.

Ratings.comment: Her class is easy and laid back. Shes a nice professor and shows that she really cares about her students. Her lectures are easy to keep up with and she explains things really well. Her exams are easy if you go to lectures.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and deep passion for psychology, which significantly contributed to students' success. She actively encourages engagement and offers extensive support through office hours and career advice, making her classes invaluable. Students strongly recommend her over other instructors due to her comprehensive approach and dedication.

Ratings.comment: She was an amazing professor! She really enjoys the field of psychology and it definitely showed. I never spoke up or went to office hours, but take advantage of it! She was so willing to help out with opportunities and what to do after undergrad too. I ended the class with nearly 100% and she was a big reason why. Take her class over other profs!!

summary_comment: Professor Van Zandt is widely regarded as ineffective in teaching PSYCH 3321, a required course for B.S. students. Students find her lectures confusing and her materials inadequate, leading to significant stress and minimal learning despite passing grades. The TA's are highly recommended for additional support, but the professor's unavailability and poor communication exacerbate the difficulties.

Ratings.comment: She often didn't understand her own material. Unfortunately, she is currently the only professor for PSYCH 3321, which is a required course for B.S. students. My best advice would be to go to the TA's for help, as they probably have a better understanding.

Nothing against Van Zandt personally, she just doesn't have that firm of a grasp on how students can retain this information. I got through the class with a fine grade but a lot of stress and don't feel like I actually learned. The TA's are great, super helpful. She's very hard to reach outside of class, frustrating and hard to understand

She made this class too difficult. The material itself isn't hard, but she finds a way to make it confusing. The notes she posts online are garbage(tbh theyre not great during lecture either) and there's a lot of miscommunication with her and the TAs. I am honestly shocked I did well in this class, but I don't think I actually learned much. Avoid!

I had Dr. Van Zandt for the honors version of 3321. The homework is written by the TA and isnt too bad if you actually understand the material, which can be hard because Van Zandt was not great at teaching it. It seemed like 80% of the class was lost. I took 3 stats classes prior to this one and I ended w/ an A, but struggled for it. Avoid her.

Honestly avoid if you can. Idk how she is with her other courses but she can't teach stats. 3321 doesn't need to be as difficult as she is making it. Doesn't post notes or communicate with TA. Had terms incorrectly defined on her Carmen which is gr8, students learning false info is the goal right? And shes the only one teaching it SP19! Yay OSU:)))

Has a nice personality, but don't let that fool you. The concepts in this class aren't difficult & she somehow makes them impossible to understand. Written exams with no calculator & this is a STATS CLASS. Minimal time for exams, HW doesn't match w/what you're tested, & prof is hard to reach & not helpful. TAs are great, but only do HW not lectures

She is so unorganized. Doesnt post the full notes &refuses to answer questions about the HW because shes not the one grading it. She was out of town for the 2 weeks before &of the second midterm so help was limited. The content you think you will be tested on from the HW, notes actice isnt even hard but she asks questions we have never discussed

She skips through the notes super fast, & doesn't post the complete notes online so there's a good chance of missing things. Her exams don't test what we learn. Practice problems aren't even relevant for the test. Unable to use my cheat sheet for the exam b/c what's in the notes aren't on the test. It is unfortunate she is the only professor.

She explains things in the most complicated ways and Ive learned more from teaching myself. Her exams are not like anything done in class, on the homework, or on the exam review problems. Youre allowed a front and back cheat sheet for exams, but its useless when her exam problems are so difficult, poorly worded, and not multiple choice.

Professor is very unreasonable. She is hard to reach and if you can she tries to get you to go away as soon as possible. Exams are tricky and no one is allowed to ask questions. She provides review questions, but no answers because she found the questions online. Would recommend taking this with ANY other professor.

The exams are written (no multiple choice). The exams are approximately 20 questions long and we only had 55 minutes to complete. Wording on exams can be confusing. There are two textbooks: she pulls from both. Lectures either make you feel like you have a handle on topics, or you have no idea what is going on. She posts incomplete lecture slides.

Trisha Van Zandt seems like a fun person outside of class, but was not a great professor. The topics were unorganized and she never provided clear notes.  The only points come from quizzes and exams.  Talked about her political agenda all class. Very boring lectures.  Was excited for this class but very disappointed. Walked away learning nothing.

This is by far the best class I've taken at Ohio State so far. She is extremely helpful and very funny. I recommend office hours simply because her TAs and she give very helpful hints for the exams. I don't really enjoy the subject matter (this is just a required course) but she makes it interesting and fun to learn. Highly recommend.

4 exams. She allows an 8.5x11 page of notes for exams which is quite helpful. Posts notes online, but you need to go to lecture to understand them. She gives you review questions for exams which help alot. She also curves exams. One hw assignment every week dropped the lowest 4. ALEKS hw wasnt bad. Gives out extra credit for going to class.

This class is honestly quite easy. Dr. Van-Zandt lets you bring a cheat sheet into the exam and she even gives you extra credit for showing up to class. The exams themselves are not really that bad either and she stresses on things in lecture that usually show up in class.

I really did not like her teaching style at all. Her exams were harder than they needed to be. I have taken a regular stats class and a calculus class and received an A in both of them, but got a B in this class. She doesn't explain well, and her TAs for my semester graded the exams REALLY hard. Not the worst prof I've had,  but avoid if you can

I don't know if it's just the way she taught it, but I hardly understood any of the material for this class. However, I still got an A on every exam and in the class. That doesn't make sense, obviously, but I guess if you want a relatively easy A class, go ahead and take this one!

I didn't know what I was doing on the exams and I still got an A on all of them. It's an easy class, but she makes the information harder than it needs to be. If you want an easy stats class, take her.

Trisha is a wonderful person, but she is not the best professor. She covered the topics adequately, but her lectures were out of date and often centered around Dateline or 60 Minutes videos from the 80s and 90s. Her exams are very easy if you go to class, and she provides the quiz questions in advance so you can prepare.
Easy class IF you go to lecture. The only grades are the midterms and two in class essays, though. There's a lot of extra credit, but you really have to work for it.

Could use 8 x 11 cheat sheet on exams. Gave a few 2 point extra credit quizzes for coming to lecture. Seemed very nice in class but was never able to meet up with her for help outside of class. Made material more confusing than it should have been most of the time. Put notes online, although they were not complete. Easier than Calc.

Trisha made basic math/stats concepts more complex than necessary for learning the basic stats material. And when reaching out to get help on clarity I didn't find her the most approachable person. Overall, if you know math and are willing to put in minimal work you will get an A, just not the best prof there to help you get there.

UGH. She managed to make basic mathematical concepts into the most confusing thing of all time. I went to class, paid attention and still got a 40% on exams. Ended up dropping it. Do not take Psych 2220 with her unless you've already taken advanced stats or are a math wiz. I had friends with other professors for it and it was a breeze for them.
Worst teacher i have ever had by far. I failed her exams, and attended every class. She told me she doesnt know how to help me. AWFUL!

So to everyone who's not a psych major: If you read a bad review about her class on here---it was probably by a psych major... who (no offense) has no grasp of basic math. I hadn't taken a math class in three years (and never had stats) and thought everything was crystal clear. She curves and gives EC questions on exams. Trish Rocks.

Do not take psychology 220 with Dr. Van Zandt.  I'm not sure how this woman did it, but she basically took stats 135 and made it the most convoluted mess I've ever experienced. Her lectures are confusing, and she does not provide full notes online.  Tests will be the most frustrating thing you experience in college because of the format.Stay away

One of the best professors I have ever had at Ohio State. She is great! Very helpful and willing to do whatever it takes to be sure you understand the material. If you go to class you usually get 2 bonus points for quizzes. If you do the work and put the time into the class, its very easy to get an A!

She is a very nice teacher. Not always the best at explaining things but she will go back and re-try if you ask her to clarify. Interested in helping the students and lets you use an 8 by 11 sheet of paper with anything you want to write on it during exams. I would recommend her.

She was cool. Helped make seemingly difficult material familiar and wanted to make sure everyone understood. She moves really fast and sometimes people don't say anything, but if you ask her to clarify or go back she definitely will. Very helpful.

If you have any math skills, this class is a breeze.  She loves giving extra credit for students who attend class and there's bonus points on every exam, which about 20% of the class always gets 100%+ on.  If you have to take this class, take it with her!

I hate this woman. She's terrible. She loves to exert her power over the students. She thinks she's amazing, but she's really not. She mindnumbingly boring and teaches as if we were in 5th grade. I mean she taught to take the mean of something for like 20 minutes. I never went to class and got 100% on her exams. She made my life a living hell.

Love her. Her voice sounds EXACTLY like Julia Roberts, which is always entertaining. Shes incredibly opinionated & loves to discuss her topic, but has accepted that others may not care like she does. No need to go to class, but you should, because her lectures are fascinating and pretty funny. Plus she gives extra credit quizzes like candy
good teacher.  class could drag on sometimes, though.  nice lady, pretty interesting.  if you go to class and do the extra credit (which doesn't take too much time", you will probably get an A.

One of the best, most interesting teachers I've ever had! She was even 'willing to commit suicide' for her Psychology of Strange Beliefs class by 'overdosing' on homeopathic medicine! Great teacher, great wit, great fun! :)
Best. Professor. Ever.

Van Zandt's teaching method is very clear and organized.  While she is not that available outside of class her TA's were extremely helpful, especially Andres.  Her tests are more theoretical than math based.  I was so worried about stats and ended up getting a 98% in the class.  Highly recommended!
She is very intelligent and very funny.  Interesting class material.  Very well organized professor.  Lots of reading.  Certainly a worthwhile class on critical thinking.
awesome, this was my first class at OSU and I loved it she is a great teacher and enjoys what she does. A good time was had by all in this class.

I absolutely loved this class. Gives random quick quizzes when shes feeling like it but gives one point for your name and another for the right answer for extra credit. So go to class! Interesting material and she explains it really well. Would love to take another class with her!
Trisha is one tough chick.  You gotta work in this class.  If you're not a gunner, forget it.
She was GREAT!!! I wish I could take another course with her, but she doesn't teach the H321 course :(
very nice!
Very cool teacher, very interesting material. I would strongly suggest taking this class.

She was a reallllly great prof. I really enjoyed her lectures--she really knows her stuff and makes the class very enjoyable. I didn't read much of anything from the books--don't really think they're necessary as long as you attend class most of the time. She gives like 10 extra credit pts which is helpful! 2 exams and two easy quizzes. Great class

This was the BEST class I have EVER taken! So relevant to everyday life. I loved Trish, she's so cool and interesting! Midterm, Final and 2 easy quizzes! I read the books just cuz I thought the stuff was interesting, but I'm sure you can get an A if you just attend class.
She is amazingly interesting.
Great class, take it!
The class: easy, interesting and makes you think. The professor: wants you to do well, brings up interesting topic, but kind of boring. You can easily get an A.
She was amazing.
Do I need to type anything? Do you see a bad rating for her?! Prolly one of the most liked professors on the entire campus.
She was AMAZING!

If you do all the reading, you'll be fine skipping this class occasionally.  Her lectures are a review of the assigned reading.  She gives several announced quizzes through the quarter and pop quizzes for extra credit.

This stats class is boring, but you can definitely skip a lot of it and be OK.  The midterms are easy as are the quizzes.  The hardest part of the class is showing up and remembering to do the homework.  Teacher is good, but I wouldn't say she's really exceptional, though.  Its a basic stats lecture - nothing more or less, really.

Prof. Van Zandt rocks!  I absolutely love her and recommend this class to everyone.  If you are a Psych major and don't need a discipline-specific course, I recommend this.  It's great, interesting and easy to do well if you go to every class; it's easy because the stuff is so fascinating.  What you learn is very applicable to your everday life.
she's cool
Very fun/interesting class. Awesome teacher. Uses lots of cool examples. Definitely recommend this class

I loved this prof.  She is willing to admit when she's wrong, she loves questions in lecture, and is fun to talk to outside of class as well.  I didn't have her for her main subject, so I can't say anything about that, but for extraordinary beliefs, she was great
Fun class, well taught, tons of examples, and pretty easy.  If you're looking for a psych elective, take 301 with her.

You will never find a Stats professor that cool and that fair. She really likes to teach and wants people to understand. If you are not a Math person, take it with her, she makes it simple and fair for students!Great teacher!
She gave a lot of extra credit for showing up to class.  If you go to class you will do well and you just have to go to labs to turn in homework.
Dr. Van Zandt was great, she made everything easy to understand and put all the notes online.  Her tests were fairly easy and very fair.  Overall a great professor!
Her tests are very fair.

summary_comment: Tina is an exceptionally effective and supportive professor who genuinely wants her students to succeed. Her classes are well-organized, with clear and helpful slides that aid in studying, and her tests are straightforward and fair. Additionally, she is highly approachable and provides valuable feedback on papers, making her an outstanding resource for both writing credits and psychology majors.

Ratings.comment: Sweetest person you will ever meet. Tina wanted everyone in her class to succeed and it was very evident. The slides are a little heavy, but very helpful in the longrun for studying. All of her test questions were straight forward and very fair. Papers were easy, reading the textbook wasn't really required because she goes over everything in class.

Quite possibly the best professor I had in College. She was always available to talk outside of class and gave me very good feedback on how to improve my papers. I would recommend her if you need a secondary writing credit and a psychology major!

summary_comment: Mrs. Brownlow is an excellent professor known for her ability to simplify complex concepts with real-world examples and accessible teaching methods. She demonstrates a strong passion for psychology and a genuine concern for her students' success, offering extensive support both inside and outside of class. Her engaging teaching style, including the use of memes, and her thorough study guides make her a highly effective instructor.

Ratings.comment: Mrs. Brownlow was a great professor. She knows how to break things down and gives a lot of real world examples while teaching. Very accessible outside of class hours. I honestly barely ever read the book but I probably would've got a better grade if I did. Definitely go to class and take specific notes.
Shes passionate about psychology, and cares about the success of her students. Shes accessible outside of class and will help in any way she can.

Ms.B is an amazing teacher. She is what drove me to change my major from Pharmacy to Psychology. She uses memes in her lectures and is very good at explaining concepts. Amazing study guides and study sessions. Go to her office hours, she really cares about you. Fun to talk to, super understanding!

summary_comment: Professor Lee is known for her challenging lectures and multiple-choice exams that are difficult to prepare for effectively. Students find her lectures monotonous and hard to follow, with little interaction or clarity in answering questions. Despite the presence of extra credit opportunities, the overall teaching style is described as lecture-heavy and sometimes frustrating to engage with.

Ratings.comment: Prof Lee is hard to listen to. Decent amount of time spent out of class because you have to participate in 7 hours of other people's psych research, can get extra credit tho. 3 exams, all multiple choice but difficult and hard to prep for, study guides were much easier than actual tests. Tophats done at end of class for attendance most days.

She just lectures and lectures, docent take any break and can't answer questions. You ask a question and she can't really answer it its like she's just regurgitating the slides. Not attendance mandatory but gives random in class questions so you never know what day it will be so you go everyday. docent prepare us for the tests at all

At first I think she is fair good until several days before final. I made an appointment with her to ask some questions about academic. When I asked my question, she used her phone to search on Google??!! Even search the vocabulary??!! Then she felt she cannot answer my question clearly so she told me I should search textbook??
Annoying lectures. Read book day before exam and you're good. Class sucks because you have to go for in class points.
Go to the lectures, and be engaged in listening. The class is a pretty easy A, as all the information is presented to you, its just up to you to remember it.

My biggest pet peeve is when a teacher or professor says um or has phrases they say continually and Dasom says um A LOT and says and what we find A LOT so it makes it very very to listen to her. Overall she isn't bad she's just next to impossible to listen too in my opinion.
Dasom is rough to listen too. She studders a lot and uses umm continually. the class has lots of extra credit which makes the class fairly easy.
Very nice professor with good, detailed notes that help with the test. Tons of extra credit. Super easy course overall.

summary_comment: Dr. Pek is perceived as well-intentioned but largely ineffective, especially given her lack of experience teaching undergraduates. Students found the class disorganized, with unclear expectations and insufficient preparation materials, leading to poor performance on exams that differed significantly from the provided practice tests. The feedback suggests that while Dr. Pek tries to assist, her teaching methods often fall short, particularly in providing practical, exam-relevant instruction.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Pek was really nice and I could tell she wanted to make the class easier for us, but the class was often disorganized. Notes aren't posted before class and are instead "group notes" on a google doc. Lots of group and individual work that didn't translate to exams. I did better in the class when I got 1-on-1 help. Exams identical to practice.

This was her first undergrad class. I had trouble understanding what was going on the majority of the time, and I have taken a stats class before. She offers 5% extra credit to your grade at the end of the semester, but doesn't teach coding in class, and teaches theory instead of the math. I could tell she was trying her best to improve the class.

She has never taught an undergraduate class, and it shows. The tests are impossibly hard, and she doesn't teach almost anything close to what is on them. We have help sheets and they still don't do much. The homework is impossible and you have to teach yourself the coding and the methods because she doesn't give practice or example problems.

If you ever are presented with the opportunity to take a class with her, don't. She is the worst professor I have had at this school, probably due to the fact that she has never taught an undergraduate class. Her second exam was impossibly hard and you have to teach yourself how to do the four homework assignments.

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Statistical Mediation, Moderation, and Conditional Process Analysis

SEI.Class Name: Analysis of Repeated Measures and Longitudinal Data

SEI.Class Name: Statistical Mediation, Moderation, and Conditional Process Analysis

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Analysis of Repeated Measures and Longitudinal Data

summary_comment: Professor Todd is known for his clear explanations and approachable teaching style, often dropping the lowest exam score to accommodate students. While some find his grading strict and the lack of flexibility in exam policies disappointing, others appreciate his understanding and willingness to help, especially in adjusting grades based on individual circumstances.

Ratings.comment: The class is comprised of 3 exams, REP assignment and a term paper. Exams are graded very strictly. Professor Todd made it clear that he was planning to drop my lowest exam, as many on here had said he has done. This did not happen, and after asking to see the breakdown of the grades and get some kind of explanation, I was denied. Disappointed.

Dr. Todd was a pretty chill professor. There aren't many tests and there was never homework besides the term paper/presentation, but he was generally a pretty easy grader as long as you show that you know the information decently well. Tip: start working on the study guides as you go through the chapters instead of cramming it in before the exam.

Proff Todd is best described as a "total bro". He explains everything so clearly and has met and worked with half the people they teach about in the book. Very understanding. I bombed one exam and did amazing on the other two so he just dropped the bad  one because I asked him nicely and participated in class. I would absolutely recommend.

Prof Todd was one of the nicest professors I've had. Really into psych and makes the class easy to understand. As long as you do the study guides, you're bound to ace the class. After unfortunately mixing up exam dates, I recieved a very low grade for one of the exams. I explained the sitaution and he dropped the exam from my overall grade. Amazing

summary_comment: Professor Jake excels in providing valuable feedback on papers and delivers clear, detailed lectures that enhance understanding when applied to course material. His teaching quality is highly regarded for its effectiveness and clarity.

Ratings.comment: Jake is really great at giving good feedback on papers. His lectures are pretty simple so going to class and listening to what he elaborates on is really helpful. He's a great lecturer!

summary_comment: Patrick is a dedicated and knowledgeable professor who tries to engage students with a dense subject matter, though the content remains challenging. While some students found his classes organized and helpful, others felt they were unorganized and too focused on attendance points rather than substantive learning. Overall, Patrick is perceived as a nice and caring instructor, though his teaching style and class structure vary in effectiveness among students.

Ratings.comment: Patrick tries to lighten up a dense subject, and he does decently at it. However it is a dense subject and expect to study your butt off to be able to understand it all. Personally, having Patrick to look at and motivate me to class definitely helped but to each their own you know.

Research methods was a pretty boring class, but he was a pretty caring guy and took our ideas into consideration. I was able to get a good grade in this class by having good attendance (lots of "activities" for attendance points), doing the homework and group projects, and studying very little. He gave us 2 easy exams; the final wasn't cumulative.

Seems like a genuinely nice guy, but he was unorganized throughout the course. His lectures were pretty boring and he would give out random assignments to count for attendance, even though he said they were only participation assignments. He also gave two group projects and he only a week to finish them. I strongly recommend not taking his class.

Really nice guy, material was dry at times but he did his best to make it engaging. homework was difficult and he was a pretty tough grader, but plenty of point opportunities to make up for it, would recommend taking his class

Class was very organized and Patrick was a great teacher. I could tell he knew a lot about the course material and he regularly took time to make sure we understood things. There were a lot of in-class activities but i found most of them to be really helpful

summary_comment: Adam is highly regarded as an effective and engaging lecturer who clearly explains complex concepts and makes the class interesting. His teaching style involves frequent pop quizzes and he is known for his willingness to help students. While some students find the exams challenging and require additional preparation from the textbook, the overall consensus is that Adam is an excellent instructor who enhances students' understanding and interest in psychology.

Ratings.comment: Just do the extra credit it's easier than it sounds. Speech and hearing department always needs subjects and it's about an hour for them. Tests weren't hard, multiple choice, but you did need to either study or pay attention in lecture. There was like one assignment/project- wasn't bad easy grader.

Adam was great only 2 projects both super easy grading criteria, and the REP papers took about 2 hours of BS. The extra cred was easy to get. Midterms weren't bad you can get by with just going to lecture and paying attention (85ish) but if you read the book it helps a lot.
Adam is good, he is just not GREAT. He would be better, but you have to make sure to read the textbooks before exams if you want to do well

While his lectures are informative, they do not prepare you for the exams. The psychology department uses the same exams for all 1100 classes, and they seem to be based mostly off of the book rather than the selective information that is presented in his slides. In addition, he goes through his powerpoints quickly, yet refuses to distribute them.

Adam was a great lecturer! He knows his stuff and is also great at explaining it. Adam used plenty of examples that helped explain difficult concepts and sprinkled in jokes periodically. I looked forward to attending his class. 3 midterms and a partly-cumultive final based off of the book. Take Adam! You won't regret it!
He really enjoys helping his students. One of the best teachers ever. You're very luck if Adam is you're instructor! Awesome teacher!

Fantastic lecturer. Adam does a grade-A job of explaining a multitude of topics. The class moves very fast, as you have to cover many different psychological concepts in a matter of months. Still, he does a great job of engaging students and gives a lot of pop quizzes that help boost your grade if you pay attention.

Adam is such a good instructor! I always talk about the class with my friends in other sections and no one seems to like their instructor as much as Adam. He explains things really well and makes class interesting. He got me interested in psychology & I would recommend him if you have to take intro to psych. I only use the book to study for exams.

Adam was a great instructor. He was funny in lecture. He gave out quizzes that you need to get your section points in the class, but he gave out so many that I didn't even need to take the last 4 because I already had my points. Don't need to go to lecture because exams are based on the book, but I went to lecture just because it was engaging

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his engaging and interactive teaching style, with students praising his care for their understanding and his use of innovative methods like videos and active learning activities. His classes are described as intense but laid-back, with plenty of opportunities for discussion and interaction. Students consistently highlight his availability and easy grading, though some note the intensity of the course material.

Ratings.comment: This was one of my favorite classes. I loved the lectures and assignments and learned so much. I would definitely take this again.
Funny and nice teacher who uses different resources to teach.
class is really intense. It goes over everything is psy. Get ready to watch videos and write feedback. Very laid back class and more discussion based. He has office hours and answer emails asap.

Ziv is an awesome professor. He really cares about the students and will work with you to make sure you understand. Instead of using the book he gave us videos to watch, and then reviewed the information in lecture. He also does a lot of active learning stuff, so be prepared to interact with your classmates.
Ziv was an awesome teacher. He doesn't do your traditional lecture style, but comes up with great activities to help us better understand the material.

He is a really great teacher. I'm pretty sure he is a student. He is always available through email and an easy grader when it comes to the quizzes. Easy A. I did horrible on the second midterm and still ended with an A- so basically easy A.

summary_comment: Professor Free is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality, engaging lectures, and genuine care for his students' learning. Students consistently praise his humor, enthusiasm, and willingness to adjust grading to ensure student success. His classes are described as both enjoyable and effective in helping students understand the material.

Ratings.comment: Free is a great instructor. He really cares that you learn the material and will also adjust the curve on exams and give extra credit to save your grade. He's funny and very engaging which makes lectures really enjoyable. He does give reading quizzes but they aren't hard and it's a good way to get you to read the book and learn the material.
HILARIOUS. I loved him, he was great. Made the material fun and the class wasn't horribly hard.

A highly recommend professor! Just choose his courses ! He's class is just amazing! When he noticed that the class average is too low,  he will try to give out a lot of extra credit ! He's a super nice person, excellent professor.

Matt was a phenomenal professor! He had so much enthusiasm and interest in the subject matter that it was contagious at times. Make sure you do the assigned readings each week for the sake of weekly quizzes and your overall understanding to prepare for exams. He's also hilarious and made me laugh at least once every class. 10/10 would recommend.

Mr. Free is one of those teachers that really cares! He is super funny in class, treats you like a real adult and I could't have a better psych teacher. He is very helpful and replies super fast to emails. Definitely take him! Plus his baking skills are on point. #missyouface and #heresyourchilipepper

Mr. Free is incredibly passionate about what he does. He is an engaging speaker that is ready to help students whenever they need it. Perfect balance between seriousness and hilarity in class. Would definitely recommend to people looking for a GE requirement. (Also his emails are super cute and so is he)

Knows the material very well, and takes the time to learn everyone's names, despite the class size. He is extremely enthusiastic about teaching, and always relates the material in an interesting way. Hilarious, with a sarcastic and crass sense of humor, and he treats students like actual adults. Section point assignments are done (class required).

Mr. Free is so awesome! He's hilarous and really takes time to get to know his students. He relates everything to the real world! He doesn't really have control over how the class is graded because everything is determined by the psych department. He says he is a harsh grader on papers but I still got A's on them and he gives good feedback.
Very enthusiastic. Good sense of humor.
Very good. Does random section points so needs to be in class to receive. Very willing to help if you ask. Very laid back and lectures were never to boring

This teacher is amazing and hilarious. He has a very sarcastic sort of humor and has excellent lectures with plenty of appealing images and videos. The most important thing is that he truly cares for his students. At the end of the semester, he wrote all of us an email saying how wonderful everyone is and that he will miss each and every one of us.
Awesome Class. Great Instructor. Do it.

summary_comment: Professor Wang is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, evident in her caring and passionate approach that fosters a supportive and engaging learning environment. Students appreciate her open learning atmosphere and find her review sessions both enjoyable and informative. Her classes are noted for their effectiveness, with exams being manageable as long as students attend regularly.

Ratings.comment: I took Wang's intro Psych class, and it was the best intro class I had so far. She is very caring and passionate, and you can tell she does care about the subject and wants her students to succeed in the class. Will recommend for all.

Wang is a great professor! I took her class online during COVID, and I have learned so much from her. She likes small group projects, and really created an open learning environment. Her review sessions are really fun and informative. The exams are really easy as long as you show up for class.

summary_comment: Mark is highly regarded as an excellent professor, known for his engaging and concise lectures that balance entertainment with educational value. Students appreciate his care and willingness to help, especially during challenging times like the pandemic. His fair testing methods and generous opportunities for extra credit contribute to a supportive learning environment that fosters growth and success.

Ratings.comment: Mark was one of my favorite professors! His lectures were concise and to the point, but in a way that was still entertaining. He was a really caring professor that handled class during COVID well, and I think I improved my writing skills a lot because of his feedback. 10/10 would recommend (plus he gave extra credit so that's a plus)!

Mark is such a great professor. His lectures are very interesting and engaging. His exams are not that hard; he gives you a study guide and as long as you know the study guide, you will get an A on the test. He is also super caring and willing to help you with any questions you have!

This dude is super helpful. The class is mostly graded based on essays, but he's incredibly helpful with topics if you reach out to him. I'm used to getting easy As on essays, but he makes you work for it, and I appreciated how he helped me grow as a student.
Mr. Susmann is a fantastic professor. He cares about your success and makes his tests fair. He also gives a lot of opportunities for extra credit. I would definitely take him again!!!

summary_comment: Heather Hansen is an exceptional professor for PSYCH 1100, known for her passionate teaching approach that caters to various learning styles. Students praise her understanding, respect, and dedication to helping them succeed. Her lectures are highly regarded for their clarity and effectiveness, with many noting her use of helpful mnemonic devices and additional study aids.

Ratings.comment: Heather Hansen is a phenomenal professor for PSYCH 1100. She is incredibly passionate about what she teaches and takes a very good approach to her lectures as she tries to incorporate each learning style. She is also very understanding and respectful as a professor and does a very good job at looking out for her students.

Heather is the most amazing professor I have EVER had. She cares so much about her students, she is passionate about what she teaches, and she provides the best lectures ever. Her lectures are easy to follow and she always provides super helpful mnemonics, tips, and tricks to help remember the material. She is always happy to help her students too!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her engaging and enjoyable teaching style, making the class both interesting and easy to follow. Students appreciate her clear guidance, use of real-world examples, and the provision of helpful notes. She is described as down-to-earth, funny, and genuinely invested in her students' understanding and success.

Ratings.comment: Took this as a Gen Ed and she was a really fun and enjoyable teacher. Got in A in the class and did not have to work insanely hard. Just go to class, take notes, and do the small assignments. Exams are pretty much like the notes and do not take much effort to get an A.

100000% my favorite teacher ever. she is the sweetest and most down to earth person I took this class over a year ago and while on rate my professor I figured I'd give her a good rating too. Her class is sooo interesting and I've never taken psych before. definitely take this class!!! lots of bonus opportunities too if you try!

Honestly all you really have to do is show up to class and follow through with the guided notes she gives you. She is the best and your lucky if you had her. Shes very funny, relatable, and down to earth.

Amazing professor, she relates everything to the real world. She is also really funny , I would highly recommend for first years. Will not need the textbook because she goes over everything in her reviews. Also, go to the reviews and do the study guide that she provide you will get an A.
Amazing teacher, actually wants you to understand the information and pass. Passed out guided notes and made class interesting.

I just took her course last semester. She will pass guide notes very lecture and these notes are very helpful when you review for your exams. The material is hard as long as you attend the class. She is nice. You can get some candies from here if you answer the question during the lecture :)

summary_comment: Dr. Torello is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes lectures enjoyable and memorable. Students appreciate his fairness and support, noting that attending his classes is essential for success. His classes are described as interesting and well-structured, with minimal required reading and a focus on lecture content, though some find his delivery can be challenging at times.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Torello is a lovely professor and person. He's incredibly funny and makes lectures enjoyable and interesting. He's a fair grader and really helps his student succeed. I have already taken two of his classes and i'm excited to hopefully take more!
Died laughing literly.
Funny guy, makes the class interesting. Be warned though, you HAVE to go class with him! I skipped a ridiculous amount and pulled off a B+, but I know it could have been an A if I had actually gone.

He's awesome and hilarious, I wanted to attend every class, I didn't, but I was def sad when I missed.He will make you laugh, sometimes hard to follow, but put in minimal effort and you will get an A. There is one assignment, I think he blindly gave A's to everyone

Torello was an okay teacher. I enjoyed his class, he definitely made it interesting and funny. He seemed a little bit scatter-brained, and sometimes he was hard to follow in lecture. But overall, I enjoyed his class.
such a great professor. best advice is go to class and enjoy. although there are only 4 midterms, he makes the material interesting so it's not hard to learn.

Excellent Prof. Funny and Engaging- He always keeps class interesting. Only have to read selected sections of the book so 95% of the test material comes from lecture. No power point but he writes on the board. Go to class and take notes. Tests are very doable. There are 4 and the final is optional

Seriously the best professor I've had in my 4 years at OSU! I was dreading taking Neuroscience and he made it so interesting! No notes whatsoever, so you def. have to go to class and take good notes! He also gives a topic study guide for exams!

Has some great stories, is incredibly knowledgeable on the topic (you can tell he really loves it) and overall, a hilarious guy. Easy exams too (50 MC questions) but you still feel like you're learning. He's basically the best.
best prof ever....

Best prof of the year in my opinion. He's hilarious (and my only motivation for going to his class) and knows the material inside and out. He has tons and tons of real life experience with almost all the subject material, so defiantly a knowledgable guy. I highly highly recommend taking ANY class with torello.

Extremely funny! Sometimes the only motivation for going to class was to hear a joke or two.  Exams are fairly simple and he lets you know what will be on it. A con is that you will ONLY be graded on 4 exams.

This man is the funniest professor I have ever had! He's intelligent, and knows his material really well and can portray to his students in an interesting and fun way. He's not too hard, and he's not out to trick you in any way. I've never looked forward so much to a class. And this class was early! I LOVED IT

Prof. Torello is the most enthusiastic, helpful, funny teacher I've ever had and if you want to have an awesome quarter take one of his classes. The tests are easy if you go to class and take notes and he's always willing to go out of his way to help you. I've never laughed so hard in a class either. It's a riot and you learn a lot too!

Nice guy, hit or miss sense of humor, seemed to only know course material after reading the required book.  Wouldn't recommend unless you're looking for an easy class and know little about drugs prior to the class.

Dr. Torello is a marvelous professor. I took two classes with him. His lectures are very entertaining to say the least. His tests, assignments, and grading are very fair. Dr. Torello was definitely an odd ball but he is definitely one of my favorite professors at Ohio State.

Doesn't stick to the cut-and-dry of neuroscience. I already found this topic very interesting, but it could be taught in a very boring way, which is exactly the opposite of how Torello teaches it. Very enthusiastic and offers tons of clinical examples and fun anecdotes that help you remember for the test. Take him! He's great and funny, in a weird
Great teacher..made class go by fast. exam questions come mostly from notes in class, so if you want a good grade go to class!
Very interesting class! He wants to help the students in anyway possible... very nice person..
He was nice and funny but did not cover much of the material that was on the midterms.  He got off topic and talked about random things at times.  Made class interesting though.
One of the best professors I've had here. Funny, makes class interesting, quizzes are easy if you just take notes in class. Very helpful. I would definitely take another class with him for sure.
An amazing professor! Enthusiasm and sense of humor makes you want to go to class. I would highly recommend him =)

Dr. Torello is entertaining, smart and easy to listen to.  The time in class flies by because his lectures are so hilarious.  It was sometimes difficult to tell whether he was just off on a crazy tangent or whether the material would be covered on a test.  Other than that, I recommend him!
Great Teacher.  I didnt really care at all about psychology, but he got me to actually appreciate it.  If you ever get a chance, take a class taught by him

Best teacher I have had so far at OSU.  He is a little quirky, but in a good way.  He is a joy to listen to and he makes lecture interesting.  I learned a lot.  There were 2 mid terms and a final, but as long as you stay awake in class and do the reading (not that much)  you should do great.

Easily one of the best experiences I have ever had as a student.  This is the kind of professor you see in those awful movies where kids who don't really care about their studies are turned into enthusiastic zealots of academia because of some miracle teacher.

As long as you scan through the pages he assigns in the book and take decent notes, you'll be set to go in this class.  He's absolutely eccentric in a great way and hilarious to listen to.  Learning about psychology is loads of fun with Prof. Torello.

He is funny, nice, easy, hilarious!!  he tells stories and although you learn a lot, it is not hard.  No final or midterms.  Only 5 little tests (easy to study for-as long as you go to class you are okay).  One of the best profs I've ever had!
You are going to be so hapy if you get into this class. This would be the class you actually look forward to going to.
Very entertaining, very flexible and fair. Faculty at Capital, so doesn't teach much here. Be prepared to read and study, but overall a great teacher!
Very funny professor, and very interesting class!  He is a kooky man, which makes for a fun experience.
He is one of the best teachers I've ever had. I actually looked forward to going to class. and he's absolutely hilarious!! you should definately try to get into this class

He is the best teacher ever!  So entertaining!  He only teaches one class per quarter at OSU because he is on faculty at Capital University.  But if you are lucky enough to take his class you will enjoy it!

summary_comment: Professor Macey is known for her engaging and humorous teaching style, using anecdotes and examples to make lectures memorable. However, while her tests are easy and multiple-choice, some students find the course content basic and the overall learning experience limited. Additionally, Professor Macey can be perceived as unapproachable and mean-spirited by some, particularly due to her strict policies on textbooks and excessive printing requirements.

Ratings.comment: Professor Macey gave engaging, funny lectures with a lot of anecdotes and examples to help us remember things. Tests were easy multiple choice, and she is very reasonable in reviewing questions many people missed, and if unclear she gives everyone credit. I don't feel like I learned a ton but I guess that's gen psych for you

This professor didn't let us rent or borrow textbooks--we had to purchase her extremely expensive self-authored one. She would berate us and talk about her classes behind their backs, even telling us that she once made fun of our class at a kindergarten reading day. She puts on a smile, but she's kind of mean spirited. I don't like her tone.

Prepare to lose all of your printer ink as she makes you print 100+ pages of research articles for her "Journal Exams." If your class average is low by her stanards, you'll be blamed for your incompetence and pitied with an undisclosed number of extra credit points.  Four normal exams per semester aren't enough I suppose. Six is a better amount.

New to OSU but really on top of it and a really great lecturer. Understands most of us were there for a GE credit. Super friendly and amusing during class. I started off the semester not taking it seriously so the first midterm really got me, but as long as you show up to lectures and do minor studying before the tests it should be a pretty easy A.

summary_comment: Professor Steve is highly regarded for making the class engaging and easy to pass, with a focus on student success and understanding rather than rigorous testing. Lectures are entertaining and move at a slow pace, but cover the material thoroughly. Students appreciate his flexibility, extra credit opportunities, and willingness to help, though some find him off-topic, which can impact coverage of the curriculum.

Ratings.comment: There's 5 "papers:" 1st is an intro paragraph, 2nd is the same intro with an outline and conclusion, 3rd is writing an essay w/ that outline, and the 4th/5th are the only papers you'll have to write from scratch. You'll never write more than 3 pages. 2 exams - average difficulty if you study (and he curves them). Extra credit too! Easy A!

Steve really wants to make sure that you pass the class. He doesn't really care about testing you, he wants to make sure you understand and are engaged in the content. He moves a little slow but lecture always flies by b/c he is so entertaining. All of the exams are take home, open note and you can work in groups so its hard not to get an A.

He is a great guy and really caring, but he gets off topic literally every single class. I didn't end up really learning anything which sucks cause I was really excited for this class. I basically used this class as my office hours and got a bunch of other random things done while he babbled on. BUT its an easy A w/ online surveys and extra credit

Steve is a really nice guy, and is very passionate about Clinical Psychology, but he has no idea how to teach. He got so off topic so frequently during the semester that we had to skip over entire units at the end, and he let other students debate online, open-note quiz/exam questions in class with him, which was annoying. It's an Easy A if you try

He is GREAT!! If you have the option, take him!! All of the quizzes and exams are online, and he is open to changing your score if you argue your reason. He really wanted us all to succeed and was very flexible. He's also super funny and makes class really enjoyable.
Steve is awesome. I am so glad I took this course and it is probably my favorite so far as a Psychology major. He teaches really well on so many levels. He's also funny and relates to us well.
Super cool guy! Cares about his students and is super passionate about psychology. (pretty cute too)
Best Psych 1100 professor! Made lectures engaging and interesting. Gave outlined notes and reviews before the exams. Definitely wanted everyone to succeed

I loved this class and I loved Steven! He's the coolest guy and he makes it so you don't have to read the textbook at all. I left my textbook in the shrink wrap and still managed to get a 97% in the class. Review the study materials before the exams, and you should be fine. If you have the choice, take Psych 1100 with him!
The professor is excellent!

Highly recommend this teacher! His lectures were interesting and he had really good examples that made the material easy to learn. He is genuinely interested in you doing well and the guided notes help a lot for tests.

I highly recommend taking him as a professor! He provides a great set of guided notes along with interactive power points. Class attendance is a huge part of your grade, but he makes coming to class worth it.

This professor was great for an intro to psych class! Very knowledgeable, lectures were interesting and engaging. He gives guided notes, so as long as you show up to class and pay attention, you'll be fine.

summary_comment: The professor is dedicated and provides clear explanations and engaging lectures, using Top Hat to gauge student understanding. However, the exams are challenging, with tricky wording and comprehensive coverage of material, often leading to significant grade drops. Despite the stress, students appreciate his care for their learning and his efforts to improve their writing skills.

Ratings.comment: As a person who scored a 5 on my AP language and literature exams in high school, I considered myself to be a very good writer. Somehow, though, I never managed to get an A on a paper in this class which was quite frustrating. There are Top Hat questions for a participation grade, and if you listen to his explanations, the exams are not hard.

I dropped this class because of how difficult the exams were. You miss a few questions and drop multiple letter grades. The instructor was nice and he seems interested in the material but the class was pretty stressful.

He's a good professor and tries to explain as best as he can. The material is easy to learn but is way too hard on the exams. The questions are worded tricky and out of 25 points. He doesn't give a study guide so you have to learn ALL material for a 25 question test. Not sure if this is his fault, but overall not a bad class.

He's a new instructor. He gives good lectures and uses top hat to gage where the students are. You write 4 papers or so over the material you learn; but, you also learn to improve your writing. He really cares that you learn.

summary_comment: This professor offers a highly engaging class for those deeply interested in social psychology, though the exams are challenging and curved based on performance rankings. However, opinions vary widely; some find the class extremely boring and recommend avoiding it, while others praise the professor's knowledge and teaching approach despite the difficulty.

Ratings.comment: This is actually the most interesting class I have taken in OSU. If you are really into social psych, you would like this class. There's no assignments, so final grade is only dependent on exams, which are hard but the grade is curved according to the ranking. Attendance is not mandatory but super helpful if you want to get a good grade.

This was the most boring class I have even taken at Ohio State. If you are a psychology major I recommend taking ANY other class as your upper level class. Theres only 3 exams that count towards your grade and thats it. It wasn't too hard just honestly SO SO SO boring

I agree that class average was a D on every test, but a curve makes it a B-. All you need to do to do well is show up to class and take notes on the research he discusses. He is a great, knowledgable professor. He even admitted he makes the tests hard because it's an advanced class, but he curves greatly. don't blame a poff because you don't study!
Good luck passing this class. Averages on the exams are D's. Hardest class I've ever taken and he makes his tests unpassable. Do not take this course!!!

summary_comment: Rebecca is highly regarded as one of the top teachers at OSU, known for her engaging and clear lectures, accessibility, and genuine care for her students' success. Students consistently praise her for making complex material easy to understand and enjoyable to learn, often recommending that others take her classes.

Ratings.comment: Rebecca is by far the best teacher I have had at OSU, She has interesting lectures, is so caring, approachable, all around amazing. You'd be lucky to have her! 10/10

Becca went above and beyond for our class. Her lectures were really straightforward and helped consolidate everything on the exam. The textbook really wasn't necessary, just the guided notes and practice tests she makes should be enough for the final. She's also very accessible for questions and extra help if you need it.
Becca is a great teacher! She explains the material really well and gives out fair topics. Gives out good study material for tests too. Would take again.

I absolutely loved Becca. She's a great instructor and makes the material really easy to learn. She wants everyone to do well. Her lectures are engaging and fun! I loved her class so much. Wish she taught more psych classes!
Becca was very interesting and her lectures were very engaging. She made the content really easy to understand and fun to learn. If you have the choice, defiantly choose to take this class with her.

Rebecca is good at explaining the basic psychology concepts, and is clearly passionate about her class and psychology. She really cares about her students. The class itself is easy, and the concepts covered aren't anything special.
She makes lectures interesting. She makes the material clear. She is always prepared for lectures and makes an effort to make class personal. If you have the chance to take her, take her.

Becca is so nice and caring and really wants her students to do well. She has really clear and entertaining lectures with guided notes, and she prepares her students for the standardized psych midterms and final really well. There are lots of opportunities for extra credit. I definitely recommend taking Becca's class!

Becca made lectures very easy to follow along with (guided notes), and created review questions that were super helpful when studying for exams. She was enthusiastic and passionate about the material, and always answered questions clearly if you had them. If you go to class and take advantage of all bonus opportunities the class is an easy A.

I'm so glad I have Becca for psych! She is extremely sweet and helpful and I learn a lot from her. She makes and prints out guided notes for every section that you go through during class. She adds in videos and real world examples and fun activities for the class. Definitely try to get Becca for psych 1110!

summary_comment: Professor Maxcey is highly engaging and passionate about her subject, making lectures interesting and accessible. However, her class requires the purchase of a costly workbook or anthology, which is often necessary for success. Despite this financial burden, students appreciate her helpfulness and care for their learning experience.

Ratings.comment: The class itself is easy and she clearly is interested in the subject matter. The biggest downside is that you must buy her $100+ anthology or you will get at best a C in the class. She loves to humble brag in class and even though class isn't mandatory it'll really hurt you if you don't go (always some exam questions that aren't in the slides).

This class was alright. I liked that she was passionate about the material and the exams were not difficult. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it's worth going to class because even though she posts the slides online, she'll give additional info that will be on the exams. One annoying part is that she makes you buy a $100 workbook that she wrote.

She makes lecture super interesting. She posts the slides online, but you need to show up because she will test on things she says in class that aren't on the slides. Don't buy the book. But, you have to buy a $100 workbook for journal article assignments that are very time consuming. As long as you go, you will get a lot out of this class.

Dr. Maxcey's class was one of my all-time favorites at OSU. Maxcey makes lectures really fun and interesting, and makes you care about what you're learning! Easy exams and homework. She's very helpful and personable, would definitely take this one again.

I've had Prof. Maxcey for 2 different classes now and she is by far the best instructor I have had at OSU. She actually cares about her students and values their input in the class more than any other professor I have had. She 110% knows what she's talking about and her projects are super interesting. If you have a chance definitely take her class.

This class was ok. Material was relatively interesting, and she knows what she is talking about. The article assignments mostly were useless busy work, and I didn't like having to buy a book that's just a compilation of research articles that I can find online. This class was easy, but I would honestly rather take a harder but more enjoyable one.

This class was an easy A, she made easy material easier to understand. The only bad thing is her dumb anthology, which is required. I don't understand why I can't just go online and get the homework research articles from there. Wasted $100 on it. Other than that she's suuper nice and helpful; I didn't even have to take the last 2 exams to get an A

Dr. Maxcey is incredibly engaging and genuinely cares about her students. She makes all the class content understandable through her lectures and all of her powerpoints are posted online. Her textbook with journal articles was on the more expensive side, but it was actually immensely helpful and taught me a useful skill for my future in psych.

Understands the topic just fine, but comes off as patronizing and subliminally snarky. Some people really like her--I'm not one of them. Lectures are pretty dry, still informative. She likes to self-advertise, talking about how many important people she knows and how intelligent she is. I came to learn--I don't care.

Maxcey, though teaching an easy enough class, made it incredibly inconvenient. One of the two required textbooks for this class was $87.50... it was her personal book, a collection of nothing more  than articles you could find on google and a copypasted worksheet... but if you don't get it, you'll fail. Also incredibly unresponsive to emails.

Yeah this class is really easy but I hated everything about it. The lecture exams are a joke, but the article exams are designed to be nit picky and trick you which none of your students appreciate, Ashleigh.

Dr. Maxcey is great! She's hilarious and often makes lectures entertaining. Grade consists of 4 Chapter Exams-lowest is dropped (75%), and 2 T/F Exams on Journal Articles. She posts her lecture slides online which have basically all the chapter exam material. If you study the slides well and show up as much as you can, you should get an A.

Very fun and passionate teacher.  She is the type of teacher who could make anything interesting, and PSYCH 3310 is a pretty easy A.  If you want, you can definitely skip all lectures and just study slides online to get an A.  If you need bonus pts though, she randomly gives bonus pts during lectures.
