Makes you spend $40 on printer ink for her dumb Journal article exams that are wildly unrelated to the content administered in lecture.

She is very excited about her classes and is also very willing and eager to answer questions. The exams are based off of lecture: a lot of the questions come straight from the powerpoints! She tries to engage the class and makes jokes. Made me interested in the topics! Get the book if you skip class, 5 exams but drop lowest-5th is optional

Had 5 exams during the class but you are able to drop one or not even attend one if you are happy with your grade. Reading & answering the articles was tough but she'll go over articles in class & usually point out the important info that she'll test you on. Don't bother buying the book because she bases the exams only off her lectures & articles.

I had Dr. Maxcey for a neuroscience class and I wasn't doing so well in the class for most of the semester but then she offered extra credit and an easy final and I ended up with an A. If you have to take cognitive neuro, take it with her. She's super nice and cares about student feedback as well.

Dr. Maxcey is by far my favorite professor that I have had at OSU. She makes her lectures interesting even though the material is simple and easy to learn for the most part. She is one of few professors that actually made me want to go to class. I would definitely take her class again if I could.

I took 2 courses with her this semester and found her to be one of the most helpful professors I've had at OSU. Most professors get annoyed by people asking questions in class or over email, but she seemed genuinely dedicated to helping us learn and responded encouragingly. She's also very nice and easy to talk to. 10/10, would take her class again
Her class is really easy but it is also very boring and her lectures have little to no organization, just a bunch of random facts thrown at you.

By far the best professor I have had at OSU. She is so caring and relatable! She makes the material from the book much easier to understand in lecture. The only grades she gives out is exams, but she drops the lowest one. The exams are not too difficult if you go to lecture and study.

Dr. Maxcey is my absolute favorite. She is super down to earth, and is one of the nicest human beings ive ever met. Even though attendance isnt mandatory, I would highly recommend. You get to do fun demos in lecture and she makes it make so much more sense.

Such a sweet professor who really cares about her students. Both lectures and the textbook are helpful for studying, though she doesn't make you learn everything in the book. Tests are straight forward and pretty basic if you review. She supplements the book with journal articles but always goes over them in class.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as effective for earning an easy A with minimal effort, particularly through simple assignments and a take-home final. However, her lecture style varies among students, with some finding her lectures interesting and enriching while others find them dry and unhelpful, often preferring to learn from slides and external resources. Her teaching approach includes a focus on practical life skills and class participation, though some students find her lectures and class environment less engaging due to her blunt and sometimes demanding demeanor.

Ratings.comment: The context of her lectures are interesting and enriching, yet her lecture style wasn't my favorite. I only attended a few classes of her at the beginning and the ending of the semester and found those are pretty much useless. You can read the lecture slides on your own and watch the Up Series on your own and get prefect score on every assignments.

She is a great professor and the class is an easy A as long as you do the work. She had the most interesting lectures of all my classes and teaches things that are good to know in life. She is a little blunt and like class participation but other than that she's great.

No technology allowed in class. Goes through slides WAY too fast. But you never need the slide info because there's no exam except take-home final. Gets mad if people don't participate or give the exact answer she wants. Assignments and quizzes are short. Lectures are useless - unorganized, too fast, irrelevant to grade. Easy A but miserable class.

She is a boring lecturer, but she gets the point across. There are no midterms and the final is taking home, making the class very laid back. She does have us do discussions on reading; however, you can getting away with skimming because she expects the responses to be brief. The class is an easy A as long as you do the assignments.

I'd only go to class for the UP series. I would not take this class again for a few reasons. 1. She never answers emails 2. She doesn't even grade her own assignments 3. She does not care at all about the course or teaching. 4. There are never explanations on what you missed for assignments.

Johnson was extremely blunt, sarcastic, and a boring lecturer who never seemed interested in what she was teaching. She got angry when no one was willing to participate right away. There were few very simple assignments, which she took forever to grade (but most got 100% on anyway). Would not recommend showing up to class, besides for the UP series

One of the best professors I've ever had, she genuinely cares about her field and her lectures aren't boring at all. This class was also an easy A, for her assignments she emphasizes the importance of brevity which is super nice because you don't have to write 10 page papers like for a lot of other psych classes

Lectures are boring and present information that are either common sense or stuff we learned in Psych 1100. Assignments are simple and graded easily. No exams. Overall, her class is an easy A but lectures are dry.
She doesn't mess around, she is very straightforward and blunt.

Her powerpoints are not posted online, and as she goes through them in class there is no time to take effective notes. I ended up with hardly any of the info I needed to study for the exams. Raised a virtual child which was time consuming but easy and a large part of the grade--which was nice. Overall she is scattered in explanations.

Your grade is 6 "quizzes", she drops one grade.They are about 20 questions long but they aren't always over anything you ever talked about in class. She is very scattered, and shows lots of movies and than is done with class for the day. She doesn't answer questions much, and seems irritated by students. Not someone who I consider a teacher.

Genuinely surprised there were negative comments. Her class is an absolute breeze. No homework, no textbook, the final was 10 multiple choice questions. Come to class, the topics are interesting and she's nice. Easy, EASY A.

Excellent, small, discussion based class. Material was based on a different research article each day, and learning to apply broad concepts to them. My only complaint is that the only grade came at the end of the course, and there was no way to tell how you were doing until then. But Dr. Johnson knows her stuff and makes it fascinating to students.

This was a terrible class. She doesn't show up when the class watches a movie (and neither does the majority of the class) and she doesn't show up on TEST DAYS. It's very irritating if you have a question because she won't be there or email you back. She will also probably be very condescending if you ask a question. AVOID THIS CLASS.
She made multiple choice questions each worth 8 points. This caused the class average to drop tremendously. It was a lazy move of her part to create an exam.
Just not a very helpful professor. She seemed uninterested in being there and it was very STUPID to make multiple choice questions worth 8 points each!

Didn't know she was teaching the class til an hour before in week 1. She's lazy, doesn't respond to emails, she didn't come the last day of class so no review help, grades take forever to post. Terrible attitude and no respect for students. Won't give notes, even if you miss class for a religious holiday(TRUE). Should NOT be considered an educator.

She isn't the best lecturer and she's extremely awkward, but the class is easy. She gets the point across pretty clearly. Some questions on the quizzes come from the book, but they're the same as the practice questions on the textbook's website. As long as you take notes during class and check out the website for the book, this class is an easy A.
Great class if you are interested in children. Exams short and straighforward: if you attend class, listen and comprehend you will do well :)

She is the worst professor I have every had; rude, lazy, and made the T.A do everything. late with grading and doesn't do anything she told the class she would. I would recommend against her for ANY student

summary_comment: Professor Rubinchik excels in teaching, making complex material clear and engaging. Her high-quality slides enhance understanding, and she has earned widespread acclaim as one of the standout professors this semester.

Ratings.comment: Professor Rubinchik is great. I loved her class, even though it was really early in the morning. She makes the material very clear and her slides are the best. One of my favorite professors this semester.

summary_comment: Professor Valentine is an excellent lecturer who breaks down complex material into manageable parts, making it easier to understand. His lectures are well-organized, and he rarely references the textbook, as his slides cover all necessary information. While his grading can be challenging, particularly for papers, students find him approachable and passionate about teaching the subject.

Ratings.comment: small part of grade was participation - but he mainly just looks for people to show up and pay attention. He makes his own slides for lecture which cover most of the information but I'd recommend reading from the book before exams. Grades a little tough on papers but super nice and clearly loves teaching the subject
Valentine is a great professor.  He breaks down the material to make it easier to understand.  He goes over the most important topics in the book, so I never needed to use the book to study material.

A lot of information, but it was so enjoyable. Tom breaks down the information so its organized and easier to understand. Slides were very clear; didn't even touch the book once. 3 short papers which discuss lecture material. Tests weren't a breeze, but they were very fair if you studied. Great guy and great lecturer. Highly recommend.

summary_comment: This professor offers a straightforward and largely online homework system with minimal effort required. His exams closely follow his lecture slides, making extensive preparation unnecessary. While some test questions were challenging, consistent class participation ensures high grades.

Ratings.comment: There is a lot of homework but it's online and very easy, he just has you watch a couple videos and answer questions. Don't get the textbook because he writes his exams off of his lecture slides. He has graded activities in class, if you show up and participate you'll get 100%. Some of his test questions were tricky, but I didn't have to study.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as either excellent or terrible, depending on the student. Some praise his knowledge, helpfulness, and curve on tests, while others criticize his tardiness, unprofessionalism, and ineffective teaching methods. Overall, his effectiveness as an instructor is highly polarized among students.

Ratings.comment: Had him for psych 1100; a great choice for my first college class. Thought it was pretty easy. He curved most our tests 6-10 points. Was very happy with the overall experience.

Was late to the majority of classes and was not prepared most of the time. Was aggressive to students in lecture and email who had issues understanding concepts. His clothes were sometimes dirty and his butt hung out. He also had poor hygiene. He took a long time to grade and return emails. I learned nothing from the class

I really liked the class. I see some complains about his being late, but I was actually appreciated his being late for the class so I don't have to get there at time lol Also, you really don't need a book the powerpoint handout is the only thing you need.
Fantastic Professor.
This guy is fantastic.  He is very helpful, and I would take anything he teaches.
Terrible professor. Doesn't make any attempt to understand students, only throws definitions at problems. Late to every class. Grades papers using keywords, not concepts. Makes copies of the SEI's...

I didn't like this class, or him as a teacher.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL.  Walks in late every day, wears wife beaters and jeans (eew!), takes weeks to hand back papers and exams, lectures straight from powerpoint, takes forever to answer emails... His comments on papers and exams are completely illegible, and thus useless. Take another writing class!

Can't really depend on his notes, if you read you will be fine though!! This class has a heavy workload! Pat konws what he is talking about but don't depend on him for help, he is really busy and probably will not answer your e-mails!
I was definitely not a fan. A majority of my E-mails went unanswered and he took forever to grade exams and papers. Not helpful at all.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, making complex material easy to understand through engaging examples and thorough lectures. Students find her approachable and supportive, with a sweet and enjoyable demeanor that keeps classes lively despite potential monotony. While a textbook is recommended for homework, all exam material is covered in her lectures.

Ratings.comment: Awesome teacher. She is my best professor this semester. Book was really not needed at all as long as you go to class. She gives guided notes which are awesome and if you use them, then no need for the book. She also does tophat, so attendance is mandatory. She is super nice, and very understanding when it comes to late work or other things.

Puts material in a very easy to understand way, with a good and interesting examples , and all necessary information is given. Her personality and attidude in class is very sweet and enjoyable, even though the class can turn into a snooze fest its not too hard. Textbook is needed for homewook, but all exam material is given during lecture.

summary_comment: Heather is highly regarded for her engaging and enjoyable teaching style, with students praising her effective use of guided notes and supplementary videos to enhance understanding. She is described as a helpful and knowledgeable lecturer who genuinely cares about her students' success. While some find her lectures can be a bit dry at times, the overall consensus is positive, highlighting her overall effectiveness in facilitating learning.

Ratings.comment: Heather's class has been really fun to take. Her lectures are very good and she provides guided notes for easier note taking. She includes some fun youtube videos to make content easier to understand. The midterms are fairly easy as long as you take good notes. Minimal studying is required. She is very funny and seems like she really cares about us
Very helpful and her notes are also very helpful. Loved her class.
She is a nice lecturer, and always has a lot of information on her powerpoints. She provides guided notes, which makes note taking easier. Def take her class!

Understanding teacher that doesn't really care if you come to class or not. Lectures could get a little boring, but her examples were awesome. As long as you do the readings, you can get a good grade in this class without actually going.
She's great!
She is so hot!

summary_comment: Professor Yu is an exceptional teacher who deeply cares about her students' understanding and success. She effectively uses examples and multimedia to enhance learning, making complex information accessible. Students who stay engaged outside of class report significant success.

Ratings.comment: Professor Yu is such an amazing teacher. She cares about her students and if they fully understand the information. She always gives good examples and really makes the information stick. You just need to make sure to keep up with learning the information outside of class and you're set for success.

Such a wonderful prof. I love psychology to begin with, but she showed me even more as to why I did. I highly suggest taking her class. (Also, she uses pictures and videos of her dog as examples hehe).

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their enthusiasm and engaging lectures, which students find both interesting and enjoyable. The class structure is relatively easy, with minimal note-taking required as the content is covered in pre-class powerpoints. Students can achieve an easy "A" with minimal effort beyond attending class occasionally and completing the brief daily tophat quizzes.

Ratings.comment: Interesting class and such an enthusiastic teacher! There is tophat daily but its just 2 questions that you can answer without going to class. Dont need to take notes, just read the powerpoints before exams and youll be fine. Easy A and he gives bonus too. Youll want to go to his class because his lectures are fun, interesting, and engaging.

summary_comment: Gina is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and strong commitment to student success. Her lectures are engaging, supported by visual aids, and supplemented with guided notes that encourage active learning. She is known for her patience, professionalism, and willingness to provide extra credit opportunities and early feedback on assignments.

Ratings.comment: I worked really hard in this class and it really isn't that hard if you study and pay attention to the lectures. Gina is really nice and my favorite teacher at OSU so far. We got a lot of extra credit opportunities and Gina's lectures were really helpful. She also provided guided notes for her lectures and was really patient and nice.

Gina really cares about her students and wants everyone to succeed. She keeps lectures interesting by adding many pictures and videos to her slides. You should get the textbook, because it can help clarify confusing concepts but I didn't read it religiously. Exams are very easy! Get started on REP early and do all of the extra credit!

Uses tophat for in-class activities so show up. Provides guided notes but you still need to read the text because sometimes the notes are missing information you're responsible to know for test. Extremely professional. Allows you to turn in written assignments early for feedback. Psych 1100 has opportunity to earn 12 extra credit points.
My favorite professor so far. Truly cares for her students and does everything she can to help.

summary_comment: The professor is known for being very strict with grading and having challenging tests with confusing question phrasing, though she is understanding about missed exams and offers flexibility. Students found the class demanding with heavy workloads and difficult exams, and some suggest it might be better to take a different course for the writing requirement. Lectures are described as dry but informative, with pop quizzes and in-class reviews helping with preparation for exams.

Ratings.comment: very nice personally, but her tests are super hard and questions are very confusing the way they are worded. doesn't give much feedback about papers written, and she grades pretty hard, I had to miss a test and she was very understanding and very flexible about retaking the test, not sure I would recommend her..

Class was way more difficult than I'd expected. Material was interesting but workload was heavy and exams were challenging. Had to write an essay every week on top of everything else. Better to take a different 2367 course for writing requirement.

Courtney was an alright lecturer. She is very excited about what she teaches but the class was dry. All the powerpoints  online. She gives pop quizzes so I would go for that . She does review in class. Study for exams because there is just a lot of info for each exam. And dont  wait to the last minute to study for the final because its  cumulative

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as having a challenging teaching style that leaves many students struggling, particularly those with weaker math backgrounds. Despite multiple assessments, students find it difficult to achieve satisfactory grades, indicating a potential gap in the effectiveness of the instruction for lower-level learners.

Ratings.comment: I am terrible at math and going into Stats I hoped to have a great prof... Wrong. 4 tests and 9 homeworks are not enough for me to get a decent grade.

summary_comment: Dr. Stanley is a caring and approachable professor who significantly improves her teaching methods over the course of the semester, making the class more engaging and easier to understand. While some students find her initial lectures overwhelming and her teaching style scattered, others appreciate her kindness, passion, and efforts to help students succeed, along with the numerous opportunities for extra credit.

Ratings.comment: Stanley is a very condescending professor who does not seem to care about the betterment of the student. Her lectures are all over the place because she is very scatterbrained, and whenever anyone asks a question she HAS to say well if you listened before... instead of just answering it. I wish she was nicer and not so all over the place.

At first I wasn't too crazy about Dr. Stanley's lectures- this was her first time teaching the class and it was very information heavy. She quickly adapted to teaching this class and began to implement videos and extra little "brain breaks" that presented the information in a unique manner. Dr. Stanley is extraordinarily caring and approachable.

This class was really really easy if you tried. Read the book and go to class and you will easily do well. She was a good lecturer and gave lots of opportunities for extra credit. The class was very low stress, enjoyable, and interesting. She is very nice and approachable.

Dr. Stanley is a very caring instructor. She explains concepts in detail & really solidified my knowledge of introductory stats. She offers a good amount of extra credit (>3% to the final grade) and her practice exams & homework questions are similar to the exams. TopHat participation & attendance matters, so don't skip too many times.

Stanley is a really nice professor! She is so kind and cares about her students. She is a young professor so probably not very experienced, but she really makes an effort in teaching. She is super passionate about how to make the world a better and happier place for people to live so is really inspirational to me. Empathetic! lots of reading though

This class was (to be honest) really boring. She gives 6 opportunities for extra credit, up to 3% on your final grade which is nice. She's also vocal about caring about how her students do and will allow for re-dos on homework if the class struggled. I spent most of class working on other class work, the material is bland but do-able.

Leanne is a very nice person, but overcomplicated PSYCH1100H. Most people in the class were only taking it as an honors pre-med requirement, however her class was much more difficult than any other 1100H class. Your grade will be almost entirely determined by exams. Her lectures are fine, but sometimes she goes too fast and you'll miss something.

Leanne is passionate and wants her students to succeed. Her clarity in lecture could improve, but she had just started teaching. It did improve over time. She is also flexible with homework. This was my first statistics class and I did not struggle. Just read the book and you should be fine. Overall, a low-stress class with a caring professor.

Leanne Stanley is such a nice and caring woman! Although Psychology Statistics is not the most interesting class, she really cares about her students and gives lots of opportunities to succeed including extra credit, weekly homework, and participation (attendance) points.

summary_comment: The professor demonstrated strong teaching skills by providing relevant examples and ensuring high pass rates, though she occasionally struggled with tardiness and unprofessionalism, discussing personal topics in class. Another instructor was notably unprofessional, frequently late, and digressed into irrelevant topics like cats and personal issues, leading to poor explanations and unclear concepts. A third professor was generally effective but occasionally ran late and appeared flustered, though she improved her lectures and maintained fairness in grading.

Ratings.comment: She gave first hand examples of the material which made it more interesting and cared a lot about students doing well. I heard that no one failed. She told us on day 1 that she has a condition that can make her have tremors, took a little adjusting to. She definitely knew her stuff. She is obsessed with cats, but was silly about it.

She had good lecture slides and was very fair with grades, but was very unprofessional. She would often show up late to class and discuss overly personal matters in class. Though she knew the material, she often delivered it with little confidence during lecture, which frequently left me feeling unsure about it.

Worst professor I've ever experienced. 5-15 mins late to every single class and was very unprofessional. Went off topic often either about cats, her hearing disability, or her inability to find work (which in my opinion would be due to the lack of professionalism,  constantly being late, etc). Only grades are from tests, concepts not explained well

Dr. Pallett was a little distraught at times. She ran late to class often and seemed flustered when she arrived. However, she was a solid lecturer and explained things well. Her powerpoints were helpful (the book was not necessary) and improved over time. Overall, she ran a fair class and did a good job. Be warned though: she has a cat obsession.

summary_comment: Professor MacGregor is generally well-regarded for her helpfulness and approachability, though her teaching style can vary. Students find her classes easy and enjoyable, with one noting her sense of humor and another praising her kindness and willingness to assist. However, some criticize the quality of her PowerPoint presentations and the reliance on the textbook, suggesting that students need to actively engage with both materials to succeed. Overall, while the class can be challenging, many recommend her for her support and clear in-class explanations.

Ratings.comment: I had a social psych project class with her. She's very helpful with projects and has a good sense of humor.
very easy class, very nice lady

Karen is a cool person. I went to sleep so many times,  and just surfed the web. Coming to class counts bc of random assignments (they really help your grade). I did bad on homework and quizzes, but got good grades on the exams. So when doing homework actually read the book. I sure didn't. My grade could've been an A, instead of a B.

She's nice but I don't like her teaching. Her power points suck because she doesn't include detail from book&then tests on it. Read the book!!She said she would give us quiz key answers for the final, never did, and then included all those questions on the final. I don't know what my final grade is, but now I feel that I have to fight for my grade.

Very good but hard class. Go to class because powerpoints have blanks in them. Textbook is needed because a small portion of the exam is only found in the book, but most stuff is material only on her powerpoints.  The papers have to be graded strictly so go to office hours. She also curves the class. I recommend taking her for 2367.

Prof MacGregor was extremely helpful and her lectures were not bad to sit through at all. Mainly powerpoint used, and you don't even have to open the textbook because she is very detailed in class. I would most definitely recommend her, just make sure you show up to get all the information!

She was very kind & willing to help if you needed it and went out of your way to ask. Research methods is quite boring and dry material so it was a bit hard to get into. Midterm and final that are from the book (she doesn't make them) in class points, homework, some are dropped too. You have to put some effort in but if so it's pretty reasonable.

She was very nice and helpful. Lectures could be boring as she just read from slides, but she tried to make it fun and relate-able. The class is almost completely from the book but I really enjoyed it.
Very nice and gives you slideshows which summarize the course content. She doesn't write exams so they are completely book based. Know all the vocab and the class is easy.

She is very nice and willing to help her students if they don't understand something.  She has power points that she uses in class, which isn't mandatory, but you NEED TO READ YOUR TEXTBOOK!  I suffered badly on my exams that are most of your grade.  I took this class because I thought it would be easy but it's not if you don't plan on studying!

She is not helpful AT ALL. She straight up tells you that nothing from her lectures is on the test, only stuff from the textbook. Thus, her lectures are pointless. She makes things a lot more confusing than they need to be. Overall just not good.

Fantastic professor. Keeps lectures concise and is very willing to help. Exams were fairly difficult, though not bad if you went to lecture. She does include some questions on material that's only covered in the book, but it's a small portion of the exam and you should be fine regardless. Great professor; would definitely recommend her.
She is a great teacher, that presents information in a simple clear way. Class attendance isn't exactly a top priority, but it is always interesting.
A relatively easy class if you attended lecture. A really nice professor who made the class pretty interesting. I'd definitely recommend her

First year professor, pretty dry lectures in my mind. I went to most classes, but wound up mindlessly surfing the web for the period 75% of the time. Exams were all multiple choice and if you studied the slideshows posted online it was not hard. She says you need to read the textbook I did not and still managed A's on the exams.
She was a pretty cool teacher. Kept class interesting. YOU HAVE TO READ THE TEXTBOOK. She gives questions from it in her test. Super nice.

Autumn semester 2012 was her first year teaching at OSU and she did great. Class isn't mandatory, but it defiantly helps to go. All her power points are posted online though if you miss. She keeps class interesting with video clips and great examples and is always willing to answer questions. Because of her I want to minor in psych now.

summary_comment: Anne is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for her dedication to student success and engaging teaching methods. She provides comprehensive resources, extra credit opportunities, and makes lectures lively with multimedia content. Students consistently praise her care, knowledge, and willingness to help, often recommending her class strongly.

Ratings.comment: Anne was so great! She wants you to succeed, so show up to class and take notes. She also hosted review sessions that were extremely helpful. She tries her best to make lectures engaging with outside media use, such as youtube videos.

Anne worked hard to provide everything we needed to succeed in the class. We had guided notes, review sessions before exams, and many extra credit opportunities. She would give very applicable examples and tried to make lecture as engaging as possible, which included giving us a short break. She's the best instructor I've ever had!

Anne is by far the best professor I have had at OSU. She is the most caring person and is so knowledgable about the subject. She wants you to learn and get a good grade. Theres extra credit thats offered (just do it). I studied a decent amount for the exams and ended up with a high A. If you have the chance TAKE HER NO MATTER WHAT!

She is an amazing professor. Very nice, and very helpful. Extremely knowledgeable, and she will do anything to help you if you are struggling. She is patient with her students. I would advise reading the textbook, it helps a ton.

Anne is amazing at her job. She helped me learn sooo much while taking this class. I highly recommend attending class because she always has fun activities, videos, and acronyms to help you really remember material. If you're interested in a little of psychology and want an easy A, definitely take Anne's class.

While class isn't mandatory, I found that when I went to class and participated I learned the material better than reading the book on my own. Dr. Wilson is an amazing teacher, and she really knows how to get across her point without being rude or confusing

She is the sweetest. She gives guided notes for lecture and creates a review game for you before exams. It's obvious that she's very passionate and enthusiastic about psych and tries to make lecture interesting with relevant videos and visuals. Basically just an awesome human being.

Ms. Wilson was the best teacher I have ever had. She had great in-depth notes and lectures. She was always there to help you, and explained material so thorough. I would 100% recommend her to anyone! She's a great teacher and she's very attractive!

Very good professor. Very nice and genuinely wants students to do well. Tests are pretty easy and there are many extra credit opportunities. Follows high-school-like teaching style. She prints out lecture guides for you. She lectures for a bit and does a little review to make sure you understand the material. Before exams you play a review game.

Easily one of the best teachers I have ever had. She gives fun, interesting lectures, with extremely helpful guided notes. She really knows the subject inside and out, and she clearly cares about the success and well being of her students.

Anne Wilson is a young professor full of energy and love for psychology as well as for her students. She gives guided notes and the exams are pretty straight forward, as long as you can apply the definitions from the guided notes. She hands out candy a lot and you receive a lot of points just for coming to class. The only thing I did't like was REP

Anne is a young professor who is passionate about her class and subject. She provides guided notes for every lecture that are easy and helpful. Her lectures are filled with videos, clip arts, and concept checkpoints to make sure everyone fully gets the concept. Midterms are simple with example multiple choice questions. She gives study guides.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her availability and clear teaching style, making the class manageable with consistent effort. Students find her engaging and supportive, though some note that exams can be challenging and not directly aligned with lectures, requiring thorough preparation from the textbook. Overall, while the class is considered fairly easy with straightforward material, success hinges on diligent study and consistent engagement with the course content.

Ratings.comment: Great teacher and good course. She's always available for any questions about the material or assignments. Study for exams and do the extra credit.
I love her so much! She is so sweet and her class is so easy. If you don't pay attention, your loss.

Good professor & pretty easy class. She provided all info needed for the exams in the study guides and the material was all straight forward. I showed up about 70% of the time and still managed to maintain above a 95%. Study the night before the exams and don't turn in your responses late and it should be an easy A.
Nice teacher, seems very engaged and wants her students to learn. She doesn't give out enough grades besides exams, so if you do bad on one good luck.

Exams are the only grades, which is especially frustrating because they are unnecessarily hard. Questions don't focus solely on lecture content, and lecture itself not all that helpful. If you don't have/read the book, it'll be hard to do well because exams go way deeper than what is explained in lecture. Exams are multiple choice/written response.

summary_comment: Dr. Lindquist is known for delivering interesting and engaging lectures, and he is highly supportive during office hours. However, his exams are challenging due to vague and potentially misleading questions, making it difficult to achieve a good grade even with thorough preparation. Students emphasize the importance of attending lectures and doing extensive out-of-classwork to succeed in the course.

Ratings.comment: First, the information overall isn't hard to understand (at least if you're a Neuro major) but his test questions r VERY VERY VAGUE (they 're worse than Boyd's). He says he didn't want to trick us but most exam questions felt like trick questions so it is possible to study hard and still fail. He is a nice guy though. NO MUCH EXTRA CREDIT

Dr. Lindquist's lectures were quite interesting and he was really helpful outside of class. Your grade is based on 4 exams (final is not cumulative) and 4 reading quizzes (1 dropped). The averages for the exams were pretty high so don't expect a curve.

Lectures were very interesting, but it was super important to pay attention for exams!! His exams often ask questions about specific graphs and tables from experiments on his slides, which you wouldn't understand unless you listened to him explain in class! Very nice guy and super helpful in office hours, but this was not an easy class

The class is structured so that grades come entirely from quizzes/exams. While Dr. Lindquist is well spoken and gives decent lectures, the  questions he asks on exams are easy to misconstrue and are often poorly worded or poorly designed. Thus, even if you know the material well, it is quite easy to miss many points. Do NOT take his class.

Professor Lindquist is a great professor! His class can be difficult if you don't pay attention or go to class. He is funny and explains the material in ways that student can understand. His exams are mainly multiple choice with a few short answer questions at the end. All in all, this is a great class and a great professor!

In my opinion, a very dry lecturer and difficult material. The class was very fast passed and taking this course first semester freshman year was not easy. Definitely have to do a lot of work outside of class. If you want to know what you got wrong on your exam, you need to go in or you'll never see it again. I regret not buying the textbook.

I really enjoyed Dr. Lindquist lectures. He was really good at explaining the material.  I suggest going to class even though he posts his slides. When attendance was low he would give hints on what would be on the exams.

Lindquist was interesting. His lectures weren't required, but when I went I enjoyed learning about the material. Just the sheer amount of information presented is what is most difficult. Your grade is based on 3 exams and 2 quizzes, that's it. So prepare to study, A LOT. Averages on the exams were around 75-79%, no curve.

Don't buy the textbook for this class!! Basically everything comes from the notes and lecture. The class only requires a few hours of memorizing from PowerPoint slides before the exams. Otherwise, it's pretty easy. Dr. Lindquist is a pretty nice guy and a good teacher. Can get irritated by questions though.

He did not require us to have the book for this class. All of his exam questions were straight off the power points which he posts on carmen. He is genuinely interested in teaching. He tries to simplify things as much as possible since this is an intro class. I would definitely take another class with him.

Great professor with the fairest tests I've ever taken. I had to drop due to illness, but will be happily taking another class with him. Don't be overwhelmed by the sciencey stuff.  He understands this class is an introduction and won't kill you with crazy test questions.  All multiple choice. Fun class to go to.
Very clear instructor. 3 midterms and non-cumulative final. Lectures were humorous and engaging. Memorable examples.
Great professor. Good sense of humor and very clear. I thought there were some nit-picky essay questions on the exams, but other than that, just memorize the material and you'll be fine.

Great professor! He is probably the best in the neuroscience courses, take him for behavioral neuroscience! Easy class and he makes it interesting and worth going to class even though all lectures are posted online. If you have a science background the beginning of the course will be cake but still not difficult for non-science majors.
Dr. Lindquist is one of the best professors I have ever had.  His exams are fairly easy, but some questions can be tricky.  He does give study guides for each exam, which is extremely helpful.
This professor is tough on you if you happen to have illnesses during the quarter, despite having doctors notes.

summary_comment: Professor Yu is highly regarded for her kindness and understanding, making her a supportive instructor who genuinely wants students to succeed. Her grading is lenient, with multiple opportunities for extra credit, and she is readily available for help. While her lectures are not the most engaging, her classes are manageable with consistent effort and completion of assignments.

Ratings.comment: She was so kind and understanding and I felt like she genuinely wanted us to learn in the best way possible. Tests were all open note and online, but still study a bit. There were several extra credit options. Don't procrastinate REP. As long as you keep up with the work, study a decent amount, and show up for some classes you'll get an A.

She is an easy grader and was always willing to help with questions/problems. The only thing is her lectures aren't the most engaging. While attendance isn't for a grade, she doesn't post the notes' answers but if you miss one or two you can talk to her about it and get them in office hours.

Personally, I think REP and the class were fun. You'll pass the course if you do all the assignments and extra credits. There are 3 midterms and all of them are open notes. I got b, c, and a on the three midterms, and still passed the class with an A.

Lectures use guided notes and TopHat for attendance. As long as you complete the assignments, it wasn't difficult to get a good grade. Online exams and 2 short papers, plus a few discussion posts and other small assignments. Lots of opportunities for bonus points. Dr. Yu is very nice and understanding, and if you need any help just send an email.

Psych 1100 was honestly a breeze. Attendance was not mandatory whatsoever, and there were 3 big tests throughout the whole semester. Besides that, there were occasional discussion posts, papers, and the REP that was time consuming at times. Honestly, do the work and the extra credit and youll be fine.

summary_comment: Professor Lisa is highly regarded for her dedication to her students, offering straightforward assignments and open-notes tests that simplify the learning process. While the class is manageable, students still need to put in effort to achieve good grades, particularly by reviewing material thoroughly for free-response questions.

Ratings.comment: Lisa was an amazing professor and cared about her students. A lot of her assignments were completion, and she did her best to not overcomplicate the class. All of the tests and quizzes were open notes which just made the class easier, but review a bit before the tests as the free response questions require you to understand the topic.
Great teacher, average class, easy enough to understand, still have to work for the grade.

summary_comment: This professor at UC is highly regarded for his excellent teaching quality, standing firmly on students' perspectives and providing an easy grading system with only four exams where the lowest can be dropped. He is known for his laid-back and approachable demeanor, making his own notes available to students and offering helpful review sessions. While attendance is recommended due to occasional pop quizzes, his classes are generally considered interesting and straightforward if students engage with the material.

Ratings.comment: The best professor At UC!!!! Really stands on student's perspectives to teach and grade. Easy A, no textbooks, no weekly assignments, only 4 exams and can drop the lowest one. He is a cool and nice guy. Strongly recommended

He was a great instructor! Very easy grader and understanding when you approach him on a mistake that you think needs fixed. Review sessions before tests are really helpful! Attendance is recommended; he gives random pop quizzes. Great class and very interesting!

He was a cool laid back dude. Took intro to social psychology with him. Makes his own notes & prints them off for everyone in class. 3 Exams and final along with in class points so don't skip too much. Tests are relatively easy as long as you read from his notes and actually try a little. Overall good teacher. I'd recommend him!

summary_comment: Professor Joseph is highly regarded as one of the best at Ohio State University, known for his deep engagement with students, remembering their names, and fostering a genuine interest in learning. Nick is also praised for his dedication, clear communication, and willingness to help students, making complex material accessible and ensuring they are well-prepared for exams. Both professors are described as passionate, engaging, and genuinely invested in their students' success.

Ratings.comment: Mr. Joseph, Is probably the best professor OSU has. He shows that he cares for his students by knowing everyone's name, and talking to everyone and helping you think about the material in deeper ways. He made me enjoy learning ( I thought was impossible). I havent taken his class in a long time but realized how much his class change my life.

Nick is a great teacher and genuinely cares about his students. He works hard to make sure you have all of the material you will need for exams, and will even give guided notes if you ask for them. He is still learning himself, and if you have a question he can't answer he will often try and find an answer for you, which is really nice and helpful.

He passions for teaching students and always willing to help students get good grades. Assignments are kind of irritating but still good for getting extra credit. Exams are fair if you follow the lectures and, keep an eye on what he starred or mentioned in review sessions. Some questions  appeared on the exam exactly the same.
He is always involved in your learning. He tries hard to know all the names of students who answer questions in class. Very funny and speaks clearly and loud so it's easy to hear.

Nick is an amazing instructor and is very passionate about the course material. His teaching style is great as he always encourages participation and includes great real-life examples in his slides. He is very caring towards his students and makes sure they are prepared for exams.

Nick is an awesome professor! He really cares about his students and it shows. He is willing to put in the time and effort to help you if you go to him. His lectures are really helpful and he does a good job of putting extra emphasis on things that are going to be on the exams. Overall great professor and great classwould recommend.

He's excited about what he teaches and the lectures are never boring. His Psych 1100 section consistently preforms the best on exams and he is always willing to help when you are struggling. He cares about his students both in and outside of class. A really great professor for this class, you'll have fun in his class.
Hes engaging, unlike other professors. He doesnt just read off slides, he provides videos, group work, top hat, and resources. He shows that he really cares about teaching.
He provides great examples, in different ways, and slows it down for some students that he notices is taking a while for notes. I learn so much and he makes teaching look effortless.
The lectures also really interesting, mostly because it is a very interactive class and often includes visuals and analogies.
He is very charismatic, caring, and is patient. He explains the material very well and in a multitude of ways that foster learning and participation.

summary_comment: Dr. Bennett's teaching quality varies widely among students, with some finding the class easy and the material interesting, while others describe it as dry and difficult to engage with. Many students criticize his lack of responsiveness to emails, difficulty in contacting him, and exams that do not align well with the lectures and textbook. Overall, the class is seen as average, with significant differences in student satisfaction depending on personal learning styles and circumstances.

Ratings.comment: I don't really know what the previous reviewers on here are talking about... this class was super easy and the test questions came straight from his slides. I will say he rambles in his lectures though. Overall I found the info to be interesting, and the class was pretty average as far as professors go.
DO NOT TAKW HIS CLASS!!! Awful professor!

Dr. Bennett was the worst professor I ever had. He was inconsiderate and lacked empathy towards his students during a pandemic. His exams were non specific and at times no correct answers were listed based off of his lectures and the text book. I would not recommend him to anyone. If you have him as a professor change while you can or good luck.

I had Dr. Bennet during the pandemic and while he seemed nice in lectures, he did not respond to any emails and was extremely hard to get into contact with and did not answer questions or try to help students succeed. There were a few times were there was NO CORRECT answers on exams according to textbook and lecture notes- when asked- no response
DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS. He didn't care about his students and the class is super dry

Dr. Bennett lacked empathy and understanding towards students going through a pandemic. Several students gave SLDS notes which he did not follow or ignored. His lectures are very boring and rambles on a LOT. We had 3 exams including the final and 4 discussion posts for the entire class. The exams were very generalized and hard to answer.

Dr. Bennett's Honors Intro to Psych class was very easy. He said to read the book, but it was never really necessary - just skimming it as you watch the lectures is good enough. Quizzes and projects are not difficult, and extra credit boosts the grade a lot. He was not the best lecturer, but it was an easy A for GE and Honors credit.

This class is okay. Even after reading the book and watching his recorded lectures, the test questions are nonspecific. The book is far more incorporated into the exams than the lectures are by ANY means. He rambles quite a bit in his lectures, and doesn't make a ton of sense. It's hard to take notes on the lectures. Good luck, you'll need it.

I took counseling psych with him during this pandemic. He says the exams are heavy on the book, but i did not even read the book. I just looked at the lecture notes & listened to the lectures. This got me 88-90% on the exams. He is very monotone w/ lots of ums/uhhs. I had to play lectures at 2x speed. He lacks empathy! Wont let make ups at all

Dr. Bennett gives really great and personable lectures. He gave a lot of useful information about furthering a career in counseling in addition to class material. There were 3 tests & 1 paper with no HW and no attendance requirement, but I can't imagine doing well on tests without going to class--he asks multiple questions specific to lecture.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as having poor teaching quality, with many students finding his lectures monotonous and unengaging, often reading directly from slides without adequate explanation. The class structure is frequently criticized for being disorganized and overly demanding, with challenging exams and confusing assignments. While some students appreciate the opportunity for extra credit and open-note testing, the overall consensus is that the class is tedious and not well-structured.

Ratings.comment: Avoid this professor like the plague. This is my first time rating a professor and its because I do not want other students to have to suffer through this mans horribly boring, monotone lectures. His syllabus and organization of class is all over the place. I passed with a B but that is solely because the exams were open note.

He was nice, but this class was so annoying and terrible. He stood and spoke for 80 minutes and was occasionally asked questions. Exams and pop quizzes were open note, but had stuff we had never seen before. Writing a paper every day and summarizing each class was redundant and not helpful. Lots of extra credit, but this class was so tedious

He's a nice guy, so I feel bad rating him poorly, but he does not know how to structure a class. His lectures just read off the slides, his tests are unreasonably difficult and he doesn't give enough time given the number of questions, his assignments are unclear, and he doesn't explain them. And we had to read and write a paper for every class.

Sloutsky uses a grading set up that baffles me as to why he thought it was reasonable. two exams total, but the mid-semester exam is worth 90 points (80 minutes to take) and the final is 120 point cumulative (105 minutes to take). When I emailed him he responded with little thought or effort much like his in person lectures. Please spare yourself.

I feel so bad giving Vlad a bad grade. However, Vlad simply talks for an hour and twenty minutes straight right off the slides, and he doesn't know how to structure the class. His pop quizzes and exams, while open note, have things on them I've never heard of before. In class, everyone looks at one another in confusion. Avoid him if you can.

The lecture is kinda boring but Dr. Sloutsky does work hard to teach it. He covers tons of experiments and great ideas. This class also push me to read journals that I might have never read and I learn a lot from those. Tests are OPEN BOOK + 55 extra credits, so you can't complain for anything! Also, he is really patient and always ready to help.

Sloutsky can't teach and his lectures are incredibly boring. At the end of every class you have to turn in a paragraph summary for attendance so you have to go. He does offer a ton of extra credit though and the tests are open book, open note, open computer! He also can be kinda rude. He will put you down if your opinion is not the same as his.

This guy reeks of insecurity. At every chance he gets he tries to uphold the validity of psychology and puts down anyone who challenges anything in his class. He is really, really condescending if your answer to a question in class isn't what he's looking for (even if it's right). That being said, this class is a SUPER easy A, but lots of busywork.

Sometimes the class could be a little dull, but overall it was pretty easy. You have to summarize a lot of academic  journals, but you can do an extra six and get sixty extra credit points! which is aaaaawesome. There were two separate final projects and a final exam, but both exams are multiple choice and the projects aren't difficult

summary_comment: Dr. Walton is highly regarded for her dedication and extensive knowledge in her field, making the class both engaging and informative. She demonstrated exceptional understanding and flexibility during the pandemic, ensuring a supportive learning environment. Her grading is straightforward, provided students complete the required work.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Walton is amazing. She is dedicated and very knowledgable about the class subject. She was also really understanding when this class was taught during the pandemic. She grades pretty easily too as long as you do the work. The class is super interesting.

summary_comment: Dr. Sullivan is highly regarded for her effective and straightforward teaching style, making complex topics accessible and her lectures engaging. Students appreciate her clear communication, prompt responses to emails, and passion for the subject matter, which fosters a supportive learning environment. Her exams are known to be fair and straightforward, provided students attend lectures and complete supplementary readings.

Ratings.comment: Wish more of my online classes were like hers. Simple, straightforward format with lectures that were just the right length, and plenty of opportunities to practice for exams and ask questions. Also loved the fact that she talked about students' research interests during office hours! She' great at communicating and responds to emails quickly, too.
She's amazing! Make sure you take one of her classes before you graduate!!!
She is so sweet and caring! Her material is super straightforward so exams are too.

Dr. Sullivan is a great professor. She is super knowledgeable and her exams are very straightforward. If you attend lecture and take good notes, you should be fine! Make sure to read/watch the supplemental materials also!

she's so nice and funny and keeps lectures really entertaining and clearly knows what she is talking about. she has made me consider getting a career in something with the psychology of children and or family psychology she is super sweet and understanding as well. if you watch the lectures and do the reading the exams aren't bad at all.

Dr. Sullivan is a gem. She clearly is passionate about the subject matter, and her heart for the students and content is evident. She is passionate and intelligent, and I learned so much without really trying.

Dr. Sullivan gives INCREDIBLE lectures. Her lecture slides are pretty simple, so going to class and listening to what she elaborates on is really important. Her tests are easy and straightforward. She's also an angel and wears the best outfits.

summary_comment: Professor Samimy is highly regarded for her effective teaching and supportive approach, with clear grading criteria and thorough feedback. Students find her lectures and materials comprehensive and engaging, though some note the need for diligent effort, particularly in completing weekly discussion posts and thoroughly proofreading papers. Overall, she is seen as an excellent instructor who makes the course both enjoyable and academically rewarding.

Ratings.comment: I love Professor Samimy. She is so nice and gives great feedback. Her grading criteria was clear and she gave great feedback. I wish I hadn't bought the book because I never used it. All the information was provided in the slides and lectures. Definitely would take her again for other classes!

Professor Samimy was always ready to help, despite the class being delivered asynchronously, she responded to emails and was willing to chat. The abnormal psychology topic is very interesting, integrated into the scientific writing aspect of this course. Exams are easy, make sure to put in work into papers and take note of feedback!

This class shouldve been an easy A, but I will say a few things that I messed up on. Do all of the weekly discussion posts because 3 of them are for extra credit which makes a huge difference. Also, she is a tough grader on papers and there are 4 of them so make sure you proof read and get them checked. The lectures and quizzes are easy content.
No drawbacks. Just take her section, learn fun&easy, and then get A.

She is a perfect graduate teaching assistant. She is good at helping students understand course materials and willing to help you at office hours. Take hers will be a good choice. The whole course composes by 5 papers, 1 mt and 1 final and participation.

summary_comment: Professor Coutts is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching quality and engaging personality, making his classes enjoyable and effective for learning. Students consistently praise his dedication to their success and his understanding approach, noting that he genuinely cares about their well-being and academic growth. His supportive and inclusive teaching style, along with clear explanations of material, contribute to a positive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: I always enjoyed being in his class. He truly cares about helping you succeed. Not only is he a good teacher and explains the material well, but his awesome personality makes the lectures even more enjoyable. Just study well for the tests and do all of your assignments and you will be fine! Definitely recommend!

I thoroughly enjoyed this class and I think a lot of it has to do with the professors teaching style. The only thing I would say is to make sure you study for the tests. Overall it is a pretty easy course as long as you do the work.
The GOAT, one of the only professors that actually cares about you.

Mr. Coutts is one of my professor who made me feel welcome at college during such an unusual time. He is understanding, in a way that he doesnt just care if you have an A rather that you are learning and are happy and healthy! I 100% recommend

Mr. Coutts is the type of teacher you hope is proud of you. I missed my essay and he informed me that it wasn't turned in and gave me time to do it, which I appreciated more than I can say. He made the zoom calls genuinely enjoyable and comfortable.

summary_comment: Professor Baldwin Way is highly regarded for his engaging and caring approach to teaching. Students appreciate his willingness to answer questions and adapt to feedback, making the lectures interesting despite their heaviness. However, the course is challenging, with tough exams and a significant workload, particularly in terms of studying numerous studies presented in class.

Ratings.comment: I really liked him and this class! Content was interesting and relevant. A decent amount of test prep is required due to the number of studies presented, but go through those and youre golden. Lots of grades with exams, online quizzes, top hat, paper, and extra credit. He listens to student feedback and tries to make lecture interesting.

I absolutely love Baldwin Way. I took his course in the midst of COVID and he was really understanding with everything going on. If you have the option, 10/10 recommend him. Make sure you read and study, and you'll pass.

Prof Way is always willing to answer questions, and it's clear to see that he has a big heart & really cares about his students. The class format is lecture heavy, but it's an upper level course so it's expected to be hard. But of all the upper level courses I have taken, this has been the easiest! 10/10 would recommend!

Lectures are super heavy like 50-90 slides but he never finishes most of them. Quizzes and readings are easy but the exams are very difficult. My exam grades did not reflect the rest of my grades. He seems really caring but he makes way too many mistakes on his own exams. I would not recommend. This class was the definition of stress.

lecture heavy. take good notes. exams are tough but it is a 4000 level course- it is expected. He's nice, and very caring. Even though his lectures are heavy he doesn't make it boring- seems to really care for his students

Professor Way always tried to keep class interesting. His exams were a little tough and he lectures a lot but always tries to keep things upbeat. You can tell he cares about students doing well and is always open to answering questions. He also is open to giving him feedback on the class which is rare but good! I would take his class again!

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Biological and Social Bases of Behavior

summary_comment: This professor offers an easily manageable course with comprehensive guided notes, making lectures largely optional. The assessments, including three open-note midterms and weekly open-note quizzes with no time limits, are designed to be accessible, contributing to high average grades. Extra credit through REP significantly boosts final grades, making it one of the easiest paths to an A in the semester.

Ratings.comment: Super easy and she had guided notes so you really didn't have to go to lectures. The 3 midterms were open note and relatively easy I got above an 88 on all three. One quiz a week on the lecture which is open note and has no time limit (a lot of the answers are from quizlets). Easiest A of my semester honestly. Do REP extra credit raises grade a lot

summary_comment: The professor demonstrated solid teaching quality in her first semester, particularly excelling in social psychology. She is approachable and accessible, and while the majority of the grade hinges on a few major exams, students can succeed with adequate preparation.

Ratings.comment: This was her first semester teaching and she was pretty good for social psychology. She makes herself available and her tests aren't too hard. The only bad thing about the class is that most of your grade is based on 2 midterms and the final but if you study for those you should fine.

summary_comment: Kenneth is an outstanding professor who excels in teaching writing, offering comprehensive feedback on three major projects and fostering success for his students. He grades participation but allows students to recover points through weekly assignments, and he does not assign exams. Overall, his class is highly praised as both excellent and engaging.

Ratings.comment: Writing class- so obviously a decent amount of writing. There are three major projects, and Kenneth gives great feedback and sets you up to succeed. He is a great professor!! Participation is graded, but you can do weekly assignments to get those points back if you miss class. No exams! This is an amazing class and an amazing professor!

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their approachable demeanor and easy class structure, though the material still requires some effort, particularly through reading the textbook. Quizzes can be challenging initially but improve with practice, and the instructor maintains good rapport with students, providing helpful handouts despite occasional discrepancies between slides and handouts.

Ratings.comment: super nice and the class is really easy. as long as you watch the lectures, youll be okay.

Very easy class. Just read the textbook and do it frequently to make it easier on yourself. There is a lot of extra credit. You do not have to attend since the exams ar based on the book.Make sure you study for the quizzes even though you can you the book.
great rapport with class

Classes were okay. Gotta read ahead the textbook anyway. She did give some helpful handouts but sometimes diff from the slides. Quizzes were fair, was difficult the first time but a lot better later. Explained clearly enough at least for a foreign instructor. BTW she's cute. lol

summary_comment: Dr. Spencer is widely regarded as a kind and accessible professor who genuinely cares about students' grades. However, his teaching effectiveness is marred by slow grading and a lack of clear feedback, which frustrates many students. While some find his lectures and exams manageable with proper preparation, others criticize his unpreparedness and disorganized presentation slides.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Spencer is a kind spirit and very accessible and understanding. The only downside to this class is that he can be a very slow grader, and when it comes to grading, it often seems like he doesn't actually read the responses but rather give you a random grade. There is no rubric or comments so if you do poorly you won't know why.

Dr. Spencer was a great professor. His lecture presentations were bland but if you took note on the words he was saying and read the textbooks the exams were not bad. Also is an understanding grader. Would take an exam from him again

Good professor but takes forever to grade. Let's you submit things a week early to get feedback. Lectures are good, but slides are confusing if you don't go to class. Good professor if you go to class and don't procrastinate its a great class!

Quite literally one of the worst professors I have ever had. This class was 1.5 hours long when it should've only been 55 minutes. He rambles on about studies without actually providing us with any useful information. He has a kind spirit, but there is no way this man is fit for teaching. He is impressed with his own research more than class.

The course is graded by four exams and a final research application paper. There is an optional cumulative final that can replace one of the four test grades. The info on the tests are half lecture, half textbook. The lecture slides have very little information on them so your notes are really important and you have to know the studies discussed.

Dr. Spencer was great. Unfortunately with 2020 he had some family complications come up and had to go off schedule but he was always great at communicating that and was very lenient with grading. Class is very lecture heavy and youre graded by a few things. Overall it was a great class and Id be happy to take a course with him again.

Sooo many people complain about him but he's honestly such a nice guy and he really does care about your grades. His tests are hard I wont lie but I studied for 2 hours before the test and I never got below a B. I believe he does a fine job fo explaining concepts but you actually have to go to class because his presentations are somewhat bare.

He does not seem to prepare for lectures and also has taken the whole semester to grade the only three exams taken. Does not respond to emails and if he does it is after many many tries. Lecture slides provide no information and is very scattered and all over the place when explaining concept.
He does not care at all about us. If you see that the class is not doing so good, why can't he find a way to help us? He contradicts himself while explaining the lectures, so it is very confusing.

This class is not impossible, and it is very interesting and intellectually stimulating. There is no homework, but there are 4 tests that require a lot of studying. It is difficult to take notes, but I recommend recording the lectures and taking notes at your own pace. I left this class with more knowledge and an actual understanding of the concept

I like this professor, attendance isn't mandatory but it is mandatory if you want to do well on exams as your notes are all you have to study. His exams can be tricky and he is a tough grader especially when it comes to the essay portions of his exams, make sure you know this studies he describes and how they connect with the topic of discussion.

He has passages that should be read prior to each class and I did not read one of them. He goes over them in depth in class and that was enough for me to do very well on the written portion of the exam. The class is hard but there was a google doc full of notes that was helpful for studying. It's an interesting class and his Qs are conceptual.

Never been more lost in a class. The studies he teaches are unprofessionally done and don't make sense, so they are very hard to study for. He gives 4 exams and an optional cumulative final to replace your lowest exam but he will not have all of your grades in in time to see if you need to take the final so you pretty much have to take it anyway

This is a 3000 level undergrad course that is formatted like an advanced graduate level class. We can rely only on empirical articles to piece together class concepts. There is no textbook. The slides are minimally helpful, and the professor is hard to reach. If you want a challenge, great. But know what you're signing up for. I sure didn't.

This professor is horrible. He takes forever to grade exams (like a month). He doesn't email you back and he teaches the class on stupid research that is very difficult to understand. The class is nice but with him teaching it makes a whole lot worse. I think he is a grad professor as well; this is a mid-level undergrad course
Impossible exams and very unclear notes. takes him over 3 weeks to grade exams and very hard to reach through email. If you take this course- take with a different professor

Took Stereotype and Prejudice. There are some basic online notes, so you have to show up to class and pay attention. 4 hard tests and optional cumulative final to replace your lowest exam. This class shouldve been easier but the amount of info was too much and he describes all these studies in a difficult way. Nice guy but hard class.

Make you read and memorize many junk research articles for exam. Those articles are not very informative and some of these research play around with number and graph makes the result seems significant. Just Awful!

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her caring nature and effective teaching methods, making the class accessible as long as students attend and take notes diligently. She thoroughly prepares students for exams and uses real-life scenarios to enhance understanding, leading to positive student outcomes and strong recommendations.

Ratings.comment: She was such a nice professor who really cared about her students! This class is easy, as long as you show up and take decent notes you should get an A. She really prepared everyone well for the exams and you could tell she really wanted everyone to succeed!

I loved this class and I liked her as a professor. She was very caring and she explained things very well and put them into real life scenarios for us to understand more. I would highly recommend taking her for psychology.

summary_comment: The professor is caring and understanding, responsive to emails, and flexible with test formats, making the class relatively easy if students take good notes. However, lectures were challenging to engage with, despite the professor's desire for student success.

Ratings.comment: The lectures were not the best, was hard to stay engaged, but is very caring and wants you to do well. Will respond to emails and is flexible and understanding. Easy class as long as you take notes. Tests were online, at home, and open note, no final.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her clear knowledge and engaging teaching style, described as easygoing yet thorough. Students find her class well-structured and believe consistent attendance and attentiveness lead to success. Overall, the professor is seen as both knowledgeable and approachable.

Ratings.comment: Overall a good class! A super easygoing professor who knows what she is talking about and seems to enjoy it. show up to class and pay attention and you'll do well- it's laid out nicely.

summary_comment: Kristin is highly regarded as an excellent professor, known for her kindness, understanding, and effective lecturing style. Students appreciate her clear communication of what is needed for success, her flexibility, and her genuine care for their learning. Her classes are described as easy with straightforward exams and a supportive atmosphere.

Ratings.comment: Kristin is an amazing professor. She is kind and understanding and is a great lecturer. The material covered in class is on exam there are no tricks on the exam, go to class, study and read the book and you will pass. She is funny and shows great examples to help understand topics. She genuinely cares and is a great lecturer 10/10 recommend!

Easy A, bc of extra credit and easy hw. Show up to class to fill out notes bc lecture slides arent posted. Kristen really cares about her students a lot and is flexible and willing to talk through your issues. Exams are easy too if you just read the textbook or show up to class. Grade composed of chapter quizzes, 3 exams, participation and REP.

Kristin was incredibly kind and caring professor. She took feedback to heart, and made sure to answer all questions no matter what. Kristin was very open about what we needed to know and her lectures had great examples and videos. Easy, fun class.

summary_comment: Dr. Tom is a highly rated professor known for his engaging lectures and use of pop culture to make abstract concepts more relatable. Students find him approachable and humorous, and many recommend taking his class despite some criticisms regarding slow email responses and lengthy exam grading times.

Ratings.comment: Great lecturer and overall witty guy. He makes more abstract class material relatable by showing videos from pop culture. He is flexible with office hours and the exams are fine if you study material from the slides. The only criticism I have is that he sometimes takes several days to answer e-mails. In all, I would definitely recommend Dr. Tom!
Tests are way harder than they need to be. The tests focus on little details rather than big pictures. He also takes FOREVER to give you back your grades.

Hilarious professor, easy to talk to both in and after class/office hours. Really knows his stuff and always made me look forward to coming to class. Responds kinda slowly to emails though so it's best to ask any questions in class or in his office hours!

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!! Dr. Tom is an awful professor. He doesn't return assignments for months, takes nearly a month and half to grade exams and forgets to provide department mandated extra credit. He graded our exams wrong so we were all down by 10 points. His office hours are only 30 min long and he's late to them and he doesn't answer emails.
Great guy, take good notes.

Dr. Tom was pretty nice, and I did well in his class. He gave good feedback on papers and had a pretty helpful review session before the final. The class was a bit boring, though, and to combine a writing class with a social psychology class was a weird combination. He wasn't an easy grader, but I'd say he was pretty fair.
Fantastic professor. Must take!
Exams are harder than necessary, he is extremely unorganized and takes forever to grade things also. No homework in the classes, just exams. If you dont have an interest in this, DONT take it.
I took this class as an elective that I thought would be relative in my life and I hated it. He opened every class with some contriversial

I've had the pleasure of Dr. Tom being my professor for 2 courses now (ab psych & counseling psych) and both times I absolutely loved his class. Straight forward, willing to answer questionstalk in general, and super nice. As long as you attend class and pay attention you will be fine. Not a hard class, really enjoyable.
This class was difficult. The lectures were long. Tom seemed like a good guy and tried to be relatable but this course was hard to understand and pass.

I loooove Dr. Tom. I'm usually not into asian guys but he is so smart, funny and awesome that I can't help but think he is sexy! He is VERY interactive, using the internet and youtube alot. He cracks alot of jokes, too. I actually take his class at Columbus State, not OSU. His exams are NOT hard at all. He is personable and cool....recommended.

He's a really great teacher. Very interesting and showed a lot of video's in class which made it not seem so long. His exams were a little difficult but manageable. He's very personable and down to earth. I definitely recommend taking a course of his if you get the chance. Really funny and relatable guy.
