Instructor Dave was great.  He really made class interesting.  Hard grader on papers but I learned a bit about writing.
GREAT PROF.  Class could be a little tough at times (exams), but it was a LOT of fun and I learned a ton.  This was the only class this year that I looked forward to going to.

Prof. Tom is a great teacher.  His classes are not easy, but if you want to learn something valuable, he is your man. Dont listen to any negative comments, those are just people mad at the world because they suck at life.
I really enjoyed the class. Professor Tom was a very good teacher and he made the material very interesting. I will be looking for another class that he teaches. I would recommend him to my friends.
Worst teacher ever at OSU! Avoid!!!
Instuctor Dave was great! My first college instructor ever and one of the best I've had

Overall a great teacher - kept things interesting and fun.  Exams are all essay and can be tough, so look out!  If he offers a review session for the final, don't bother showing up - nothing we went over in the review session was on the final!  Really enjoyed his class - highly recommend.
Great class. I would take another from him if he taught any others here, his class was always fun to be in.
Smokin' hot and a great personality.  It's too bad he's taken.
Good teacher. Sort of monotonous teaching style, all power point slides. Relatively difficult class but as an honors class not too bad. Overall great personality!

summary_comment: This professor demonstrates exceptional teaching quality, clearly mastering her subject matter and effectively conveying complex ideas. Her expertise is evident in both her lectures and the high-quality images she uses, surpassing those from Professor Booton. She is highly regarded as a valuable asset to the classroom.

Ratings.comment: She got tired of her professor and started teaching the class one day. Really understands what shes talking about and takes better pictures than Booton. A true Gem.

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered a good teacher who explains concepts clearly and provides additional resources for learning. The class is described as very easy with minimal assessments—no final exam, just a group project and participation-based grading. Despite the ease and potential for high grades, some students feel they don't deeply engage with the material.

Ratings.comment: Good teacher, explained everything pretty well and class was super easy, only really have a group project at the end which is graded very generously.  I personally wouldn't take again because I felt like I didn't really learn the material, but that shouldn't stop you from giving this class a try
She was a very nice and good teacher. Her class is very easy and there is no final just a little super easy presentation

Professor Lee was very good at explaining psychological concepts, and giving students more resources to explore the concepts on their own. Class was SO easy, no tests or quizzes, mainly graded on participation (weekly reading) and group project at the end of semester. Honestly it would be really hard not to get an A in this class.

summary_comment: Dr. Hines is highly regarded for his engaging and accessible teaching style, making even large lecture classes enjoyable and interactive. He is known for his thorough preparation, clear communication, and willingness to help students, often using modern and relevant content to enhance understanding. While some students found the exam format challenging, most appreciate his supportive approach and the manageable workload.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Hines was great. I was thrown into this class by my advisor because of a last minute class drop by the school, and he made it enjoyable. He usually responds quickly to emails which is great. The class is VERY lecture heavy. He posts base level notes, but adds a lot of information in the lectures. The exams were all open note!

Dr. Hines was a very sweet and passionate guy. Lecture was not required and all the materials were online and open book open note for exams. He would try to get the class to talk and no one would, so he is a very interactive professor even with a class of 150 students. He is very sweet and forgiving!

Dr. Hines is very well prepared for class and an overall nice professor. Grades in this class are almost all group projects and writing but it's very manageable. Overall I didn't have to put much work in to get an A and this class was still very educational.

The exam format was horrible. I couldn't finish any of the exams due to 10 multiple-part short-answer questions that needed sources in the given time. He took forever to grade and with no feedback. Huge semester-long group project that constantly had issues. The class is not for people with busy schedules. I passed, but I wish I never took it.
Lectures aren't very exciting but assignments are generally easy and is a fair grader

Prof. Hines is such a caring professor and you can tell. His teaching style is so in touch with the world and Genz, and the media content he pulls to explain concepts is so good. He is genuinely a funny and entertaining teacher and I would recommend his class to anyone.

I took this for the diversity GE and loved it.The class is easy-open note quizzes, 2 group projects, and a weekly discussion board.  Dr. Hines is a great professor.  He tries to make class fun, keeps students engaged, and has a very modern outlook which is really great for this class.
very easy course and he tells you exactly what you need to know for exams. weekly discussion posts and 2 group projects so not much work at all. he's very accessible and willing to help!!

Professor Hines was nothing but good to my class, and he did a really good job teaching for it being his first semester teaching that particular course. His classes are very interactive, tests are open note, and he tries his best to listen to everyone.

Essentially a psychology of sociology class. Tests are easy and were open note, some group projects were fun. Information was very interesting and very applicable to people doing social sciences. Professor did his absolute best to stay politically neutral despite political nature of some topics.
Dr. Hines was a pretty good professor. His course content is pretty easy to understand and gives good lectures. His exams were open-note as well. Highly recommend!

Pros: Cool younger teacher. interesting material. open note exams. does unique projects like infographics and podcasts. funny lectures
Cons: lots of readings. delayed grading. granted it was his first year teaching this course, but not very organized. fun overall tho. didn't really learn how to rule the world

Overall the class is pretty easy but there are a lot of assignments for this class that take up a considerable amount of time and are only worth 3-6 points. Super nice guy and he makes lectures interesting, but the 1-2 long response discussion posts that are only worth 3 points are hard to find motivation for.

summary_comment: Dr. Yocom is highly regarded for her organization and willingness to help students, offering numerous opportunities for extra credit and maintaining a supportive classroom environment. However, her teaching approach can be challenging, particularly for complex subjects, and some students find her exams difficult and not aligned with lectures or homework. Overall, while she is generally liked, her effectiveness as a lecturer varies among students.

Ratings.comment: It isn't an easy subject, but she teaches it well. I have previous stats knowledge, and I am still commiting at least 3 hours a week to homework plus additional time going to the learning lab to earn extra credit and attend review sessions.
Love her style of teaching for this class! Notes were not overwhelming and gave us a chance to state our opinions in a supportive environment. I learned SO MUCH in this class.
Dr Yocom was VERY easy to talk to and cares about her students so much! One of the most organized classes I have every taken.
Was a super unhelpful professor. I have academic accommodations that she completely ignored. Her I dont feel that she prepped her students for exams very well.

I don't understand what I'm supposed to know. This is the worst class I've ever taken in my undergrad experience thus far. I've got a 3.9 GPA and I worry about even being able to get a 50% on exams. Study guides are so poorly made, myself and the other students shake with fear before taking the exams. Ive never felt so discouraged as a student.

I'm taking another class with dr. Yocom this semester recuse of how much I like her. She's very organized and on top of things. Her timing is honestly insane. She's super understanding and super friendly.

Dr. Yocom is a nice person but awful as a lecturer. Her exams do not align with then lecture/homework. She grades tough on exams too. The course is homework heavy. She will make you feel defeated as a student. There are tons of opportunities for extra credit and I would take complete advantage of that.

Dr. Yocom was great! She offered A TON of extra credit, and has many assignments dropped from your final grade to ensure one bad assignment doesn't screw you over. There are 4 exams that aren't super difficult, weekly problem sets, and homework assignments. She's always willing to help and I thought she was very fair. Highly recommend!
There's a lot of reading in the text book and the homework takes a while sometimes. There's not much work outside of this besides in class activities and a group project.

Professor Yocom can be hit or miss - she offers a lot of extra credit, but lectures and readings don't always align with exams. Use resources like unstuck AI to supplement and stay on top of the material.

The tests in this class were nothing like the material she teaches during lecture.  She focuses heavily on calculations during class, but then on tests we do no calculations and it's all conceptual topics.  When asking her for help she basically tells the class to try harder and go to the learning lab, which isn't helpful either.

I am writing this after the release of our second exam score. Our class average was a 50% and it feels like she is gaslighting us into thinking it is our faults for failing. I understand we need to study outside of class, but there is nothing to study, she provides us with little material to study on the exams. I don't recommend Anna Yocom.

Since this was an online class I never met Dr. Yocom. About the class, however, is that it's not "difficult." The textbook is just very dry and long when all it needs to do is describe formulas. It is difficult to filter out what is necessary for homework and tests. Overall, it is a dull statistics course and you will need to put in the work.

Great professor! Loved her. For this class, don't waste too much time on the textbook readings or questions. She only tests on class context which is way less in depth than the textbook. The classes were engaging and she has you discuss interesting questions with people around you. Overall a great class. Answers questions.

Dr. Yocom is kind and caring - she explains the material thoroughly. The textbook can be hard to follow and the homework assignments provided don't directly translate to exams (calculation homework vs concept exams) do all the extra credit she offers and you'll be fine (I got C's on 3 of the exams but ended up with an A-).

The notes were not able to be access until after class, so during class your on your own. Had a lot of responses like, "You'd have to check the textbook to understand" to questions. Attendance mandatory because she would randomly give extra credit for being in class. Exams material were different from lecture material. So hard I had to drop it.

She has a random in-class assignments making the attendance mandatory since its worth points. Chapter assignments are over 2 hours long not including the reading you have to do to prepare for exams. She's not thorough when you come to her with questions or need help with improving your grade. Very difficult and tough grader.

Dr. Yocom is amazing!! she made data analysis so easy. Her lectures were interesting and helpful. Work load was manageable and all helped my understanding of the content. Lots of extra credit opportunities! We were allowed to have a doubled-sided note page for every exam (including the final). The book was also helpful. Take Dr. Yocom if you can!!

She was a nice professor and explained things well, but the homeworks were nothing like the exams. Our weekly homework and our weekly in-class assignments were mostly math problems, and her exams were strictly application-based, not math. Lots of extra credit opportunities, but her exams were heavy, worth nearly 60-70% of your final grade.

Anna is one of my favorite professors I have ever had! You do not have to be good at math at all to succeed in this class. She is funny and really cares about the topic and her students. She offered sooo much extra credit, and a cheat sheet on every exam! Lectures were only mandatory like once a week. Can not recommend her enough!

Course had a lot of opportunities for extra credit. I'm not a huge fan of stats, but she was always excited and had a very positive energy about her. Loved answering questions and helping her students.

Dr. Yocom was the worst professor I have had yet. You have to do a lot of reading which I was fine with but sometimes the readings wouldn't be clear. When you ask her about it in class she doesn't do a good job clarifying, and talks in circles a lot. She also wants us to rely on our peers to help teach instead of teaching herself. 0/10

If you dont like to read dont even consider taking this class. If you dont read youll have no idea whats going on. She expects you to learn from the reading and then she elaborates in class yet doesnt teach. I asked her what something meant and she said "Yea, I dont do definitions i just do explanations if you want a definition read the book" 0/10

Dr. Yocom has great lectures that included slides, videos, charts, and examples. She allows a front&back page of notes on exams, uses TopHat for feedback & getting-to-know-you questions, gives 3 1-pagers throughout the sem, 3 extra credit assignments, is available after class, will meet to discuss exam grades, & encourages discussion in class.

Dr. Yocom is a wonderful instructor who always makes your contributions feel valued. The course is mostly discussion based, which helps keep your attention. I'll admit, the textbook homework was unnecessarily tedious, but you get used to it. Because it covers the whole lifespan, be prepared to take a lot of information in...a lot...

Yocom was a great teacher!  I did not like the fact that most classes were mostly a discussion rather than a lecture.  It was more of students' opinions rather than the lectures.  The tests were okay but the questions came from the book rather than the lecture.  Attendance was not mandatory but would have in-class activities randomly.

Too many reading assignments that require us to complete a maximum of more than 200 questions. Credits are not given for correctness, but still painful and time-consuming. Especially when two readings are due in one week! The exam allows one page of notes. But questions could be a lot and very detailed. Not an easy A to get even compared to 3513.

Reading homework is excessive. Each chapter requires us to anwser over 75 concept questions, which takes a long time to complete. This has affected my focus on other classes and as a result, have become more stressed. Being successful in this course requires completing reading assignments, being an active notetaker, and studying hard for exams.

She's pleasant and cares about her students. Has a quiz every week on the long readings, and these affect your grade. Don't skip. Allows one OOPS pass that allows you to drop your lowest grade. Beyond this, she's inflexible; no extra credit with her. Doesn't upload class slides online. TAKE NOTES! Allows one page of notes (double-sided) for exams.

Amazing class and Dr. Yocum is extremely passionate about the content. She doesn't always cover every point during lecture so there are LONG interactive readings for homework. Attendance is really only mandatory on the days when in activities due in class. 

I certainly felt lost after the one class I missed. She allows 1 pg notes for the exams.

Dr. Yocom has great lectures that include a variety of material like slides, videos, charts, and examples that we look at in class. She allows a front&back page of notes on exams, uses TopHat for reading questions, and had 3 1-page papers throughout the semester. She's available after class for questions and encourages discussion in class.

She is not a great lecturer in my opinion, but I think it was worse for me because this class is only two days a week which makes the classes longer. I get very bored in her lectures, she use the same phrases over and over, and I don't love the way that she responds to some people when they offer their point of view (acts uninterested).

Took this as a summer course and it was well worth it. She offered so much extra credit and it was for easy stuff too. The textbook made things confusing but her lectures were always short and very helpful. You don't have to do any actual math on the exams, just on the homework. She always encourages people to reach out with questions.

The class was fine. It was not particularly interesting to me. I got a low grade because I put very little effort in but it was definitely not a hard class. There was also a lot of extra credit offered. It was not a bad class I just don't like statistics and I wasn't engaged in it .

Dr. Yocom is a good professor, but I don't think I would take another one of her classes because quite honestly she is annoying. She definitely knows what she is talking about but makes things a lot more complicated than they should be. Go to the learning lab and get extra credit and don't forget to go on attendance days.

The class itself wasn't my favorite, and I would have preferred to use a textbook to PyscLearn, but that's simply because of how math-y it is. Dr. Yocom is very understanding and approachable and gives lots of opportunities for extra credit! Overall, her teaching style was easy to understand and wasn't overwhelming, would definitely recommend her!

Dr. Yocom sincerely cares about her students a lot and is very accessible outside of class. If you took AP Statistics in high school you'll do great. Attendance is required on chapter practice days. She offers a TON of extra credit opportunities- and no calculation problems on exams. Take this class with her!

I thought this would be an easy class as I've taken child psych. Wrong. So much textbook reading. Started class online but randomly took away that option. NEED TO GO TO CLASS. Exams are a thumbs down. Not nearly enough time & too specific. Don't think I learned anything. 100% regret taking this class.

I had Dr. Yocom for PSYCH 1100H last semester, and although I had never studied psych ever before, she made it so much easier for me to understand. In my experience, I found that the lecture notes were the most essential thing even though I still used the textbook. She also really cares about all her students. Definitely recommend!!!

A great professor for this class. You only need to show up when you do the chapter practices and there are a lot of opportunities to get your grade up. If you can take this class with her I would recommend it.
LOVED this class! Prof Yocom made me want to attend class -- she made things interesting and kept us involved.
Dr. Yocom made this class much better than I expected! Go to class and ask questions when they come up!

If you come to class and listen you will be fine. Tests are completely fair. She seemed to be that professor that wanted to be more reasonable Bc she knows we have other classes and that made me appreciative.

Yocom is a great prof! She's really sweet and helpful, and seems like she genuinely cares about all of her students. As long as you're willing to put forth the effort to get help from her or her TAs when you need it, this class should be very easy for you. otherwise, you'd better hope you did really well in stats in high school.
Dr. Yocom rocks! I was super scared of this class and she made it very easy to follow along and learn the material. Make sure you read the book and do the practice!

I didnt really enjoy this class at all, I was constantly confused and felt that Yocom was confusing. Difficult material and was hard for me to comprehend especially since math is my weakest subject. We were also bombarded with work, there was always SOMETHING for us to do and it was hard for me to manage in my situation.
Online videos were great. Even examples worked out on the screen!

Dr. Yocom is a solid choice for this course. She gives students all the material they need to pass. you are only required to attend lecture on "practice" or "exam" review days. I only attended the required days and passed with an A. Show up to review days and pay attention, know whats on her study guide, and use the book (gold) to clarify concepts

I loved Dr. Yocom! She goes over everything that will be on the tests, so reading the textbook is not necessary unless you didnt go to class. As long as you study your notes and memorize terms, the tests are not hard. There are 2 projects, a presentation/paper and research, that you complete in groups. If you put the effort in, you get an A.

Dr. Yocom made Data Analysis not terrible, however you have to put in a lot of work. Her multiple choice on the exams are far more difficult than the extended response. Go to class and do the homework problems! Her slides are very clear and help you understand better if youre confused. She can overcomplicate ideas!
The material itself is not difficult, but she made simple ideas too complicated in exams, and the homework is really difficult. She doesn't round up or curve. I got 89.9% this semester.
Yocom was amazing! I was surprised by how clear this material was -- the exams are pretty easy if you come to class and follow along. Would definitely take her for another class!
Anna Yocom is absolutely amazing. She makes new info easy to understand because of the amount of examples and practice you do in class. She also gives plenty of opportunities for extra credit.

Was thinking I was going to do average in this class, I have gotten A's in all of my logical math classes (algebra, pre-calc) BUT this class.... there's about 30 kids in my class FAILING. She makes things too complicated and grades harshly on the homework.
I actually enjoyed the class. Yocom makes the material pretty straightforward -- come to class and it is easy to prepare for the homework and exams! She is super nice and easy to talk to.
Dr. Yocom was awesome! She made what I thought was going to be an impossible class easy to understand. If you put in the time, you can get a good grade. Do the extra credit too!

This class is fairly easy. If you do the review sheets she gives for each chapter, the midterms should be cake. I only went to class on the mandatory attendance days, other days the material was easy enough to learn from the textbook. She also offers up to 9 points of extra credit.

If you have ever taken a stats class, you'll probably think this class is really simple. However, Yocom overcomplicates ideas, uses weird formulas/data sheets, and her exams are ridiculously irrelevant to anything talked about in class. Despite having a good grip on class material, overall exam grades sucked and she doesn't curve or round up.
A good professor, but her grading can be very unreasonable. There aren't that many grades in the class either. The class is very interesting, but not an easy A by any means.

Dr. yocom's lectures were really engaging and the 55 minute classes flew by. She has a very active classroom environment and encourages students to work together before explaining problems. Content is not too difficult, helps to have taken research methods first if possible tho. Don't be afraid to ask questions, lectures can move pretty quickly.

There was no homework in this class other than suggested readings, but she went over everything you need in class so it really is suggested. I did well, but you need to study the notes because there are no practice problems to use for exam prep. Lectures were very clear and Dr. Yocom is very nice and energetic in class.
Not great at explaining class content. Over complicates simple statistic techniques. Does not answer questions when you ask. Calls out students in class
She's an excellent teacher but the class material and speed was difficult.

It wasn't as easy as I thought it would be, and there's a LOT of textbook reading. There were also quizzes, exams, a 3-part project, and 1-page responses, so a lot of grades but a lot of work. I felt that the exams were oddly specific over so much content. Overall, though, it wasn't too bad and the class was small and collaborative.

Dr. Yocom's exams are very difficult since they are all application based, and, other than the group discussions in class, there is no way to practice for them. She also will grade any papers extremely tough. The only points of the class were from exams and group projects too. I recommend taking this class with another professor if possible.

Dr. Yocom's class definitely took a little time at the beginning, but was not hard at all. I had never taken a stats class before this, but her grading criteria, recommended textbook readings, and extra credit (no other profs for 2220 do this) really helped me do well. She is knowledgeable and wants her students to do well!!
Every morning she comes in and goes "good morning how we doing?" and its the cutest thing. she's super helpful and positively reinforces questions.

Rated the course a 4 on difficulty b/c she makes you work for it. If you DO the work she assigns and STUDY (practice + do the odd problems in the book), an A is very attainable. Easy to lose points, so practice a lot. The guy who got a B+ and is complaining shouldn't have been skipping class. Prof gives lots of useful info in lecture. GO TO CLASS.
Wasn't expecting to enjoy this class. Dr. Yocom made the material easy to understand. Go to class and complete the extra credit!

She is very good at teaching her class and makes concepts clear and concise. Lecture is mandatory and for participation about 1 in every 3 lectures for practice days and there is a weekly homework, but overall these two things put together make it very easy to learn. She also offers a lot of extra credit opportunities

Very enthusiastic. Made one of my least favorite topics relatively enjoyable. Attendance is graded approx. once a week, the same day homework is due. These review/practice days are extremely beneficial. Tests are relatively straightforward. Disclaimer: Homework often uses previous answers, no later points are granted if you miss the first one.

Was nervous for this class, but Dr. Yocom made the material really clear. Do your homework, and ask for help if you need it. Lots of extra credit points too! Looking for other classes to take with this prof.

Very nice, has all sorts of ways to get points such as tophat questions & group project. Tests are difficult, have to know the theories inside and out. Lots of opportunities for points, very helpful. would recommend taking her class agaim
Dr. Yocom is awesome. She is very easy to talk to and made class interesting! Already looking for another class to take with her!

Yocom was probably one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. She makes herself very available if you need her outside of class and loves answering questions. She also taught the material very well and really helped me understand stats. Has homework every week and gives lots of extra credit. Easy exams if you understand the material

There was one group project (research paper) (optional to work alone), around 13 discussion post (2 lowest dropped) and 2 exams (3 including final). Grading was very clear. Lectures were clear and engaging. An awesome teacher. I only got a C+, but I definitely slacked in a major way. Therefore, a 2 difficulty rating. And easy A.

Dr. Yocum's courses are easy enough to get a good grade in if you show up and do the work. She loves participation and group work, so be prepared to talk to other people in class and do projects together. Attendance isn't taken, but if you miss a lecture you miss a ton of information. She makes class as interesting as she can and is a great person.

Dr. Yocom is awesome. I've never met anyone who doesn't like her and am genuinely surprised to see some lower ratings on here. I've actually taken a few classes with her and will probably take more if I can. She's so easy to talk to and very accessible outside of class. If you go to class, do the extra credit and homework, you'll land an A.

Dr. Yocom is a try hard. Takes her class very seriously, requires a lot of participation and talking with peers, many discussions (that do not help), and grades papers too ambiguously. She does not budge on grades given (even if you are astute in your argument). I've had her many times... same in every class.

She is by far my favorite prof. at OSU. She's really caring about her students and will take time out of her day to accomodate your schedule. The class moves kinda slow but you can really get a grasp on the subject that way. She is very thurough and the exam aren't too terribly hard. Make sure you do study and do a lot of practice problems.

Dr. Yocom was great! She gave a lot of extra credit options and her lectures were clear and easy to follow. Tests were not any harder than homework. She also made herself available a lot to help and was super nice. Definitely take her if you can!

Dr. Yocom is a great teacher! She is super clear on what she expects, and makes the class easy to do well in. She offers so much extra credit that even if you mess up, you should still do fine in the class. Shes awesome!
Amazing Professor! Definitely take a class from her!

Attendance isn't mandatory, but it really helps to show up to class and fill in the guided reading outline that she gives you. She also has random attendance days once a week that counts for participation.

Ended with over 100% in the class. Lectures go through exactly what you need to know, and what steps to take. Gives formula sheets on exams. Homework is easy if you go to lecture, and offers a ton of extra credit on it at the end. Exams are just like practice worksheets for class. Makes the material and her exams very clear. Highly recommend.

Dr. Yocom is awesome. She made a difficult course very doable. I learned a TON and I didn't hate the class (I was fully expecting to hate it because I'm not big on math). She is funny, teaches well and she is very knowledgable. DO THE EXTRA CREDIT and the resubmissions, it will save you! I'd take again and I'd recommend to any psych major!

Was not looking forward to this class, but Prof Yocom actually made it enjoyable.  Go to class and keep up with the homework and you can easily pass.  Also Prof Yocom is very easy to talk to - go to her early if you need extra help!  Great prof and good class.

What should be a simple statistics course is ruined. Lectures are pointless, only go for attendance days. Reading through book explanations are what I used to learn, awful lecture slides. She's annoying. Tons of homework and extra credit offered but take FOREVER, you will hate your life while doing it. Only upside is tests were easy.

Lectures aren't mandatory, but it's convenient to fill your guided notes in during class instead of on your own. Also, if you do attend class to get your notes, the book isn't really that useful unless you run out of time in class or sometimes for extra credit purposes. She's very upbeat and a good professor overall.

She makes stats very easy to understand. She makes sure the class is actively engaged in the material, and is very good at breaking down the lecture materials as well. Her tests are pretty easy, as long as you actively do the homework you'll be fine. Really have nothing bad to say about this class, Yocom is awesome and makes stats pretty easy.

Don't need the book unless you want the end of chapter extra credit, so don't waste the money on it. Lots of extra credit opportunities are given in addition to the end of chapter ones as well. If you go to lecture and actually pay attention/participate, you should get an A for sure.

Dr. Yocom was super nice and the class was relatively easy if you paid attention and did the homework. She gives plenty of extra credit opportunities and is eager to help. The tests are exactly what she tells you to expect.

Prof. Yocom is really good at explaining statistical terms in a way students can easily understand. She genuinely enjoys teaching the material and makes jokes throughout the lecture to keep people interested and at ease when some of the material seems difficult.

Anna's class is set up that if you come to class and do all of the homework you will at least pass. She does give lots of extra credit opportunities so take advantage. The homework and tests are tough but not impossible if you study and attend class. The more you do above and beyond what is expected in class the better your grade will be!
This class was just horrible. The worst class I've taken. This class was very difficult and there was so much material to be covered.

Great teacher! The material is not the easiest but she explains it clearly. There is a lot of opportunities to receive extra credit, too. The class requires a little bit of time and work but Dr. Yocom makes it very manageable.

I was worried about this class because I'm terrible at math, but she makes the material easy to understand. Participation required on certain days. There is homework every week, but its not a bunch and you can earn credit on problems you missed. There are multiple opportunities for extra credit.

I had professor Yocom for 2220.  Since a lot of psych majors aren't in it because they love math, it's a hard course for some.  She made everything crystal clear, though, and has a very good lecture, practice, and group work routine. It's a tough course, but I really liked her.

I was really nervous for this class because I'm very bad at math, but Dr. Yocom made this class great! Her lectures are very good, and she gives plenty of practice opportunities. If you don't understand something, READ THE BOOK, reach out to her, TA's, or the peer tutors. She offers extra credit and the chance to correct homework. She's amazing!

I am so thankful for Dr. Yocom. I was worried about this class because I struggle with math, but with her it was alright. You NEED to attend lectures to understand things. Only get the book if you want to do extra credit-otherwise it wasn't needed. She also offers extra credit on days you go over the exams so go to class!

Great teacher! Funny and tries to make class better. There is homework but its super easy and you have a week to do it. Easy tests. Can get extra credit points. Would only recommend getting the book if you are going to do the extra credit. If not, no need for it. Takes attendance on review days.
Great professor! So helpful for this tough class!! Actually cares about her students! Take her for this class, so good I promise!
She is a nice lady. There are tons of homework, but 2 get dropped. No cumulative final. Gives random participation codes. If no one shows up to class she gives out extra, extra credit.
Actually made the material interesting and I learned so much!!  SO many chances for extra credit!

One of those professors that makes a subject more challenging than it should be. Homework is graded on correctness, not completion, and an online form is filled, while your work has to be translated into Microsoft Word and uploaded to receive credit. Extremely tedious, and she isn't helpful either. Tests are worded poorly as well.
This professor is great! The class she teaches is difficult. However, if you show effort you will pass. She will allow you to call her cell phone, and is eager to help! I would take her again!!!

She's kind of really annoying in lecture. Pretty boring and always walks around to make sure you're on task. Going to class matters because she takes attendance for credit. However I didn't learn anything from her. The book is what I used to study.
Awesome teacher. Gives you plenty of opportunities to improve grade and miss quizzes and homework. She drops a lot of grades. Really easy to learn from.

Amazing professor!  Tests and homework can be tough, but she is willing to help over email or in person.  Don't be afraid to ask for help!  There are lots of assignments, but it is all very organized.  One of my FAVE profs!

If this is your first time taking a class like this, i suggest taking it with another professor. There are homework assignments every week and if you dont understand the material you're screwed. Takes off alot of points for short answer exam questions. Extra credit only counts for 3pts (requires a ton of work) & she doesn't round your final grade.

Professor Yocom was a good professor. She put the slides online before class so you can print them out and bring them.  There are several opportunities for extra credit.  Grade consists of homework, online quizzes, 2 midterms, 1 final, and attendance. Go to class, do the homework, study, and you'll do fine.  Very willing to answer questions.

Dr. Yocom is a good professor. She is engaging and truly wants to see her student succeed. Expect weekly homework, one attendance day each week, and a decent amount of extra credit. You will need to put in the effort, but overall, it is not a difficult class. Anyone who did not get the grade they had hoped for, simply didn't put in enough effort.

Dr. Yocom is a very tough grader. She looks for very specific information and I find myself questioning all my answers. She doesn't seem particularly interested in teaching, often having to make corrections to papershomework answers she has typed up to present to the class. I would recommend finding a different teacher for this class if possible.

Anna is tough, I'm not gonna lie. But I also didn't put in as much effort as I should have. I missed a few homework assignments and participation points. If I would have gone to lecture more often, I would have easily gotten a B or higher (and I'm bad at math). Buy the textbook or make friends with someone who has it. You need it.

Dr. Yocom's test are pretty fair and the homework is 30% of your grade. So as long as you study, do the homework, and show up on Fridays (attendance counts on review days) you should get at least a B no problem. I should note some homeworks have problems from the textbook on them, but you can use the books they have at the learning lab.

homework due every week  and an online quiz or two due every few weeks. I would recommend REALLY putting thought into your homework because a lot of your grade comes from there. GO TO LEARNING LAB FOR EXTRA CREDIT. On exams, start with the computations so you don't run out of time. Multiple choice can be tricky- it sucks but read the book to help.

All you have to do to pass this class is the homework and do well on the tests (that's just to pass).  If you want to excel in this course you need to show up everyday and study a bit.  It's an easy class to take and if you don't show up (despite the fact that it's mandatory) then your final grade will only decrease 4 points.

Dr. Yocom is a great prof. The class set up allows you to succeed. HW was 36% of the grade so it is worth taking the time to do it well and you get to drop 2. Practice in class each week is really helpful and you get attendance credit so go to class on these days. She's a little peppy for my taste but helpful.

I knew things because of past stat classes. You have to go to lecture though because it can get confusing. Don't like turning in homework online. Needs more examples and better powerpoint! Attendance is taken at random times, so may the odds be ever in your favor. Also you will have to buy the textbook for maybe 3 homework questions all semester

If you attend class you should be fine. Her tests aren't super straight forward, but they're not impossible. Takes attendance once a week, and you'll have weekly hw and quizzes, but has a reasonable amount of extra credit available.

If you're able to attend every lecture,  course is easy to follow. If you don't intend to be there every day, you probably don't want to take this class.  "Study guides" are literally chapter titles and section titles straight from the book, and she only posts partial notes online. I spent hours reading. Participation assignments once a week.
I appreciated how approachable she was, which made a tough subject easier to relate to.

She was very clear in her explanations, but had a lot of material to cover. With that, going to the TA with questions was very helpful as well as getting practice examples at recitation. I would definitely attend class because any statistics is hard if you don't see the examples worked out.

Oh, Dr. Yocom. While I did get an A in this class, I'm pretty sure it was due to the AP Stats I took in high school. Anyone in her class can tell you that her test questions are often very poorly worded, and any attempt to question her will leave you with a sarcastic, condescending response. If possible, try to find another professor.

She contradicted herself constantly and the class wasn't clear on right answers at all. The homework is very confusing and she loves to grade you hard on things that could have gone either way as the answer. Wouldn't recommend her at a all. You will need the book because she doesn't teach herself but outlines what the book says.

She is terrible at teaching Data Analysis (stats). Frequently disengages the class by reading from the book. Only engages when a higher up is in the class evaluating. Every point counts with her terrible grading scale for a math based class. Babies the class with comments an elementary school teacher would use yet unable to actually teach us.

While she is helpful, I just can't get over how the relation from her tests and homework don't matchup. The questions she makes are open ended and difficult to find answers too. I felt like everyday someone was challenging her on wording of questions. She is helpful, but more trouble to take any of her classes than they are worth.
The best professor ever that you can get for a statistics class. She gives couple extra credits assignments and also curve the class! Homeworks assigned are super helpful! Love her!
She's super sweet, answers any questions, and the class is mind-blowingly easy. If you go to class and pay attention somewhat, you'll get an A. Very minimal work outside of class.

Dr. Yocom is a great professor who keeps the class interesting with fun and interactive activites that allow psychology to be related to your own life. Tests are difficult, as they reflect concepts and your understandings of those concepts.

This class was SO EASY. The only thing that is frustrating is that it seems many students were not prepared with the pre reqs for the class, I felt I was ahead of the game with my AP Stats course in high school. Exams are very fair and you get to make a formula sheet to use. Show up to class, take notes and you should get an A.
Incredibly boring and there is very little class involvement. Class wasn't a hard topic but how she taught made people often zone out. She also dinks a lot of silly points off writing assignments.

Dr. Yocom was great!  Sweet and kind, and the class wasn't hard.  Lots of annoying group activities in class but I mostly just did them alone and she didn't seem to care.  Considering it's a research methods class it wasn't all that boring.  Would take from her again.  Got an A.
She's a good instructor for Primate Cognition. Knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. As long as you read the textbook, go to class, and do the discussion posts, you'll be fine.

She is very nice and interests in material. Homework and quizzes make a up huge part of the grade. Unfortunately, these assignments are completed online so you cannot ask for clarity on her extremely poorly worded, open ended, and arguably incorrectly constructed questions.

Very difficult. Not interesting material. You often lose major points for minor mistakes. It's a math class, not a psych class. She is unhelpful and does not make the material interesting in any way. Unfortunate that this class is required for the major.

Dr. Yocom is an excellent professor! She is engaging, well prepared for class, and a genuinely caring and skilled teacher. She is fair, but that also means you can't slack off. You have to do the work, study, and attend class.  You will have to apply what you?ve learned in class on the exams.  She makes it easy to learn though.  Just pay attention.

She is a really nice teacher and is genuinely interested in helping the class. The problem is that her exams are really difficult. She doesn't use the homework/review questions as a guide to her exams "Why would I test you on something you already know?". I studied hard, went to review sessions, and did my homework and still did poorly on exams.
Really nice teacher. Makes sure you understand material. The material is tough important to attend class. She will offer extra credit, and curves when needed
She's a great professor. She really knows what she's talking about and answers emails quickly.
Wish I never took this class with this professor. Not a good experience.
Clear and nice. Just go to class and you'll be fine. make sure to review notes. exams are hard because it takes the info and puts if in situations. If you study and go to class, not bad at all.
Really nice teacher. Wants to help and teach. Lectures are really long. Do need to study for tests and quizzes. Overall, good class. Hard to stay focused and memorize everything.

you are not required to attend classes, but I highly recommend you to cause it's so interesting! she tries her best to make it fun and clear. I love the videos in class. the textbook is really funny too.  Her materials were wellllll organized and easy , just memorizing a lil bit. My favorite class. Exams are easy too.

She is so sweet. She tries really hard to make class fun and is always willing to hear what you think. I only went to class on test days and still got an A. It's the easiest class I will ever take at college and the material is actually interesting.
made the class interesting

Anna was an awesome professor! She knew how to make class interesting and was very enthusiastic about hte material.  Studying is important for both quizes and exams, but if you do the work it is not hard to get an A.

Anna was such a cool professor. Every class had guided notes that followed a powerpoint. The guided notes could either be done in class, or followed the book pretty consistently too. She showed a lot of interesting visuals and stories that made the learning more applicable to life.
Great professor. Class was interesting and easy. You will have to study a little but its not hard at all.

Anna is extremely enthusiastic, which was off-putting at first, but I came to appreciate it because it helps keep the material interesting. She's very helpful and wants her students to succeed. She is funny and very knowledgeable. The book is unnecessary, the guided notes on Carmen are exactly what you need to study. I Highly reccommend her class.
Awesome teacher, really enthusiastic, loves what she is teaching. Guided notes make lectures and studying really easy.
No Comments
No Comments

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Life Span Developmental Psychology

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Life Span Developmental Psychology

summary_comment: Dr. Phenis is a knowledgeable and passionate professor who emphasizes student learning over grades, offering flexible deadlines, open-note exams, and extra credit opportunities. However, his lectures are often described as convoluted and dense, making it challenging for students to grasp concepts during class. While some students find his group projects and assessments stressful and unhelpful, others appreciate his supportive approach and willingness to help through office hours.

Ratings.comment: Nothing is worth the group project he has you do in this class. It didn't teach me anything, and it was extremely time-consuming and frustrating. He clearly loves the subject, but I found the lectures to be convoluted. He is a good guy, but don't take Research Methods with him.

Horrible group project. Didn't end up learning anything useful due to all of the stress trying to understand the impossibility complex group project directions. His lectures are incredibly dry and uninteresting. Please never take anything with this prof.

Dr. Phenis is a knowledgable professor who is very passionate about psychology. He prioritizes students    learning the content rather than the grade given. All quizzes and exams were open-note and take-home. Overall I would recommend everyone try to get him as a professor.

Dr. Phenis is a knowledgeable professor. He records all of his lectures and makes them available to access outside of class. He does not have exams throughout the semester besides the cumulative final. There is a group project. There are weekly quizzes. He does random TopHats for extra credit as well.

Dr. Phenis is a very knowledgeable professor. He records all of his lectures and makes them available to access outside of class. He does not have exams throughout the semester besides the cumulative final. There are some assessments on the material that can be difficult. There are weekly quizzes. He does random TopHats for extra credit as well.

Dr. Phenis is clearly very passionate about research and that's amazing in a prof. but he talks himself into circles and the lectures are so dense you lose focus immediately w/ how much you get talked at. His slides make sense and meeting with him 1on1 clears up a lot of questions, but he makes simple concepts difficult to grasp in class.

I'm not sure why Dr.Phenis' ratings are so low, he was an amazing professor. He had flexible deadlines or all assignments, open note exams (including the final), extra credit, and test corrections, and was very nice. An A is 100% possible if you use all available resources. I would 100% take another class with him in the future.

I wouldn't say that Dr. Phenis is a bad lecturer. The topic of neuroscience isn't meant to be easy. Although attendance isn't mandatory, I suggest you go. He can give a lot of good tips and hints for the assessments. Yes, the grading for them are harsh but there is a reason you get remediations for them. Remediations are grade boosters! Do them!

I really enjoyed the structure of this class. People complain about the assignments he gives, but I feel like they were really beneficial because he allows remediations which encourages students to review old material. There are also many opportunities for extra credit.

The class was really lecture heavy, but the material was interesting and he gave about a million different chances for extra credit. Even though the assignments he gave were difficult, I feel that they were beneficial because the remediations he offered encouraged students to review past material.

This a very content heavy class, and although the material is hard, you can definitely still end with a good grade if you put the work in. Rewatching each lecture helped me do good on the quizzes and assessments, and there are opportunities to fix your mistakes for a better grade on these assignments as well.

Phenis is NOT a good lecturer, NOT an easy grader, and NOT a professor to learn from. If you believe that this class will be a wonderful commencement to your neuroscience major, you will be deeply disappointed. The only reason I get an A is by using materials from other sections and studying for my other neuroscience class. Take Dr. Coutellier.

Lectures are extremely boring and exhausting with a huge amount of unnecessarily complicated content. He tries to hide important information for tests from the slides and makes questions as convoluted as possible. His free-response questions are graded all-or-nothing, and remediations are graded harshly. This class makes me hate neuroscience.

He is the worst professor I've ever taken a class with. He's a boring and bad lecturer, he allows to redo things but you have to get 100% on the remediation and do a bunch of work with it which takes hours. 0/10 recommend him. There's much better professors or classes in general (if this isn't a specific requirement for you). Save yourself
Lectures can be dry, but Dr. Phenis is approachable. Tough group projects require diligent partners. Quizzes are tricky, but he's flexible on late work. Unstuck study helps streamline study prep.

Dr. Phenis is a fantastic teacher. Even if you miss deadlines or receive a poor grade, he always offers extensions, penalty removals, and remediations to improve your score. He's not always available, but during work hours, you're guaranteed a comprehensive response quickly. Deadlines and instructions on assignments are very clear and regulated.

Dr. Phenis was able to answer any questions I had quickly. People noted that he is boring, but the material he has to work with is so dry. He does have a lot of guidelines and deadlines that can get confusing. Don't have flaky partners; the group project is a big part of the grade. There are many ways to succeed if you work hard and seek it out.
A research methods class truly about neuroscience. Overly complex group assignments that go way out in the weeds. Confusing instructions and generally boring to listen to. Would not recommend
Do NOT waste your time with him he is so boring and the group projects are probably the worst thing ever. You will inevitably be confused the entire time and not end up learning a single thing

Very difficult to keep up with his lectures and often times his test/quiz questions arent even found on the slides he provides. You'd have to rewatch all of his zoom recordings to understand topics because you cant really study off of his slides.

Content is difficult and his lectures can be a bit hard to understand but if you pay attention and take advantage of remediations it's completely doable to get an A, I found it very helpful to make my own notes and to ask him any questions after class.

Dr. Phenis was a great professor, lectures were informative and you could tell he cared about teaching the material. Class itself was not too difficult at all, one cumulative final, sort of bi-weekly quizzes and assessment assignments (less points, weighted heavier). If you pay attention in lecture you will have no problem! Offers remediations too

Dr. Phenis is a nice professor. Although his lecture is boring and quizzes are difficult to understand. But he has a nice late hw policy and if you did something wrong, he will give you an opportunity to fix that if you have a reasonable reason.
Very boring lectures and tough quizzes that make up the majority of the grade. Mainly group projects that are so in-depth and confusing for an intro-level class.
Good luck

Phenis himself is a nice guy but his lectures are boring and a big part of your grade is group projects. I had a good group, but I know many and who suffered. He does have a good policy for late work and extra credit so that's a benefit. He's not the toughest grader but some of the assignments seemed very far out of the scope of the course.

I personally just hated his exam/quiz policies. The quizzes and exams are worth 60% of your grade, so if you mess up on one, congrats you just dropped a whole two letter grade. You can do "quiz remediations" BUT the process is so long and tedious, you can't even earn your full score back, AND you may not even be guaranteed the points back.

Not sure why there are so many 1 star reviews. He was amazing. All lectures are recorded (what he says is important). Multiple extra credit opportunities. AND the ability to redo all quizzes and assignments for full credit. The final was only worth 9%. From what I've heard about other 3313 professors Phenis is by far the best.

Group projects are irritating but fair. Lectures are recorded which is helpful. All assignments have one week grace period. Hes very nice and easy to talk to but sometimes is almost too smart to properly explain things. The class overall is easy and hes very fair added a curve to the final and lots of extra credit available just start early!

Overall I think he was a great prof. The content itself gets pretty difficult, but Phenis is extremely helpful if you ask him. If you take the time to get a good understanding of the content it isn't difficult to get an A in the class. You can remediate everything up to 100% so your grade really relies on the effort you put into the class.

I don't get all the hate, if you do all the extra credit and actually pay attention in class then this will be a breeze. Also this class is extremely group heavy so if you are having problems with your group members in the beginning you MUST let him know. Overall not the worst class but I am so excited to be done.
The lectures were boring and difficult to understand, with lots of overexplaining/lost in thought. Tough grader and just unenjoyable class and classwork.

Feel like a very strong foundation in bio is needed before taking this course. If not, you may seriously struggle in this course. The assessments were difficult, despite studying well in advance for them; graded harshly and won't tell you were you were incorrect. Heard other neuroscience professors are a bit easier, suggest taking it with them!

He's a pretty good teacher, but his lectures can be quite long and sometimes boring. His quizzes aren't terrible but his assessment assignments are pretty hard and he grades those harshly. Very few extra credit opportunities.

Overexplains during lecture and is difficult to understand points. Group work is a majority of the class. Slides are easily accessible and lecture is optional (posts zoom), but quizzes are difficult and final is very difficult.

Currently sitting in his class wishing I wasn't here. He has explained this assignment for over 30 minutes despite the same explanation being typed out on Carmen. He overexplains everything to the point where his point is completely lost. Makes the content and projects WAY more complicated and deep than it needs to be. I tried to avoid him but alas

Dr. Phenis is extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and puts in so much effort to benefit his students, such as providing detailed feedback on many assignments, allowing us to correct mistakes, etc. The assessment assignments were challenging but help to learn. He provides everything you need to do well.

Dr. Phenis is a pretty nice guy. Had some issues with my group (group work is VERY important in this class) and he was willing to grade group projects individually. Attendance isn't mandatory but don't take that to heart, you need the lectures. There's plenty of extra credit available, I would do it weekly to help with learning the material.

Weird class setup that makes it hard not to earn a good grade. Gave an incredible amount of extra credit and allows you to remediate everything but the exams twice. Bland lecturer but he is knowledgeable about the material.
Great professor, very knowledgeable. Amazing class for all neuro majors, as it gives you so much info. Interested grading scale, that seemed to be good for most people. Overall a great prof.

phenis gets a bad rap, but he has sm fair policies to give you a good grade. attendance isn't mandatory, he records every class & posts slides, allows you to submit any assignment late (just fill out a late form), minimal hw, extra credit, etc. even if u get a bad group, he'll grade individually if u just reach out & he will help in any way. b nice

Maybe this class is better if you get a decent group. I wouldn't know, my group was awful.
Quizzes are fine if you look over slides, but the final is absolutely brutal despite a lot of studying. Appreciated that he'd let you get quiz points back through review.
Seems nice and knowledgeable, but the way the course is structured makes it so hard!

This class is mostly group work so if you participate and have a good group you will get a good grade. BUT lectures are extremely difficult to understand and the final is near impossible. You can tell he knows the topic well,but explains them in the most bland, boring and most un-understandable way that makes the class impossible to learn materials

He will do whatever he can to help you get an A. You can redo all quizzes and assignments (which are all open note anyways) and he even does quizzes with the entire class together and gives everyone full credit. All lectures are available on zoom and as long as you pay attention you should get an A.

The one thing I can recommend is do the extra credit as you go!! It helps you study for the quizzes every week and is super easy! This class is heavy on group projects and meeting with your group every week to work towards the final original research article, but you all get gradely separately so others work doesn't affect you!

For 3313 there is no group work and you can correct your quizzes up to a 100%. Dr. Phenis is very knowledgeable about the topic but his lectures are slide heavy. If you can pay attention in class he is an excellent professor. Grades are basically determined by how much work you put in since you can correct everything to a 100% besides the final.

What I liked about his class was that there was lots of opportunity for extra credit and remediations to bring up assignment/quiz grades up to 100%. He posted his lectures online and all assignments/quizzes are open book open note. However, his actual teaching method was hard to follow and not very clear.

Dr. Phenis is a great professor who really knows what he is talking about, and he is really passionate. I just found the class to be really hard for an 'entry level' class. I am not wanting to go into research in psychology, but those who are would really benefit from this class. The quizzes are easy, but the projects are a lot.

Dr. Phenis was the best professor I have had yet at OSU. Dr. Phenis does a phenomenal job bridging the basics to detailed aspects of the complex topics
discussed. He really emphasizes learning and understanding the concepts by allowing TWO makeups per assessment/reflection/quiz. Everything in this class is open book/notes. Take with a grain of salt

Prof. Phenis was a great professor for both classes I had him. Very understanding and gives thorough feedback to questions. Lots of group work, but nothing too difficult. Would take his classes again!

You can tell Prof. Phenis really knows what he talks about and that he is truly fascinated by psychology. With that being said this whole class was based on 3 big group assignments which sucks. Luckily I got a good group but if your group sucks you're screwed. There are open note quizzes and a cumulative final. Attendance mandatory on group days.

The professor is a nice guy but he talks so much that you will be confused I promise you. Also the majority of your grade will be based on these three group projects so pray you get a good group. I had a great group and we struggled together to get through each assignment.

Dr. Phenis is clearly a wicked smart man. He knows what he is talking about but the issue is he explains the content in a way which is hard to understand.Also, your entire grade of the class is dependent on group projects, so good luck if you get randomly assigned bad partners!

dr. phenis responded to emails quickly, but he is a slow grader. 3 big group assignments with weekly group meetings, weekly open note quizzes, and a final. super nice guy, just often overcomplicated the material. tons of extra credit, the material is just boring but he is not a bad professor by any means. posts lectures and slides on carmen.

While he was very knowledgeable on the topics, I found that he didn't do as well translating it to his students.  I often was left confused and he was very hard to reach via email.  He wouldn't email me back about assignments or questions often until a week later.  I would not recommend this professor unless you are already well-versed in psych.

I really liked the set-up of Dr. Phenis' lectures. The information on his slides was well-arranged and was fairly concise yet thorough. This class will definitely require you to apply yourself and make connections between material, but Phenis did a nice job at making complex concepts easier to understand and provided helpful feedback when grading.

I honestly thought I would ask Reddit and go with their opinion on this teacher (I was warned but not as much as here). If you want a high A dont take him, his class is based on GROUP WORK, if they do bad, you will receive an F! I would take someone else. Quizzes=EASY, but his classes=boring and doesn't explain well on what he wants in his projects

He wasn't a bad professor but he didn't teach in an engaging way considering how much content is covered. Over-explains a lot and you're better off just rewatching his lectures and learning at your own pace. Attendance is not required which is nice.

I hated this course. The lectures were hard to follow because it was so boring. He uses terms that he hasn't taught yet and will tell you it'll make sense later but never does. The quizzes are easy but the final exam was horrible. I recommend avoiding this course at ALL costs.

The class is informative only if you are aiming for research, otherwise it's meaningless and boring. 
The group project is a pain if you care. You will spend so long preparing something on one enjoys reading. He would say he grades each person but he doesn't bother to. If your teammate does bad job you are doomed. 
I think he hates this class.

One of the worst classes Ive ever taken. I didnt believe people when they said he was awful but they were right. The material is so easy but he is sooo boring and the final was one of the hardest finals Ive ever taken. The whole class is basically a group project too and he grades that stuff really harshly. Seriously do not take a class with him

Dr. Phenis is incredibly intelligent and engaged in the material. This class is definitely lecture heavy and it is important to watch every lecture and take really good notes. The quizzes and mastery assignments were challenging at times, but were not impossible with good notes and extra effort. He gives tons of extra credit also!

If I could go back in time, Id tell myself not to take this course with this professor. He doesnt give timely feedback. His quizzes are extremely difficult. All his in class examples can be found in the book. And he admits that his final is way harder than the rest of his content. He is okay as a lecturer but that a good professor does not make.

I do not recommend taking Phenis for psych 2300. Your entire grade is essentially group projects, and I don't know a single person who got above a 70 on his final. He gives good feedback on work, but the material is confusing and his lectures don't help.

Dr. Phenis was a decent professor and is a very intelligent guy, but this course is difficult and his 6 mastery assignments were graded somewhat harshly. There is opportunity for extra credit however. All lectures were recorded so you did not have to attend, but you definitely need to watch them because he includes important information.

I heard some bad things about this professor but was pleasantly surprised. I am not the smartest person, but I had success in this class by watching recorded lectures. He tells you exactly whats on the quizzes and offers aid outside of class.
he is really good at explaining things and helpful. i have had zooms with him and he is very caring snd wants his students to do well and learn

While Phenis knows his information and is very good at knowing this topic, he is not very good at explaining this information to his students. Very knowledgeable but sometimes it feels as though you must know his level of information to understand him. Great guy and very smart, but a bad professor. Only take again if he can learn to explain better.
Super caring and is always willing to explain concepts further inside and outside of class

The coursework is easy and basic. It is easy to understand and learn. He does mandatory group work with a randomly assigned group and it doesn't relate to the course. Feedback is not helpful and he belittles you. The "help" he gives does not relate at all and it does not make sense. Definitely recommend avoiding his course, just wait for a new prof

His class is incredibly hard, he is horrible at lecturing and treats students like they should just know better. His lectures are incredibly difficult to get through, long and wordy, but he says nothing throughout them. He grades like he is talking down on you, kind of rude commentary. I have never had a professor like this and I dont recommend.

His classes are lecture heavy and there are a lot of quizzes and group projects but he is fairly generous with extra credit and the quiz and exam content come mostly right from lectures. If you stay on top of things you should do fine in this class. If you get less than a B- in his classes it's probably your fault.

He's really passionate about his stuff & is a nice guy BUT I wouldnt take him again. His quizzes are v hard and though I had a 90 going into the final, I bombed it and ended with a B-. He also took weeks to grade our group assignments if you were in a group like #12 and on. Sucked bc we didnt get our grade till 2 days before our final proj was due.

Very bad teacher. He was so in his own world that he forgot we were intro to Neuroscience students who did not yet speak the foreign language of Neuro. Dude needed to tone it down and stop talking to us as if we had P.H.D's in the field. Really did not explain things at all to us.

Dr. Phenis is a pretty great professor. He has weekly quizzes, occasional mastery assignments, a final, and tons of extra credit (he added 5 points to the final). If you really listen to his lectures he stresses what's important and provides study guides for every mastery assignment and the final. Fair grading and consistent effort is rewarded.

Dr. Phenis was a fair professor. You have to watch the lectures and take detailed notes to do well on the weekly quizzes and biweekly mastery assignments. The textbook helps clarify and reinforce concepts. He goes pretty in-depth with the lectures, and I feel that I didn't learn much for the long term. Lots of extra credit at the end!

Dr. Phenis teaches in a way that shows you he is passionate about his class. Going into the semester, the material may seem dense. However, if you rewatch his recorded lectures, break down the material, and actively learn throughout the course, you will do well! Attend office hours, form reliable study groups, and be persistent. Keys to success!

His lectures are quite long and boring, it helped to listen to them at 2x the speed. The mastery assignments are really hard to get 100's on, as they are graded pretty harshly. The course content is pretty interesting, but it is a significant amount of work.

Phenis literally gives you everything you need to succeed in his class. He knows a lot and is passionate about the topics. He also gives study guides, which if you actually understand, you should do well on his assessments. My class was fully online and everything was open note. Overall, the class isn't hard, especially if you actually enjoy it.

Phenis is not an inherently bad person, but he is overall bad at being a higher education teacher. His teaching is so inconsistent and hard to follow, his quizzes and exams are unnecessarily difficult, and his delivery of the material is hard to follow. I've had him in two classes and his classes have been my largest obstacles in college. AVOID

Dr Phenis is a good guy and tries to make the class interesting but it just doesnt work. The lectures are extremely long and confusing. The quizzes (usually weekly, make most of your grade) are incredibly hard, no matter how much you study. The assignments are also very complicated and take time. Background knowledge before this class is a must.

Professor Phenis is a nice enough guy, but as far as classes/teaching styles go...I would recommend a different professor for this course. Quizzes were *extremely* difficult and made up the largest portion of the grade, the lectures were difficult to follow along and he always seemed frazzled if anyone had a question. Nice guy, not a great prof.

Phenis is an absolute sweetheart he gets so excited about glutamate its adorable. I had him for an online corona class, so the tests were open note. Theres a lot of material covered, but its not super hard if youre interested in it. Definitely easier to handle if you go in with an understanding of anatomy and basic psychology.

It is extremely difficult to understand what he is explaining. He stammers too much when he talks. He also often does not finish one sentence to start another sentence which makes me so confused and cannot get what he is trying to say.

First thing to know, his quizzes are unreasonable difficult. I studied vigorously for his quizzes and still get a 50% at best AND his quizzes are worth 30% of the class grade. The group assignments, which are what you work the hardest on, are barely worth any of your grade. I just feel like his grading is backwards in a sense. Wouldn't recommend

I took Phenis' class his 1st semester teaching and my first semester of undergrad. I have difficulty paying attention in class and his teaching style didn't help -- I studied by taking notes off his lecture slides. He had a fair amount of bonus opportunities that semester (not sure if he still does) and I finished the class with a 97.
Lacks empathy and respect for students. Group assignments are pointless and a waste of time. I know this is a required class for psychology majors; find a different professor.

Tests are based off lectures/slides so you will likely not receive a good grade without attending class. Some of the hardest I've had, really test your understanding. I'd recommend taking good notes or recording the lectures. Dr. Phenis grades fairly & tons of dropped+extra credit questions on tests. Great guy & professor, bad reviews are unjust.

Professor Phenis is a nice guy, and you can tell he knows his stuff. But the way he teaches was unbearable. He was super disorganized, would jump from ideas rapidly with little explanation, wasn't able to make the material understandable and even showed up late a few times.

Group projects were awful and that with quizzes made up your grade. Quizzes were 30 mins and open note, but one try. If you get a bad group then good luck, it's a lot of work to do alone and everyone gets the same grade. He changes his due dates because of the protest which was awesome, I respect him a lot for that.

I make A's in all my courses but I had to spend so much time studying, watching videos, etc in this course just to get the grade I wanted. This is a 3 credit course, but I spent at least 12 hours a week working on assignments for this course. Simplify what we need to know for exams because most of us have to take this for our audit, not by choice

He really wasn't that bad. The course was 4 weeks, which is intense, but with the right people, you can get through it. There were group projects 4 weeks which I hated because my group did not communicate. Quizzes were difficult, timed 30 mins, and questions worded hard and only one chance. He's a great person for helping students in times of need.

Often was unprepared for class. His slides matched the textbook sometimes word for word. Less than half of the class attended lecture because if you read the textbook, youd do well on exams. Any examples given in class were exactly what the textbook has. He was rude to students and would talk over you or get mad if you don't understand something.

Dr. Phenis is a good guy, but he is a newer professor. He doesn't take attendance but if you do not go you will have no idea what you need to know. Study guides + his review sessions are your best bet. Group projects WILL be the majority of your grade. He does "curve" his exams very generously (hardest five questions are extra credit).
the class is well organized. he made sure all questions were answered. this was the pandemic semester, he handled the class as well as possible. overall, a very nice guy. would recommend him!

Prof. Phenis goes quickly in lectures but he covers all the materials that are on his tests and is very accessible and eager to help students if they are struggling. He provides ample time for questions and doesn't teach extra information that you won't be tested over. His class is structured very clearly. Would definitely recommend him.

The lectures seem like he is just reading from the book, they're super boring and he doesn't seem interested in teaching the material. He is very hard to reach outside of class and takes over a week to respond to emails. He also seems very annoyed when students don't understand the question or know the answer, and will ignore and talk over them.

It was his first year teaching, so he struggled a bit, but it was obvious how hard he worked at improving. I learned a lot and thought that he did pretty well by the end of the year. I would definitely take another class of his. If he maintains his effort level, he will soon be one of the best professors on campus.
Gives a lot of extra credit that makes up for a higher grade in the class. Lectures are very unorganized and he does not teach. Going to class was a waste of time but he took attendance

okay honestly this class was so annoying and his lectures are so boring he just reads the textbook, BUT the group assignments are really reasonable and if you try on them they actually help you understand things and he grades them really easy. he gives SO much extra credit too! not the best at explaining, but the textbook is great.

The lectures are super fast and I learned nothing from them. I read slides on my own every day and went to his office hours pretty often to understand things on slides--really spent a lot of time on this course! There are quizzes and group assignments as well. The exams are hard. However, he was "insane" in giving extra credits, so a super easy A!

I feel for this professor bc tries his best. His lectures do not help at all. A lot of unnecessary assignments that do not help you learn. Exams are kinda hard but he gives a lot of EC to make up for that. With that being said this class is very doable if you are able to read the textbook and completely teach yourself the information.

He gave tons of extra credit, but it wasn't worth as much as he said it would be. Nice guy, definitely receptive to how the class was feeling, but he was too lazy to figure out Carmen. The reason we had so much extra credit was because he didn't want to have to figure out how to drop our lowest exam in Carmen. If you can take someone else, do it.

He was very receptive to what we as students said we needed from him in order to get the most from this class. He offered tons of extra credit.
