He would literally jump over seats during the exam to help out students if they had questions. Would be almost impossible to fail. Lectures weren't interesting but the subject isn't anyway. Use the book!!!!

Excuses are the nails used to build the house of failure. My eyes roll into the back of my head when I read reviews on profs that say "he's not as bad as what everyone says" BUT for prof. Phenis this is actually the truth. He is BEYOND fair with grading, will make time for you if you need to review, amazing extra credit, CURVES EXAMS. He's great.

I'm not one to complain about professors but I had to make an exception after this course. He rambled about random topics, constantly had to correct himself, and couldn't answer questions because he isn't an "expert on that topic" as he would say. On many occasions he would give information that was so incorrect students had to notify him.

At the beginning of the semester, he was a bit rough, but after he took feedback from students in class he became more receptive! He's not as bad as everyone says he is, and frankly people are being too hard on him. His lectures are very straightforward and he genuinely wants everyone to do as good as they possibly can!

The material itself includes a concept and then it goes into a ton of exceptions to rules. He does a good job of trying to get these points across and will sit with you until you get it. I really do believe this class has prepared me well for later down the road for research. People should get over themselves and not just surf for easy A's.

I personally loved this teacher. I took this class as an elective so the class isnt directly related to my major at all which made it tough at least for me but hes so caring he emails back super fast if you have questions and there are a lot of opportunities for extra credit. The lectures are a bit boring at times but he loves what he does.

do yourself a favor and not take his class. terrible speaker, rambles on about wrong things then tries to correct himself and confuses students. gives a lot of extra credit because his exams are terrible and full of mistakes. Group projects have so little to do with the material and he did not even write up the requirements until 2-3 days before

Tedious group projects, overly difficult exams littered with grammatical mistakes, gives out extra credit points for damage control and padding on these group projects, boring and awkward lectures, and a rather rude emailer. Harsh for a first year, I know, but this is a lower level psych class. Take all his classes with someone else if you can.

Get ready for your grade to be based almost solely on group projects! he's clearly very intelligent, but he almost expects his students to have the same level of knowledge. OSU believes this is a very important class and won't accept any other school's interpretation, and I was pretty disappointed. I felt like I got nothing from this class.

Nice guy, boring lecturer. The textbook is a lot more clear than the lectures, so it would be in your best interest to read the textbook and teach yourself the material before coming to class (attendance is taken daily). His exams are very difficult but he curves them and gives the class a lot of opportunities for extra credit.

He can be a little ramble-y, but he honestly cares a lot about his students. If you're struggling with something or content, talk to him. You'd be surprised how helpful he is, and willing to work with you. One of the most considerate professors I've had.

He doesn't do a good job of conveying information to the class and makes easy topics way more difficult than they have to be. Projects/group assignments do not help with what we are supposed to be learning. He is unorganized and makes typos/grammar mistakes everywhere. The class is fine if you have the book, so just teach yourself if you take him.

IMO, worst prof at OSU. He's RUDE, awful at explaining EVERYTHING then gets annoyed when the class doesn't understand? (which leads to awk. silences) Makes everything so much more difficult than it needs to be. I DREAD coming to class bc the energy is so bad. Pulled up his ratings in class & tried defending himself. Doesn't know what he's doing.

Really needs to take a remedial teaching course: unclear points, constant stuttering, non-confident speaking, etc... Constantly tells us he didn't prepare us for the exams but continues to teach the same way.. Most importantly, this man PULLED UP HIS RATEMYPROFESSOR COMMENTS in class and proceeded to dissect them and defend himself.. very strange

His lectures are very fast-paced and there is a lot of information but the tests are very straight forward if you put in the work to learn the material on the lectures. He posts study guides for the tests and creates online lectures to help before an exam for the most important material. People who honestly complain about him dont put in the work.

I actually have no idea how people are rating him so low. He gives a large amount of extra credit after every test and if you read the book then you'll for sure pass. He grades relatively quick on the things that matter (midterms) and even though he is slightly confusing in lecture, overall I feel like he really cares and is trying. Get over it.

One of the worst professors I have had at OSU. I normally can deal with bad professors but he is so confusing and does not provide clear details at all. He is a hard grader and assigns very hard homework. If you take this class, find another professor.

This is one of my hardest classes when it shouldnt be. Phenis is new and obviously hasnt found the best way to teach his material. Hes smart but horrible at explaining things. Hes trying his best but needs to figure out how to organize his classes better for the future. Lots of easy hw saved my grade. 3 exams are so hard he had to curve them all.

This guy... He should not be teaching at OSU. He is nearly impossible to understand in class, is completely scattered and unorganized, and does more to confuse students than teach them. I've done well on the exams because I had previous experience with some of the material, but I understand how others could be completely lost.

Where do I even start: this guy clearly just doesnt get it. He has now changed his lecture style for a third time, there is little to no practice problems for materials he claims needs to be practiced outside of class, and he CONSTANTLY talks about concepts for several minutes then goes oops no wait I meant the opposite. Ridiculously awful.

Gives you grad level questions on exams, doesnt help much when it comes to studying. The concepts he discusses are far more difficult in class than when reading in the book. I will say taking data analysis before would help.

The worst professor I've had in my life. Period. Rather than taking criticism and fixing the things he is awful at, he gets defensive and tries to make excuses for why he makes such a simple so much harder than it needs to be. He messes up on his slides, messes up while talking, and then tries to go back and defend himself messing up. Terrible.

Hes a good professor Has a lot of group assignments but gives you the chance to change out of your assigned group if needed. Exams are kind of hard but if you show up every day you should be fine. Helpful tophat reviews for exams.

Pretty good professor. Hard exams but if you show up to every class youll do well on his exams. Review days are really important and help a ton. Somewhat confusing chapter lessons but its really just because the concepts being taught are pretty confusing. Nice professor and solid course.

Worst professors had in my college career. Exams are complex pertaining to more simple content. Countless mistakes that he has to correct. When presenting information he mixes up his words and confuses students. He does not speak with confidence. You'd be better off not going to class and teaching yourself. Do yourself a favor and take someone else

He rarely lectures in a way that makes sense and when he goes over assignments he will be wrong when explaining important topics in the class. His tests are a nightmare (extremely confusing) and the strict attendance policy should be removed considering it's more confusing to be in class than it is to attempt to teach yourself with the textbook.

Unorganized. Its his first year so I try to be understanding, but its ridiculous. Takes forever to grade items, assignments have little structure/instruction, exams are hard. We thankfully have opportunity to make up a few points for an exam. Some people are harsh, but he truly needs to do something much different if he wants students to succeed.

Hes very nice. Hes trying to learn how to teach material and organize it into tests. He wants his students to succeed but the material is very hard through the way he teaches it. Its a lot of material, and tests are hard. Hes overall not bad, just wish the class was a little more organized and to know what he wants us to focus on.

He over complicates all topics. Typical example of a first year teacher coming in and trying to overreach all the material. Hes gone back and forth between lecture styles and the book he offers doesnt offer nearly enough workable examples. Dude is straight floundering and bringing the class down with him. Nice guy, bad teacher.

Very obvious that this is his first year teaching, his tests are very difficult as he makes you choose what answer is BEST out of a pool of answers that are (most times) all correct. It seems like he is passionate about what he teaches but is unsure about how to convey it all to students who have yet to learn any of it - effects your grade a lot.

Makes an already dull research methods course more boring. Has a talent of making simple concepts more confusing. I don't know if its hard to focus because of his monotone voice or his constant stuttering. Acknowledges that he hasnt prepared us for an exam on numerous occasions but continues to make exams where the class average is a F.

Hes unprofessional, brought up this website in class. He seems like he genuinely cares about the subjects but I didnt like his teaching style. He didnt seem like he really cared if people wanted him to slow down. He is very passionate and to pass you have to spend a lot of time with him in office hours. take 2300/3313 with another professor.

Lots of people hate on him but what they don't understand is that he teaches a difficult subject! Sometimes the stuff he says is a bit confusing but he always clarifies. Overall great professor and knows what he's talking about. If you study and pay attention in lectures you'll get an A.

Professor Phenis does not seem comfortable in the teaching environment. This class is book heavy, and I teach myself almost all of the material. The structure is all over the place, the powerpoints are confusing, and the test questions are unnecessarily long. He said 1 of the exams is more difficult and people failed, yet maintained the same test??

Dr. Phenis does an adequate job of preparing you for the exams. He gives practice concepts and hints at question topics during lecture. If you ACTUALLY pay attention in class and reach out to him when you're having difficulty, you should be fine. While group work can be frustrating if you answer the full question he generally grades forgivingly.
Hes not as bad as everyone is saying. Lots of lectures and he makes things harder than they need to be sometimes. He is a really nice professor and is trying his best.
He is passionate about what he does. First year teaching the material so he is trying his best. Just be patient and ask him questions. Always willing to help you.
He tries his best to help you understand the material, you just have to communicate with him instead of complain about it.

He literally talked about his rate my professor score in class, trying to passive aggressively justify himself as to why he teaches the way he does. He answers emails rudely, has the grammar ability of a five-year-old, doesnt care about his students grades, and gives zero notice when it comes to doing group projects. 10/10 would NOT reccomend.

You can tell he is having trouble with finding a right teaching method. Its not fair to any of us students because it is affecting us and our grade. Hes all over the place and not straightforward at all. The tests are confusing and he says multiple answers could be right but he says to pick the best one. If you want a good grade do not take him!!!

Not a great professor, he twists concepts around to make them way more confusing than they need to be. Studying is mostly trying to understand what he is saying, and even his powerpoint slides are hard to follow because the grammar is so bad. He seems nice enough, but I highly recommend avoiding taking his class.

Hes probably one of the worst professors Ibe had at OSU. He seems like a great guy but I feel like I learn nothing from his class. His lecture are super long and boring. They consist of him just rambling on about assignments and random things that dont fit in the lecture! He makes things really confusing so read the book if you take him!
Really bizarre lecture/course set up. There aren't really lectures in class we kinda just ramble about homework/off topic information. If you like structure to a class, I don't recommend.
Lectures are confusing and he is hard to follow

summary_comment: Dr. Miller is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching and genuine care for her students. Students consistently praise her supportive and approachable nature, which fosters a positive learning environment. Her passion for the subject matter and innovative teaching methods make her courses both enjoyable and academically rewarding.

Ratings.comment: One of my favorite professors! She truly cares about her students and is very accommodating!

I absolutely loved Dr. Miller! I cannot say enough good things about her as a person and as a professor! She was caring and genuine towards students with passion for the course content and for our research projects. She made research approachable and provided a support system. I recommend Dr. Miller and this psychology of motivation course fully.
She's my top recommendation for psych students. You'll love her, and so will your GPA.

Her class is straightforward, and fun to be in. She clearly cares for her students, and makes it clear we are her priority. if you can take her, do it! You will walk away with an A as long as you do the assignments.
She was the most amazing professor. She really cares about her students. This was the best way to end my college career. I have never taken a class this easy!! Take it!!

I'm taking Dr. Miller for both Psychology of Personality and Motivation Psychology.  Overall, she has been the unexpected highlight of the semester and I truly am thankful for the understanding of what students are going through and emphasizing learning and caring over just forcing grades, how compassionate education should be.

Her theoretical approach to the course makes me think about finding myself, and these deep thoughts carry with me. I like thinking about what my ideal self would look like and the steps I could take to get there. This class is helping me to recognize what I really like about myself as a future counselor and appreciate my unique personality more.

Dr. Miller loves psychology so much. We do interesting activities to understand working with various personality types. I'm often thinking of personality throughout my day now. Class is thought provoking.I also prefer the way she structures the class for learning with resources available online. I'm registered to take another course with her.

Dr. Miller cares deeply about us as human beings and helps us apply the psychology of motivation to our lives.  The way she teaches gets to each student's passions with goal setting techniques and psychological confidence to believe in our hopes.  She is enthusiastic about psychology, and I highly recommend her.  Very flexible and understanding.

The only reason that I didn't rate 5/5 was because the start of her classes was quite drawn out about the final paper. We were beginning our research for the project before we even touched on any of the topics in class. Very confusing but I can tell her heart is in a good place and she really tries. I would take her classes again.
I appreciated Dr. Miller's course design, positive teaching style, and genuine desire to help students with understanding psychology, grad school, and career decisions.

Dr. Miller is amazing and always gave me positive feedback that was very encouraging. I enjoyed learning about all the disorders that fall under abnormal psychology. I learned a lot in a short amount of time.  Would definitely take a class taught by her again.  She is very caring and the learning makes you feel relaxed.

Dr. Miller was a great professor! The 6 week course was one discussion post (that was writing parts of your "final paper") and one quiz (multiple choice, take up to 3 times) each week, and turning in your paper at the end.

She also gave great feedback on everything graded, and was flexible with due dates if students needed an extra day or so!

Most caring professor I've seen. She takes time to clearly grade homework and gives tons of feedback. A very easy 6 week summer course-just a weekly multiple attempt quiz, and a weekly discussion board that breaks down the sections of the research paper (instead of a final). definitely recommend!
Super caring and understanding of time constraints and she constantly extended deadlines and helped whenever she was asked.

It was really my honor to have Dr. Miller as my instructor again this summer. I am grateful that Dr. Miller knows how to let us be in a good mood to study psychology. I will take another two courses with Dr. Miller this autumn semester, and I am excited. The feedback Dr. Miller sent me is useful and helpful for my writing and learning.
Dr. Miller has always been one of my favorite professors! She genuinely cares about her students and their success. She is intelligent, kind, and understanding. I will always recommend her classes!
Kind Professor, always smiling at her students, even though some students never attend her class. Got full marks on each assignment, would definitely take again.

Literally the easiest thing I have ever done in my life was this course. It is only out of 100 points but there is really no way you cannot get a 100% in the course. Discussion posts every week that help you with your final research paper and easy quizzes you get 3 tries on. You do not have to go to class, which is sad bc she is so kind and caring.

I love this woman. She is so sweet and caring. Easy grading for weekly multiple choice quizzes that are online, unproctored, and right from the lectures with no time limit. The lectures are engaging and encourage you to talk to the people around you. Her life is interesting and I love her attitude towards sport psych.

Absolutely love Dr. Miller!!!! She is such a kind person and so incredibly welcoming to everyone and understanding of people needing accommodations. The class is super intellectually stimulating.  It is clear Dr. Miller loves teaching.

Dr. Miller is an amazing professor who really cares about her students. Attendance isn't required, but you have to do weekly discussion posts. These are mostly about the final project, which is broken up through the semester and is very easy to complete. Quizzes are online and you get two attempts. I'm happily taking her a third time next semester.

Dr. Miller is really laid-back and super kind to all of her students. She accepted any and all late work up to the last days of the semester, which was really helpful. I had her previously for an online Psych of Personality and she was great then too!

class is mostly discussion posts and the final is a project that she helps you complete throughout the semester. she's one of the sweetest professors ever and genuinely cares about students doing well. easier than some of my 1000 levels tbh

Dr. Miller is an amazing professor. Class assignments are very manageable and there are no exams. Her lectures are really interesting, and she is also super flexible when it comes to showing up to class and turning in assignments. She also cares about her students and understands that they have other things going on outside of her class

Lisa gives you discussion posts to do weekly and there are a few quizzes that you can take twice but they are not hard. just look over the slides and you'll be okay. class format is based on a study you conduct and then you write a research paper over the course of the semester. I highly recommend her for an upper division class

By far my favorite professor! She is so easy going and understanding. You can easily get over 100% in the class. I will be taking 3 other classes with her next semester based off of the great experience that I had! I recommend!

I have taken both this class and organizational psych with her because she honestly grades on effort. Her assignments were very straight-forward and easy. You can tell she genuinely loves her students and what she teaches.
Dr. Miller is so nice and really cares about her students!

I loved taking Dr. Miller's class. She has awesome and interesting lectures and grades very easily. The semester project was very interesting and fairly easy. Overall I really enjoyed all of the material and did not stress about this class. There was weekly quizzes but they were super easy.

This is my second course with Dr. Miller and I wish I could take a third! Dr. Miller is kind and compassionate. She is clear with her assignment requirements and wants her students to succeed. Dr. Miller's class brightened my day. If you take her course, attend lectures to fully benefit from her teaching!

Loved Dr. Miller's caring and positive engergy.  The professor provided advice for graduate school that helped me in my entrance interviews.  Being able to select my own topic and work on my own research led me to discover my desired area of focus in psychology.  Highly recommend and would take again if I wasn't graduating.

It's mostly lectures and group work in class. The syllabus didn't match the class at all, which made it really confusing. She's really nice and helpful with questions, and lenient overall. The grading felt all over the place though, wouldn't take again.

Psychology of Emotions class is my second class with Dr. Miller this term. I actually fell behind due to a personal issue. She was so kind with helping me get back on track with exceptional empathy.  We've touched on every emotion this term...we learned how to create and savor good emotions and how to cope together with difficult emotions.

Positive Psychology with Dr. Miller is my 3rd class with this professor.  I'm planning to enroll in her class this summer too.  She is always passionate about the topics and offers opportunities to practice psychology skills in class.  Always very kind.  I learn about my ways of thinking and also about how to help other people.  Highly recommend!

Dr. Miller was an amazing instructor! She always teaches the information clearly and makes the topic fun to learn. I learned a lot from this class.  Professor Miller was passionate about both the course material as well as helping her students. I am very happy I took it as I learned a lot.

very kind person with a truly big heart, genuinely cares for all her students learning and wellbeing. really has a great way of orating, especially to such a large class audience, still asking questions and listening to students. i appreciate her positive attitude which was an uplifting part of my day. i also appreciate her leniency with deadlines.

Lisa Miller took on the task of teaching this new course, and I think she did an excellent job of doing so. 
Dr. Miller was very communicative in what exactly we had to do, and always greeted us with kindness and a smile. She always encouraged us to ask questions about the material, and she did a great job of explaining everything. Just loved her.

A gem of a human being, Dr. Miller was absolutely amazing. I had horrible health issues this semester. She made accommodations immediately and was the reason I was able to finish school. Easy to learn from, encourages independent thought, never hesitates to help. I had a lot of great professors, but Dr. Miller is best of the best in psychology.

This is my second class with Dr. Miller and I enrolled in more courses next semester with her. She is absolutely amazing and opened me up with self analysis. She has the kindest heart and truly cares about her students. I look forward to going to her class!!! I always look for her name when signing up for classes because that's how awesome she is.

This class was my breathe of fresh air this semester, go with the flow. There were no strict deadlines. Lecture sparked some heated discussions, but was very interesting to see my classmates views. The only assignments were weekly discussion boards which in turn were copy and pasted into my final project as they are used as the building blocks.

This is my second time having this professor and I really appreciate the format with which she organizes her classes. Lectures are group-oriented and there is a lot of interaction. This professor is a fair grader and is always in a joyful mood.

This is a class for the new GE, so this was her first time teaching it. The course itself was very boring and mundane, but Prof. Miller was up for the challenge and did her best to teach to us. She is extremely kind-hearted and very communicative, and a very kind grader. Hated the class, but Prof. Miller definitely made it easier to bear.

The summer course for Theories of Personality is online and has a relaxed vibe for learning comfortably.  Topics are interesting.  Dr.Miller helps you create your own ideas for research on personality topics you enjoy.  I will submit my final course paper for my grad school portfolio.

Dr Miller is my absolute favorite professor of all time. I already took her classes and specifically signed up for another one because of how much I enjoyed her teaching style. Not only is she super organized but she genuinely encourages thought-provoking conversation. Miller emphasizes mental health above all. Absolutely loved taking her classes
Love Dr. Miller!  Very warm and understanding.  I would take another class with her in a heartbeat.  100% recommend.  She is intelligent but also fun loving in class.

Learned alot about myself and the psychological world. Dr. Miller is uplifting and gives the feeling like she truly cares about you.  She stays organized and on schedule but also gives more time if students need it. She is passionate about happiness, relationships, and sports psychology. If you have the chance, take her class.  Genuinely kind human

Dr. Miller is a brilliant caring professor.  Brightened the day with energy!  She structures the class with hands-on activities.  It's not a boring lecture with a professor going on and on.  Highly recommend.  She's very inspiring about helping you with life and professional choices.  We learned psychological skills on top of research skills.

Like other reviewers said: this class is VERY easy. You don't need to show up and still get an easy A as long as you turn in your weekly discussion boards, quizzes and final paper. Her lectures were super boring and filled with mindless small group activities. I feel unprepared for upper-level classes because there was no in-depth learning.

Dr. Miller is a great professor. She cares about the material and her students. Lectures seemed kind of pointless at times but she offered great feedback about our research paper project. As long as you do the weekly quizzes and keep up with discussion boards you don't have to go to class to get an A.

Dr. Miller's research methods course is very laid back, with only a few quizzes, one final paper, and weekly discussion boards that add up to your final paper. The layout of this course takes a huge load off of the effort to tie the essay together. Best of all, her courses have no exams!

EASIEST class I’ve ever taken. There’s no exams just 10 5point quizzes. The quizzes are open note and she gives multiple attempts. Her class is focused on discussion so there’s a discussion every week. There’s one research paper due at the end of the semester. Super easy and she’s so caring. Highly recommend

Lisa Miller is notorious for being an incredibly caring professor and understanding when you come to her with any difficulty or reason for absences. She genuinely really cares about her students and it shows. Every assignment she gives is pretty easy, except there is one research paper you need to write throughout the year.

Almost too easy. You could theoretically not do anything and still get an A, but if you are here to learn you can learn a lot in her classes. I enjoy challenges as I learn better that way, this class is not a challenge. But it did make my life easier. Listen an pay attention, you can learn something that will better your life forever :)

Ive taken many classes with Professor Miller. Loved this class! Loved the focus on high-performance psychology and psychological skills training. Its clear she loves her job and is passionate about helping students.

Professor Miller was outstanding! Her class was stimulating, and the format allowed us to be creative. I love how she created a class plan that built up to the largest project so it wasnt too overwhelming. I dont think Ive ever met a professor that cared so much about our mental health. I believe all classes should be like this. Enjoyed it!

I love Dr. Miller! She is such an incredible energetic person and professor! I have only high praise. Ive taken several courses with her. She is so kind, compassionate, flexible, and enthusiastic about teaching. The courses were well organized with an easy to follow structure. Highly recommend! One of the best professors at OSU!

Dr Miller is very nice and sweet. However, she gives out so many group projects and discussion assignments. I prefer lecture classes, but most classes were just discussions so I stoped going and I ended up with a 100. Its an easy A if you do what you need to do, but if you aren't into group projects and discussions I wouldn't take this class

Dr. Miller is not only a great professor, but a sweet woman as well. The research project seemed daunting at first, but she broke it up into weekly DB posts, which let us make step-by-step progress on it each week. For project itself, she let us simply compile our posts into the final paper and format them. Strongly recommend her for this class!

I had her for my research methods class and she was amazing. My brother passed away during the semester and I also got extremely sick and she was very understanding and excluded me from assignments and gave me extra time whenever I needed it. The research project is super fun and I like how we worked on it all semester. Shes a great professor.

Dr. Miller was really understanding this semester and did her best to make the course manageable despite everything else. The final paper was broken up into discussion posts throughout the course which made it pretty easy to do. There were also weeks where you got points for just checking in on the discussion boards which I appreciated.
She is a sweetheart! I loved her positive psychology class and it has helped me in my personal life so much! Take her classes, you wont regret it! She truly wants the best for her students.

I loved her this semester! Such a kind and understanding professor and empathetic to all of us students. She knew how to keep things so lighthearted and wholesome even with covid hovering over all our heads !

Dr. Miller is a GREAT professor. This is definitely a low maintenance class, but its really interesting. Dr. Miller really cares about her students and wants you to genuinely enjoy the class. Definitely take her if you have the chance, shes a sweetheart!

Dr. Miller is one of the sweetest profs I have ever had. Especially with the confusion of COVID-19, Dr. Miller has gone out of her way to ease the load on the students and make sure that her class was not a source of stress for anyone. 10/10 would recommend any classes from Dr. Miller!

Best professor @ OSU. Very kind, caring and understanding. Pushed back due dates to accommodate for COVID-19 and other stressors. Class is out of 100 points, I finished with 100/100. Quizzes are unlimited attempts and easy if you review the notes. Final was easy and youre given two attempts. Final project was lowkey fun, easy and quick to finish.

Dr. Miller is a wonderful professor! I think she specializes in positive psychology, and she applies it no matter the class; she makes everything simple and engaging and always knows how to motivate students.
Dr. Miller so the best professor at OSU. Quizzes are unlimited attempts and only one big paper for a research class. No midterms at all. She is very caring and understanding. Highly recommend.

Dr. Miller is a great professor. The class is insanely boring, but she tries to make it interesting. She posts all of her powerpoints, does not take attendance, and the only grades are a research project, journal, and a few quizzes that have unlimited attempts. She wants you to succeed in the class.

Any class available with Dr. Miller, I highly recommend it! She is an angel of a professor. She cares about her students and wants them to succeed. Assignments usually have multiple attempts. She grades things fairly easy. Love this woman.

I took this online class during the summer and it was by far the most interesting class I've taken thus far. The prof is really caring, supportive and willing to help you. The exams are based off reads in the textbook, so you will still have to put in effort and time to prepare for exams. Other than that, I highly recommend this class.

Dr. Miller is one of the sweetest professors Ive ever had. Shes so modest but brilliant and makes everything very easy to understand. She enlists group conversations and makes everyone feel comfortable speaking aloud in class. Dr. Miller is a must have for psych1100.

Dr Miller is literally the best professor Ive ever had. She teaches multiple courses at OSU and really has her students success at the top of her priority list. Would highly recommend taking any of her classes and also getting to know her. Shes absolutely awesome!

There are a lot of sections for Intro Psych at OSU, but if you can, sign up for Dr. Miller's section. She made psych extremely simple, gave us unlimited attempts at the section quizzes, and tried her best to anticipate which questions would be on the midterms (the midterms were the same for all sections, so she had no control over the material).

summary_comment: Dr. Boyce is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for her engaging and humorous lectures, clear grading criteria, and genuine care for her students' success. Students consistently praise her accessibility, kindness, and passion for the subject, often noting that her classes are both interesting and easy.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Boyce is the best. She's personable, quick to respond, very understanding, and I genuinely enjoy her lectures. She's also really funny and has a great personality. Her grading is clear and she genuinely wants her students to do well. Definitely one of the best professors I've had at OSU.
She is just wonderful! Great teacher and person, makes the material very accessible and is always there to help you succeed
Genuinely awesome professor

A very bubbly person, gives off english teacher vibes. She also seems like she has ADHD lmao. 

Course was super interesting! Concepts were easy (basically operationalized common sense) and there's semester-long groupwork where you present a research study and write a mock research proposal.

KRISTY BOYCE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR AT OHIO STATE. Her lectures are so interesting and she is truly so kind and caring. She is always willing to provide help to her students no matter what. I wish I could take all my classes with Professor Boyce.

one group project that you work the entire semester through, easy lectures and exams, I really enjoyed the material (but i'm also a psych major). she is easy to email/talk to whenever you need help. grade based on chunks of group projects, and 3 exams. you can get an A even without going to lecture; there is one group presentation

I genuinely loved taking this class and will be looking for more classes that she teaches. Her lectures were very informative and I was always interested in what she was saying. She's very passionate and enjoys social psychology and it shows, and it definitely shows. If you don't take one of her classes, you're definitely missing out.

This class was very boring but easy. There were some interesting parts, but only reason I went is because of TopHat. Lectures are extremely long (20+ slide) and she will tell you to read the book, but you don't need to. I would have had an A in the class, but I got docked points on my project!
This class was very easy in terms of assignments and quizzes. Her lectures get a little boring but she is extremely nice and very caring! Attendance wasn't required.

Professor Boyce was so caring and you can really tell that she is passionate about her field. Lectures were organized and to the point and she took measures to make sure everyone understood everything she was teaching. I would definitely take another one of her classes.

Good professor, easy class. Don't need to read textbook, tests are easy. She records the lectures, but I'm not sure if that's because of COVID. Would probably be boring if I had to go to class because it takes me 15 minutes to watch each lecture once I skip past everything irrelevant and play it at double speed. She's caring and easygoing.

The only assignments were two group projects, 3 exams, and REP participation, so if you got a bad group things were awful. Lectures were straightforward, and she provides PDFs of the slides to take notes on. Open-note exams. Highly recommend.
The lectures were pretty boring for me, but Dr. Boyce does everything she can to make class more fun. She is very kind and helpful.

She gives a lot of work and the class requires you to read the entire textbook due to inquizitive. She does seem like she cares about the students but thats hard to display in an online course. There are no cumulative exams, just quizzes every other week on the chapters we worked on. There also is no final.

Dr. Boyce really wants her students to do well. Her lectures are super clear and she gives guided notes for each one. There are a couple of group projects and a presentation but they aren't too bad. Midterms and final are online, non-cumulative, open note. She is incredibly nice too.

One of the best instructors I have ever had. She gave on-topic and focused lectures, was understanding of personal circumstances, and was highly accessible outside of class. Go to class and take notes, and you will do well while learning a lot. Absolutely amazing professor!
Exceptional professor and made one of my first classes at OSU enjoyable!

This is my second class was Dr. Boyce. Not only are her classes typically pretty easy for upper-division courses, but she is also an amazing person. She will put in extra work to make sure you understand the material.

Truly an amazing person. Overall, the class content is very easy to understand, and watching her lecture slides prior to the lecture was plenty for the quizzes. Everything was open-note and pretty simple. Just do the assignments and you will be very successful!

She is very clear on the assignments and their due dates, always sending email reminders to get them done. The exams were open book and times, but if you read the chapter you would easily get an A. There are weekly readings and mini-quizzes about the chapter, as well as homework, but it was all very manageable and open book.

Dr. Boyce's class was pretty interesting. I appreciated the fact that her lecture videos managed to be succinct while covering almost everything we needed to know. There were quizzes every other week, which were usually pretty easy if you watched the lectures and read the textbook, and the HW was generally easy points, too. Definitely recommend!

Dr. Boyce was very kind in her feedback, though I never interacted with her in person. Her class was easy and the criteria was clear while learning a lot. It was a great intro class, not too intense but I learned enough.

Dr. Boyce is an easy grade and assignments are easy. I took this class asynchronously, so all of the quizzes were open note. Dr. Boyce is also extremely understanding and gives everyone two "oops" passes to get extensions on the assignments. She also provides opportunity for extra credit.

Professor Boyce is awesome! I learned so much from this class and would definitely take her again. Assignments and tests are straightforward, and there are extra credit opportunities. If you just pay attention during lecture and have a rough understanding of the weekly articles, you'll be fine. Overall this was a very easy class.
Dr. Boyce is awesome. Her class is super informative, and she's great at teaching the material. If you do the work, you'll get the grade you want.

A good course to fill your schedule with if you're already slammed. The assignments are very short and she gives guided notes for you to write in while reading the textbook. If you pay attention to the material and put effort into discussions/journals, you're sure to get an A

Go to class because all the notes are taken in class. You don't need a textbook or anything but remember there is no curve. I was .01 away from an A and could not be rounded but overall she is a super nice professor and it should be easy as long as you study.

Such an easy class. Very straightforward assignments and exams. I barely studied because her lectures and notes were enough to understand the material. She's a wonderful professor as well, very understanding and kind. This is my second class with her and I only have nice things to say about her. Truly a gem.

Dr. Boyce creates a really laid-back lecture environment. Always open to hearing our ideas and feedback. Exams were a breeze, you could look over the notes 20 minutes before and pass. Really nice woman and a really interesting class too.

This professor is very kind and upbeat. She is always positive when lecturing and makes being in class enjoyable. She is knowledgeable and respectful of her students. She is always open to her students feedback and comments. The class is engaging and she relates the information to our everyday life.
This class was all one big group project, but there was plenty of time in class to (almost) finish everything needed. Dr. Boyce is honestly a queen, and I would recommend all of her classes!

I enjoyed this class. Prof Boyce was very caring and always encouraged participation. The class wasnt hard. Many concepts were somewhat common sense. However, the exams were a tad harder than the lectures (not super hard though). After the first exam, you get used the setup. Id suggest this class with Prof Boyce! Easy A!

Dr. Boyce is a wonderful professor and I really enjoyed class. Exams and paper were all very easy and if you show up to class and take notes you'll do fine. Biggest issue in the class was the number of annoying students who asked constant, unrelated, questions that slowed us down. Dr. Boyce is amazing and I hope to take another class with her.

Dr. Boyce is one of the nicest profs I've ever had. She is truly passionate about social psych, and her lectures are really interesting! She is also very willing to help and engage with students, as she usually ends class 5 minutes early so people can ask her any questions they may have. Her tests are super easy if you pay attention in class.

Dr. Boyce is one of the sweetest and most approachable professors I've ever taken a class with. Always willing to answer all questions after and during class and was also open to various student suggestions. Lectures are v interesting and the class material is not difficult at all. I highly recommend taking a class with her if you get the chance!

The Most Manageable Honor Course I've taken. (Class Avearage is A 93.8%) Just make sure you attend every class,and know the concept of the slide and the main result of the research article. Most part of the video assginment can be done during class time. Great Professor! Would Highly Recommended!

Kristy was a great instructor! As long as you go to class and get the notes, everything else is straightforward. She explains concepts very well, is very open for questions, and seems to love what she does. I would definitely recommend her!

I loved her class! It was very straightforward and engaging. She's very approachable and always gives examples, explains and makes sure everyone understands. The material was not difficult at all. If you pay attention in class and do just a little review before the exam, you should easily get an A. Take her class!

Ms. Boyce is a pretty nice professor! She is caring, kind, and very knowledgeable at the same time. I remember when I chatted with her about one of the social psychology topics I am interested, and the next day she sent me the email about some researches and books she recommended. (But it doesn't mean the class is easy!!!)
I love her! She is amazing! Her lecture is amazing and she is a great professor with caring and understanding. Highly recommended for her classes.

This was my second class with Dr. Boyce and I still love her! She is the sweetest lady to ever walk this planet. The class itself is SUPER easy, everything is basically common sense or is explained in detail in lecture. Also, I asked D. Boyce to be a reference for a research position and she was SOOO willing and so excited to help me. Love her!!

Easy A. Grades consists of 3 parts 1In-class assignment is predictable. See the syllabus, make sure you go to every last class of each chapter 2Written HW, do it in advanced, and go office hour to check answer with her 3Tests , just review the slide, if miss just tell professor and she will give you her slide to take photo, since it is not posted

This woman is amazing!! So sweet & friendly, makes lectures relevant to students, gives insightful examples, and asks for opinions about exams/material covered. Her tests are directly what she teaches, but she doesn't put the powerpoints online so you have to go to class if you want the easy (but enjoyable) A

I took 2 classes (2300&3530) with Dr. Boyce, and I loved taking both of them. She presented intriguing lectures, very fair tests, and she was very accommodating to my crazy schedule when I took her class (optometry school interviews & family emergencies. The only downside for someone who likes to skip class is her random in-class assignments.

Kristy is a wonderful professor who makes lecture interesting and relatable. She is passionate about her are of expertise and relays information very well. No book is needed in order to obtain a decent grade. There are some in class assignments that count for attendance/ in class assignments but are super easy. I for sure will take her class again

She was SOOO nice. Her class was the easiest one I had all semester and I plan on taking another one of her classes next semester. Her tests count for a majority of the overall grade, but they are graded very fairly. GO TO CLASS. only 2-3 homework assignments for the semester because everything else is done in class.

Great prof for many reasons. Very passionate and gives fair exams. Always go to class because she assigns random assignments for points. Cares about students' wellbeing and eagerly answers questions. Not too warm and fuzzy. Would definitely take her class again.

Dr. Boyce is very clear and knowledgable. She loves teaching and wants her students to understand the material well. She does not try to make this class more difficult than it needs to be. A chill and fair professor for an interesting class.
Random in-class activities will be the death of you. The lecture is basically copy and pasted onto the exams.

Dr. Boyce is great! She is funny, nice, and enthusiastic. Grade consists of 3 exams (58%), 3 easy homework assignments (29%), and several random but very easy in-class assignments (13%), which she uses as an incentive to attend class, as you never know which days she will hand them out. If you show up, do the assignments, and study it is an easy A!

One of my favorite professors here because of how much enthusiasm she has for psychology and her students. Definitely recommend taking a class with her at least once. Make sure you go to class and take good notes, as she does not post full slides online.

Dr. Boyce was a really great professor! I went into the class thinking that it wouldn't be that interesting, but Dr. Boyce's profound insight and enthusiasm for the subject matter proved me wrong. Her lectures are very organized and she communicates the information very well making it easy to understand. Couldn't have been more satisfied!

Great professor! Exams were straight from the notes and super clear. Don't need to read over your notes more than once for an A. The 4 short assignments were easy and also straight from notes. In-class activities were basically free points for participating. Best professor to take this class with - nice, clear, and informative.

Her class is so easy, I have gotten 100% on both midterms with barely studying. As long as you show up (to get points for the in-class activities, which are worth a good portion of the class), you will do fine. There are only 4 homework assignments and they take maybe 10 minutes each. She's super caring and I would recommend taking her class!

I liked this woman. I took in the summer, so we only had 2 papers & 3 exams. Literally all you have to do is take  the notes she writes in class, plus her examples she gives (she doesn't post powerpoint slides).  I wish she wouldn't take off points on your exam grade if you had an excused note !!

I absolutely loved Dr. Boyce! Go to class b/c she'll have in class assignments that add up and can help your grade. Study the notes and you should be able to get a A! I liked her class so much that I tried my best NOT to skip it because I enjoyed it so much. One of the kindest profs I've ever had! Very personable too-we even grabbed coffee once!

The exams were pretty easy. Hw assignments were also easy but boring. You need to attend lecture for in class assignments and because the notes are not complete. The material was very boring for me, but Dr. Boyce is funny and tried to keep people interested.
Excellent Professor.  I really liked her, and had a great time in class.  Cute too.

Boyce was an amazing professor and I would definitely take her again. Tests were easy if you put in the work and read the textbook. She was so nice and even let me reschedule a test after a family emergency. Great professor.
Kristy was pleasant. Her class was easy, fun and her lectures were very clear. There are in class assignments which are super easy so don't miss too many days.

She was great! This class was super fascinating (though I'm biased because this is my area). The tests were not overly difficult if you went to class. The overall workload is light for this class! Would definitely recommend for anyone interested in personality!!
She has passion for this class and is really helpful.
Very clear contents in class. Just go to class, do your in-class activities, write down her added comments, and memorize terms before class :)

She was a great instructor! Tried to make material stimulating and interesting when it was a bit dry! Super sweet and ver approachable! Tests were easy if you study her lecture notes! Attendance isn't mandatory but you should attend for she gives random in class assignments.
Really great professor!! She made the topics interesting and was very helpful if you had any questions.
Really great professor, she is really enthusiastic about the topic.

Wonderful teacher--just be sure to read the textbook for material she doesn't cover in lecture. The good thing is that she will tell you what she won't cover in class, so you will know exactly what to look for in the text book.

She's such a sweet lady! Exams were easy and straightforward. Final was cumulative, but she gave a study guide so it was super easy. She had random in-class assignments that just count for attendance points, so you need to go to class. Studied directly from the slides, didn't even buy the book. Interesting class!

Easiest A of my college career. All the information was presented in class on the slides, and the tests were clear and straightforward. Lecture was boring but mandatory because she gave random, inclass assignments. Final was not cumulative like other 1100 classes; however, each group had a presentation project which was different but not too bad!

The class (Psychology of the Self) itself was very interesting.  The power point slides were sometimes confusing.  For example, she might cite a research study but not give specific details of the study (# ps? Premise?).  If you read the book along with the power point slides, the class is very easy. If you don't read, you might be confused.

I really liked Dr. Boyce. She was sweet and made lectures interesting and entertaining. As long as you studied, her exams were manageable. Had to attend class because there were random in-class assignments for attendance purposes.

I loved this class so much. Dr. Boyce is very clear when she lectures and takes her slides right from the book (though I still think it's worth it to buy the book and do the readings, but that's just me.) She's also extremely helpful in office hours and it really shows that she wants everyone to do well. Great sense of humor and personality too!

Dr. Boyce is one of the best professors I have ever had. It's true that you can't afford to miss class, but she is such a good teacher that I never had any desire not to go in the first place. As long as you put effort into studying and attending class, you should get an A no problem. The class itself is not difficult by any means.
Very nice and helpful! All info is communicated very clearly in lectures. If you go to class, you'll get an A!

Dr. Boyce does not teach blow off classes, but she's not super hard either. She is EXTREMELY willing to help!! After going to office hours my grade increased dramatically. Don't by the textbook, her notes are all you need. Makes the class very interesting. HIGHLY recommended!

Even though this class is a joke, I only got a B+. It's out of so few points if you miss a single in-class assignment its going to hurt you. You just can't afford to lose any points on quizzes &in-class assignments. So go to class. dont buy book either, her notes are verbatim from the text

One of the worst professors I've encountered. Very ambiguous test questions that are graded on exact definitions of a concept. Not to mention the midterms and final consist of 8-10 short answer responses. The papers are easy to write but she is the most nitpicky grader I have had in a long time. Take Art Ed for a 2nd writing course DO NOT TAKE THIS
Kristy was sometimes unclear with assignments, but usually tried to help. Exams were hard and based on lengthy articles that could have had a thousand possible test questions.
Straightforward style of teaching. Exams are fairly easy if you go over the notes.

easy easy easy class. attendance isn't mandatory but she gives a lot of in class assignments (they aren't worth much but are helpful towards your grade). definitely take her class if you get the chance.

fantastic teacher. No mind games. she presents the material and she is fair. Have to attend class for points, but she wants you to learn. A refreshing change from the other burned out crappy osu psych profs! Wonderful teacher, they should all be like this.
She is fantastic. Gives you all the info you need in lecture, along with a note 'guide' you can follow along with and fill in. Very fair grader and a genuinely nice person. Take her class!

She's really nice and easy, very clear, you could get all the material from the book easily but she has in-class assignments that you can't miss, so go to class.  Quizzes 1 wk before each exam were really helpful for a procrastinator like me.  I got an A- and most of my points off were from missing super easy in-class assignments, so go to class.

She's such a sweet teacher and uses good examples to explain complex material. I never used the textbook. She breaks the class up with the in-class assignments, so go if you want the points. Study for the quizzes! Won't call you out to talk in class either :)
Boring.  Just like all psychology professors, it is just reading definitions from a powerpoint.

She is very helpful and nice and I would recommend her class.  Lectures can be boring but class attendance is mandatory because she gives in class assignments that you can't make up, so missing them can really hurt your grade.
Very nice and helpful instructor. I enjoyed taking her class and would recommend it to other students.
boring class, ambiguous test questions, useless in class assignments. Shes cool but not that good of a teacher
Go to her office hours. Her exam questions are ambiguous, but she'll help you with all the assignments. Go to class or you'll miss points on in-class assignments.
So nice and helpful, will explain things in a different way if you need. Lots of examples to help you understand. Very thorough. I recommend this prof!
Took intro to social psych with her. She is so nice and is very clear and interesting in her lectures. Not a blow off class but easy to understand.
Dr. Boyce is one of the nicest professors i have encountered at Ohio State.  Genuinly interested in her field, her students, and her school.  Take any class by her if you have the choice.
Dr. Boyce is awesome! She makes lectures interesting and has good stories that help you understand and remember the material. Go to class, take good notes, and you should do well!

summary_comment: The professor is highly knowledgeable and passionate about his subject, but his teaching style is challenging, with classes that are difficult to follow and grades heavily weighted towards a few high-stakes tests that do not always align with the material covered in lectures. Students find his explanations complex and his lectures monotonous, often consisting of little more than textbook graphs. Many students struggle with the lack of support materials and find the class structure demanding without adequate preparation tools.

Ratings.comment: Class was ridiculously hard. All grades were almost soley based on three tests which covered material he never talked about.
Smart.  Knowledgeable.  Expert in his field.  Loves his subject matter.  Pay attention.

he's a good professor and very knowledgeable, but sometimes his explanations are still very complex and don't help. the coursework consists of 5 short quizzes (the lowest quiz is dropped, 10% of your grade ), a 2 page paper (15%), a midterm (30%), and a final (45%). the final is graded on a curve. the slides he posts on carmen are super unhelpful.

His slides did not match the provided slides on canvas they were just graphs from the books. The class consisted of 5 pop quizzes, a paper, and a midterm/ final. No information or study guides were provided it was me and the textbook for this class (which didn't help much). Sign up for this class if you want to teach yourself.

This dude would talk in the most monotone voice making him extremely hard to pay attention to and his lectures were just him talking about graphs given in the textbook. 5 quizzes, a paper, and a final exam are the only grades. Quizzes have nothing to do with slides. Would go off on very long tangents about things not related to class. Horrible.
The worst professor I have ever experienced.
I can't hear what he is talking about wherever I sit and he had a lot of quizzes. The ppt he gave in class and on carmen are totally different! I won't have any of his class again.

- talks very quietly and is extremely hard to hear during his lectures. He offers a zoom which is nice if you cannot go to class 
- barely has any grades for you and the quizzes and tests are so hard and barely has anything to do with what is taught in lectures 
- no review guides, the slides only have pictures of graphs and no information

very intelligent guy but only gives slides he thinks are important. slides are just pictures of the graphs from the book. overall grade in the class is based on 4 quizzes, 1 paper, a midterm and a final. quizzes and tests are on completely different things that are not provided in the slides given
He teaches his classes in a very low voice that is impossible to hear, his lectures have nothing to do with the exams, and he provides no review. If you want to fail the class you can choose it.
Worst class ever in OSU, he is so boring and the quiz is unrelated to what he taught, half of the class got 1/0 from his quiz. Don't take this class. :)
Prof. Jagacinski is nice guy and fun to talk with. Really learned a lot from his class.

This class is supposed to be a basic psych requirement but I struggled a lot. He hands out notes but he leaves A LOT out so they don't make sense and he doesn't post any notes online. Pop quizzes, one midterm and a cumulative final so there are not many points. He is super nice but I would not recommend taking his class.

This is a class I'm assuming is supposed to be easy going and basic. His lectures have little if any relevance to the text book making it confusing to refer between the two for the tests. He wastes an unbelievable amount of paper, printing out his slides (which do not make sense even when explained). 0 study guide material, small amount of grades.
I'm in his class at the moment. I have tried so hard to pay attention, but I am confident that it is impossible. Painfully boring.
Excellent teacher.  Enjoys and knows his subject matter.  Friendly and helpful.
Though it's been nearly 5 years, I often refer to what I learned in this class in discussions with colleagues.
Richard is smart.  Pay attention.  You might learn something.  Actually, he is quite brilliant.  He enjoys his work, and is generally interested in progress of the students.

His lectures were boring, but he gave us handouts to follow along with, so that was helpful. He has 2 paper (easy), 4 quizzes (easy) and two test (moderately easy. I think I would take his class again.
His "slides" were incomprehensible. There were about 4 total grades in the class. It was boring.

Dr. Jagacinski was a very poor teacher. He never taught anything and his lectures were boring. Also, there are not many points in the class so it is easy to go down a letter grade and his midterms are pretty hard
Didn't teach us anything. Boring.

Spends entire 2-hour lecture posting random graphs and charts with no flow or purpose. Very hard to follow or understand, and overheads are hard to see. I expected a lot from the course, but was disappointed to see how he teaches. I haven't had his exam yet, but I'm not very optimistic given how he presents the material. Course packet's unorganized

Oh boy.  Dr. Jagacinski is a really nice guy, and it is obvious he knows this material well.  That being said, even he is not excited about the material.  Add to that, he teaches off of an ancient projector that forces one to be at the front of the lecture hall, it equals a pretty dull class.  Attendance is mandatory because he gives 4 pop quizzes.

TERRIBLE!!!! DONT TAKE with him!! He is a nice person, but his lectures were unbearably boring. The information is incredibly hard to understand from him. All he uses are graphs. It is just graph after graph after graph. Seriously consider a different class or teacher!!

Dr. J. is a nice enough guy, who certainly knows his stuff but not all people were meant to be teachers.  Several times he disgustedly woke people up who were sleeping in class.  Sure that's disrespectful of the student, but his monotonous droning and old fashioned overheads are somewhat responsible.
If you want to take a good nap, take his class.

He's a very nice guy who definitely wants his students to understand the material. This class is difficult and you have to read and completely understand the text (which is dry) in order to do well on the test but he is willing to help you and will explain the material until you understand if you go to his office hours. I would recommend.
Very difficult and hard. Boring

Dry sense of humor. Attendence is a MUST!! He gives 4 pop-quizzes. Lectures weren't very exciting, he uses overheads straight from the textbook. Dr. Jagacinski is very informative. Mid-term and final were difficult but do-able. It is best to read the textbook before class

dry/goofy sense of humor that I liked; lectures were informative although material itself wasnt always very interesting; genuinely nice person- you can tell he is brilliant, but if you want extra help you will need to be proactive about it; make sure you show up to class!

Probably the most boring professor I've ever had to listen to. His lectures are torture. They're boring and he tries to be funny but he's not, so that makes it even worse; also, you're forced to sit through these horrid lectures because he gives 4 pop quizzes. He pretty much only uses overheads that are straight from the textbook.

Common sense material, he's very boring, doesn't take attendance but has ONLY pop quizzes. It forces you to come to class. His lectures are extremely boring and he doesn't even have power point slides.. just boring overheads.

Very boring material and he is really confusing to listen to. If you don't know too much about stats.. he's not going to teach you the basics. He assumes you already know a lot about the topic. The material is so dry. He tries to slip some jokes into the lectures.. but it's just painfully boring.
Boring boring boring.  Just looked at graphs all day everyday for an hour and a half. Don't miss class or get the notes from someone else if you do miss it.

He is a really nice person and cares about you understanding the class.  It is a very boring class and text, but if you can get past that and work hard you can still do ok.  It's a hard class and he does just lecture with no notes other than graphs, but he'll help you as much as you're willing to go meet with him.

This class was tough to stick with.  He lectures right out of the book, (the text is pretty dense, too) and his lectures are boring (uses graphs on an overhead.)  But, if you can stick it out, he does use a curve since his exams are so tough.  It makes for a long quarter, but it's not impossible.  He is a nice guy, and does try to be helpful.

Mr. Jagacinski is a really nice person and it seems important to him that the students understand what he is teaching. He is very dedicated and knowledgeable. One time he actually went out of his way to help me correct the APA format on my paper, which I thought was really nice because it wasn't his place to have to do that. Lectures might be a lit

Basically teaches straight from the book, but only covers maybe 10% of what is tested, and the book itself is practically one big block of monotonous text, so have fun reading that. You will get full points taken off of papers for improper citation and then find out those points are equate to full points off the final grade.
Oh my god....I've been here for 4 years - worst teacher ever.  Very nice - but you WILL fall asleep in this class!!! Monotone, Mumbling..the works!

Dr. Jagacinski is a nice man who is genuinely interested in his subject matter.  His degree is from Harvard or some other Ivy League school and his genius exceeds his ability to communicate the material clearly.
the course was good, but the tests were difficult, and the homework was unclear. It would have also been nice if he had presented research from the last decade.
This is an easy class, if you don't don't get this guy. I heard all the other professors are more clear and they have better grading systems. Get another Professor for Pysch 300!!
Very nice man.  This professor really knows his stuff, and will explain if asked, about anything you don't understand.  Don't be afraid to ask him.  I recommend him to other students.

VERY BORING!! It was very hard to stay alert and attentive in his class. It was also rather difficult to understand him, he mumbles alot. His tests are difficult unless you read and do flashcards on terms and stuff for the class.
Borrrring...lectures on an on about pointless over head graphs that everyone can barely even see.  The class material is easy, but the tests were hard and confusing.
He's VERY boring and lectures seem pointless but then he pulls random questions out of nowhere.  He's generally easy, but you'll be bored to tears.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as highly effective, with students praising his engaging class, comprehensive coverage of material through research paper readings, and his availability to help and answer questions. During the transition to online learning due to COVID-19, he demonstrated flexibility by providing detailed overview videos and maintaining regular communication with students. Conversely, another set of students found his teaching style and course structure to be ineffective, citing issues with unclear grading criteria and insufficient project instructions, leading them to strongly advise avoiding his class.

Ratings.comment: Literally one of my favorite professors and classes I have ever taken! You read 4 research papers a week and have exams over it, get 12 completion EC points, and present three times. Sounds intimidating but it is really interesting class! I would highly recommend. The class is very engaging and he is always there to help and answer questions!!!

COVID-19: His response to courses going virtual was amazing. All lectures were asynchronous, except group project meetings every few weeks. Instead of lectures, he made overview videos that summarized important points. Did a mid-class survey to check in with students and was willing to make changes. Plenty of opportunities for points via quizzes.

The WORST psych professor I have ever had. The textbook is $200 & he refuses to post the slides. Gives you a week's worth of information every single class. Has the most unclear grading criteria & gives you a bad grade for not knowing what he wanted. Gave ONE paragraph of instructions on the huge semester long project. Avoid him if you can!

summary_comment: Dr. Bengal is highly regarded by students for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which significantly enhances the learning experience. However, while many students find his classes enjoyable and not particularly challenging, they note that the initial lectures can be difficult and the grading is mainly based on weekly assignments and exams. Students consistently recommend taking a class with him due to his exceptional teaching skills.

Ratings.comment: This was my 3rd class I took with him. I honestly hated the class, I loved him as a professor but I hated the  class compared to psych 3375. You have 2 weekly assignments, exam, random tophat questions and that basically your grade. You do get a cheat sheet for your exams. The class is chill but the lectures were rough for me. Easy A- class though

This was my 2nd class I took with him. The class was ok, I loved him as a professor but the class was not my favorite compared to psych 3375. You have 2 weekly assignments, exam, and some tophat questions and that basically your grade. You do get a cheat sheet for your exams. The class is chill but the beginning lectures were rough for me.

The best professor I have had here. i scheduled another class with him for next semester solely because he is teaching it. Super interesting and funny guy and the class is not very hard if you pay attention

Best professor ever. I've taken his classes twice, both asynchronous online and in person. Even his asynchronous class/lectures were interesting. I tried to take his class again next semester but didn't need the credit. His classes were genuinely the highlight of my day.

Dr. Bengal is an amazing lecturer, about halfway through the semester the information gets stale. I recommend not skipping class because the exams are difficult and fully based off of what he talks about in class. Other than that, the weekly survey and journals are very easy, really only a couple other assignments and no cumulative final.

Dr. Bengal is just the most spectacular professor I have ever had at OSU. I feel honestly honored to have taken his class, and you bet I will take more. Definitely take a class with him if you have the chance!!!

Steven Bengal is the funniest professor I have ever had. He makes you want to attend lecture since he makes the content engaging, interesting, and can lighten the serious content with his humor. He is not a tough grader so if you do the work you should do good. I cannot recommend him enough, he is an amazing professor.
He's funny

Really a great professor and an interesting class, would recommend to anyone looking for an engaging class. I feel all of the assignments were easy enough and if I didn't miss one of the exams, I would have easily gotten an A without much studying
BEST PROFESSOR EVER! Exams are easy enough, cheat sheet on every exam, and tons of extra credit. He makes lecture fun and definitely recommend.

Great professor. His class was test-heavy, but he allowed a cheat sheet. Assignments are clearly instructed and he grades easily. He does not respond to emails fast, but when he does it is very helpful. Made class engaging and fun. it is very helpful when he does

I think I may be in love with him. Best professor of my life, I think. Don't know how anyone will top this. Hilarious and engaging lectures--he is clearly incredibly smart and truly understands the subject inside and out and is passionate about teaching it. Syllabus and slides and creatively made in Canva and are organized really well.

One of the best professors at OSU by far. Lectures were always entertaining but material itself can be boring especially if you have taken other law/crim classes. Assignments are kind of tedious and feel pointless, but I would do whatever assignments to take Dr. Bengal tbh. Oh also extra credit!
He was one of my favorite professors that I had at ohio state!!

Dr. Bengal kept every single lecture fun and entertaining. While lectures were not mandatory he did do tophats for grades and you did not know when he would do them. But the lectures were a class I never found myself dreading to go to. Pretty exam heavy, with some tricky questions. Overall, this has been my favorite class I have taken so far!

Lecture is never boring, you usually won't want to skip this class. The grading is very clear and there are a few extra credit points up for grab. All assignments have a flexible deadline of a week which is super helpful. His exams aren't set up to trick you --> go to lecture, pass the exams. Oh, and always do the cheat sheets.

Steven was a truly incredible professor. This class was incredibly entertaining. He was hilarious and witty and made paying attention to the lecture much easier. The material is also relatively easy and straight-forward. No complaints at all.

best professor I have had and love this class! You have 3 exams which you get a notesheet (ec). The assignments seems bad but they really aren't! You also have 2 weekly assignments but they are just for completion. Show up to class and write down all the examples! Examples are key for the class!!!!
Very fun, passionate, and entertaining.

One of the easiest classes I've taken, almost too easy. A couple of assignments a week, shouldn't take more than an hour, no reading required. He's a great, engaging, and funny professor, though gets off topic really easily. In my case, these tangents meant missing out on potentially interesting topic areas due to time constraints.

I wouldnt count on him responding to emails, if you go to office hours hes very good. All assignments have a one week grace period which is a lifesaver. No exams are cumulative and you are allowed a notes sheet for all of them. He does take attendance which really is important took me from an A+ to B+. recorded lectures are bonus class is very fun
Funny.

Another slayful semester with Dr. Bengal. I've taken three of his classes and all of them have been amazing. His lectures are very informative and funny, and he is very open to questions and goes above and beyond to answer them.

Absolute gem of a professor with excellent humor, fascinating and quirky anecdotes and plethora of OBJECTIVE psychology studies (and he's got a TON of passion for psychology and his favorite experiments)! Really down-to-earth, caring, and open-minded. Workload is light, tests are fair, and takeaways are deep and practical. Best GE diversity class!

I adore Professor Bengal as a human, but not as a prof.. I was frustrated because one of the exams was way harder than the rest, and everyone I knew consistently did poorly. Lots of A students with 66 %. He is super funny and approachable but does not often answer emails or questions. Grading is unclear sometimes, participation grade is scattered.

this man is so real. aside from that he's very caring and handles the subject matter in a very sensitive and informative way that helps us to gain a different perspective on the topic. lectures are great, not too much homework, and exams are easy if you study!

Group work is terrible, but Dr. Bengal makes it bearable! This class was very challenging, but Dr. Bengal was there to support us every step of the way. He gives wonderful feedback, and his great sense of humor helps numb the pain when that feedback is negative. He's quite literally an award-winning instructor, so take his classes!

I'm writing this to those of you who attend the first day of class and think, "Wow, this guy sounds so annoying." I thought the same thing on the first day, but I was quickly humbled. Steven is the funniest professor I've had at OSU and he can thoroughly relate the content to the students. He actually teaches and I felt prepared for every exam.

Absolutely loved Steven Bengal as a professor. Literally, the best professor I've ever had hands down. His exams can be vigorous but his class is an absolute must-take, a professor I will never forget.

Dr. Bengal is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. Funny, engaging, and eccentric. Cheat sheets for exams, but make sure you go to class and pay moderate attention because the slides are not self-explanatory.

He's an eccentric and funny guy with excellent music taste. Initially, I was intimidated and scared for my wellbeing in this class, but because he's very good at explaining and teaching, I ended up doing very well. He also gives good feedback if you meet with him during office hours.

Super interesting and eccentric guy. His voice is really funny to listen to. Explains the materials very clearly and tries to answer questions all the time. Even though data analysis seems like a dull class he actually makes it a lot more engaging. Would recommend taking any of his classes.

I really enjoyed this class, and though I may not have always understood the material, Dr. Bengal was more than willing to help with any questions I had.
