summary_comment: Dr. Leuner is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and engaging content, despite occasionally reading from slides. Her classes are known for being self-sufficient, with all lectures available online, and she offers multiple opportunities for extra credit. Students appreciate her accessibility and ability to integrate real-world examples and social issues into the curriculum.

Ratings.comment: This was one of my favorite classes of the semester. Yes, she does read from the slides at times, but she often elaborates and gives further details if people ask questions. It's an interesting subject and she teaches it well. There are optional extra credit assignments throughout the semester, and exams come from the lectures, which are recorded.

This class isn't bad at all if your a neuro major. There are three midterms, one of which you can skip, and a final, as well as a small paper. She posts all lectures online, so I never went unless it was a test day. One thing I thought was off about her is that she's weird about questions. Might as well not even ask because she isn't gonna know.

hormones and behavior is a good adv class to take but be prepared to not learn much from lecture. she stands there and reads her slides verbatim. her exams are straight forward but cover a lot of material. lots of true/false questions and the rest of exam are mcq. she gives easy homework assignments and small ec opportunities.

4644 is a good class for the sequenced advanced psych class, but I had to study a lot to get good grades. the lectures are pretty boring and when you ask questions in class she usually doesn't even know the answer. there are extra credit opportunities and the homework is easy, but the exams can be tough. overall, its a fair class.

Dr. Leuner is wonderful! Her lectures were exceptionally well-organized with clear information and lots of real-world examples. I appreciated how she worked in relevant cultural topics and integrated science + society together.  Outside of class, she prioritizes communication and is accessible to answer questions and provide guidance.

Dr. Leuner is a great professor, and I really loved the class! I loved how she worked some important social issues into her presentations. The class is super interesting, which always makes studying easier! Her quizzes and final were very fair.

You don't need to show up to this class to do well. All lectures are posted online and her exams come directly off that. Sometimes there are experiments that are on the slides that may be unclear if you don't show up to class. I only showed up to class on exam days and started studying 3-4 days before. She also drops lowest exam and provides EC

Might be the easiest upper-level neuro class OSU offers. Dr. Leuner is great and the material you learn is very useful for the MCAT. Never went to class and studied for exams the night before and got an easy A. She offers extra credit for every exam. Highly recommend using Anki to keep up with the material. VERY EASY A!! TAKE this class.

I LOVE Dr. Leuner. She's very relaxed about teaching and just wants her students to understand more about hormones and the brain. There are 4 multiple choice exams and 10 points of extra credit given throughout the course. One exam is dropped from your grade, but you have to take the final. She can be so funny during lecture too in very subtle ways

Dr. Leuner is a great professor and she is always willing to help her students with their problems. Her lecture is very comprehensive and her exam is fairly easy, of course as long as you study for it.

Dr. Leuner is great. This was by far one of my favorite Neuro courses. Would leave class everyday fascinated. Drops lowest Midterm grade but ended up allowing us to drop our cumulative final because the averages were low. Super fair and great!
Dr. Leuner is one of the best professors I've ever had! She is passionate about what she teaches and cares that students do well.

So, 4 tests, hard, and thats it for grades. Some extra credit, but not enough to actually help. She only reads off the slides, so going to class is a waste of time. Must read the book and extra articles for tests. Her tests are also very wordy and you slip up on them if you don't take your time. Not one to boost your GPA--difficult :(
Extremely bright professor, very knowledgable, and always willing to go above and beyond to help students understand the material. Would take another class with Dr. Leuner in a heartbeat.

Dr. Leuner is very clear in her lec. which are based on slides. Textb. difficult to get through; highly technical and dry. Exams mainly based off of lec. & slides. 4644 Hormones and Behavior has a lot of info. Dr. Leuner seems to keep it on the simpler side, so if you are a neuroscience extraordinaire, it may not be detailed enough for your taste.
Class isn't difficult if you attend and study the notes. Enjoyed the subject matter and thought it was interesting. Dr. Leuner is a good lecturer and her exams are very fair.

Dr. Leuner is a really great teacher! I feel like I learn a lot from her, and she is challenging in a good way. I took Behavioral Neuro with her and am now taking Hormones and Behavior and I love both classes.

summary_comment: Juan is an excellent professor known for his clear and understandable lectures, accommodating policies such as open-note exams and multiple extra credit opportunities, and his use of Top Hat questions to track participation without mandatory attendance. He is generally described as kind and very supportive of his students' learning.

Ratings.comment: Juan was a great professor. His lectures were easy to understand, exams were open-note, and there were several extra credit opportunities. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but he randomly assigned Top Hat questions to track participation. You didn't have to be there all the time to get full points, though. Overall, he's very accommodating and kind.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for their exceptional teaching quality, characterized by kindness, care, and an engaging approach. Lectures are straightforward and easy to follow, with interesting content that is relevant to real-life situations. Exams are fair and open note, offering ample extra credit opportunities, and the professor is known for being extremely understanding and helpful.

Ratings.comment: Best professor this semester!! Kind, caring, and a very chill professor. Lectures are straight forward, easy to understand, examples, etc. Exams are very fair, open note, and you have lots of extra credit opportunities throughout semester. Interesting content that's applicable to real life. Highly recommend!

The kindest professor I have ever had! She is so kind and her lectures were always very interesting and easy to understand. Her class activities were engaging and interesting as well. Super understanding and helpful! Couldn't recommend her more.

summary_comment: This professor offers a relaxed yet effective learning environment with minimal attendance requirements but includes easy group assignments and regular TopHat quizzes that significantly contribute to the grade. She provides ample opportunities for makeup work and extra credit, ensuring students can maintain high grades with consistent effort. Her supportive demeanor makes the class accessible and highly recommended.

Ratings.comment: This class was a breath of fresh air. Attendance isn't mandatory but there are very easy group assignments and TopHats done randomly during class that are a big part of your grade. There are many chances to make up any missed points and gain extra credit. She is very nice and supportive. You will get an A by just showing up. I would recommend!

summary_comment: The professor is known for her straightforward and manageable assessment methods, with weekly easy quizzes based on provided vocabulary lists, and three relatively simple exams. She is described as very approachable and accommodating, offering extra credit opportunities and flexible support during challenging times. Overall, the class structure allows for a low-stress environment where achieving high grades is feasible.

Ratings.comment: There's a quiz every week but they're really easy and just on the vocab. She gives you a list of words to study and you just answer around 10 questions on them. Definitions come from the textbook.

Very nice and wholesome teacher that accommodated students' needs when things got difficult. Class had 3 exams. All the psych 1100 exams were very easy and the weekly quizzes were a little difficult but other than that, it was easy to get an A in the classes. Top Hat questions in lectures that were graded and lots of extra credit opportunities.

summary_comment: Dr. Givens is known for his fairness in grading and ability to explain complex concepts clearly, though his lectures can be dense and focused more on advanced topics than introductory material. Students appreciate his accessibility and willingness to help, but note that the course structure—with a heavy emphasis on exams—requires significant dedication and memorization. Overall, while the class can be challenging, many find it rewarding due to his supportive nature and helpful hints for exams.

Ratings.comment: Even though most of your grade is based on exams, he grades them extremely fairly and always tries to give his students points. It's important to take notes while he's lecturing because some of what he says will be on the exam, but he does a fantastic job of explaining everything at a speed you can understand and answers questions very well :)

Givens shouldn't be teaching an intro neuroscience class. Seems like his lectures are aimed more towards grad students. 3 exams are worth almost all of your grade and require an insane amount of studying. Questions on exams come from a topic he mentioned once or twice in a lecture. Nice guy and really helpful, he's just teaching the wrong class.

I think Dr. Givens really cares about what he teaches, but I feel as though he didn't do a very good job of teaching the material. Instead of what he used to do, there are three exams and very few other assignments. The exams themselves are quite difficult and require a lot of memorization and dedication to get down. However, this is neuroscience.

Dr. B was a great prof, esp during the pandemic. He was accommodating. For the online class, there's no final. Just a quiz every alt week, and very basic homework assignments. He was always v helpful and accessible. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it's harder to get an A if you don't pay attention. Gives hints about questions before quizzes.

2 midterms, 1 final, 1 group presentation, 1 unofficial presentation and 1 short essay. The grading is clear. No text book use. The course materials were complicated and there were a bunch of things to remember, but Bennet was always willing to help you with that. Participation is not required, but it was hard to get high grade without attending.

He was super nice and caring, and always accessible outside of class. He often gave us hints for potential exam questions, which was very helpful. 2 midterms and a final, with multiple choice and choice of short answer. I found his lectures to be pretty engaging and he was happy to answer questions as class went along. I would take his class again!

While Dr. Givens can be quiet and scatter-brained, he is such a nice guy. He validated all the concerns I had on my presentation and research articles. This course was mostly discussion based, so it was mostly students presenting. You'll be bored a lot, it can be time consuming for essay exams that you write in advance, but its not too stressful.

The class have a lot of memorization. However, the exams are straightforward and have extra credit. Print slides before class and/or add notes from his lecture to the slides. He only focuses on important points and some exam questions are from his lecture (not on slides). He didn't really agree with textbook sometimes. One presentation assignment.

Dr. Givens is a great professor who genuinely cares about the material and helping students learn more.  The class is pretty tough, and I would recommend it only if you're a psych/neuroscience major; as I'm only a psych minor (business major) it was actually the hardest class I've taken at OSU.
Not too difficult but not too easy. 3 hr long lecture was boring but overall not bad. Never touched textbook...
Was a little...okay very monotone and the lectures were a bit of a bore but all the info you needr is on the power points and his jeopardy games help a lot. Overall a decent teacher.
Easy, lecture wasn't necessary as he basically read right off slides, but exams are online and you have ample time

Talks so quiet! Class is boring but not terrible, 3 online exams and 2 assignments. Sounds easy, but he expects extreme detail in answers so if it isn't perfect you will miss points. Zero curve and only 200 points so hard to get better than an A- in my opinion. Frustrating but not too bad if you are familiar with neuroscience.
He was an Amazing teacher; very informative and the class was a breeze (very easy)

Class was relatively easy. Lectures are somewhat boring, but his PowerPoints are incredibly useful. The exams come straight from them. Make sure you pay attention in class because there will be exam questions that cover material that he vocalizes.

Lectures are long and boring. He claims his test material comes out of the slides, but I found the book way more helpful. Tests are very difficult, but he curves them, which helps a lot. Difficult, but technically do-able class. On an unrelated note: he's kinda hot in a bizarre way
Very boring lectures. I found myself learning more from the textbook than the lectures. Tests were moderate.. not impossible though.

He seemed very friendly/eager to help students, but he was a terrible lecturer. He was very vague about a lot of his slides and generally seemed uninterested in most of the material. Tests were very difficult.

Super friendly and helpful. Lectures could get dry, but the material is really interesting.  He tries to stick to what you need to know, but will also go more in depth if people ask.  You can really see his passion for the field even though he is a bit monotone.

Super nice guy, crazy-making quiet/scattered lecturer. If you don't know much about neuroscience you'll have to teach yourself from the book (what I did) or spend lots of time with him one-on-one. He's probably much better for advanced students.

This professor is very boring. It is very tempting to just skip class and teach yourself from the book.  He is helpful one on one because you can constantly ask questions.  For such a boring class, it didn't help that he didn't provide any way of making it interesting.  This class is required for my major and I might have to retake it, yikes!
Hard class, but professor was sooo willing to help. He made pretty dry material interesting. Very straightforward and tells you what he expects.

I took this class for summer quarter, basically three lectures a class. But the prof did his best to make it clear. I liked his style, low key. Probably boring for people who aren't interested in neuroscience or biology.
He's a great teacher. I missed a few classes toward the end of the quarter that led to me not doing as well on the final as I'd hoped.
An exellent professor, and a nice person,too.

He is a nice enough guy but do NOT take him for summer quarter.  He crammed whole weeks of lectures into each class.  3 lectures a day! The tests are somewhat hard but he offered review sessions.  He is somewhat disorganized and it seems like the lectures aren't in a good order.  I guess he is fine for an already bad class.

He is a really nice guy and knows his stuff very well. In lecture sit in the front to make sure you hear him. I found his class very easy. He posts all his notes online. To succeed all you need to do is memorize the notes because all the test questions come from the online notes.

He's perfectly nice and all, but I found his lectures kind of dry and his teaching style awkward. The material also wasn't quite what I was expecting- it was much heavier on the neuroanatomy and physiology than on the relationship with behavior. Two midterms and a final, 50? each, so that wasn't bad...I just found the whole experience boring.

An inevitable class for psych majors, this professor is not bad, It's all about brain chemistry/circuits and the CNS. Fun if you like hard core neuroscience.  I ended up with a C without too much effort. The class average was an 80%. Study hard though!
Great teacher, and not bad looking. Very helpful, and cares about his students. Very down to earth, and knows the material inside out.
I liked this teacher. He is helpful, down to earth, and not bad looking. He is a nice guy over all. I took his class after a few students recommended it. They liked the guy too.

A great teacher, but make sure to sit near the front, as he speaks quietly.  You really have to go to both lecture and read the text to do well.  I STRONGLY recommend asking for his grad student, Karen, as a tutor if you don't have a background in biology.  She's GREAT at dumbing the material down and making it easy to remember.

Professor who is very enthusiastic about his subject (but gets embarrassed when he gets too excited). Attractive in an odd way and has great legs. Looks like Bert from Sesame Street. Take his class!! =D
All of notes are posted online... for lecture he just reads off of the notes.
hard class, must know biology well and understand it. boring class, long lectures. hard but tests are all multiple choice not tricky tests.

Great class!It should be considerably easier for anyone with a bio backgraound and I think the psych majors will have to do extra work outside to understand the biology parts.  Prof was always willing to answer questions outside of class and was generally likeable.  His voice is quiet, so sit close to the front to prevent distractions.
Great professor if you're willing to put in the work.  If you're lazy, you'll do poorly.  Otherwise, just go to the lectures, read the text, and you'll easily get an A.
Great Prof.  Highly recommend.  Whoever says its boring is probably boring themselves.
Very kind and intelligent.
This class could easily be one of the most boring I've ever had to sit through and because of that I rarely attended, monotoned, and lecture seems disorganized.
great prof - very smart.  office hours were the best way to get help.  midterms were tough, but he tells you what to study in lecture.

I attempted this class twice, but had to drop halfway thru because I can't sit thru class. He will tell you directly that he doesn't care if you do well in his class-he will not help you. He speaks in monotone, mumbles, and teaches as if your a moron if you don't already know the material.
Just a lot of memorization... three 50 question multiple choice tests make up the entire grade. Pretty easy class and there's no point in going to lecture
The lectures were not helpful and he was not good at explaining anything.  The test reviews are pointless.
No Comments
Regardless of whatever people before said, his tests came DIRECTLY from his lectures.  Everything.  You just REALLY have to pay attention to everything he says in class.
inconsistencies in his explanations

Regardless of prof psychobio is hard!  Tests were right out of the book, even though he said he only tests on lectures. He lectured as though he expected you already knew most the info. Also, lectures were monotone hard to stay awake in. However, I've heard he's tons easier than other 313 profs.

Dr. Givens is a horrible prof...when I asked him for some help he told me that there wasn't much else I could do that I wasn't already doing and then told me not to concentrate on the book because his lecture material is from an old book,but then the questions on the exam come straight from the book

Heard so many horror stories about psychobio, but was told to definitely take it with Givens.  I am actually doing excellent in this class, but DEFINITELY know the info.  He's a very smart guy and knows his stuff.  Be prepared for specific exam questions.  But he's a good professor and a real cutie!
Amazing! Loved him! the material is pretty tough and sometimes overwhelming but he is MORE than willing to help! really nice guy
Doesn't care if you do good or bad, very dry in class, sometimes I don't think he understands what he is saying and if he does he can't explain it to the rest of the class.  Terrible teacher!!!

Awesome class. Interesting, but he is a bit dry in his lecture. I thought the multiple choice exams were ridiculously easy, always over a 97. Just pay attention to his slides. Didnt even touch the book.
Yikes! Agreed, tests were absurd and waaay detailed! be afraid.

I agree with the person below me.  He never emailed me back either!  The lectures were DULL and did not touch 1/2 as deep as the questions on the test he expected us to know!  Read the book and lectures and am still doing horrible!

Tests were absurd. There were things on them not mentioned in lecture or in the text. Lectures were vague and dull. This professor never responded to my emails. I did better in Biochem 511 than in this class if that tells you anything.
Givens is hot!  Besides that, he wants the students to understand the material and is willing to go out of his way to help them.
Great person, always willing to help out students in any ways he can.  A must have Professor.
No Comments
I actually took 313 with Prof Givens and chose to take 512 b/c he was teaching it.  Awesome instructor.  Very helpful, will write letter of recom for almost anyone
No Comments

summary_comment: Dr. Myung's teaching style is polarizing among students. Some appreciate his passion for the subject matter and find his classes engaging despite the dense content, while others find them confusing and poorly structured, leading to poor performance unless significant effort is put in. Overall, his classes are challenging but offer opportunities for extra credit and leniency in grading.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Myung is a great professor even though the things he taught were extremely boring to me. I think he knows it can get dense so he tries to make it funny sometimes. There's a lot of reading to do in this class, but you can get away with doing the bare minimum that is required for the eight reaction papers. The exams are all true false so not bad.
Please avoid taking any classes with him. One of the worst professors at OSU!

If you want a professor who will give you a zero for a simple mistake then he is the right professor. Not only is his lectures hard to follow due to him only standing in the middle of the class and getting side tracked talking about anything else other than the material we are being tested over, but also he gives no assistance whatsoever.

If you're taking 5612 as an elective for CSE, find something else. Class is run abysmally and his lecture slides are the worst I've seen at OSU by far. His lectures are damn near impossible to follow, as he goes on tangents about his conferences or his college life. He's a nice guy, but don't take his class if you actually want to learn something.

Tough but fair, one of my best professors yet! You will not regret taking his class, but you should regret not taking the time to learn the material. Ignore reviews on his accent, he is well spoken. He is fair and upfront about the grading scale, but it is tough. I found he is the best instructor of PSYCH3312. Also READ READ READ, the book is good!

People either love or hate Dr. Myung. He is incredibly passionate about the material he teaches, so he tends to touch on all the developing topics he's excited about, even if they aren't related to class material. If you love the material you're learning, you will definitely enjoy his classes; if you're going since it's required, then likely not.

Myung is a terrible prof, please don't take him. He covers a wide range of material at a superficial level so it's hard to know exactly what you need to know. He told us in class today NOT to study for our first exam because he needs some way to differentiate our grades - everyone does well on the essays and he needs some people to fall behind.

He gave lots of extra credit and easy going. No attendance. HOWEVER, this course is NOT EASY AT ALL! Though it's a psychology course, it almost all about neural networks. For passing this, you must know programming (use MATLAB), multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and more. HE IS THE ONLY CHOICE IF YOU WANT TO TAKE THIS COURSE. So, be prepared.

Only teaches concepts in class and says only basic math is required. You need to know calculus. If you don't already know how to code you'll struggle. We all struggled through the homework. Luckily there were a few knowledgeable people in the class. He did give relaxed grades on some of the homework and projects though.

He is an amazing person. Really nice and understanding. He cares for all of his students, and encourages people to visit him outside of class to talk about their interests. His lectures, however, were monotone and it was easy to fall asleep through. Thankfully, he is very clear with what he expects the students to know on both exams and papers.

His accent isn't the worst that I've heard, but there are still a fair amount of times that you have to think about what he said. Seems like he cares more about the history and people involved in the topics discussed than the material itself. Also he is more interested in talking about his work and what conferences he's attending than teaching.

Be sure to look at your exam after it's graded because many of the "correct" answers don't make sense. You should challenge them. Will ask about dates of research and other useless trivia on exams. Helps to take statistics class prior this one. Lectures weren't that exciting but you must attend or there's no chance you'll pass the exam!

I spent more time trying to understand what he was saying than actually learning anything.  I hated this class more than any class I've ever taken in three years of college.  He was TERRIBLE and I don't know if he could have made the material any more boring.  TAKE MY WORD FOR IT, DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS FROM THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!!

He is the worst teacher ever. He just talks at you and doesn't really make sense while he does it. The tests are super hard and he weights them really heavily. Multiple choice questions worth 6 points each!WTF?! Don't take this class with him!

This is the worst professor I have ever had!  He has the most boring lectures (very thick accent and monotonous voice) ever but you have to go to get the notes.  His exams are hard and before our first exam he said that if he said something that didn't agree with the book to go with what he said!  Overall the worst professor I've ever had!

This guy is terrible! Not only are his lectures incredibly boring, but he also contradicts himself constantly. I went to all of the lectures, but he posts the lecture notes on Carmen, so you'd do fine w/o going to class. The midterms were harder than the final. Terrible professor. Avoid Jay Myung if at all possible!
The most boring class I have every taken. He has no speaking variation. I think I went 5 times all quarter and atill got a B

He is not very nice or helpful. He speaks English but has a hard time with pronouncing words. His homeworks are easy but his lectures are boring. For our class, right before the exam he changed the chapters that would be covered by adding another one.
To sum him up as a teacher he was horrible. He was incoherent in lecture and in his tests. The tests were extremely tricky. Hopefully I don't come across any more bad teachers like him.

I think he may be the worst prof I've had at Ohio State.  Horrible at explaining things, not at all willing to help, and his accent is so hard to understand that I spend more time trying to figure out what he said than actually learning the material.

This class is manditory, so I would suggest keeping up with your math.  The grading is pretty strict but otherwise he's a cool guy.  You'll receive extra points for questions that "spark" the intellect, and that he likes.  He'll help you out if necessary.  Don't feel shy to visit him at office hours.
not helpful, terrible teacher

Despite his accent he is able to communicate the material thoroughly, speaks better english than most native speakers. Learnt a great deal in his class  as he encourages and spends time explaining things if you come halfway. Is very rigorous and knowledgeable but not inflexible, I have had him as an advisor so I know. I recomend meeting him halfway
Poor explanations, poor teaching, poor professor. nuff said.

Accent is not hard to understand but a lot of times he has trouble understanding your questions.  His exams are hard to understand because some questions it is obvious that english is not his first language. The class shouldn't be hard but because of that it is.  Homeworks are graded for correctness which is also hard.  Only take if ur good at math

i had him some time ago,i am fine with his accent. but he's pretty good at making simple things complicated, and he weigh a lot on Math. the test is not that hard and it should not be, but he's not very clear maybe that's why the test seem weired. and yes,it's like an essay test+true or false(very tricky!!!)!very helpful though,an ok person!
You aren't allowed to ask questions in lecture, and he doesn't base his exams on the homework at all.  The homework is math problems, and the exams are essays.

This guy sucks, hands down.  I wish another teacher taught this class.  I have no problem with his accent, but he mumbles to himself quietly and then continues teaching in the same voice so you miss a lot of what he says.  He needs lessons in how to speak to an audience.  His exams sucks balls, it's like he's trying to make you fail

I don't know how this guy got smileys. he is awful.  I know the material backward and forward and did not do well on the midterm.  The questions are just dumb and he totally contradicts himself. I have taken 5 other psych classes and gotten A's in every one of them.  Except this one. Steer clear! Take stats 145

Prof was great.  The class had hard bits but it was interesting and more theory-oriented than I expected.  I didn't notice his accent after the first ten minutes and I haven't had a prof as interested --genuinely interested -- in teaching and students in a long, long time.

Poor guy had pit-stains. While I could understand him despite his accent, the material wasn't clear until the lab TA went over it again. Puts WAY TOO MUCH WEIGHT on the true/false questions. I was getting As on the hws and Cs and Ds on the exams. Scraped a B, total, because of point distributions.

The lab instructor gives better explanations in lab than he does in lecture. He mumbles, and the exams are nothing like the review he gives you. Not at all like stats classes I have taken in the past. Not a hard class,but not fun AT ALL!

Interesting class and an interesting area for him to be teaching, seeing as he is in the Quant Psych Dept.  His test weren't too bad although, he does look for very specific answers, which if you don't give he is very strict on giving any slack for such.  Awesome accent as well, for any ling majors.

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Bayesian Statistics for Psychological Data

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Bayesian Statistics for Psychological Data

SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Bayesian Statistics for Psychological Data

summary_comment: Dr. Wasserman is highly regarded for his kindness and understanding, making the learning process approachable and supportive. He effectively teaches R Studio and provides numerous opportunities for extra credit and second chances, making the course manageable even for challenging material. Students find his classes engaging and often recommend him, though some note occasional disorganization and technical issues.

Ratings.comment: He is very kind and understanding to his students and does his best to be personable. He does a walkthrough assignment that is almost exactly the same as the assignment that is graded, so it makes it easy to complete and work off of. The tests are open book and you can take them any time during the exam day.

Pretty funny and caring guy who definitely wants his students to succeed. Class was a bit disorganized and as someone who had prior knowledge of most of the concepts, still confusing, but overall it was a fun class. Pretty technology dependent but he teaches R studio well. Tests weren't hard and homework was longish but easy.

Dr. Wasserman was a great professor. He made difficult concepts understandable and he taught R Studio very well. Understanding R Studio is crucial to doing well in this class, so this is not one you want to skip! Most of the exams were online with 2 attempts, and he offers an abundant amount of extra credit. His dry humor was also pretty funny.

If you like dogs and dad jokes, then Dr. Wasserman is the instructor for you! He wants everyone to succeed, so his assignments and exams always mirror our in-class activities. Lots of extra credit and second chances. Despite how intimidating it looked at first, he made it very easy to learn R Studio. Would recommend him.

Dr. W. wants his students to succeed and provides plenty of opportunities to do so. Material can be challenging but all you need is a basic understanding. Attendance matters because of TopHat, but you can zoom in if you want. Best professor I've had at OSU when it comes to teaching software. Exams are online async which makes it easy.

Literally one of the best professors out there!! He is so caring and accommodating. He is always there to help and gives students many chances to do well in class. Definitely the best professor I ever had at Ohio State. 100% recommend him for Psych 3321!!

Nice class, take it. He's one of the most patient and empathetic professors I've ever had. Good at explaining, structured & organized lecture and slides. Lecture is lowkey funny too. The content may be hard for some, but trust me (I've tried other like 2 profs) he really made it as easy as it could be.

I could tell that Dr. Wasserman had a very hard time teaching this class from the lack or organization and abundance of mistakes. All the material taught in the course was not new info for most of students (taught in the prereq course- PSYCH2220), however test averages were very low because of the poor grammar and rules that he used.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her excellent teaching quality, delivering engaging and informative lectures that effectively help students understand the material. Her organization and respect for her students, provided they engage appropriately, contribute to a positive learning environment. However, some students have noted that her summer classes move at a rapid pace, and a few have found her less effective, suggesting she may not be suitable for all types of learners.

Ratings.comment: This is your dream professor. Amazing lectures that really help you understand the material. She cares about her lectures, very organized, and very respectful as long as you apply yourself in her class.
One of the best professors. She moves fast, but she knows how to put the information in your mind.
Do not recommend taking Summer class with Dr.Bailey.
worst teacher ive ever had.. literally taught me nothing
Shes an awesome professor, the way she teaches makes the class very interesting! Highly recommended!!

summary_comment: Dr. Ladanyi is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and passion for teaching, though some find his exams challenging. Students appreciate his fairness, in-class reviews, and willingness to help, noting that attendance significantly impacts performance. Many recommend his classes, citing his down-to-earth personality and commitment to student success.

Ratings.comment: Wonderful human and professor. Take any classes you can with Dr. Ladanyi! Exams aren't easy, but they are fair and he provides you with in class review and a practice test the week of. Go to class, lectures are engaging and it is difficult to succeed if you skip, attendance matters for exam performance and your overall grade in the class.
I deeply enjoyed his class, and I wish he taught more than two classes. Live laugh loved him. Super helpful works with students and is very passionate about what he teaches, and you can tell. 10/10

Lectures were very confusing, he was never clear on what exactly we had to do. For exams, I am jealous of people that took 2300 from a different professor and finished with minimal coursework and high grades (and NO exams). Def only take this professor if you absolutely need to. There are many better professors at OSU.

Best prof I could have had for this course. I ended up loving the class and he made the materal interesting. In order to secure an A, read the textbook and review. The class is extremely tied to the textbook. He cares about attendance so go to lectures,he gives lots of examples though so theyre helpful. Overall, really nice and cares about students
His classes are amazing! He is a great teacher, and I would definitely take his classes again

Jesse is a really down to Earth, who really cares about his students. If you put in the work you will for sure get a good grade. I loved this class, and he made it so interesting to learn about. He love's feedback from his students and wants to really make the class the best it can. Definitely take his class if you can!

Jesse took over this class mid-semester and was extremely understanding of the disorganization of the class. He's passionate, friendly, and funny. W ish he taught the class the whole semester--I would've liked it a lot more! Student feedback important to him, and he made several changes to the course based on students' opinions to better serve us.

easily one of the best profs Ive had at OSU and hes only a grad student! he makes asynchronous lectures really engaging, is very personable, and you can tell he really wants his students to do well. the class feels easy, but I also feel like Ive learned a lot. I would definitely recommend taking a class with him even if psych isnt your thing!!

I'm a 3rd year, and I've never rated a single professor of mine BUT i explicitly created an account to write about Jesse. He is, BY FAR, the best teacher I've ever had here at OSU. His lectures are funny (with current memes), he's super approachable, takes ALL feedback, and genuinely cares about every student. I'm actually sad the semester ended :(

BEST TEACHER EVER!!! Highly recommend taking social psych (3325) with jesse. He truly cares about his student's success and is such a fun professor to listen to. You can tell how much he loves psychology and teaching. Very interesting class and he gives great examples to help you understand. Midterms very much reflect what we learn in lectures.

summary_comment: Dr. Siefke is highly regarded by students, known for engaging lectures and accessibility outside of class. His teaching style is fast-paced and detailed, requiring significant effort from students to keep up with the material and prepare for exams. While some find his lectures engaging and the content valuable, others note that his exams may not always align perfectly with the class material, and the workload can be demanding.

Ratings.comment: The best professor I had, the material is a lot and it combines a lot of bio but if you do the reading and lectures and study you would be in good hands. his lecture are so engaging and genuinely love going to his class. be aware tech is not allowed in the class and you need the old school book and pen in the lecture.

Just finished the 1st 3313 Exam. It was HARD. He covered the material in lecture & the lectures are great, but I didn't read enough of the book. I had his cog neuro class  before and some stuff is similar, but 3313 is way more detail. He gives extra credit though. Only problem is when other students ask random questions about stuff not on the exam.

Excellent professor. Made lectures interactive & fun. He introduces a lot of material you don't get in other psych classes and he is very fair on grading and extra credit. Very accessible outside of class too, He gave me advice on getting into grad school and is a pretty cool guy. You can basically ask him anything and he will tell it like it is.

SO much hype around this man, I had him for mem and cog and now im in his neuro class. He talks so fast. weekly quizes that if you do poorly on he will not open it to see what you do wrong. his lectures are long and boring and barely covers the content on the weekly quizes. he is very smart and professional but not good for a professor....

He is by far the best instructor I have had at OSU. (I'm a 3rd year). This was my second time taking this class and it was the lectures that made it for me. Attendance isn't mandatory, but the content of the lectures was AMAZING and actually helped me do well on the Exams. Weekly quizzed with only 4 questions. Homework is just summarizing articles.

Dr. Siefke is a nice person but he isn't a good lecturer. His exams do not align with the material that is presented in class. The class itself isn't worth a lot of points. Be prepared to read and study hard for his exams.

Dr. Siefke is a great guy. If you respect him and the class material, he will do the same for you. He was always willing to meet with me outside of class when I did poorly on a quiz or wanted to review what I missed on exams. Textbook readings are not required but helped me succeed in the class. There is also ample opportunity for extra credit.

Siefke is hands down my favorite teacher at OSU so far and even made stats interesting and fun. I had his neuro class before & this was WAY different. Not bad, just different content. He's super nice & really wants to help you learn. He is fair as long as you follow the rules in the syllabus. 4 Exams, 6 assignments (kinda hard), and a weekly quiz.

do not take this professor. in class you would think he explains things well and then you take your quizzes and it doesn't align with what he teaches. an overly difficult class for no reason. also finishes lecture notes the day of your test so won't give you much time to review beforehand!

Good professor but the way he taught this class does not work for me compared to his cognitive classes that I got an A in. Weekly quizzes, three exams that are mostly conceptually and not math, then you have the assignments. I hated the assignments though, actually the death of me but thats probably me being dramatic. I would recommend someone else

First time teaching the class and he did great! This is part of his interest so he really understood all of the topics. Weekly quizzes and exams. They are easy, just need to make sure you can differentiate between all the terms. But its like your basic psych class honestly! Highly recommend!!!! Exams and quizzes were take home and open note!

Dr. Siefke is my favorite professor I have ever had.  he does not allow any technology in lecture which alot of people didn't like at first but it works great for me.  He is so pationate about the subject matter and does a great job making lectures engaging.

Very smart but hard class. One thing I wish I knew is there is no flexibility with exam conflicts. I had to move a doctor's appt so just plan ahead. You can get extra credit which is good, but exams are difficult!! Overall nice guy and loves teaching.

Clearly very passionate about the subject and cares about students understanding and succeeding. Can't help but hate the course content, but that's not his fault. Pretty funny guy and he constantly tries to create an environment where people feel comfortable to ask questions during class time despite it being a lecture.
Hard exam questions.

There is a good chance Dr. Brian cares about your education more than you could hope to for yourself. He made me passionate about learning again as a burnt-out senior. Did not allow technology (phones, laptops, or tablets) in class which I hate to admit definitely helped me learn. Exams and quizzes were not difficult and mostly on Quizlet.

Weekly quizzes which can be found on quizlets, attendance isn't mandatory but it helps to go to understand the course. Gives 3 larger assignments which re writing heavy but pretty easy. Exams are 50 questions 50 minutes open note online and he gives you several days to complete it. Exams are pretty easy and straight forward. Great guy, cares a lot.

Dr. Brian is very genuine in wanting his students to succeed. He answers questions in lecture very thoroughly. My only complaint is that lectures started to feel repetitive and a little dry so it was really hard for me to pay attention. That's partially because of the content and partially a me problem too though. He gives some extra credit too.

If this your first time taking stats then you need to be going to every lecture or this class will kick your ass. He is a great professor and really really cares about his students. The hardest part of the class is the homework assignments so start them early and go in for help if you need it. He also gives extra credit quizzes which are wonderful

I hated the way he did the presentations, he had all the answers and explained them rather then doing step-by-step teaching. He's a super nice guy but his teaching style cause a good amount of people to struggle. Also, if you take this course I recommend loaning an Ipad from osu to take the best notes.

Great professor. This was my second time taking PSYCH 2220 (Stats) and I did way better this time, thanks to Dr. Brian. He was super helpful meeting me for office hours and he really cares about students actually learning. You will do well if you do the reading and go to class. He's also hilarious and makes stats actually kinda fun.

Best professor I have ever had! I am taking him again for a stats class next semester! His class is very engaging and he explains things very well, and answers questions very well! The exams are easy as they are not trick questions, they are just like, what is the function of the amygdala? He loves his job and it makes his class wonderful!!!!!

Best professor I have had! I am taking his Psych 2220 class next semester because of how amazing he is! He knows what he is talking about and wants to help people understand, he loves when you ask questions! He is very passionate and his midterms are easy, median is usually around 44/50 and you find out your grade right after you take the exam!

Dr. Siefke is very passionate about what he teaches, which makes class fun. While I was hesitant about his "no tech during class" rule, I grew to appreciate it. He knows how to keep you engaged in a lecture. I did not enjoy the 3 written assignments, but they are helpful for future classes in the Psych major. Would recommend him.

Dr. Brian is a wonderful professor! Although he teaches upwards of 300 students per semester, he finds time to answer questions quickly. He clearly puts a lot of thought and effort into his lectures and every interaction with his students. The material is hard but not too hard, and as long as you pay attention and engage you will do well!

This is one of the most difficult classes I have taken and barely hung onto an A. This professor is also one of the most passionate, entertaining and engaging educators I have ever had. He kind of reminds me of Jack Black in School of Rock. The book is the densest I have ever read, lectures are dense but I am glad I had this fantastic professor.
Very caring professor. Opportunities for EC, and always open to meet for extra help. Really wants the best for his students.
Great professor! Taking him again next semester

GREAT professor! Always available if you need help. He really cares about his students. He always checks to make sure the class is understanding the material. He understands the stress of college students. Overall amazing professor. Always open to answering any questions during lecture with no problem. Would recommend.

Dr. Brian is amazing. He really cares about you understanding the material. I am not a math person, but I understood every unit with ease because of the way he lays it out. Boils materials down to nuts and bolts, makes sure that you understand WHY the information is helpful in the real world, and is so encouraging of questions. Gem of a professor!

There are 3 research papers, 4 exams if I remember correctly and weekly quizzes that are no longer than 5 questions that are review of the chapter done last week. Gives out a few extra credit opportunities although their not worth a lot but extra credit is extra credit. Easy to digest lectures, he is very nice, would take a class he teaches again.

Dr. Brian is great. Exams were fair & straight forward, esp. if you went to class. Lectures were clear & engaging - he made a point to answer as many question as possible & still paced the lectures and material well! You can easily ace the assignments if you put more than minimal effort in (make a draft or two). Was very supportive. Take his class!

4 exams, one gets dropped, only 3 assignments which take some time but not very difficult!! I found the class very interesting as a neuro major, and the lectures were clear as he thoroughly explains concepts that students have trouble with. Also, exams are more than fair, the study guides are all you need to do well!
Amazing

The Exams are difficult. Weekly quizzes are fine, and Assignments are graded a little harshly. Lectures are not mandatory but try to go around exams for the course. Not graded by many things, so it is important to do well on the things that are graded. Overall, just okay. Dr. Siefke is a really nice guy, though. Just was a lot of information.

Took his 2220 and 3513, his energy is lil awkward online but works well in-person. 3513 ppt is not as useful as 2220 (you can pass the exam plainly rely on the ppt in 2220). 
Recommend 2220. 3513 is okay but the content isn't very interesting & need to remember lots of facts.

Dr Brian is a good guy! His class was easy and he goes verrrry in depth on the material. Sometimes lecture can get boring because we would be spending way too much time on some topics. This was mostly due to questions asked by students. I found myself skipping some lectures ONLY because I had a base knowledge of stats. He is really helpful though!

This professor doesnt care about you at all. When you have family deaths and forget to turn an assignment in and ask literally the next day to turn it in he says NO. It sucks because we are going through this tough time with covid, we have to take online courses which sucks even more because its so confusing but death in the family & he says so !

Dr. Siefke was a great teacher. I only attended half of the first lecture and never went again. Weekly quizzes were very easy, and you'll need to put in some effort for the exams and assignments but they were still fine. One exam is dropped and there's lots of extra credit from the quiz points. Easy and smooth-sailing class overall!

One of the best neuroscience teachers I have had the pleasure of taking. Funny, respectable, and always willing to help a student. He is very clear with how the class will be graded and drops one of the exams. I did not attend most classes and still achieved a 100% in the class.

I took Data Analysis in Psychology with Dr. Siefke and I have to say it is probably one of the most rewarding classes I've had at OSU. The material is rather challenging, but Dr. Siefke does a great job of keeping things easy to follow and make sure that everyone in the lectures are keeping up with him. He offers extra help if you need it, and EC
Dr. Brian is a great professor, and I really enjoyed 3513. It was a fairly easy class as compared to other neuro classes. I would highly recommend the class and professor!

I loved having Dr. Siefke for Data Analysis! He's very approachable, and he really wants to make sure everyone understands/is comfortable with the material. I would definitely reccommend staying on top of the reading and taking quality notes, as these will make it easier to follow the lectures and complete the assignments.

Definitely take Dr. Brian if you can! He always says this class isn't a math class but it sadly is (esp. towards the end) BUT he is always there to help and truly wants his students to succeed. He's super laid-back and makes class easy to get through. He does have weekly quizzes but that was the only negative aspect of his class.

Dr. Brian is an amazing professor and you can tell he prioritizes the well-being of his students. He teaches the material well and everything is understandable. The exams and quizzes are fair and he gives lots of opportunities for points in class so if you do all the work and attend lecture you should be able to get an A.

Dr. Siefke gives *very* good lectures, strongly encourages participation in class and gives a very reasonable workload. He has a great attitude, being very laid back during class and can be funny. He puts a lot of emphasis on reading the textbook but almost all material is still covered in lecture. If you apply yourself, you can easily get an A.

Dr. Siefke was an amazing professor. I could definitely tell that he cared a lot about both his students as well as the material he was teaching. The class was graded based on the best 3/4 exams, 3 papers, and weekly quizzes. He gave plenty of opportunities for extra credit. You do have to know a lot of material, but his exams were straightforward

A really funny and caring professor. He makes lectures interesting just by how passionate he is about the material. He is always willing to work with students and homework is minimal. Quizzes only cover material directly covered in lecture, so no need to over study. Great professor, awesome guy.

Siefke is a fantastic professor. I took Intro to Cognitive Neuroscience with him, and I've never taken a college-level STEM class but he explains everything very clearly and genuinely cares about making sure we understand the material. He also loves to discuss with students who stay after class and answers every question nonjudgmentally. Take him!

He's a great professor and very caring, but this class was kind of difficult. Assignments are really time consuming and a pain and his exams are somewhat difficult. Even if you study, you'll see something confusing on there you're not familiar with. He does give extra credit though which is nice and helps. Also drops your lowest exam score!!

I'm sure he's usually a better professor, but in these weird COVID-19 circumstances he was... frustrating and unwilling to adjust his course accordingly. His tests are difficult, but the 3 other assignments were easy (but also time-consuming busy work). Attend lectures, test questions sometimes directly refered to lecture content not on the slides.

For an introductory neuroscience class, PSYCH 3513 taught by Dr. Brian is definitely not recommended. Unless you are trying to minor/ major in neuroscience and this is the only available class, I recommend taking other classes. Even though I got a good grade, looking back I spent so much time on this class when I only took it for my requirement.

Siefke is a good lecture and is very helpful with any questions. I thought his class was extremely hard, but I ended up with an A. I have talked to Neuroscience majors (I'm a Psych major) and all of them say that his class is easy. So it just depends on your perspective.

He's very kind and wants his students to do well. The content wasn't hard at all, I thought. The quizzes he makes us do every week are annoying, because they're due at noon, so it's easy to forget. The learning lab offers extra credit, so go there!! Also, get help from there for assignments. Overall, a manageable stats class!! Take him!

Dr Brian is a great professor and cares a lot about his students and making sure you grasp the concepts of psychology. I recommend reading the textbook so you don't have examples of studies/cases that may appear on the exams. Daily pop quizzes are a thing so attendance is basically mandatory because points for the class are scarce. Overall great.

Brian is more than happy to answer any and all questions in class and his lectures are very clear and interesting. His love and passion for neuroscience is clearly demonstrated everyday in lecture. He is a very understanding guy and truly cares about his students. 11/10 take Siefke if you can !!.
Amazing teacher, 10/10

At OSU Ive had so many professors not take the time to address individual student needs, but Professor Siefke has been considerate and helpful so far this semester! Its not even the end of the semester, so the fact Im taking the time to write this should say something about the quality of his character. Deff select his class. Worth it.

Professor Siefke is the most helpful professor I've ever had. I had him for Cog Neuro and Research Methods, both topics that could be very dry and uninteresting. However, Professor Siefke's fascination with psychology is infectious which makes the topics all the more bearable.

This is my second class with Brian, and I found him to be GREAT for 2220. He goes over material time and time again and truly acts like a "servant to the students." 6 HW assignments (about two hours each), 4 exams (multiple choice 40 questions), and weekly online quizzes (most end up being extra credit). Show up to class bc he gave out EC 3 times!

What a good guy. This man made a very awful semester for me a little bit brighter with his class. Yes its stats. Yes its sometimes isn't SUPER interesting, but he cares about all of us and you can tell. What a warm spirited professor, he deserves your attention.

Brian is a really awesome professor. He understands a student's life and is overall a genuine person and it shows in his teaching. I definitely had to read the book thoroughly because he sped through the lectures every time with a bunch of info, but I still went because he sometimes gave extra credit. I was worried about the course but he was great

Brian is very chill and relatable. He knows his stuff and loves to answer questions in class. Be prepared to read the book and go your notes a lot if you want an A. He makes really helpful powerpoints and tells you exactly what is going to be on the test and what to study which is nice. He also likes to put extra credit on the tests and curves.

I really enjoy Dr. Brians lecture. He is very knowledgeable and wants his students to succeed. Hes very helpful in class and over email if you have questions. For someone who has never taken a stats class ever, he made the material very easy to understand. Highly recommend him!!

Dr. Siefke is a nice lecturer, and really cares about the content he teaches and your understanding of it. The downside is he often uses a lot of jargon, and he moves at a relatively fast pace as there is a lot of content to cover. Sometimes you can feel overwhelmed because of the amount of information he crams into a short time frame.

I took him for Psych2220 and Psych3513. Dr. Siefke is a great professor who really cares about what he teaches. If you pay attention during class and go over his slides, you'll do good. The material is on the tougher side, but Dr. Siefke does a great job explaining it and making it easy to understand. I wish I could take another one of his classes!

He is passionate about teaching but sometimes gets himself too wound up and confuses terms and concepts leaving himself to clarify his mistake later in an email. Funny guy though and gives you plenty of chances to earn points in extra credit if you show up to class.

Brian is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. He is very quick to respond to emails if any issues arise. Easy short online quizzes every week, 3 assignments, and 4 exams (get to drop lowest one). Gives extra credit quizzes and extra questions on exams sometimes. Great lecturer; very helpful to go to class but is not absolutely necessary.

Siefke is an incredibly relaxed man. He has very few assignments or expectations, and a lot of the class only shows up for the exams which can be aced from the online posts alone. That being said, I gained a lot from going to lecture because this man is truly personable and funny. He's the type of professor you want to have a beer with. Easy exams.

Dr. Siefke is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He explains the class material throughly and is extremely helpful during office hours. Even though this was his first time teaching Data Analysis, I believe most of my classmates also loved his teaching style. He gives a lot of extra credit and is a fair grader! Definitely recommend 10/10

I have had this professor twice now. Once for Research Methods, and now for Cog Neuro. He treats students fairly and offers a ton of extra credit. Although it is true that the reading is pretty boring, he makes the central ideas in lecture interesting & he puts the slides online. The assignments & exams are ok if you study. I definitely recommend.

Communicates the material extremely clearly and does a lot of examples in class that make sense; he always lets his students know that he cares about their success in his class and is always open to questions; best prof I have had so far in psych department

Great professor. Very enthusiastic and realistic. Extremely approachable and caring about material. Slides posted online, no attendance grade. Tests are straightforward and easy. Disclaimers: Does not allow electronics in his classroom. Requires 2pt quizzes every week (online) but are due at 12pm on Monday, so are easy to forget.
He cares about his students' success and is very thorough and easy to understand. One of my favorite professors on campus

Brian is awesome! I've never had a professor care so much about my progress as a student and I felt prepared for every exam. I like his teaching style and when he calls people out who are absorbed into their phones during lecture. He always asked if we had questions and gave us plenty of opportunities to get the grade we wanted. Learned a lot!!

Brian was one of the most caring professors I have ever had. He really makes sure his students are set up for success. He provides a ton of extra credit quizzes(he didn't do pop quizzes with us) and his assignments are easy 100%. Midterm two was definitely the hardest, but pretty much all exams are lectures and study guide material.

Brian was an amazing teacher. While its true that his lectures were a little fast paced and confusing, Brian always made sure his students understood the material. If you had a question, no matter how dumb it seemed, Brian would answer it without judgement. Brian made Psych 2300 an easy A. Plus, he dropped the lowest exam score.

Class isnt mandatory but he really does highlight what will be on the midterms. Do the study guides and you will ace the tests. Great lecturer, engages with the class with demonstrations and really does care about his students. If you can take him for this class i would highly recommend doing so.

Brian is a cool guy overall but he's a mediocre lecturer at best. He flips through slides extremely fast and leaves students frustrated at the end of class. He is more than welcoming to help but also makes lecture a little confusing. You really should read the book if you want a good grade. However, he does drop your lowest test grade so thats nice

He really cares about his students, he loves when people ask questions during lecture. Very open outside of class. Exams only cover lecture content, but he can move fast in lecture. Wording on exams can be a little tricky so watch out for that. Drops lowest exam score!

AMAZING prof for cognitive neuro. Extra credit pop quizzes at the end of every lecture. Doesn't use textbook, so always go to class. Exams are off of his powerpoints, but very detailed. Cares about his students but doesn't deal with slackers. He will answer every question he knows and research ones he doesn't.

He's pretty passionate about the topic, but can get boring. Syllabus says the textbook is required, but I never read it and did fine. Do well on the pop quizzes, because you can get a ton of extra credit from then; I got so much I didn't have to take the final. 3 midterms, 1 final, lowest of any dropped, 3 short papers

He is a very good professor, he cares a lot about doing well in class. This class isn't too hard, he gives you many opportunities to get a bunch of extra credit. Lectures are long and can be boring but he shows a lot of great examples. Overall, he is a great professor!

Lectures were long and got boring quickly. Repeated himself a lot and then blew through important slides. Exams 1 and 3 were average, but Exam 2 was hard and clearly drawn from the boring textbook nobody reads. But, assignments were easy 100%s, and pop quizzes gave me 14 extra credit points, and I didn't have to take the final. Pros and cons.

Brian is a great instructor and I really enjoyed taking his class. He has a pop quiz every class but once you receive 20 points you will get extra credit. I had over 10 extra credit points! The pop quizzes are easy as long as you look over the lectures before class. The exams are a little tricky but he will add some points to increase the average.

Easiest Class Ever Today I take Exam 3 and assuming I get above a 40/60 it will mean I'll have aced the class AND won't have to take the final.  This class is ridiculously easy, go to lecture, you're paying for it after all, and study for the first couple exams

I met with him 3 times and he is a great instructor who cares a lot about us. The book WAS kind of dry and detailed, but it wasn't that bad. I disagree with other posters that lectures were boring! He knows a lot about the material and mixed it up with videos and experiment demos sometimes. The quizzes are not really that hard if you come to class

Overall, he seemed pretty out of touch with his students. The majority of us are neuro majors who have seen most of this material before, but it often felt like we were being coddled. His idea of teaching "critical thinking" is to constantly preach his own biases on topics covered in class. Reading directly from slides makes for boring lectures.

Pop quizzes every class that are easy IF you read the book, which is super long and dry. Even he admits that it's filled with too much information, but still tests off everything in the book. Includes very specific questions from the reading on exams that aren't discussed in class. Took 3 weeks to grade a scantron. Would not recommend.

Excellent teacher. He kind of has to dumb down and simplify the material for some of the students, but is definitely dedicated to making sure you get it. Always willing to help outside of class, too Not very hard class at all if you do the reading and go to class. The pop quizzes every class are easy and also a way to get extra points by the end.

He's a good lecturer, although the subject matter can be a bit dry. Communicates clearly and gets really excited about neuro. Pop quizzes are kind of hard but reading the book help a lot. Exams are average difficulty.
Feels like you're taking an advanced neuro class when in reality it's supposed to be an easy intro class. His lectures are boring and the material is heavy, avoid taking this class with him.

Horrible teacher, blows through notes, says things will not be on the test but then puts them on there. Pop quizzes at the "end" of every class but changed it to randomly during class. Extremely boring presentations. Supposed to be an extremely easy class for neuro majors, it has been my hardest.

Lectures are incredibly boring. This is supposed to be the joke neuroscience intro class but he really make you work for it. Reads off slides, gives 3 question quizzes every class which you actually have to study for, and he speeds through notes so it is impossible to get them all. says exams are easy but worded weird.

Class is quite easy. He is a nice guy but he teaches at a level below many of his students. Tends to read off slides and go very quickly toward the end of class. Sticking to a schedule is very important to him. Exams are easy. Gives short quizzes each class in place of attendance. Gives 3 assignments which is only outside work.

Definitely dedicated to student learning. Does not allow laptops/cellphones in class, but that helps for being focused on lectures. Lots of material to learn and most of grade is from tests. Does not take attendance, but going to class definitely helps because there are short pop quizzes almost every class period.
SO cool. VERY laid back and easy going. He really wants you to succeed. It's more a friend teaching a friend instead of professor to student.

Brian is a great teacher. He presents the information in a clear and interesting manner. He was very easy to set up an appointment with. He doesn't take attendance, but we get short 3 question multiple choice quizzes at the end of most classes that help our grades. Attendance is not taken, but showing up definitely affects your grade.

By far the best professor you can get. Attendance isn't mandatory but he doesn't post the lectures/slides on Carmen and he gives 1 point quizzes almost every class (easy quizzes) so going to the lectures is the best way to do well. He is very passionate about psychology and his students and it makes the class enjoyable.

The best professor I've ever had. He answers every question, no matter how difficult, and if he doesn't know the answer right away he will find it on his own time and email the class. He's very passionate and dedicated to psychology.

summary_comment: Dr. Shoppe-Sullivan is highly regarded for her caring nature and engaging lectures, though attendance is not mandatory, she encourages participation with weekly in-class assignments that contribute to the grade. The course structure includes keeping the best 3 out of 4 exam scores and offering extra assignments for points, making it generally easy if one attends regularly. While tests can be challenging, the inclusion of easier writing assignments helps stabilize grades.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Sullivan is very caring and keeps her lectures interesting. Attendance is not required, but there are random in-class assignments about once a week. You only get graded for 10 but are given more than that, and your best 3/4 exams scores are kept. It is a pretty easy course as long as you show up to most lectures!

Dr. Shoppe-Sullivan is a great professor and the class was interesting. She cares that you learn, so she loves when you ask questions. Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are random in-class assignments and you get points just for doing them, so I recommend showing up. Tests are somewhat difficult, but easy writing assignments cushion your grade.

summary_comment: The professor is generally seen as challenging, particularly with difficult quizzes that require extensive note-taking from lectures. Students found the group project to be poorly structured and the grading to be harsh, often taking off half points for minor issues. Despite some positive aspects like interesting material and willingness to help, the overall experience was marked by difficulty and inconsistency in assessment.

Ratings.comment: Should have been such an easy class but she made the quizzes impossible. You have to take active notes in class or you won't be able to find answers for the tests. She expected way to much and the group project was dumb.

There are quizzes every other week and they were overly difficult for an elective course. Her averages for quizzes were very low and she wouldn't provide adequate feedback. There is a big group project which was structured weird as we hadn't actually worked as a group until presentation. Definitely take this course with another professor.

The class had relatively easy and self explanatory concepts however she graded very hard taking half points off of as many things as she could. Quizzes were unusually difficult and there were weekly discussion posts. No exams thankfully and every assignment was online except for a group presentation that was very easy.

Very nice professor with interesting material, but her online quizzes are difficult and they're worth a good chunk of your grade and lectures aren't that much help. Doable course load and easy points otherwise. Many extra credit opportunities and she's always willing to help. No final or exams, but there is a group project.
Never read textbook or went to class. Lectures good, homework kind of busywork, but easy points. Interesting topics, easy tests, would take again.

Lisa seems like a lovely woman and had an upbeat personality. Always came to class positive but when it came to her quizzes (which made up most of the grade), they were impossible!!! I get that with online learning some teachers may want to make things more difficult to make sure students are working for their grade but her quizzes were ridiculous.

Overall, the coursework is light and doable. However, she's very careful about her word choice on the exams. I would take 5-6 pages worth of notes a week on her lectures and still fail her quizzes. The content itself is fun to learn, but I didn't enjoy it as much when she made it extremely complicated. A little ridiculous for a Tier 2 course.

I thought the class was overall pretty easy. I studied around 3 hours before exam and always got an A. However, the final wasn't cumulative and so I studied how I usually did for other exams and I absolutely bombed it and got a D. She ended up curving the class so I got an A so it didn't matter. Overall, it was easy except for the final

The book isn't required, but it explains the material better than her. Her tests are based on examples from lectures. Her powerpoints suck. There isn't much to boost your grade. Tests are very difficult. She allows you to earn 0.5 points of extra credit during tests. Test averages are really low in the class.

In this class you have 10 weeks to come up with an experiment idea, create the experiment, analyze your data, and write a research paper. If you can't handle the amount of time that will obviously take then don't take the class. Dr. Libby did a great job of presenting the material in way that made the class a lot easier than I was expecting.

Dr. Libby is a good professor,however,she needs to improve her teaching style and provide students with study guides/review sheets to help them prepare better for the exams,because there is a lot of material to remember,which is overwhelming and a bit like a guessing game,because you never know what to expect on the exams.(I failed all 3 of them!)

loved the info in class, but very specific. tests were hard, averages for midterm were in 70's, final average was a 68%. opportunities for 4 extra credit, fairly easy to obtain. exams are VERY difficult. 2 "discussions" to attend with 10 other students, easy points. overall, good teacher but hard exams. read book for first exam, not for others.
I've loved every psychology class I have ever taken at Ohio State... until I had Dr. Libby for a professor. I would rather drink molten glass than have to deal with her again.

She might not use a textbook or give tests or quizzes, but she is sadistic when it comes to classwork. Plan on reading at least 3 journal articles a day, writing 1 to 2 papers a week, and when it comes to research she is the pickiest person in the world. Avoid at all costs, unless you plan to cancel everything else in your life for 3 months.

AVOID. I was so excited to take this class but I nearly failed bc of frustraction. Her teaching style did not match book which did not match notes which did not match test. 1/2 MC half essay but hard grader (nit picky...if not exactly clear no points) EC is joke, 1/2 class did not know answ. BLAHHHH

Decent class; good experience if looking at graduate school in psych. A bit unclear and slow at answering emails. Sometimes seemed like she shoved a lot of her dirty work on her TA. If you haven't taken psych 321, just be prepared for some frustration when it comes to reporting data. fast-paced and quick deadlines, but no tests or book.
pretty good class. as long as you study well you should do fine. very clear in her teaching and standards.

This class is a scientific study of human relationships, so you can't go into it expecting something out of Cosmopolitan. That said, I thought the subject matter was very interesting and the tests weren't THAT hard. She is straightforward and clear, and more personable 1-on-1. She's also very willing to help. Kinda cute in a professor-ish way.

Hardest, trickiest (essay) exams ever! They don't test knowledge directly, they ask you to infer things from what she talked about. And she's boring as crap. Explains relationships in terms of  evolution. What a joke! Disappointing. If you're interested in relationships, just buy the textbook on eBay and avoid this class at all costs.

The class could have been so much better! She is pretty boring for how great the subject matter could have been.  Tests are some of the hardest I have had in my 4 years in the Psych department.  She offers lots of extra credit but its only worth half a point.  It was overall a disappointment

Prof libby is great.  her class is kind of interesting, no homework assignments just 3 exams.  3 discussion sessions per quarter and you only have to attend two..super easy.  test's aren't the best, but definitely not hard.  if you study a little you'll be sure to get an A, B-

I found this course to be difficult and rewarding at the same time. I thought the Sex and the Cty clips worked well with the material. The tests were rather difficult, but there were plenty of opportunities for extra credit if you bothered to show up

One of the best professors I've ever had.  Very reasonable in her expectations.  I thought the exams were extremely easy, but some people had trouble with them.  My favorite course in all 4 of my years at OSU.  Material is very interesting!
If you are interested in relationships, and how to make them better you will like this class. She is monotone and boring. Tests are somewhat difficult. I learned stuff from the book.
Very boring, my friend dropped the class because she couldn't stay awake.
This prof is wonderful.  The class is great, and I would take anything else she teaches.

Really interesting class, excellent powerpoints, really clear about everything.  The textbook was easy to read and she picked a lot of good videos to demonstrate the material.  One short paper & 2 tests - pretty great for a brand new class

summary_comment: Professor Shankar is perceived as a kind individual, though her teaching methods are considered lacking in effectiveness. Her lectures and teaching skills are deemed insufficient for comprehensive learning, necessitating students to rely heavily on textbooks and memorizing answers from lecture slides to prepare for exams. Students face a long wait of about two months between exams and receiving their grades.

Ratings.comment: Prof Shankar is a very nice person but her lecturing and teaching skill lacks a bit. She's a grad student at the same time so I guess that's why but just wait for exams it feels like you didn't learn and then a 2 month wait for your grades.
