Read the textbook and memorize the answers to the guided questions on the lecture slides for exams.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his exceptional teaching skills and genuine care for student success. He effectively explains complex material and encourages questions, creating a supportive learning environment. Students find him approachable and genuinely invested in their understanding and success.

Ratings.comment: I didn't do so well in this class but that was 100% my choice. He's a great professor, I just didn't go to class for half the semester and fell behind. He's really good at explaining things. He genuinely cares that everyone understands and succeeds in his course. Very approachable guy, never makes you feel dumb for asking a question

I had Dr. Miller for PYSCH 2220 and he was amazing. One of the nicest professors I have had, cared about the class, helped understand the material extremely well, gave time to ask questions in class and explained them.

summary_comment: Dr. Saygin is an effective professor who clearly communicates expectations and provides numerous opportunities for extra credit. Her lectures are informative and engaging, though some students find them lecture-heavy and not always directly aligned with exam questions. The class requires significant reading and preparation, particularly for presentations, and while challenging, it fosters deep understanding and critical thinking.

Ratings.comment: Great professor that makes expectations clear through all the assignments and exams. Lecture heavy and being in class is important, but not required, and material was pretty interesting. 3 exams, plus a final, and lowest exam score dropped (don't have to take final if first 3 scores are good). Lots of extra credit opportunities. 2 response papers.

I love Dr. Saygin. She cares a lot about the material in this class. As someone who was scared of doing presentations (the whole class is about doing presentations on the journal articles we read), I really enjoyed talking with my classmates about the material. I learned a lot, but be prepared to read about 6 journal articles a week to prepare!

I definitely not recommend taking this class with her. She is super nice, but nice well experienced with the material. She reads from slides most of the time and her exam questions are not related to what she gave in the lecture.

Hard class but makes you think. Expects a high level of understanding of journal articles. Fun lectures and she obviously cares about the material. Presentations have to be well thought out. Be prepared to discuss the articles in class. Debate at the end of the semester helps bring it all together.

Like a lot of grad classes in psych I found this one to not be very informative. I learned a few things. Some of it was repeated from lower level courses, or the lectures were very mundane. Graded items are three presentations, and short weekly response paper to articles, which are difficult to read. Make sure your presentations are very detailed.

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Techniques and Topics in Cognitive Neuroscience

summary_comment: Robby Ralston is an effective lecturer who makes class engaging and easy to pass with minimal homework, provided students attend lectures and take notes. However, some students find his lectures slow and difficult to follow, and he occasionally experiences technical issues with posting materials. Despite these challenges, his clear course structure and supportive approach contribute to a manageable and low-stress learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Literally no homework involved, and as long as you go to class you can disregard the textbook. His lectures are very interesting and you can get an A by writing down what's on his slideshows. He doesn't post slideshows after classes, which is the only bad part, but if you pay attention it is hard not to get an A as the exams are a breeze too.

Robby Ralston took way too long to explain concepts in lectures. These lectures being 1 hour plus for each 2 lessons per week. Definitely could have been less time. Examples don't make sense sometimes and basically makes us figure everything out for ourselves. Does not take the time to make sure we understand. Easy class, bad lecturer.

He is genuinely understanding and wants his students to succeed. However, he often has "tech issues," preventing him from posting the material on time. He usually pushes the due date back as well, but don't create a plan to get this classwork done on a specific day because the time it's posted every week constantly changes.

The class structure is clear with two recorded lectures a week along with a weekly quiz on the material and check-in surveys. There are three open-note exams and "designer question" assignments every 2 weeks. Class is easy and manageable, only critique is that lectures can be slow and boring.

He is a fantastic lecturer. He knows what he is talking about and answers questions well. The course is not hard AT ALL! He provides pre-written notes with fill in the blank. If you go to lecture and complete the notes you cant fail. Tests are open note open book! Book is included in course fee.

summary_comment: Dr. Pitt is a knowledgeable professor who delivers heavy lecture-based content, making the class challenging due to the vast amount of material covered. Students find his exams demanding but manageable with proper preparation. While some students appreciate his helpfulness and clear explanations, others struggle with the early morning class time and the lack of structured study guides.

Ratings.comment: Attendance isn't mandatory, but I promise you'll regret skipping. No textbook. There are 4 research papers, and 4 midterms/1final - closed note. His material is LECTURE HEAVY, he provides slides but those are incomparable to what we learn in class - it goes way beyond that. He is helpful in accommodating students, and he has gained my respect.

Dr. Pitt is a good professor and he did a great job on teaching the lecture. There are only 4 exams matter for the final grade, and if you dont want to take the final exam you can submit an essay instead. He also provides about 5% extra credit. The exam is hard, but if you study for it before then you will have a good grade.

This class is hard mostly because of all the information in the lectures. Studying is extremely difficult because he gives virtually no information about what is actually going to be on the exam so you end up spending a whole day going through hundreds of slides for a 32 question exam. He is very helpful answering questions during lectures tho

Mark is very knowledgable. However, I found his class to be pretty difficult. The lectures were boring and the material is very dry (especially at 8am). His exams are pretty tough since they are only 30 questions, he gives you no study guide or help with studying, and there is a lot of material covered (especially for the cumulative final).

I struggled with this class probably more than any other class in college (I'm in my fourth year). Overall, PLEASE don't take it at 8am like I did. No homework is required, it is only there to boost your grade - everything is based on test scores. Attendance is not mandatory but it's very hard to keep up without it. The material was very dry to me.

Pretty easy class! Exams and discussion posts only. As long as you study you should be fine! A lot of material but pretty straight forward and reviews it often. No book needed and powerpoints online. Knows a lot and would take again!

Good prof. Very clear and his powerpoints are easy to follow. Don't have to go to class, just study powerpoints and you'll be fine for the two midterms and final. If you do go to class, don't be afraid to ask questions. He's extremely knowledgable and knows how to answers questions in a clear and interesting manner. Highly recommended.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional clarity and ability to encourage critical thinking. He fosters an engaging classroom environment through frequent discussions and debates, pushing students to reconsider their viewpoints. With a single final exam and manageable weekly quizzes, he maintains a balanced approach to assessment.

Ratings.comment: Best professor I've had. He is clear and makes you think outside the box. There is only one exam, the final. There are quizzes every week but they aren't too bad. A lot of the lecture is class discussion and we have debates, which is nothing to be afraid of. He'll ask you questions that will make you rethink your opinions which I love. 10/10

summary_comment: Graham and Mr. Bartels are both highly regarded for their excellent teaching quality. Students find their courses manageable with straightforward exams and plenty of opportunities for engagement through participation and extra credit. Both professors are described as kind, considerate, and effective in making complex topics accessible and engaging, with many noting the value of their recordings and flexible approaches during challenging times.

Ratings.comment: Graham is great! He's very nice, likeable, and his course is not difficult. There were 4 exams that were straightforward and OPEN NOTE, 2 responses papers that were not hard, and 50 participation points with many opportunities to get them. Plus, he offered a ton of EC. The course was interesting, and attendance is highly recommended to take notes.

Mr. Bartels made Abnormal Psychology easier to learn and to be successful in. He gave great lectures, providing insight and real-world implications of concepts, and gave good extra credit opportunities. Mid-terms were also open notes which was a huge plus.
Mr. Bartels is a very considerate and kind person, his lectures are fun!

I love Graham, he is an awesome professor and lecturer. His class is very manageable with light homework, and the exams are very straight-forward and he prepares you for them well. He cares a lot and tries to remember everyone's name. He also records his lectures with notes so that you don't have to worry about missing class or not understanding.

I loved this course, there was a lot of interesting information that was very easy to follow. All lectures are recorded, so you never miss out on anything. The assignments and quizzes were pretty easy if you watch the lectures. The professor himself is very understanding and enjoys teaching. Overall a great course!!

Lectures are great and have a ton of information in them. There are a few assignments outside of exams that are totally doable and don't require a ton of time. The exams are straightforward and open note. Prof Bartels made the material easy to understand and engaging, I would definitely take again.

Graham was very understanding about the covid pandemic and was there to make life easier. He was caring and flexible. Online there was 1 live class day to catch up on the material provided in the lectures required to watch by that day. Overall an amazing guy would 10/10 recommend

summary_comment: Brittany is widely regarded as one of the worst professors based on student feedback, with many criticizing her confusing and poorly structured assignments, low-quality videos, and inconsistent grading criteria. Students found her lectures unhelpful and her teaching methods lacking, often describing them as lazy and ineffective. While a few students appreciated her responsiveness and found the class easy, the overall consensus is negative, with most advising against taking her class.

Ratings.comment: This class had the potential to be interesting, but Brittany was one of the worst I've had. Assignments were confusing, not helpful to learn the content, and inconsistently graded with unclear criteria. Videos are low quality and do not help with mastering content and most of the time do not help on the weekly quizzes. Take this with someone else.

Her "lectures" are low-effort 30 minute recaps of the book. Class time is just a study hall. Assignment instructions are incredibly vague, and she docks points when you can't intuit her unspoken expectations. I hesitate to even call this a flipped classroom course, as she did nothing to encourage higher order thinking in class. She's just lazy.

she's a nice lady but her method of teaching is so lazy imo. uses a flipped classroom model so you basically have to teach yourself and the mandatory classes are just a glorified study hall where she takes off points for the dumbest things even though she'll say to your face it looks perfect. do not recommend her at all.

Brittiany gives you many opportunities to get the grade you want in her class! She was quick to respond to any emails you needed to send and answered all questions you had thoughtfully. I can't stress enough how much I loved her class -- my only advice is to reach out and ask your questions, its the only reason I got an A+.

This class was pretty easy- minimal effort put in and got an A. However, this professor is terrible. Her lectures are a joke and her assignments are stupid. Her grading is so odd- it almost seems like she takes off points sometimes to just make it look like she actually reads and grades them. If you want to learn, don't take this class.
I took psych 3325 and she was amazing. Group assignment and homework/quizzes.
one of the smartest and best professors at OSU!!!!

Class was required for my major but very interesting and easy to stay engaged, gave lots of real world examples to make topics clear, if you ever have a question, email her and she'll respond right away

She's a very nice person and a pretty good lecturer that tries to make pretty boring material interesting, but her exams were overly hard. Even though I had pretty much every term from her slides memorized, I still struggled on some of her exams because she asked very nit-picky questions that forced you to know many intricate details.

Dr. Shoots-Reinhard is by far my favorite professor that I have had. She is extremely funny, smart and honestly cares about the students and will go out of her way to help. When it comes to her lectures she is extremely enthusiastic, and can really relate the content to your life and the real world. I recommend signing up for one of her courses.

She really cares that her students do well in the class and gives many opportunities to bring up your grade. Participation matters but she gives more than enough opportunities to earn all the points. She usually tries to end class early, and reviews after every section. She drops 6/11 quizzes and 2/3 written assignments. I would take it again

Overall, a good professor and an easy class. Class was mandatory for my major, but Professor Shoots-Reinhard made the lectures enjoyable. The quizzes were sort of tricky, but easy tests and easily graded paper. An obvious and admitted liberal with a bit of a teaching bias, but it's not hard to get past. She is very endearing and very funny.

She is one of the best professors I've had. She cares about the subject, cares about the students, and loves to share personal stories. As much as people have complained about her tangents, they are relating to the subject matter and will help you learn and retain the material. I've had two classes with her & will be taking another next semester!

She'd be a better professor if she lectured on subjects covered in our quizzes. As others have pointed out, it's about 55 minutes of her telling the class about her day. Reading can be interesting, but it's very long. She is at the least upbeat, and genuinely interested in the subject.

Super nice professor who works to make sure that you learn what you'll use in your career.  Is readily available to help students who need it and works to get to know students, which is uncommon at large universities like OSU.

Be prepared to be bored. You're spending tuition on her basically telling the class to tell personal stories as opposed to actually teaching anything (about 20-30 minutes of every 55 minute class is personal stories).   On the rare instances that she is teaching, it's dry, and ridiculously boring.  Easiest A ever when I stopped going to class

Brittany likes to facilitate class conversation which can get a little boring, but her exams are easy (you can contribute questions to them and she has buffer questions), and participation points can be made up by posting on the forum.  Going to class isn't strictly necessary because she posts slides, but I enjoy it for her helpful examples.

Participation points are the only reason to attend. Not really a surprise but she's an obvious liberal to anyone over 21, but most college kids dig that, so understandable. Other than that, really dry lectures, tries too hard to fit in with the students. I wasn't a fan. Easy pass though. As far as security goes, they should have someone else teach.
She is really funny, makes assignments and tests pretty easy if you memorize the notes. The examples she uses in her slides are on the exams. Great professor
She is a really funny person. I had a lot of fun in this class. It was interesting and she made the class atmosphere laid back and comfortable.

Brittany is a funny and friendly person. The problem with this class is that there are many sections of it so the instructors have to be strict on certain things like late papers and such. There's lots of note-taking, and the tests are pretty hard, but not so bad if you prepare yourself.

Brittany made psych 367 very difficult. She made ready exactly off her power points and made class very boring. There was no benefit in going to class besides getting participation points. For the exams she never gave out review sheets and told us to know "everything". She graded the papers and test like it was a graduate course. No fun, no help!

summary_comment: Professor Novak excels in delivering high-quality, engaging lectures that blend humor with practical examples, making psychological concepts accessible. She provides ample study materials and occasionally allows early releases from class, enhancing the learning experience. Students strongly recommend her for PSYCH 1100, particularly for General Education credit.

Ratings.comment: Professor Novak is fantastic! Her lectures are funny and engaging, and she does a good job giving real life examples of psych concepts. She also posts a good amount of material to review for exams, and sometimes lets you out of class early. If you're taking PSYCH 1100 as a GE, definitely try to get her!

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered effective in answering questions and providing clear feedback, though his lectures can be dry and slow-paced, making the class feel拖沓。学生普遍认为需要定期上课并做笔记，因为他的PPT内容不全面且他准备不足。考试相对简单，但需要认真对待随机出勤和实践课。总体而言，尽管教学方法较为传统，但他对学生负责且易于接近。

Ratings.comment: You do need to attend class for 5 random attendance checks and take notes regularly because his powerpoints do not include all exam information. Class is boring and drags on and he doesn't make the material interesting. Doesn't always have good answers to questions in class either, I don't think he's prepared enough to be teaching this class.

Matt is one of the most caring instructors I have had for any class. He made this class extremely easy and if someone does not get an A its because they literally are incapable of studying powerpoints. Exams are very straight forward and very very simple as long as you glance at the powerpoints. Have yet to put more than 5 minutes into studying

His notes are so unclear, be prepared to take your own notes on everything. Dont ever expect clear grading criteria either. Take this class with a different professor who knows what theyre talking about because its interesting material when your professor does more than read off a list of symptoms and treatments for each disorder.

Matts a great person, but not the most interesting for this class. Exams are average but not nearly enough info is in his powerpoint slides, so youll need to come to class and take notes. He talks pretty slow and monotone, so the class drags on a bit. There are 4 practicums you need to be in class for, and they can be tricky, you need to study.

Great professor! Answered all my questions to the best of his ability, even if he had to admit he wasn't sure, but looked up the answer and got back to me the next class period.  Attendance isn't mandatory but I loved lecture and he does attendance 5 times at random.  He's an over all super chill guy and I would absolutely take his class again!!
There are 5 random attendance points that you want to get. Three test, and no cumulative final !

summary_comment: Jarret is highly regarded as an exceptional instructor, known for his engaging lectures, first-hand experience, and ability to make complex material accessible and relatable. Students appreciate his approachability, willingness to help outside of class, and his passion for the subject matter, which fosters a supportive learning environment.

Ratings.comment: Jarret is an amazing instructor! He knows how to keep the class engaged during lecture and is very approachable. Makes himself available before and after lecture if you have any questions. Love his humor.

Jarret is the best professor I have ever had. He's super understanding and kind. He is great at answering questions and his lectures include information he has learned from first hand experience, so it's easier to understand concepts. Thanks for being awesome Jarret!

Jarret is the coolest professor I have had. He makes lectures so interesting and has great examples. Highly recommend this class, especially if you're interested in psychology. Really cares about students and will help you out.
Has a lot of first-hand experience which makes his lectures very interesting. He really cares about and wants his students to do well.

The lectures are incredibly interesting and he has a lot of first hand experience, even at such a young age. He makes it easy to understand the material and is always willing to meet outside of class or answer emails if you're confused or struggling with an assignment. It is clear he is passionate about his field and cares about his students.

A very great professor. He makes the material easy to comprehend and relatable. Always open to answer questions and outside help if needed. He quickly responds to emails which is helpful for any concerns or questions that I have at home. HE IS FUNNY! It is easy to follow along with lecture and time flies. Handles sensitive material appropriately.
great professor and class!
great class. The material can be tough but Jarret is really good about explaining it and gives extra credit that really helps!
very cool dude and a dope class.
fave professor! the class is fun and he gives lots of extra credit. 10/10
Available often, personable, grades well with good feedback, easy to follow rubrics, fun classes
Really cares about his students and is more than willing to help you learn if you ask questions. Material is difficult for exams and there are a couple papers but not a lot of work otherwise.

Jarret is awesome! he responds to emails super fast! the material is a little more difficult but he explains it well and makes it fun. Dogs are always accepted in his class and he posts the slides so it's lit. He's hilarious and grades fairly.
Only a graduate student right now but knows what he is talking about. He makes lectures interesting and does not stress you out with too much work.
He was awesome! Very hilarious and easy going. Class was pretty easy and actually fun.
Mean

He was hilarious, kind, and very attractive. It was a pleasure going to class because he knew what he was talking about but still had the ability to joke and connect with the class. He told us exactly what to expect and made this class an easy A, if you put in the minimum amount of effort. Attendance isn't mandatory

Jarret was a very helpful grad student instructor who cared about the success of his class.  He provided online powerpoint slides as well as paper copies of the slides to follow along during lecture.  He gave a few quizzes which were not difficult and provided constructive feedback on essays. Overall, very good instructor.  Would highly recommend.
He is a good professor. He cares about the student and tells interesting stories.

summary_comment: Ilana is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, described as both engaging and effective. Students appreciate her down-to-earth and humorous approach, which makes the class enjoyable and memorable. Her clear lecturing style and practical advice for exam preparation contribute significantly to student success.

Ratings.comment: Retook this class after having to withdraw from it last semester due to a horrible professor. Ilana exceeded my expectations. She is so down to earth and funny. Go to class because she will provide things to focus on for the exam but I did not mind since the class was so enjoyable. If you take notes in class and do the assignments you will get an A
Ilana is an amazing lecturer! She was one of the people who got me interested in psychology!
Read the book and you'll pass her class.

summary_comment: Professor Nate is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex concepts easy to understand through extensive explanations and jokes. While his exams can be challenging, students find his review materials invaluable. Participation is encouraged with easy, ungraded assignments that offer extra credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment: Nate is hilarious. Every class was full of jokes and extensive explanation of concepts, so it's not hard to understand the material if you go to class. AND GO TO CLASS - there are super easy participation assignments and only half are actually graded, the rest are extra credit (10 points EC). The exams were kind of rough but he made great reviews.

summary_comment: Heather Daly is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for her engaging and entertaining lectures filled with clear examples, fun videos, and interactive activities. Students praise her for making complex material easy to understand and retain, and appreciate her availability and willingness to help. Her classes are recommended for their quality and the supportive learning environment she creates.

Ratings.comment: Genuinely so wonderful. I want to be Heather when I grow up. She is so funny, down to earth, and understanding. An absolute queen, please please please take her class if you ever get the chance!

She was an amazing professor! I had her as an 8 am, and she made sure to keep class lively and fun. She explained the material in a way that made it easy to remember for midterms, and she used lots of fun videos and interactive activities in class. I'm sad that I won't be able to see her next semester!

Heather Daly is the best instructor in PSYCH 1100! Not only she will give you amazing lectures with lots of clear examples and interesting videos, but also you will easily get full points on class and her assignments. A very caring and kind instructor. All you need to do is to review the material she gives in time. Worthy to take her class again!

She is amazing. A real gem. She includes lots of visual and auditory learning which immensely helps to retain information. Shes also really caring and relatable, and really helps out whenever you need. Literally talk to her if you ever need anything. Her exams are pretty straight forward, use guided notes and know info on them, youll get an easyA

Heather is an amazing professor. Her lecture notes give you exactly what you need in order to succeed. When exam content isn't covered in her notes, she gives you page ranges to go over. Her lectures are entertaining and were the reason I was willing to get up for 8 AM's everyday. Go to lecture then read where you need to fill in gaps.
She's a nice professor willing to help students, and there are opportunities to get extra credits. So if you are willing to study, you will pass.

She is a great instructor! I had a slight interest in psychology, but this instructor really had a contagious passion for the subject which helped me to enjoy the class. It isn't too difficult, but I would definitely recommend attending lectures and taking good notes.

Heather Daly is a real gem! I was having trouble with the REP section and she went out of her way to help me fix it. Her lectures are funny, interesting, and she always adds pictures of her cat Finn on Fridays. I would completely recommend her for anyone. She's the kind of person you would love being friends with! Take her for PSYCH1100 in person!
Heather was very organized and spoke in lecture with a lot of passion and clarity. She made the class fun and easy to follow. She provides great guided notes and study tools that are really helpful.

summary_comment: Dr. Beers is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching and genuine care for her students' success. Students appreciate her engaging classes, clear explanations, and willingness to help, though some found her tests challenging. Overall, she is seen as a very positive and supportive instructor.

Ratings.comment: Just wanted to come on here and say that Dr. Beers is one of the most fantastic people I have ever met. I've never had a professor that cares more for her students and she genuinely just wants us to succeed. I enjoyed going to class and participating in discussions. Absolutely fantastic person, get to know her if you have the chance :)

Prof. Beers is so funny, caring, and genuinely interested in her course teachings! She is one of my all time favorites, and how cool is it to be able to say you took a Psychology of Harry Potter class in college!?

What an absolute sweetheart! Lovely lady, and really wants everyone to do well. I took stats with her, probably my worst subject, but she explains things really well and will always slow down so you know what you're doing! 10/10 would recommend

Dr. Beers was a great professor.  Her tests were fair...if you were attentive in class and studied, you had no problem.  She was also a very interesting professor...keeping my attention in class.  She explained things perfectly and gave many clear examples.
Fun lady and really interested in the subject.  Tests were all essays but graded fairly.  Anybody who says differently didn't study.

she is super nice and funny. attendence was somewhat mandatory... but she didn't mind if you had a legit reason. hardly anyone missed class. very understanding and lenient. passed out slide notes during lecture. easy material. however, you have to study somewhat for tests.. easier class to take. highly recommend.

Class was interesting and grading was fair.  Attendance wasn't really mandatory, but most people were there all the time.  Some short papers (2-4 pages) were required.  If you come to class and at least skim the reading, it's relatively easy to get an A.  Overall, great professor!

She annoyed me because she seemed so nice in class but then her tests were from the devil apparently.  I always thought I did well after they were finished and then I got my grades and would be so confused as to where all my points went!

Loved her and her classes! She passes out notes in class so that you don't have to scramble to write notes while she is teaching. She is AWESOME! The best professor I've had in my OSU stay! I def. recommend taking all courses taught by her-you will learn so much!! Tests are a bit difficult, but if you attend class, you should be completely fine!
The class was rather easy, though the exams were somewhat difficult.  She was very willing to help students and had a passion for her field.
Extremely helpful and fair. Very nice and made material clear.

Apparently just like her 367.01 class, which would be my only complaint... heavy in writing.  Otherwise, she's incredibly nice and excited to be there for you.  Her tests are challenging but material in class is presented very well in lectures.  Obviously spent time preparing for class.
Very fun and perky lady. Papers were graded a little harsh, but exams are graded easier if you know what you are talking about. Very enjoyable class.
Great lady.  mildly funny.  oh.  by the way.  My GPA took a nose dive after her course.  I got an A in a 500 level English course but got a B- in this one.  Go figure.

Very enthusiastic towards the subject but not very fair on grading. Office hours helpful.  Lost interest in class after first exam because of grading.  If you need to boost your GPA, dont take this class.

Hated it. i was excited to take the class but soon lost interest. u can learn more just by reading the text. u never know what she wants for papers and test. if u go to her for help, she just bombards u w/pics of her son and offers no useful help. perky woman, bad teacher
Very lively, kept me up at 8a. HW is pretty easy and test cover more concepts than actual math ability. Overall, pretty fair in grading and wonderful when you go visit in office hours.

Very enjoyable to have as a teacher, her tests are more concepts than math and are very difficult. But she kept class fun and interesting and was always willing to talk to you if you felt an answer was correct and hear your argument.
Very enjoyable class
very good teacher, very precise and thourough, and never strays from text, very helpful. But tests are mildly hard, def study for tests, but class is interesting and fun

Really really hard statistics course because her tests did not test students over what was taught and practiced in homework. Tests were not math based but conceptually based, and the answers she was looking for were implied, never written in notes or text
All essay tests but gives excellent help

Apparently she writes her own answers to the essay questions on saran wrap, places this over your essay exam, and takes off points wherever your handwriting deviates from her own. If you need a high GPA for grad school, steer clear of Beers.
VERY HARD ESSAY EXAMS!
No Comments

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on the Teaching of Psychology

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Seminar on the Teaching of Psychology

summary_comment: Stoni is an excellent professor known for her clarity in lectures and passion for the subject matter. She emphasizes class participation and group work, and while the workload is manageable, students must attend classes, take notes, and stay engaged to perform well, with midterms and exams being straightforward.

Ratings.comment: Stoni is a great professor, who is clear during lecture and is very passionate about her class. Very little work, midterms/exams are pretty straight forward, enforces class participation and group work. If you show up to class, take notes, and just overall pay attention, you will get an A.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as ineffective, primarily relying on final exams for grading without offering quizzes, papers, or discussion boards. Students find his exams challenging and unfair, with no curve applied even when class averages are poor. His teaching methods are criticized for being insufficient and punitive, leading many to advise avoiding his course entirely.

Ratings.comment: This guy is the worst. He only has exams as your grade. No quizzes, papers, discussion boards, or curves. When the class average came back as a 61%, his advice was simply "do better." The fact that he remains hired is beyond me. It's about time professors acknowledge their flaws when the entire class is suffering. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. HE BLOWS.

This guy downright blows. His study guides give you about 40% of the necessary topics to go over. His exams use purposely tough-worded questions to throw you off, he doesn't curve anything despite terrible class averages, and he doesn't assign anything outside of his 4 exams. Steer clear at all costs and take Abnormal Psych with any other professor

summary_comment: Dr. Wirth is a knowledgeable and engaging professor who makes an effort to relate course material to real-life situations, which aids understanding. However, his class is challenging, particularly due to frequent pop quizzes and exams that test application of concepts. While he is approachable and cares about his students' success, the class requires strong study habits and dedication to succeed.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Wirth is a really great professor. His class is slightly difficult. Take good notes, you should do fine. Gives pop quizzes so make sure to study a lot. He is a funny guy and relates material he teaches to his life, which makes it easier to understand the material. He cares about his students and wants you to pass.

Gives really good lectures . He tries to be funny ... but at least he tries. He makes remembering easier by giving us real work examples. Pop quizzes got to me but I had a chance to do some extra credit work and he will change your quiz grades to a 10/10. Exams are based off of applying what we learned to examples.
Overall a great guy. Interesting class for 8am and he knows his material. Just pay attention.

Great person in general and professor in general, but do not recommend this class to anyone who has bad study habits. Pop Quizzes will sneak up on you. Exams are worded very difficult, so you must study and know what you are learning. Lectures can be long and boring on most days.

Nice guy but not a great professor. The exams are ridiculously confusing! Please do not take any course with him unless you want trick question exams and a class with so little points that it is almost impossible to receive an A.

This class would have been a lot easier if he wasn't the professor. Every time he had to explain an assignment, he barely ever made sense. The whole class was confused during 90% of the assignments. Other than that, his power-points were very helpful. I dropped the class because he was too confusing of a professor.
If you can learn through reading a text book then, this would be a good class for you. Good professor, very clear lectures, but if you don't read you won't pass.

He's a pretty funny guy, just because you know he thought of his jokes the night before so he could say them in class. So it's an entertaining class. When it comes to the class material, he knows what he's talking about and tries his absolute hardest to make sure you know the material while he's teaching. He also expects you to read all of the mods

summary_comment: Laura Simon is highly regarded for her engaging and energetic teaching style, which keeps students motivated and involved. Despite the class requiring significant effort, particularly through reading and completing assignments, students find her approachable and supportive, with many recommending her classes.

Ratings.comment: Laura herself is very sweet, she reminds me of a Disney princess. However, this class is a decent amount of work. You must read the textbook because 10% of exam content is on it. She has very high expectations for her classes. Final Paper and Final Exam is a time killer. Only take this class if you are very passionate on the content.
she is amazing I recommend taking a class that she teaches. Assignments not too hard and help on anything is always provided if needed.

Laura is a great professor and brings a positive energy to every class that made me excited to learn! If you pay attention and take notes the exams are not hard (I didn't study at all for the midterm and got an A). Her expectations are a little high but she will always answer questions that you have. I would definitely take a class her class again!

She's very nice and gives good lectures, but she has high expectations. She does random attendence checks so you'll need to go to class, 10% of the exams are not apart of the slideshows so you'll have to read, and there's a semester long paper that's not too bad.

This class is definitely not an easy A, but the material is so interesting and Laura is amazing. The midterm was extremely hard but there was a curve, the whole class is only based on 200 points. Midterm, final, research paper, and random participation quizzes, that you had to get right, are it. Also reading is necessary, but take a class with her!

LAURA SIMON IS AMAZING! She is the most energetic, friendly, and fun teacher I have had at Ohio State. Not to mention she literally pavlovian conditions us in class with candy every time we answer a question. Like it is conditioning us to participate for candy, and she is using us as her guinea pigs! Agh she is so cool. Her lectures rock too.

This class is very definition heavy. I found it interesting, but it can get boring. Laura keeps it interesting by being very upbeat. She finds a way to mix humor, and it is clear she cares about her students. She gives candy out constantly.
Laura is a great professor and is very caring about her students to ensure everyone is successful. Loved this class!

Laura is a great lecturer. Her guided notes are very clear, and she usually explicitly points out the things youll need to know for the exam as shes teaching. She also hosts study sessions for every exam (VERY helpful), and she is very positive, funny, and caring.
Very great teacher and very caring. Also very very good looking..
More papers than I thought, but it in general it is a easy course.

Pretty incredible prof. She cared very much about us, and she was pretty good at explaining things. Her review sessions were incredibly helpful-- I only went to the review sessions for the 2nd midterm and the final, and my 1st midterm was by far my lowest exam grade despite my attempts to study on my own. Pretty funny, too, in a quirky way.

summary_comment: Dr. Opfer is highly passionate and engaging in his lectures, using real-world examples to make complex concepts accessible. Students appreciate his enthusiasm and find his classes interesting, though some note the lack of structured guidance on assignments. Exams are primarily multiple-choice and can be passed with focused study using the provided review materials, with opportunities for retakes on the first two exams.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Opfer is passionate and funny in his lectures. He explained the experiments well and provided real-world examples to make concepts more interesting. The exams require a lot of studying and the study guide only lists the concepts. He offers retakes for the first two exams to replace your grade. Each lecture covers a ton of information so show up

His lectures were really interesting and you can tell he's passionate about childhood psychology. He was very charismatic during lectures and it was easy to pay attention. His tests were relatively easy if you paid attention and took good notes. Some things on the test were things he only said in lecture but weren't in the slides or book.
Nice guy, lectures were interesting. Reading the textbook is important and theres a lot of it

He's really passionate about psychology so lectures are pretty engaging. A lot of the material you need to know comes from the book, so you should stay on top of textbook reading. For studying DEFINITELY DEFINITELY do the review questions, from each module that are in carmen, the questions really are similar to the tests. Absolutely do the REP xtra

Opfer is a nice guy who's really passionate about psych but his class lacks any real structure and he gives little to instruction on any of the graded assignment. Exams are only multiple choice and theres a retake but prepare for the worst because he gives you a study guide with basic terms and then test on super specific topics. So much READING!!!

He is very passionate about the material and tries to get everyone interested. He posts multiple choice reviews on his website that are very useful because they are very similar to the test (some of the same questions). The grades were based on several exams and a paper. His expectations are clear.

My favorite professor during my first semester at OSU. There is a lot of reading and I would recommend keeping up with it (instead of reading everything before each exam like I did). Strongly suggest going to every class. He reads from the slides on his website but keeps it interesting. Also throws in facts that are used as extra-credit on exams.

He doesn't post anything online so don't lose your syllabus. He doesn't remind you to do the REP even once so if you lose your one paper copy of the syllabus, you won't know how to do it and your grade will drop 10%. Exams are easy just do the "review" things and don't bother studying anything else.
Good professor. Made the lectures exciting and worth going to. A lot of textbook/book reading for a gen ed, but otherwise very interesting.

The honors version is easier than the regular intro to psych. You don't have to do as much out of class work, and the exams are incredibly easy. The questions are taken directly from some of the practice quizzes for each section, and he offers a retake for each exam, where he reuses questions. The final just takes questions from previous exams.

I went to one class. I read the book and did his practice problems. Got an A. The material was far too easy for him to bother teaching, and he recycles his exams. It seemed to me he didn't care--he had more important classes to worry about.
Not a terribly hard class if you attend lecture and skim the book.  Opfer is a great lecturer and really likes psychology.

Heard he was easy, so I took his class. It was really boring and class was pointless as all his powerpoints were online and they took things directly from the book. Seriously just read the book to take the tests. Retake tests if you can for the extra opp, it's nice. IF YOU SKIP DO NOT FALL BEHIND ON READING. that's what I did
This was a really good choice for an introductory level Psych class. Opfer is hilarious and always willing to help or answer questions. All of the slides are online and you can retake two midterms.

Professor Opfer is extremely helpful and funny! Always willing to help and tries his best to make classes interesting. You can also retake two midterms! He is such an awesome instructor for this introductory course!

No clue WHAT these terrible reviews are about. Dr. Opfer was outstanding. Allows you to retake midterms; learn all the vocab from the first midterm & you'll ace the retake. Final is repeat midterm questions plus a LITTLE new material. Passionate about his work and a fun guy. I'm not a psych major, but I LOVED the class and aced it.

I really enjoyed Dr. Opfer's class; you can tell he is passionate about his work. He also had a good sense of humor and a pleasant personality. The book was very good; I read it and didn't think the exam was hard. You are not graded for attendance but you'll enjoy participating in his class.
He's a good teacher who keeps classes interesting with stories and humor. Tests are fairly easy and you get to retake them and take the better score. Good teacher to have for this class

Tells you to study the powerpoints which are very general, but then there are questions about neuroscience on the test. He expects you to know the most minute details about the material, he takes the fun out of psychology. Full of himself, not very helpful. AVOID THIS CLASS

Dr. Opfer is one of the worst instructors ever. His tests are never what you think they'll be. He expects you to think at his level. If you try to go to him in person to get help he's intimidating and he doesn't want to help you improve. Exams are based primarily on examples and experiments presented in textbook and on powerpoint slides.

While this class is not easy, it is worth the effort. Opfer is extremely intelligent and he is full of info. I think he communicates the material clearly and his examples stick in your mind. He does not hand out grades, you have to earn them. I got an A by reading all of the material, attending every class and studying my ass off.

I got an 83% went to most classes, but didn't really try that hard. This class is interesting but not an easy A...more like an easy B. He tends to say ummm uh uh uh uh all the time when he speaks which is bothersome at first but you get used to it. You can tell he knows a lot about the subject, pretty interesting class

This guy is obviously prestigious when it comes to research, but he couldn't teach what he knows to save his life. Too bad- he's smart, but just doesn't know how to help others learn, which is essentially what smart people should learn to do. Unclear lectures and attention to numbers rather than concepts, which is the point of undergrad.
Hard tests, but re-takes are offered. Must be able to relate concepts, this class definitly is not about memorizing notes or definitions! He seems almost too smart to be teaching undergrads
Tests are a little hard, but we are allowed to do re takes.

Dr. Opfer is a fascinating man.  I loved the class and am contemplating a minor or second major in Psych.  The exams can be difficult, but there is a retake and the final contains questions from the midterms.  The exams were manageable enough that I could actually enjoy learning the material without worrying about the grade.
He's unhelpful and doesn't even answer emails. His tests are extremely difficult, but he offers makeups. He's full of himself but funny in class.

H100A-  John Opfer is an amazing professor.  I took this class freshman quarter and I loved every minute of it.  The tests were quite difficult at first but JUST TAKE THE RETESTS and you will be fine.

Very hard.  After you get 2 grades lower than you'd like on the tests, study the test, know it and take them makeups.  Lectures can be pretty entertaining.  He has a nice website with notes and  semi-helpful study guides.

he did not answer my emails and he lies about material on the exams. The only thing good about his class was he let us re-do midterm 1 and 2 if we wanted... prolly cuz they were impossible. ... would never recommend him
No Comments
very animated, take the retests

He loves what he's teaching and he's good at it.  Tests were not easy the first time but the re-do's allow you to do well and know what to expect.  The final was easy.  You can definitely do well in this class and learn a lot.  Had some good discussions and quite a few good laughs.
really great professor. tests and exams were easy, and if you did bad you could take it again. made lecture interesting and put all the notes online. only class i never skipped.

Amazing professor. Laughs a lot and tries to make the class as interesting as possible. Clear lectures, but he does assign a lot of out of class reading.  The tests are insanely easy and he also allows redo tests for the two midterms!  Also, the final has half questions that are repeated from the previous tests.  A fun, interesting, and easy class!
Dr. Opfer was awesome, he's very silly and always tries to make class interesting. But his class is by no means easy. You have to do all the reading to do well in the class.

The material is interesting and the classes are good.  There is no curve but there are redo exams so you can make up points.  He repeats a lot the questions from the midterms on the final.  Overall, easy and enjoyable class.
I find his midterms to be very hard especially after having read all the book material and having studied for a solid 8 or 9 hours. Too self-absorbed for my liking.

I dont know why everyone is so high on this guy. He rushed through his notes in lecture and expects you to know some of the most obscure stuff for the exams. There is also a TON of reading that he expects you to complete. Sorry Dr. Opfer, but I have a life outside of your course.

This was my second time having Opfer, and i still love him.  He makes class fun with his goofy sense of humor, and is very clear about what the tests are going to be like.  He puts everything online too!  Very cute!

Great prof. takes pride in his teaching and it shows. Laughs a lot and sounds like a cow in heat while doing it, but it only serves to make his presentations more interesting. Study and you will succeed.

quite funny and explains info really well.  the tests are very easy (mult choice) and he lets you retake them once. essay quiz is slighter harder but only counts for 5% of your final grade. lots of reading, but he puts all the notes online. great dresser too!

wow, this class is making me consider majoring in the area.  He makes it interesting with his pretty slides and jokes (even if they aren't funny, it's funny to see him laugh at them).  But, most importantly the material makes you think.  Just read the book and slides -- tests are mult choice.
Hard class, but my favorit prof to date.  great at teaching and very animated.  always helpful.  a winner.
No Comments

Ok I definitely don't think he is hot. However, he is definitely an amazing teacher. He is a bit quirky but you can really tell he loves this subject. The class is hard but that is to be expected from an Honors class. I urge anyone to take his course. But be focused on doing well.
This is the professor to take if your goal is to be a reknown expert in psychology; all others, become PhysEd majors instead. Firm, but fair.
absolutely not hot, very knowledgable, but sort of enjoys being VERY hard.  really excited about the material though.
No Comments
Very knowledgeable, clear, concise, funny...the list goes on.  Read the books and study his power points and you'll do fine.  Great class...I learned alot and had a great time doing so.
This is the best professor I have ever had - he's smart, funny, and knowledgable. And he is hot as hell.

summary_comment: The professor is perceived differently among students; while some find her great with clear notes, understanding, and helpful feedback, others criticize her for ambiguous and poorly worded assessments that can lead to deductions. Some also view her class as dry and unengaging, lacking practical applications or outside assignments, making it less enjoyable for those not inherently interested in psychology.

Ratings.comment: I would not recommend her for any course. The questions on her quizzes and papers are worded poorly and open for interpretation but she will take points off your work if you don't interpret the way she wants it.
Katie was great. She gives great feedback and helps you (and your grade) improve throughout the semester!

She is a great professor. I took psych as my second level writing class. She clearly enjoys teaching psychology and she has clear notes and outlines. The papers are graded pretty easily and she's very understanding.

Ok if you like Psych then this would be more enjoyable but it was a drag for me. She is a decent teacher but does not leave a lasting impression on what's being taught, their are no outside assignments and all you do is show up and take notes. It's just a boring class that is confusing and no projects to back up what you've learned. find other prof

summary_comment: Dr. Roberts is known for his engaging and humorous teaching style, which helps make the class more dynamic and relevant to psychology. He emphasizes the importance of reading the textbook and taking thorough notes, offering extra credit for attendance and providing opportunities to drop one midterm score. While students appreciate his helpfulness and clear lectures, some find his exams challenging and his grading methods confusing, suggesting a need for clearer explanations during lectures.

Ratings.comment: I thought that this professor did a great job in making the class more exciting and not as lecture heavy as most math courses are. He was funny and related the problems back to Psych a LOT, which was great.

Dr. Roberts is a very helpful professor. You won't do well in this class if you don't read & take notes from the book. Tests are always hard and tricky but you get to drop 1 out of 3 midterms. Don't just rely on his notes for the exams, you won't do well. Gives extra credit for attendance and it can really help your overall grade.

I highly recommend reading the chapters you'll cover in class before going to lecture, as well as taking notes from the book. I had two separate notebooks for this class--one for class notes and one for book notes and it saved my grade. The exams are so much more manageable if you're super familiar with the book. Also, ask lots of questions!

He is a great professor and very down to earth. Ppl that say it's hard have not read the chapters/absent from class all the time. I got an A, and the book lays everything out for you. Just buy the text book and read it thoroughly the week that the chapter is scheduled and you will sail on by, while others struggle giving half effort. He knows you!

Roberts has progressively become a worse teacher.  If you have him scheduled for Psych 2220, drop it now. He had to change the way he grades the class because he was failing all of his students.  He asks questions where you have to find the "most correct" answer. NO! there needs to be ONE right answer. cruel punishment.

He is really helpful and has clear lectures. He tries hard to keep everybody on the same page. I think he's one of the best professors I met in OSU! But the exams are kinda tricky so be well-prepared before you take them!  PS. Make sure you  pay well attention to his lecture and come up with questions all the time.

Professor Roberts is a really nice guy and it is very helpful for you if you visit his office hours.  However his statistics lecture is really confusing! His tests question can be tricky sometimes. I wish he could give more examples to his future student when he is doing his lectures.

I feel like Joe means well, but his lectures are extremely confusing and it seems that he makes material that is not so tough really hard to understand. There's a curve based on attendance, so that was pretty much the only reason I went to class, Tests are pretty difficult and homework is graded on correctness, and is also pretty hard.

Worst professor in my entire college education!!!  When you ask a question, he gets nervous, and moves on from your desired question. If you want examples, forget it. Roberts expects you to have prior knowledge. If you have a question prepare to be embarrassed because he makes you feel like your an idiot for having a question!

This class was terrible. I felt like I could never ask questions because Joe was terrible at explaining things in different ways. So if you didn't get the concept by his explanation, then I felt like he thought you were stupid. All the tests are conceptual based but the homeworks are all computational. I quit going to class half way through.

Dr. Roberts goes above and beyond to make time for students to ask questions and makes himself readily available in office hours as well.  The tests are very conceptual so they can be tough, but there is a curve on the final grade based on attendance. The class is definitely difficult and you need to study but he does his best to make it easier.

Super knowledgeable, educated, and organized. The material though was super tough. Hardly any math (except on the hw) but still conceptually challenging. He sets the course up in your favor (and an end of course curve) because hes aware its tough. Awesome professor overall!

It's a pretty rough class especially if you aren't very familiar with stats. The tests are all conceptual, though, so if you're worried about math, don't be. There is some math on the homework, but not the tests. The homework is manageable, but not really an easy A.

A good professor. All exams are very conceptual, focuses on logic behind the stats. Nice, helpful, very smart and spends a lot of time trying to help you make sense of the information. Overall, a difficult class but he always was happy to be there and help. I really enjoyed him.
made the class interesting, added funny personal anecdotes, and encouraged students to discuss topics.  i loved the class.

Best prof i've ever had at OSU. Course is extremely difficult, but he is so helpful, so kind, and so reasonable. Very difficult exams, can't really do well without fully understanding material but he really wants to help if you're struggling so go to his office hours! He goes back through exams to make sure they are fair. Engaging & brilliant.
He's an awesome person and professor! Very smart and funny and interesting, but a very tough grader.
Extremely difficult for a stats class but very helpful. Pay attention in class or fail.

Methods can be a very confusing class and Dr. Roberts did his best to clear up any confusion for students. The confusion was mostly because the text was unclear. He is kind and patient. You should do the readings before class because he gives quizzes randomly to keep up attendance. Exams are not bad if you have paid attention and taken notes.
He sets tricky questions for exam but he's a brilliant teacher without doubt. He totally sparks my interest in social psychology! Chapters quizzes are extremely useful!
DR. ROBERTS IS AWESOME! IF YOU HAVE TO TAKE 3321, TAKE IT WITH HIM!

Dr. Roberts is awesome! The class is hard but he is great. He is very smart and is willing to help, especially if you ask for it! Go to office hours. Grade is 40% HW 40% 2 Midterms 20% Final. He sets the class up for you to succeed. I highly recommend Dr. Roberts!

He try's to be a good teacher but his lectures can get very drawn out and boring. He puts a lot of things from the book on midterm and final so make sure you actually read it. I wouldn't recommend him at all
Very engaging speaker. Exams can be a little tricky, but there are several simple assignments to buffer your grade and additional opportunities to recover points.
Great teacher! Very engaging speaker and is great at making his points clear. He also did a great job coordinating class discussions even in a lecture hall setting.

He explains the material well and is helpful if you come to him for help, but his exams are unnecessarily difficult. He purposefully makes extremely tricky questions. I am usually a straight A student and his exams made it nearly impossible to do well. He is conniving, and makes the exams much more difficult than the material actually is.

Dr. Roberts is honestly one of the nicest profs I have had ever at OSU. He really cares about how you are doing in the class and makes every effort to work with you and the class to make sure everyone understands the material. He is one of the few profs that will go through the questions on a test afterwards to make sure they were fair. Great guy!

I had him in 485 and 508(4508) and loved both classes.  He is really smart and actually engages the class.  He is also very willing to work with students and is even willing to talk about why the wording of one of the questions on an exam might have confused you.  Best professor I've had at OSU.
Great person, he will go out of his way to help those who are trying.
I loved this class. He is a very good teacher. I did not find that he was a more difficult grader than other instructors I have had. I highly recommend this class.

He focuses on the logical side of stats more so than the math. His midterms are mostly conceptual; however, never say you want to use a calculator on his exams. He will make you wish you hadn't asked for them. Other than that, his lectures are pretty good, lot of dry humor. Read your book, it'll help. Go to lecture. He's great with office hours.

His lectures are interesting, and he's pretty funny if you can crack his dry humor. A lot of papers, grammar is really important. Tests are difficult, go to lectures and read all chapters. Interesting class but definitely not an easy A. Unless you study pretty hard, you're looking at a B. There are definitely easier second writing courses out there

He is one of the best teachers I've had. If you attend his lectures, pay attention, participate and skim over the book, which is what I did, then you'll be good. His tests encourage you to think, which I think is great! He is very fair at grading and listening to feedback on his exams, and makes improvements if necessary.

I loved this class! It is curved to a B-, but all Psych 367 classes are. He is interesting and kind of  funny. I would definitely recommend taking his class. I did not find that he was a "hard grader" compared to other instructors.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. Unfairly graded papers and test review is useless. Not willing to help you either. Didn't bother to show up to the midterm. Tries to show off how smart he is by making everybody look and feel like an idiot. Avoid if possible.

I really liked this class. He's very interactive with his teaching and the class is a lot of fun. Tests are pretty specific, but each test is reviewed after completion as a class and the unfair or ambiguous questions are removed. Only complaint: the grades are curved so that most people get a B.
He's a really hard grader.  He curves the class so the average is a B-, which really sucks when most of the students are in Honors

He grades hard, but harder on the tests than the papers. Definitely read the book! Lectures don't cover everything that will be on the test in anyway, but are still important. If you know grammar and punctuation don't buy the writing book he assigns. It doesn't let you in on any unknown writing secrets. If you want help on the papers, he'll help.
he is hard to understand and is a really hard grader. There are not many points in the class so you its hard to keep up

Joe is a really nice guy. He made the class fun and easy. There are several short written papers that he grades pretty tough but if you answer thoroughly and in an objective, scientific voice you'll do well on them.  Reading the book before class helps all the information sink in.

summary_comment: Stephanie is highly regarded for her clear grading criteria and supportive approach, making her classes enjoyable and conducive to learning. However, some students find her tests challenging and ambiguous, with double meanings in questions that can be frustrating. Overall, opinions on her effectiveness as a lecturer vary significantly.

Ratings.comment: I loved taking Stephanie's class. She was very nice and approachable. Her grading was really clear and she really wants students to succeed in her class. She gave extra credit which always rocks! Her lectures were interesting so I didn't mind going to class.

The material on the test is extremely unclear and very tricky.  Lots of the questions have double meanings and could be more than one answer.   Seemed unfamiliar with the material and constantly says "um..." which is very distracting and annoying.  Not a pleasant professor.  I would never take any class she was teaching again.

summary_comment: Professor Kallie is an enthusiastic and knowledgeable instructor who clearly explains complex topics and provides comprehensive online lectures. He offers a flexible grading system with dropped exams and an optional extra credit paper, making the class manageable with consistent effort. However, some students find his lectures dry and prefer alternative study methods.

Ratings.comment: Professor Kallie was very passionate about this subject.  He clearly explained the topics in class.  He posts all his lectures online so you can print them off, follow along, and add notes.  Gives 5 exams (including final) and can drop the lowest.  Exams all multiple choice.  Gives optional extra credit paper.

This is definitely not a class to skip. You'll find yourself failing tests unless you really know how to study. He is a good teacher; very excited about his current research. Definitely study for these tests!

There's five exams and he takes the best four so essentially you don't have to take the final if you're already happy with your grade. He also gives a bonus paper opportunity to raise your final grade 3% but it is 8-10 pages long. Good lecturer with interesting material and relatively easy exams if you study and pay attention in class.

Dr. Kallie is very interested in the material, which makes lecture more interesting. The subject matter of the class itself isn't my favorite, but Dr. Kallie works hard to find interesting examples and videos to help. He's also very helpful in office hours if need be. I would take him again.

This is a professor who really cares about his students and goes out of his way to be helpful.   His intelligence and enthusiasm is evident in his lectures and interactions with his students.  I really enjoyed his class and would highly recommend it for anyone who wants to experience a top notch learning experience.

I actually really enjoyed this professor! He seemed pretty nervous in lectures, but he had a lot of helpful demos and examples. He extends office hours before exams and is ridiculously accommodating. He puts the lectures online, so it's alright if you miss a lecture. The book is helpful for exams, but not necessary.

Not necessarily a bad professor, just very dry. I went to class at the beginning of the semester, but realized it was a waste of time as I couldn't keep up taking notes. All exams are straight off the powerpoints, mostly straightforward define or select the correct term questions. Have a B in the class, but would be easy A with 50% effort put in.

While very smart, he's very dry. Seems nervous and has to correct statements from his slides or that he has explained poorly very often. Don't bother taking if you take notes by hand because he moves fast and won't slow down. Study guides are jammed with topics but not enough depth for tests. Just read the book and skip class if you can.

Not bad. Grades are based on 4 exams and a final and the lowest of the 5 would be dropped. Read the book carefully and you will be prepared the exams. He's a nice guy who takes questions and is willing to help you. He's also really smart and makes a lot of demos himself.

summary_comment: Geoff is a dedicated teacher who provides valuable feedback on papers but can be challenging with his grading and teaching style. Some students find his class demanding yet manageable, while others warn against his lack of approachability and tough exams. Overall, opinions vary, but his willingness to help and comprehensive study materials are noted.

Ratings.comment: Geoff is a good lecturer and a great teacher! His class isn't the easiest, but is in no way impossible. He's really helpful concerning the papers he assigns and offers detailed feedback so you can improve. If you take his writing course just be careful with the first paper, everyone did really poorly. Ask for help if you aren't sure about it.

Geoff overs vague help and is not very approachable.  Very tough grader and your only grades are papers and exams.  The exams are 25% multiple choice and 75% short answer.  Avoid this professor at all costs.  Do not recommend him!!!!!

Geoff is a nice professor and is always willing to help! He gives you thick study booklets (18-25 pages) to be used as study guides for the midterms and final. If you can do those  you can do well on the exams. Warning: the final is cumulative so start early! I liked his class and would recommend him.

summary_comment: Professor Carnevale is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, which keeps students motivated despite early class times. She is known for her readiness to clarify concepts and answer questions, ensuring students understand the material. Her assessments are fair, and she effectively covers a substantial amount of content in her lectures.

Ratings.comment: Professor Carnevale is one of the best Professors I have had at Purchase College. Despite her early class times, I was always excited to attend her lectures. she exudes joy and passion for her work. She is eager to answer her student's questions and clarifies any information that a student may have missed. Her exams are fair.

She is so nice. She covers a lot of material in class  but its not bad, you don't have to read if you come to the lectures. She grades easily & her tests weren't bad. The experiments can be done in like 2 days. I enjoyed the class a lot. she's interesting & very prepared. She shows helpful videos and takes feedback seriously! A must have for psych

summary_comment: Dr. Montemayor is a knowledgeable and kind professor who makes his classes engaging and interesting, though his lectures can sometimes be tedious. Students find his exams challenging but achievable with consistent attendance and thorough preparation, as he does not post class notes online and emphasizes the importance of reading the textbook. Overall, while there are some difficulties with ambiguous test questions and technology issues, students generally recommend his classes due to his supportive nature and interesting material.

Ratings.comment: Really sweet professor. He's knowledgable and kind. Due to his age he is bad with technology and doesn't post notes online AT ALL. The exams are based on the class content so you can't get away with not going to class! You have to write 6 papers but they aren't difficult. I'd recommend this class with this Prof but there is some effort involved.

A very interesting class, and he made it easy to learn and stayed intrigued with. You have to read the book, because a lot shows up on the exams, which you will do more than fine on if you go to class for notes (not posted online, so you have to go every time), and read over the book material. Really great class, and I recommend him to all.

Dr. Montemayor was a great prof and I loved attending class. He was funny and kept things interesting but the tests were super hard. Reading the book is VERY important and without reading you definitely won't do well. There are no other grades besides 3 exams and a project so it was hard to get your grade up if you did poorly.
Really nice old man, interested in what he is teaching and makes if fun sometimes; test questions a little ambiguous

Though Dr. Montemayor doesn't post class notes and reading is completely necessary, I enjoyed this class and his teaching style. The notes were not too extensive and easy to jot down in class. He is a really nice guy who is very willing to give help. He words his test questions weird, but as long as you go to class and read (a must) you'll do fine.

I took 4551 & 4555 with him this semester. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it does help a lot to attend. His exams are pretty difficult as well, but as long as you have a general idea of the studies presented in class, you'll be fine.  He also has an awesome curve.  I failed the 1st exam horribly and still ended up with a B. overall, good prof.

The class and material were interesting, but I found that his lectures could get really tedious, and his exams were extremely difficult. He words things in a confusing way, and I often found things on the tests that were not discussed in the book or in lecture.

Montemayor is a fantastic prof. His lectures are easy to follow and very interesting and he does his best to have discussions with the class. He's always willing to help with class work or anything you want to talk about. Reading the book is a must, though. Tests are half lecture, half text book material. Overall he's amazing!

I thought this class was fantastic.  Dr. Monetmayor is very interesting and presents the information very clearly.  Reading the book is a must and the tests are challenging but I would definitely recommend this class.

Dr. Montemayor is absolutely wonderful. He is entertaining, interesting, and always open to discussion. He will answer any questions for you after class and he posts all of his powerpoints online. Although he does not take attendance, I would highly recommend attending his lectures. And reading the book is a must! Take his class if you can.

The material itself is great!  He presents the material in an entertaining way.  The tests are really hard even if you read the book.  I ended up with a B and went to class every day and asked questions.  Still I would recommend this class!
He was a good professor.  I learned a lot from him, but the class itself is hard.  You have to read the book but there is no indication of what you'll be tested over.

The class was okay. Lectures not posted online, mostly studies and their results. Exams a lot harder than lecture, lots of material from the book. Not a lot of guidance for what to expect on the exam, but two small easy papers help your grade a little bit. Probably my least favorite class I took this quarter but it definitely could have been worse.

I love Dr. Montemayor. He's a really good teacher and you will learn alot from him and not be bored. You do have to go to his lectures because he doesn't like to put up slides online. You do have to read the book, his tests are are based half on lecture and half on the book. It's not an easy A but any of his classes are definetely worth it.

I took 551 with this guy and it was hard but i still did well and liked it. Now 555 is way hard. The text book is just a regular book. and he makes it sound like he'll pull obvious things from it but there were questions on things i didn't even remember reading. I'm not saying don't take the class cause it is interesting. But be ready to study.

Very funny and interesting guy. His lectures are easy to pay attention to, and very helpful for the exams. His exams, however, are ridiculous and very hard. In his 20 years of teaching, he's only handed out 3 perfect scores on the exams. Reading the text and studying his notes thoroughly is a good way to go.

The class wasn't all that interesting, but was required by my major. He's a nice guy with a great sense of humor that keeps the class interesting. You do need the book for sure though. He uses an open discussion format in lecture and many things in the text will be on the exams but not covered in class.

This class would be easy if you had the time to put into it but I would advise not to take it with three other classes. Very nit picky about exam questions. I second this comment to a tee: "He doesn't take attendance ... didn't leave much of an impression on me."

He's a cool guy. I appreciated that he didn't just straight out lecture but asked us our thoughts and answered questions as he went along. Interesting material as well. I didn't find his exams as hard as some of the other comments are saying, but do make sure you read the assigned readings. Good class, good professor.
Great professor.  Lots of interesting material about teenagers.  Funny stories.  Grades on the curve, so your grade depends on what other people get.  Fair, but hard

I loved this teacher. He was nice, easy to listen to, and just a nice man. His tests were very hard. But I made it out with a solid high B and no regrets. It was an awesome interesting classes. All you have to do is read the book. Pretty Basic.

His exams are way too difficult and he is not clear at all. He was pretty boring. The textbook is not traditional so it's hard to know what you should be paying closer attention to. His information is all over the place

I was so excited to take this class but it was really a let down. There is too much material and he doesn't organize it in a way that is easier to understand. He kind of just gives you the book and says good luck. His exams are very hard, it's almost like he's trying to trick you. The class average was a C, and that was with the curve.

Nice guy however his tests are very tricky. His papers were very easy. He doesn't require attendance but most of the material on the exam is from the lectures. The book isn't very helpful. Your grade depends mostly on the exams. There isn't much room for error.
Great professor.  Very easy to listen to, lectures are very interesting, but 50% of the test is from the book.  Extremely intelligent man and very good class.
