He doesn't take attendance but about 40% of his test questions come straight from what he says in class. 2 tests-pretty tricky. 2 papers-very easy. You also HAVE to read the book to do well. I obviously didn't...you either find him funny or creepy. He didn't leave much of an impression on me.

551 is a very hard class. It's All memorizing data. 2 tests. Don't let the nice comments about how cool he is fool you, the class average was a D+   Montemayor apperantly has ADHD, perhaps that is what makes him amusing to others. He says weird things that don't make sense. His voice is Annoying.
He is a great professor, his lectures are interesting and completely applicable to everyday life. His tests are also very fair! I'm excited to be taking another class with him next quarter
I refuse to graduate until I take another class with Professor Montemayor.

So far, 551 has been my favorite psychology class to go to. His lectures are typically very interesting and always have some humor in them. The tests (multiple choice) were tough as you'll definitely need to read the book carefully. I thought 551 was harder than a typical psych class, but still not bad at all.

He is probably my favoreite psychology professor so far. Class is very interesting and the topics are easily relatable. I would recommend this class to anyone. Tests are  MC and can be tricky but there a chance for extra credit and 2 SMALL papers to help boost your grade.
easy class, fun. no text book just leisure books to read. cool teacher, fun class with good discussions.
The subject matter is enjoyable and the class is interesting.  The test are kind of hard with a lot of material from the textbook.  Just study hard and you'll be fine.
Lots of stories not necessary for the class, but somewhat entertaining.  Lots of very specific test questions not covered in the text or lecture.  But a better choice that Winer if you can choose.
Noice
I thought he was great.  Better than Winer by far so if you have the choice.  Montemayor is great and knows his stuff and it interested in it!
entertaining and informative
No Comments
MIDDLE NAME, "I PLAY FAVORITES."
first name Raymond

summary_comment: Dr. Egan is highly regarded for his engaging lectures and sense of humor, which make the class interesting despite the sometimes dry material. Students find his exams challenging and tricky, often requiring both lecture notes and the textbook for full comprehension. While some students appreciate his willingness to help during office hours, others find his testing methods unfair and overly demanding.

Ratings.comment: I liked him. I didn't like the exams because they were so tricky. I would much rather write papers on the subjects he tought, than take an exam. (Extra credit was like that). I could've gotten a decent grade, but never study for his exams. I studied one time and Gita perfect A. Mainly because I had so many classes. But that A helped me pass.

Dr. Egan is easily the best professor I've had. He is absolutely hilarious and that makes you want to go to class. The class has 6 exams, so it feels like you're constantly taking exams, but the lowest grade is dropped. As long as you pay attention to his lectures, an A is easily achievable.

Not that difficult, but too much work to be an easy A.  Had 13 weekly quizzes, plus 6 exams (so one every other week) which was obnoxious. Quizzes won't help your grade much. Warning: He's not as easy as he used to be. You can get an A without the book, as a bioneuropsych major who's heard some of the info before, if you memorize the lectures.

I was pretty interested in this material, and so I found most lectures interesting. Unfortunately when it came to exams it was mostly just dry memorization, which is a little boring. But the class itself was very interesting. The book is useful for reviewing and understanding.

This is the second class I've taken with Egan and this one was definitely more intense than Sensation and Perception. But honestly, go to his office hours. He's funny and 10000000% willing to talk you through what you're not getting.

Best sense of humor I've witness from any teacher. Online quizzes were just easy points, but the class in general definitely isn't a blow-off. Tests are harder than you'd expect since he comes off as such an easy-going guy. Material is pretty dry, but still worth it to take his class!

I found his tests pretty unfair, as he said in the beginning of class they would be based on the lectures, but they really weren't. I learned after the first test that just studying from lecture isn't enough, you'll probably need the textbook. He tried to be funny, but I just found it annoying, like he was trying too hard to be liked.

The tests are tricky but if you understand the concepts you should do fine. Professor Egan makes the material  (which is sometimes pretty dry and complicated) interesting and really tries to make everything clear.  He's a funny guy and very knowledgable on the subject he's teaching.

Just don't take this class unless you have to. Flawed class which I was interested in, even worse teacher. He's funny and that's about as far as his talents go in terms of teachings. Got an A, but his test questions are way too detailed and tricky. Material is dry enough as is, and he really makes it worse by making his questions tricky. No good.

Got an A in this class, still did not like Eric at all. His tests are absurd for a class like this one. His questions are too tricky, as he makes a lot of the multiple choice answers way too similar and doesn't word stuff well. He wasn't helpful; asked him to make a study guide, he said "sounds like a lot of work." Really? Wouldn't recommend him.

Great professor. Always made class more interesting with his humor and passion about the subject matter as well as passion for teaching as a whole. Actually likes interacting with students, even in a large class. Most approachable and friendliest professor I've had.

Egan is a hilarious professor, which is the only reason I semi-enjoyed this class. Reading is helpful because he usually claims that specifics and things that aren't on the slides won't be on the test which usually isn't the case. The material in this class is pretty boring, but Egan makes it fun. However, I wouldn't tag his class as a "blow-off."

Eric's exams are not what he lectures on entirely. Taken a whole bunch of Psych classes here, never had trouble with any of them. Only had one exam so far and already can tell he's a teacher who thinks he's only testing you on the material he says he is and then doesn't. Seems like a cool guy, but I honestly do not like him; something about him.

The way he lectures he is not fair in his exams. He says they are over his slides and what he says in class but many questions on his exams are about things that he very, very briefly mentioned in class. This really screws you up because you could be writing notes and miss something, and there is nothing you can do.

Top marks for Eric. He is a really nice guy who is very genuine and helpful. He is clear in class, and even though the material is on the boring side he is very good with it. One exam out of four is dropped so you don't have to take the final if you do well early on. Go to class and study lectures and it is easy to get an A with Eric.

Eric was a super enthusiastic instructor! He made the class as easy as possible, which is a pretty big accomplishment considering it is a more technical class. He is also adorable. As long as you attend class and study the notes he provides on Carmen, you will get an A in this class.

I did not think that I would like this class before taking it, but Eric definitely made class interesting. He tries to make class interactive and has a lot of demos to explain concepts. He says that you need the book, but I didn't open it past the second week. Most of the exam questions came from his lectures.

Egan is a good instructor. He speaks clearly, has a sense of humor, and is easy to follow. The class is filled with demonstrations and optical illusions to help keep things interesting. His exams are multiple choice with a joke question thrown in.

The class material is extremely boring and he tries to make it interesting but it does not work. by the second week of over half the students didn't show. His midterms are normal difficulty but his final tries to trick you. His homework seems easy but you will be marked down if the answer is not exactly what he wants.
I thought he did a really good job of trying to keep a boring class interesting. He also posts all his lectures online which is helpful if you don't go to class.
good teacher. keeps a boring class interesting

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for printing detailed notes and providing comprehensive study guides, which enhance students' learning experience. However, some students find his lectures challenging due to his quiet delivery and low volume, which can make it difficult to follow along. Despite this, he is described as kind, helpful, and willing to assist students with extra credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment: helpful notes,but very quite and seemed unmotivated.

May because I am not a native speaker, this course is a little hard for me. He is really a kind and nice guy. He is willing to help you and explain the materials. Some extra credit opportunities and printed notes. However, his voice is low.
Chris is very kind and helpful.He prints out every notes, so u just can review materials quickly and efficiently. But I think sometime the content is a little difficult (for me)

Prints out all the notes for you, so all you have to do is go to class. Announces the quizzes ahead of the time and allows you to make up missed points. Provides comprehensive study guides for both the quizzes and exams. Overall, good teacher.

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as impersonal and challenging, with tricky exams and a lack of guidance. While some students found her helpful and engaging, others criticized her for being difficult to follow and inconvenient with her lecture notes. Overall, recommendations for her vary widely, with some strongly advising against her while others praise her assistance and teaching style.

Ratings.comment: She is very impersonal. She provides a powerpoint with a few blanks in efforts encourage you to attend and keep you engaged. The midterms/finals are very trickily worded and difficult. I was two points away from an A- and she very rudely told me she would not give me the points, because I had received all the points on the essay, makes no sense.
I would not recommend her to anyone. Very precise in what she is looking for, though lacks instruction and guidence. She is not nice and boring to listen to.
Synthia is an amazing lecturer. She is very helpful and willing to go to any extent to make sure you understand the material. I would definitely recommend Synthia!

I completely disagree with previous poster, I only really studied for the final and was able to get an A-. Synthia is really nice and willing to help if you don't understand a concept. Reading the book definitely helps but not because of her, but because there is so much info in the course itself. I really liked Synthia!

I would not recommend this professor.  Her lectures never seemed to expand on the material or make it easier to understand than the book.  She talks too fast and it is hard to follow.  Also, she posts notes late at night which was really inconvenient.  Not a very easy class.

summary_comment: Dr. Chalk is highly regarded for her excellent explanations and engaging teaching style, making complex concepts accessible. She is known for her personable nature and genuine desire to assist students, though her grading is noted for being stringent, particularly in writing clarity. Students appreciate her thoroughness, clear examples, and helpful test preparation strategies.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Chalk is a great professor; she explains the concepts very well and is easy to understand; however, she grades really hard on writing. She is really big on clarity, that is what will bring your paper grade down, even if you go to the writing center. Make sure your ideas are clear and understandable. The textbook is used for online quizzes-READ!
She makes class very relaxing and enjoyable - like spending time with friends. Holly is very personable and doesn't talk down to the class, but still offers help when it's needed.
boring class, dont even need to go to class often, be familiar with the book. She's helpful, spends too much time on the same topic, but overall not bad at all.  :)

Holly is an awesome psych teacher. I basically echo everything that was already written, but I also especially appreciate that she takes so much time to make power point presentations for each lecture, and the way she explains things makes it far easier than if we'd have to learn everything by books
She is very thorough, explains material well, gives good examples, fields questions when they arise during the lecture.  She is also very personable and genuinely wants to help us out in any way.
Very helpful. Gvies you a good idea of what will be on the tests. Gives good outlines to study from. Very clear. Gives good examples to help students understand.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as overrated and overly self-absorbed, according to student feedback.

Ratings.comment: Overated Prof. who is in love with himself.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is known for being witty and entertaining, particularly due to his New Zealand accent, but lectures often move quickly without detailed explanations of computations. Students emphasize the importance of attending lectures and using class notes, as the homework is challenging while exams are relatively easier. Some find his teaching style unsuitable for introductory courses and note frequent typos in lecture slides.

Ratings.comment: He flies through the slides, and doesn't actually explain his computations.  He'll put a whole slide of computations and just show you the end result but not actually explain too much of how he got it.  I hope you have a prior knowledge of Stats before taking his class.

You don't need the book but you must go to lecture, the online homework is pretty hard but the exams are easy, you get to take a cheat sheet with you to the exams. You also must have the notes for class because he talks way too fast to just write them down. He's a great teacher, the homework, is just difficult.

Witty prof from New Zealand. You don't need to get the book, but you have to go to lecture. Office hours with the TA's saved my life. You have to do online quizzes every week that can be pretty tricky so find a buddy to check answers with! He lets you have an equation sheet but study for exams! I ended up getting an A- and I hate any type of math.
This guy is witty and knows his stuff but should NOT be teaching an intro level class. Flew through slides and the homework is ridiculously hard.

This class is awful. Though he can be entertaining, he cares not about your grade or your comprehension of the material. The homework is outrageously more difficult than the exams. He flies through the material ppts. which are OFTEN riddled with typos, which is very unsettling when trying to learn math.
great teacher

This class was kind of boring. The Prof was funny though and tried to make the material funny and interesting. You don't use the book much (unless you miss lecture) he even tells you not to buy it if you don't want to. His humor adds to his lecture, which is about an hour shorter than the schedule says, but he goes through slides really fast!

He is funny; his New Zealand accent and humor were entertaining. He is willing to help, but has trouble dumbing down the material. Also, he at times gives leeway on hard cut-offs for rejecting the null hypothesis, which is confusing. I highly recommend asking your TA(s) for help if you need it.
AMAZING teacher. He was funny and down to earth. Highly recommended.

homework if anything is what brings down your grade. his midterms are pretty much the EXACT same questions as the ones he presents during the reviews, just write those problems on your cheat sheet and you're pretty much set. easy professor, kind of a mess, DON'T TAKE IT if you don't have to.

Dr. Ratcliff is AWESOME.The course material is pretty difficult. He moves fast through slides, but fortunately does plenty of examples and always reviews before new stuff is introduced. ASK HIM QUESTIONS! He is really good about explaining stuff. TA's quality varies. Make sure you establish a relationship right away it is beneficial. Lots of HW.

This class is impossible and useless if you do not know anything about statistics. It is supposed to be an introductory class but treats it like an upper-level stats course. He goes through slides too fast and even though they're available through carmen, they're useless if you don't know how to interpret them.

Very boring material and he is really confusing to listen to. If you don't know too much about stats.. he's not going to teach you the basics. He assumes you already know a lot. The material is so dry. He tries to slip some jokes into the lectures.. but it's just painfully boring. Only one of the TA's were helpful, still impossible though.

This class is terrible.  Ratcliff, while nice and quirky, does not understand that not everyone understands stats the way he does.  I've taken two other stats class and this one, which covered the same stuff, made it impossible.  He should not be teaching this low of a class.  Plus, the TA's were terrible.  Its a good class to have, but not with hi

Professor Ratcliff was an extremely enjoyable professor who made statistics a much more enjoyable class. He involved himself in the class, and despite initial glitches in the class (CARMEN) maintained a sense of humor. His exams are straight forward IF you pay attention.

psych 320 is harder than regular stats, but prof. ratcliff put the notes online, always explained things carefully, and even had a low key quirky sense of humor. he made a boring subject enjoyable and spent plenty of class time working us through problems that would be on the tests - super helpful!!

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Mathematical Models in Experimental Psychology

summary_comment: Professor Matt is highly regarded for his engaging and effective teaching style, known for making complex material accessible through lively lectures and thorough review sessions that prepare students well for exams. Students found his approach so effective that many felt they did not need to read the textbook if they attended his classes regularly.

Ratings.comment: Matt was great- Always fun and gave very helpful review sessions before all exams, and made it so we didn't need to read the book if we attended lectures!

summary_comment: Dr. Betz is highly regarded by students for her exceptional teaching and caring nature, often described as "awesome" and "one of the nicest professors" they've had. Students appreciate her willingness to help and her approachable demeanor, though some find the class challenging and suggest studying diligently.

Ratings.comment: I LOVED this professor.  She extremely helpful with any questions you may have, and she really cares for her students.  She is AWESOME!

Dr. Betz is absolutely amazing. She is friendly and funny and I actually enjoyed lectures. Material isn't hard to deal with and there's no textbook, 3 exams worth 60pts each and a couple small assignments. I had her for Psych 300 as well, I'd recommend her for any class. She's caring, considerate, and understanding. I can't say enough. She's great
Dr. Betz is the one of the nicest professors I've ever had.  I would take her again if i could...her TA Hye Bin is a tough grader though.  300 is an easy class, an easy A.
Dr. Betz is the one of the nicest professors I've ever had.  I would take her again if i could...he TA Hye Bin is a tough grader though.  300 is an easy class, an easy A.

Good teacher, great person. Willing to go above and beyond to help students. Left me a note on my homework asking if I wanted any advice on applying to graduate schools, without me asking her beforehand.

Dr. Betz is SUCH a nice lady!! This class is tough though, and there is no book, so you pretty much just have your lecture slides and notes to go by. I would recommend attending lecture even though the subject matter can be very dry. Study hard and you'll do fine. I really recommend this class to psych students who want to go to grad school!

Dr. Betz is ALWAYS there to help and will work with you if you ask her to.  She does make semi-frequent mistakes on her powerpoint slides etc. but if you are confused she will clear the confusion for you.  Class is hard but if you need help ASK and you will be fine.
Has no clue what she's doing. She spends more time correcting her mistakes and rushing through material than actually explaining the material. A straight Stats class would be more helpful.

If you go to class and pay attention, I don't see how you could not do well. Though i did not personally find the subject matter to be interesting, class was bearable and attendance (while not mandatory) will really help you, because a lot of what is said in class is helpful in understanding and learning the material, and is included on the exams.

Class dragged on a little but Nancy made it fun. Grade is determined from 3 hw short hw assignments, a survey, 2 midterms, and a comprehensive final. I didn't look at the book once and I got a B+ in the class. Print out the notes, go to lecture, and you will have no problem. Also, her TA is a very sweet girl who is very helpful.
Terrible. Her lectures and notes drag on forever. The TA was awful as his e-mails and exams were riddled with poor grammar and contradictions. This class was a complete waste of time.

Dr. Betz is cool! I picked up this class last minute after dropping something else and I'm really glad I did because it was not only surprisingly interesting but personally enriching (you get to take career and personality tests). She's really clear and helpful too and has an amusing dry humor. I would take anything else she teaches.
Dr. Betz is awesome. She's funny and adorably awkward if I weren't graduating I'd try to take more classes from her. Doesn't make you buy a book either!
Very sweet woman. Extremely helpful. Decently interesting class.
Amazing teacher!  Keeps lectures interesting and is so extremely helpful in making sure you understand everything!!!

take your next class with prof betz!! she's awesome...always ends class 15 mins early, puts all notes up on power point.  only 3 homework assignments and 3 exams.  the homework was quite easy, and the exams are all 50 mc questions.  her wording can be a bit misleading, but if you get less than a B you're an idiot

Extremely lenient on tests, never gave out homework assignments, and very intellectual on the material.  The classes were somewhat boring, but if you made an effort, she'd make sure you got a good grade no matter what.

Dr. Betz is awesome! I only took this class because I knew it was good for grad school prep, but now I love psych testing! I would recomend this class or any of her classes to anyone. She's a great professor and really funny. I always looked forward to her lectures!
I loved this class!
Great job! Learned a lot in this course. The atmosphere was supportive, and discussion topics and presenters were excellent!

Every class that she teaches is so easy. If you go to lecture you dont even need to study for the exams. That's how easy it is. She reads the words off the slides word for word so going to class isnt really all that important either but it helps so that you dont have to study later. I'd recommend any class she teaches and I also took her 300 class.
Betz is always very helpful. Final exam is a compilation of the previous exams. Must study to do well. Excellent professor!

She is soo cool.  Boring but cool.  I have never read the book and have an A thus far.  Her exams are from her handouts in lecture, and they are very clear, and precise. I expect an A in her class, and majority of the class has an A.  She is a great professor and always willing to help you out extra if needed. I highly recommend her classes.

she's very helpful,gave extra credits. most of the people are doing very well in the class. dont expect the class to be fun, since it is a research course. but she is VERY HELPFUL and WILLING TO HELP!!expect an easy A!!a well known professor in OSU as well!

summary_comment: This professor excels in making statistics accessible and engaging, with clear explanations and organized material. Students appreciate his chill demeanor, ample extra credit opportunities, and surprisingly good lectures. While homework can be challenging, exams are manageable, and overall, he is highly recommended for fulfilling psychology statistics requirements.

Ratings.comment: As clear as a stats course can get. He is a really chill, calm dude and explains everything pretty well. I'd recommend him to everyone that has to take Psych220 to fulfill their stats req.
Plenty of extra credit. Much more clear than some of the other 220 profs. Not too hard.

His homework is challenging, but his exams are okay.  He provides extra credit.  Material is very organized.  Lectures are mixed (short, long, interesting, boring).  They're way better than I expected for a statistics course.

summary_comment: Dr. Tracy is described as a very nice and patient professor who genuinely cares about his students, but his classes are often perceived as easy and somewhat boring due to the repetitive nature of reading from slides. Students find the material mundane and not particularly challenging, with quizzes and tests requiring significant memorization. While some appreciate his helpfulness and willingness to explain concepts during office hours, others feel the lack of engagement and depth makes the classes feel superficial.

Ratings.comment: Tracy is a pretty nice guy but his class felt like a waste of time. He read right of the slides and whenever someone asked him a question, he responded with "I'm not really sure." The class never felt challenging, never used the textbook EVER which is a bummer because I can't sell it back. If you're looking for an easy but boring class, this is it.

This class was alright..not too hard but not easy either. Dr. Tracy is a nice guy but doesn't have much knowledge on some topics. He pretty much just read off the powerpoints so attending class isn't really necessary except for when readings are discussed since class participation is a portion of the grade. I recommend this professor

quizzes almost every tuesday and yea if you miss some, you could be in trouble. but there are 9 solid ones and 3 pop ones, only 6 of them count. and they are not hard. textbook is very helpful because his wording is not so clear. not a pain book to read either. 3 exams, all pretty easy. classes are boring. but he is very nice.

The class was okay. He basically reads of his power point slides, making class boring at times. There is a quiz almost every week, and three out of nine are dropped. Worth 30% of grade. No papers. Book is not necessary, but can be helpful. There are other readings along with this class as well.

9 quizzes, 3 dropped and two tests. didn't buy the book nor went to class, except for quiz/test days. the quizzes are  harder than they look..3 questions worth 10 points. miss one and you have a 7/10.   the tests require a massive amount of studying/memorizing. hes super nice though and genuinely cares.

Again, REALLY nice guy. Material is super mundane. his slides can be a little disorganized but if you know how to take notes you should be fine. dont think exams are that hard as long as you study in detail. come to office hours and he'll explain anything you dont understand. Likes to teach, patient, and very nice. Honestly, the class is easy.

He is so sweet and knows what he's talking about...unfortunately the material couldn't be more dull. I didn't go to class a lot because I'd just fall asleep, but it's not his fault. I still did well because it's not that hard. But there's only 3 tests and a few homeworks, so if you mess one up, you're pretty much screwed.

Dr. Tracy has been by far one of the sweetest professors I've had at OSU.  However, he was the only professor I received a D under.  In the 5 week summer class we only had two grades- mid term and final.  Both tests Dr. Tracy divided in half, and you wouldn't get the second until you turned in the first.  damn near impossible esp w/ fill in parts.
PROS: He's very helpful, and he curves to 80%. CONS: Lectures can be slow and boring, and the exams can be difficult. The average for the first midterm in my class was in the high 60s.

Dr. Tracy is really great! He explains everything very thoroughly and always provides good examples. He's very helpful and easy to approach. I've taken 300 and 310 with him and they were both challenging, but he's always willing to help. You have to work hard to get good grades, but you'll learn a lot!
AVOID HIM WHEN TAKING PSYCH RESEARCH! HE IS VERY DIFFICULT. THE TESTS ARE RIDICULOUSLY HARD!

Dr. Tracy is very nice and willing to help those who don't understand the material very well.  He's very thorough with his lectures, and the class is very organized.  There are 9 quizzes (then the3 lowest scores are dropped), a midterm, and a final.  The exams have bonus questions.  You should do well just by studying the notes.

Nice guy HORRIBLE teacher Uses EXACT same material from the book, examples, sentences, pictures, etc. basically just copies & pastes for the slides & then just reads them off... & is still too lazy to even make a study guide! Tests are RIDICULOUSLY hard. Plus a quiz EVERY week! Stay away if you can, will bring down your GPA even if study for days!

Prof Tracy is extremely boring.  class is easy.  he makes descriptions of everything way more complicated than they need to be, so teach yourself.  one midterm and one final plus 3 q quizzes every tuesday..drop the 3 lowest.  quizzes sucked, the rest were easy.  take this class.  u should be able to get at least a B with effort.
He is nice and helpful. However, NOT the best professor ever due to the fact that he is so boring. The only class that I had to fight to stay awake every time we met.

By far the best professor I've ever had at Ohio State.  He explains things thoroughly and goes really slow so everyone can catch on.  Turn in the hw on time, go to class, and definitely go to office hours at least once.  VERY VERY VERY GOOD PROFESSOR!

Dr. Tracy is nicest professor I've ever had.  He is very patient with his students and tries to explain things until everyone understands.  Exams are fair.  You're also graded on homework assignments and class participation.

Very helpful and explains things thoroughly.  He goes through the labs and lectures pretty slow and he's really patient.  His tests are somewhat difficult, but if you go to office hours and do the homework, it's an easy class.  I definitely recommend this professor.

It's impossible not to understand the material because he goes over every little thing until you're tired of hearing about it.  I didn't use the text book once - all test material is from the lectures.  Weekly quizzes make studying for exams quick and easy.  He does use the word, "then" a lot.  It's really annoying at first, but you get used to it.

Really really really nice guy. Class was very boring though because he just uses powerpoint, but the material itself is pretty interesting I thought and it isn't hard to get an A if you just put in the time.
Okay teacher, horrible class. Tracy is probably far more engaging in other classes, but the material in research methods in horribly dry. At least he made an effort.
Puts notes on internet. Extremely helpful and is interested in involving students.

He's a good professor but the subject matter is BORING. it's easy material, but you've got to make sure you study it because some of his exam questions are pretty ambiguous. He says "then" way too much, which annoys me to death...but other than that he is a really great professor..take him for 300.

PROS: He's a nice guy, there's no homework, he grades very leniently, and wants to help you as much as possible. The only cons are that his lectures are really boring since he does go through 50 slide powerpoints over a span of 2 hours; but that's the only bad thing about this class, which made it a pretty stress-free class overall.

Dr. Tracy is very nice. His H100 class is easy--no homework. Make sure you participate because it's 20% of your grade.However, Dr. Tracy makes the class very boring. Every class (2 hours long) we go through a 50 slide powerpoint presentation. It is so boring! He also uses the word "then" a lot. But Dr. Tracy is a nice guy and wants you to succeed.

I love this guy! Class is straight forward. No lame papers or presentations, just 2 exams and weekly quizzes. He drops your 3 lowest quiz grades and he curves! He explains things very well. He's a great teacher! Plus, he's easy on the eyes! Go to lecture, study the notes he puts on Carmen and you'll do fine!
Very nice...Seems to like the idea of teaching not the job behind it
Very helpful whenever I had questions.

Like many have said, it was a boring class, but Erik was definitely into what he was teaching. Tests are easy and he offered extra credit which had the potential to boost your overall grade by 5 percent. Oh, and DO THE HOMEWORK!

Easy to get an A. He's very helpful. If you miss class or need help with anything, he is more than willing to help as long as you contact him. Go to class if you don't want to have to read the book. His exams are directly from his notes. Don't buy the book!
Very easy to get an A.  Recommend going to lecture - that way you don't have to read the book.  Checked out textbook from library before exams, did just fine.  Good curve.
Nice guy. He tried the best he could to teach incredibly boring subject matter.

The MOST boring class I have taken at OSU. Dr. Tracy has good intentions but the class was horrible. Not as easy as I expected and I wanted to poke my eyes out everyday in lecture. Pick someone elses class, do yourself a favor.

Lectures are word-for-word from the book, so no need to buy a $100+ textbook.  I didn't go to class after the midterm, read the book instead and did fine.  It's a good idea to attend lectures, though, because Dr. Tracy's pretty thorough in his explanations and it cuts down on study time.
Great teacher!  Really enjoyed taking the class.
No Comments

Erik was seriously the nicest teacher I have met at OSU so far. He's very helpful and very kind. He's generous on the notes, attend class and it will cut down on your study time. ATTEND CLASS. Don't be afraid to ask for help, he's very nice.
Very good T.A.

summary_comment: The professor is described as inconsistent and polarizing among students. Some found her explanations clear and the class easy, praising her willingness to help with papers and her helpfulness, while others criticized her condescending attitude, low grading standards, and ineffective teaching methods. Overall, opinions vary widely, with both positive and negative experiences reported.

Ratings.comment: Gave low grades on papers, but midterms fairly easy. NOT an easy A. However, she was willing to help you with papers if you went to see her.

Hated this class, I would not recommend her. The grades on papers were extremely low with the first couples' average being under 50%. She seems like a nice person, but came off as condescending in class as a teacher. Needed the textbook to reference for papers

In one word: TERRIBLE. I have never seen a teacher talked down to her students as much as she does. She thinks she is Goddess of Writing and low-balls everyone's grades to show it. I got a 48% on my first paper, which was the 4th highest in the class! Who let this PhD student teach?

Bad reviews came from students who obviously fail at life. Extremely easy professor. Gives fill in the blank guided notes straight from book. Extra credit quizzes and reviews on each chapter and before each exam.  You dont even have to read if you just go to her class. Really helpful, clear teaching. Courtney was awesome!

I don't know why she received any bad comments...I always found her class and examples interesting. She explained things very well and had a true interest in the overall success of the class. Also, I needed help with papers, and she was extremely helpful to me. I would definitely recommend her.
She explains things very well. EASY. I honestly have no idea why she is receiving such poor reviews. I only miss 3 points in the entire class. I would recommend her.
Should not be teaching
Boring, Just reads from the book.  They must have been desperate for teachers when they hired her

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered unengaging and unfair in grading, despite being described as nice and passionate about her subject. Students found her lectures often boring and irrelevant, and her approach to teaching and assessment methods were seen as inconsistent and confusing. While some appreciated her helpfulness and clear explanations, particularly in online settings, the overall consensus is negative due to the perceived lack of effective teaching and fairness in grading.

Ratings.comment: She is helpful in the sense that she will answer questions if you have them. However, she talked [not even bothering to talk quietly] to her TAs during the midterms, thankfully she was gone for the final. Lectures were boring and more a waste of time than anything else.

She is passionate about her subjects, but her lectures were somewhat pointless, as the majority of them were videos that were unrelated to the topic at hand. Talked with her TAs during the midterms and final. Quizzes were over topics that were not covered yet in the class.

Probably the most boring class I have ever taken, completely pointless and dull. She is nice, but an unfair grader. After my group changed our entire project to her critiques and specifications, she still docked us a ton of points for who knows what.

I took her online class. First,I felt upset about online class, but in fact, her lecture was very interesting and clear. She is a really nice person. You can email her if you have any question, and she will reply soon.

Ellen is really really nice.  I took her online class so i only really met her in person twice but her lectures were really clear and entertaining.  She always says "mmkay" after everything she says haha
AVOID AVOID AVOID. This class was awful. Random attendance points, true/false midterm and final, and a quarter long group project.

She seems like an extremely nice and funny person. Definately interested in what she does...research. Unfortunately not a great prof. Quizzes online over the material you cover in class the next day with material she rarely clarifies. Quarter long group project and the non-mandatory attendance quickly becomes mandatory with frequent pop-quizzes.
interesting and passionate teacher. Love her!

Ellen is a great teacher! Her class is pretty easy overall but just make sure to show all work on exams and homework. She is always willing to help and she makes statistics as fun as it possibly could be!
great teacher, shes super helpful, but make sure you show ALL your work in psych 220, or she will DEFINITELY take points off

Class is tough because it is online.  Watch and pay attention lectures.  Do the practice questions and do the review before exams.  Questions are often similar to those.  Ellen is really nice and does not mind helping you if you have a question while you are taking the exam.

Go to class. Read the notes and you should be at least able to pull of a B. Keep up with the material and you'll do well. Get the book it helps cover stuff you don't have time to cover in class.  Ellen is great...highly recommend you take her. My class was always above the average.
Good Teacher

Great teacher! She often goes off and tells us stories about her research and how she's not lost any fingers to a chimp yet, but always gets everything covered. She's also really good at getting every question answered whether we need it for the test or not.

Truth be told in this online class i did no studying on my own , nor did i watch any of the lectures , but i did however attend the insanely helpful exam reviews and walked out of the class with a B. the class was easy and the teacher was sweet , i would definatley recommend her and the class
Online class, voice is monotonous. Lots of time wasted with pointless videos integrated into lectures.  Would not recomend taking an online class with her.

Alright teacher, but her participation and quiz policies do not make sense.  Makes quizzes really hard and will send an email saying how hard they are like she is proud of failing the class.  She is nice, but doesn't seem to really want to be teaching, seems like she'd rather be somewhere else.
She is an awesome teacher! I had her at 8 am, which was slightly depressing when I got up, but she is really funny and easy to learn with.
She is awesome.  I had her class at 8 am and she was my only motivation to wake up.  Very very interesting and funny!

I currently have Ellen as a teacher in my psych 100 class.  She is fun and goofy and makes class interesting.  She always brings examples that help make the sometimes confusing concepts clear.  She is very helpful and encourages class participation.  I really hope that I get her if I take Psych classes in the future!  I high recommend her!!!
Great Teacher, she shows realy enthusiasm and is very willing to help.  SHe makes class humorous with her stories.  The class material is a bit much, but she makes it tolerable
Great Teacher and Person! She has a corky personality, but she is fun and really into what she is teaching. Easy A if you go to class and the review sessions.
Wonderful teacher! She provides her slides online and they cover almost everything that you need for the exams. I never opened the textbook other than to look at a couple charts and I still got an A.
Very helpful. Good guided notes.

Really good teacher with good examples. I didn't go to class very often but it was helpful when I went. She's very approachable and helpful one on one. Do the reading and listen to her explanations and you'll do fine in the class.
She was very nice and helpful, she really cared about helping students and making sure students understood.
She gives really good notes, shes funny, nice, and cares about students.  Highly recommend her, just do the reading and go to class and you should pass with minimum of a B if not an A
She was great and helpful and really cared about the students

summary_comment: Tammy is widely regarded as a very helpful and approachable professor who genuinely wants her students to succeed. Her classes are generally considered easy, with multiple opportunities for extra credit and fair exams. However, some students feel that the material is simplified, which can be frustrating for those seeking more challenging content.

Ratings.comment: One of the easiest classes I have taken.  Tammy is a wonderful person and very interested in helping her students succeed, but I almost feel as if she dumbs down the material which is a little frustrating in itself.  With that said, it was a nice class to take when other classes were giving you trouble.  Don't need the book either!

Such a great professor! Exams are easy, gives multiple opportunities for extra credit, has chats on carmen for exams and posts manuscripts. Book not necessary. Print out notes, go to lecture, and you will have no problem getting an A.
Open minded and willing to accept alternate answers on exams provided you can give good reasoning. Also relatively helpful during office hours.

Tammy's a nice and helpful instructor. Your grade would be determined by pop quizzes, 2 midterms, and a noncummulative final. The exams are fair. But with all the extra credit opportunities she provides, you should do much better in the class. She also held "office hours review sessions" on Carmen chat.

very nice, had a genuine interest in her students as people, as well as their success in the class. was able to explain things very well, gave good examples to demonstrate her point. still remembers what it's like to be a student, so she's very mindful of that. final isn't cumulative, AND she holds review sessions via the carmen chatroom.

She was very helpful and nice. She really wanted everyone to do well, and, for the most part, everyone did. The tests weren't bad at all and some of the material was pretty interesting. Overall it's another pretty easy class in Psychology with a nice professor that I would recommend.

summary_comment: Dr. Briggs-Phillips is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, making her psychology class one of the most enjoyable for students. She focuses on class discussions, which can be crucial for understanding the material, though attendance is not mandatory. Her exams are generally easy, and she is known for being very supportive and helpful.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Briggs-Phillips is awesome! Cancelled class a lot and gave really easy exams. Probably the least boring psychology class I've ever taken.

She is a wonderful professor!  She is funny and very helpful.  The class is based off of class discussion, so while attendance is not mandatory it would help a lot.  Most of the questions are based on discussion that you cannot make up and some are very the text.  She is just great and it's a shame she doesn't teach more classes!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for their excellent teaching quality, consistently described as helpful, kind, and dedicated to student success. They provide comprehensive notes during lectures and include relevant material in quizzes, though these can sometimes cover topics not directly taught in class, requiring students to do additional reading and memorization.

Ratings.comment: Very good teacher. Very helpful and kind.
Always willing to explain something further if you don't understand. Truly wants you to do well. Hands out notes that you just fill out. Quizzes are very simple.

Gives notes on handouts.  Simply go to class and fill them out.  Doesn't put notes on carmen.  Quizzes are detailed and on some material not covered in class is on the quiz.  A lot of memorization and reading.  Overall, not bad if you do the reading and prepare.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his enthusiastic and organized approach to teaching, making classes both engaging and enjoyable through interactive methods. Students find him extremely helpful and genuinely interested in their learning, praising his clear explanations and willingness to assist.

Ratings.comment: Very enthusiastic about teaching, very organized, very helpful!
Went out of his way to make class fun, using many different tactics for us to learn by experience instead of in lecture form.  Very very nice.
Chad is a great lecturer.  His quizes aren't bad and he's super cute!
Overall, very good. He keeps the lectures interesting and engaging. The class also covers everything required; you really learn lots. I enjoyed going.
Extremely helpful and clear.  You can tell Chad is genuinely interested in teaching.  Gives guided notes so you can follow his powerpoints.  Go to lectures and study old tests and you'll be fine.
He is the nicest professor I have ever had.
So adorable & willing to help with anything :)
No Comments
Fantastic teacher. So far, my favorite professor.  Took great interest in anyone who needed help, or was interested in the major

nicest guy ever. very interesting and adorable. keeps even me paying attention which is a big accomplishment. he even gave out his cell number when class started in case we ever needed it. im sure no one used it but it was a huge sign of what kind of teacher he is.

summary_comment: The professor is known for delivering straightforward, easy-to-follow content with minimal engagement, relying heavily on PowerPoint presentations derived directly from the textbook. While some students find the material interesting and the grading curve favorable, others describe the lectures as monotonous and difficult to sit through, with one student strongly advising against taking the class.

Ratings.comment: Not a very engaging professor, but the class is easy. Powerpoints are straight from the book and tests are straight froom the powerpoints..do not buy book! You can find it at the library reserves. Only 3 tests, with the lowest dropped. Grades are curved at the end..interesting material!
A very good professor - I really enjoyed attending his lectures. He's extremely knowledgeable on this subject and is genuinely interested in teaching. Awesome prof, awesome class!

Terrible terrible terrible terrible professor!!!! I can't even explain how much I hated his class. I am very interested in this topic and he made me hate it. Sitting through his classes is the worst experience ever. He speaks incredibly slowly and in a monotone voice and does absolutely nothing for his students. Never goes over tests. AVOID!!!!!!!!

The material is tough, but if you pay CLOSE attention during lecture you should do okay. I'm into this topic so it was probably a bit more interesting for me. He's kind of witty, explains things pretty well for such a complex topic.

There was a lot of talk about neurotransmitters and whatnot, which I wasn't prepared for and his monotone voice made lectures kind of painful to sit through; however,if you study the powerpoints he posts on carmen, you will do well in the class. Also, if you do well on the first two exams, you are done for the quarter!
very interesting, lot of material, grades are curved
Great class--great prof

Definitely a lot harder then it seems. A lot of memorizing technical drug names and history of drug use. Tricky test questions and a TON of material to learn. Does not give +/- only A,B,C,D. Test averages in my class were low 70%. It's also really hard to listen to his voice during class and he goes really quick through the slides. AVOID!!

This class should be named Into to Neuropharmacology. Avoid if you are dumb about Psychiatry and drugs. You'll be memorizing pill names and what receptors they hit. I got a B by looking at the powerpoints the night before.  that's only because of my previous intrest in crazy meds. Tough class for most, although heavily curved.
Best class ever.
Great professor, got me interested in this topic and now I'm going to graduate school!
Totally awesome class.  Best professor I ever had.
This class should be taught online. There is no reason to go to class. All he does is read directly from the slides. His exams are hard... but his curve in the end is nice. Lectures are VERY boring!

Interesting material. DO NOT BUY BOOK!! You will never open it. His powerpoints come straight from book and test question come straight from powerpoints. Class becomes a bit boring after awhile. Best 2 out of 3 on your test grades.  Failry hard class. I still recommend it.

He LITERALLY reads right from the powerpoint slides, so if it's in outline form, don't expect him to make clear sentences and explain further then what is stated on the slide. slides posted online, study from those. grade is based off 2 out of 3 tests. You drop your lowest test. easy if you study the slides that he tells you to for the tests.

Another class where the only grades are a 50% midterm and a 50% final. I hate that. I don't think there was any curve so if you moderately screw one up, well, you are kinda just screwed in general. He seems like a nice guy but after a week you will probably get bored of his lectures and just stop going. Just download/study from the powerpoints.

He wasn't the most well organized prof, but lectures are interesting and he fosters discussion very well.  Tests were difficult, if you didn't study.  He is very willing to help, but you have to ask for it first!  Just because you didn't study and didn't get an A doesn't make it a bad class or him a bad prof.
So disappointed. He is so unclear and the tests are hard!
Watch out for this guy. He only does 2 grades - a midterm and final - but they're so hard! The class was called psychology of drugs and behavior, yet I have not seen any behavior aspects yet.

summary_comment: Dr. Arkes is highly regarded as an excellent professor, known for making the subject of judgment and decision making both engaging and enlightening. Students find his classes challenging yet rewarding, with many reporting significant learning gains. While some note the lack of a textbook and the need for extensive research, the consensus is that his teaching is top-notch and the effort is well worth it.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Arkes was a very good professor. I really had no interest in judgement and decision making before I entered his classroom but now I have a new understanding and respect for the subject matter. The only complaints that I would have would be we did not have a textbook which made things hard. The class is challenging but very interesting.
Very respectful of everyone's questions and comments, makes the topic very interesting. I thought the class would be dull but it actually changed my life! I strongly recommend it.
This is a very interesting class.  I definitely learned a lot, but this is also a difficult class.  It takes a lot of work, but it's well worth it.
Simply awesome - best professor I ever had.
He's a GREAT teacher, but watch out for the paper at the end of the class.  I had to take a LOT of time to research for it.  He's a great teacher and it's a great class but don't get lazy!
Arkes is a great guy, he went out of his way to help me find an article that I needed for my research paper.
Definitely keeps the lectures interesting.  The readings correlate well with the lectures.  I thoroughly enjoyed this class and thought he was really nice.
No Comments

Very good teacher!  My favorite psych class I've taken for the past 4 years.  The only hard part is that there is a big paper at the end and a cumulative final, but there are many small assigments along the way for the paper so you can't get behind.
He does know his stuff but do not get on his bad side. If you do he will undermine you in a passive aggressive way.

Course material is difficult, but he makes it understandable and interesting. Very helpful. Liberal grader and very fair. Big paper, but you pick the topic. Definitely would take him again...brilliant.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching skills, making even the most boring topics engaging and easy to understand. Students appreciate her clear explanations, in-class experiments, and the fact that reading the textbook is sufficient for success with her challenging yet fair quizzes and tests. Overall, she is praised for her effective teaching methods and enthusiastic personality, leading many to strongly recommend her classes.

Ratings.comment: She made the boring parts interesting and explained everything clearly. I very  much enjoyed this class and changed my major to psych. In-class mini-experiments were awesome and helped me remember the content. I never purchased the book and got an A. Highly recommend this prof!
Jamie is awesome. Lecture isn't necessary and she even says that from the beginning. All you need to do is read the textbook and show up for quizzes and you're golden.
She was by far the best prof. for this course.  She took normally boring material and made it interesting.  Her quizzes are challenging but NOBODY should have problems if they read the book.
ok
She was AMAZING!

Jamie was an excellent teacher. She has an awesome personality that made the class material, otherwise pretty intersting. The tests were sometimes difficult but there is no reason you can't pass if you read some of the book and go to the review sessions. The book is a must have for a good grade :( I definitely recommend    Jamie.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her engaging and humorous teaching style, which makes the class both enjoyable and interesting. Students appreciate her intelligence, organization, and passion for the subject matter, though some find the content can be challenging and require significant effort. Overall, she is seen as a dedicated and supportive instructor who goes above and beyond to help students succeed.

Ratings.comment: This instructor is extremely funny, nice, and relaxed. She made the class very interesting. She is intelligent, organized, and energetic. This class is fun and interesting. I highly recomend Anna as an instructor!
This class was very interesting with Han! I loved learning about stereotypes and it was very easy too!

She was great at explaining everything. Very helpful when you had questions.  She even holds review sessions besides in class, and has AIM review sessions where you can ask questions the night before the test.  The exams aren't that hard if you just read the chapters and come to class.  Tests are multiple choice, cake!
Loved the class! She is an amazing instructor. You can tell she is passionate and knowledgeable about what she is teaching. I thought her exams were fine.

Anna seemed nice.  Class was generally somewhat entertaining but sometimes it was difficult to understand what she was talking about.  The mid-term seemed fine but the final was worded so awkwardly with so many grammar mistakes that I found it hard to know what the question meant. I don't think going to office hours should be required to do well...

Loved Anna! Truly interested in  making sure you understand the material. the content of the class can be confusing and little overwhelming but super interesting. Go to her office hrs and you'll be fine!

Anna is a really cool teacher and is genuinely interested in teaching. Don't take this class if you're looking for an easy A. You have to work hard (6 papers, 2 exams and a final) and its a lot of reading. BUT--if you like psychology i recommend this class. Its interesting stuff and if you work hard it pays off.
She was an awesome teacher, prolly the best one i've had at OSU.....this class is a lot of work, but she is willing to help you with anything...she even has AOL IM office hours!

Anna was originally the TA for this class, but eventually took over for Dr. Arkin.  She has very fair expectations and as long as you go to class, skim over the readings, and go over the notes a little bit you will get an A.  Quizzes are very fair and all multiple choice.  Final paper is easy just don't try to do too much with it.
She replaced the original prof. in the middle of the quarter and did an awesome job. She is a really good teacher. I learned a lot.

Awesome teacher! She should teach all the other OSU profs how to teach like her! I learned more from her in a quarter than my entire time here at OSU. You can tell she really cares about you as a person. But dont let her laid back and caring style fool you, this is a tough course. Bonus-she is easy on the eyes.
Anna is a sweet girl and will do everything she can to make sure you get a good grade, but this class is still pretty tough.

Loved this class; we didn't spend much time on the writing; we learned soc. psych and then wrote papers about it.  I don't think we spent more than 5 minutes in writing techniques.  And, of course, she's freaking hot

Anna was a wonderful teacher. She put a lot of effort in to the class, and you can tell how much she cares about her students. It's not a fly-by course; you have to work at it. But Anna makes it enjoyable. Dresses cute, too.
Funny and nice. Keeps you interested the whole class time. She cares about her students and goes out of her way to help them. Did I mention she is HOT!?
She really cares about her students. She made the class interesting and fun. OSU needs more teachers like her!
really nice, made the class fun and worth going to, only problem is it's hard to get an A most people get B's.

summary_comment: This professor is generally considered effective, despite the material sometimes being dry and difficult to engage with. Students appreciate her efforts to make the class more enjoyable through bonus points and movie screenings, but find the exams challenging. While some students found the class easy due to the low difficulty of assignments, others struggled with the tests, indicating a mixed experience. Overall, attendance is crucial for bonus points, which significantly impact final grades.

Ratings.comment: she was an excellent teacher! the material can get slightly boring at times, but she tries her best to make it fun. attendance is important - she gives you 10 extra credits points basically for coming. she's very helpful and if you study, there's no reason you can't get an A.

Going to class is super important because of bonus points. without those 9 points i would have done way worse. its pretty much a trick to get you to go to class. boring and long class. material is common sense/easy but somehow the tests were pretty hard and there were questions on there that were ridiculous. probably would not recommend this class
her tests are very hard. Her lectures are very BORING...

She had moderately difficult exams. Her lecture's were very boring because she goes off into tangents. It takes her a long time to get through just a few slides. She gives bonus points at the beginning of class but collects them so quickly that even when you're there you sometimes can't hand them in fast enough. All in all, boring class but still o

I thought the class was very easy! I had no trouble and she gives you an opportunity for 10 bonus points for pretty much just showing up.  The course could have been more interesting but she shows a lot of movies! I thought she was very nice and easy!!!
I thought this would be an easy class, but the exams were pretty difficult. The assignments were pretty easy though. There was no curve and there probably should have been.

Alisa is a pretty good teacher. The class is kind of boring, especially in the first few weeks, but it gets better. I thought the was slightly confusing at times and I learned more from just going to lecture. It's pretty easy too; I got 100% on the exams without studying much at all.
Awesome

This class was not what I expected, either. The material is so common and general that the class is a total waste. If you want an easy class, take this. I mean, I didn't attend lectures or read the book and I got an A-

This class isn't what I thought it was going to be like at all. She puts a lot of questions on the exams that are ONLY in the book. You can tell she gets annoyed when people ask questions. Don't take this class ... it's really boring.

Not the most interesting material, plus she makes the exams rather hard compared to the material. Read ALL of the readings, if not you'll miss 1/2 the questions on the exam. Nice woman, just didn't seem to be that good of a teacher.

summary_comment: The professor delivers lectures in a monotonous tone and relies heavily on PowerPoint presentations, often reading verbatim from slides. This teaching style, combined with excessive verbal fillers, makes the class枯燥乏味且效率低下，学生普遍反映学习体验极差。

Ratings.comment: As a senior this is the worst class I have ever taken in my life.  Class consists of her droning on in a monotone voice, saying "Um" at least 500-600 times per class, and reading directly off of 70-80 slides.

Talks in a monotone voice and reads every single word off the powerpoints.  Powerpoints were online so you didn't have to go to class, but you do get points for participation so you should show up and talk.

summary_comment: Professor Sam is highly regarded for her clear and organized teaching style, which effectively prepares students for short-answer exams. She is proactive in addressing class issues and adjusts her approach accordingly. Her grading is fair, provided students adhere to the given guidelines.

Ratings.comment: Exams are short answers and Sam makes it durable because her notes are all very clear and neat. and she is really helpful and acceptable for any suggestions. and she will make good adjustments for the class if there is a problem. her grading of paper is fair, as long as you follow the guidelines, you will be fine.
ow ow owwww! smokin'.

summary_comment: Sabrina is an excellent teacher known for her clarity and thorough preparation, making the course accessible and manageable for students.

Ratings.comment: Sabrina is a great teacher! Very helpful and clear in class. She prepares you for the test pretty well. It is not a hard course.

summary_comment: The professor is enthusiastic and highly knowledgeable but tends to be quiet and less engaging in person. She excels at responding to emails and provides good examples, making her one of the better TAs at OSU. While she is supportive and wants students to succeed, her in-person availability is limited, and she switched roles after just two weeks.

Ratings.comment: Enthusiastic and knowledgeable.

She acted if she kinda didn't care the role time. She was quite and great with responding with emails, but didn't provide much help for being in person. Also, she quit being our TA after the first two weeks and switched to be a TA for a different major.

She's kind of quiet but gives good examples. Good with emails. One of the better TAs at OSU. She wants you to do well. Just study for a couple hours before each exam and you'll do fine. Online quizzes

summary_comment: Dr. Fujita is a dedicated professor known for his clear and engaging teaching style, though his exams are challenging and require thorough preparation. Students appreciate his humor and helpfulness, but also find his classes demanding, especially when it comes to reading the entire textbook. Overall, while some find his course rigorous, many recommend it for its depth and relevance.

Ratings.comment: Psych of stereotyping and prejudice is an incredibly interesting class and Dr. Fujita is a great professor.  I highly recommend this class.  As for those saying that you have to read every page of the book...yeah that is what you do with a book.  You read the pages. If you're in college you should probably get over that.

Horrible professor. Teaches with powerpoint and goes WAY too fast to write anything down so make sure you print off the notes.So, if you learn better by writing things down you're screwed. Exams are very difficult for no reason. Must read every page in the book to do well on an exam. Thinks he's fuuny, but isn't.

This guy went to Harvard and has a great teaching ethic! He is very clear and precise in what he will test on, as long as you read the book and study his notes! Probably one of my favorite professors yet! I suggest going to class everyday in order to get a good grade in the course! I came out with a B!

Very dedicated to his subject matter. You can tell that Dr. Fujita lives, breathes and eats social psychology. The class is by no means a walk in the park, but if you read the book in tandem with lectures, you'll do fine. On a side note, he indirectly inspired me to pursue a career in education and research.

Professor Fujita is a good teacher. He is very clear when presenting the material and is funny at times. He was also very helpful to those who were having a hard time with the material. There are two papers, which were pretty easy, and three exams which were very difficult. 50% of the exam is from the book while 50% is from the lectures. His exams

Dr Fujita is fairly smart and humorous. To be honest, the exams are hard compared to other psych exams that I have taken. The lecture is fun but the textbook is so boring! Psychology of prejudice and discrimination is the least psych class that u should choose.

He is clear in telling students what he expects from them. His exams can be moderately hard if you expect that memorizing things will get you off with a good grade (don?t write note cards prior to exams). Study the concepts from the book and make sure that you revise his lecture notes.

Papers were easy to write. Reading is boring, but do it. The tests are impossible because it is filled with so many tricks and lures. Even if you go to class, its still hard to get higher then a B with the curve. I would recommend it. the class is interesting. alot of info to be absorbed. fujita is a good professor.

I'm not a psych major, and I didn't really think there would be a lot to learn about in this class since the topic is so narrow. Man was I wrong! Dr. Fujita knows his stuff and makes it very easy to learn all of the material. His tests are tough, but not impossible. There are TONS of theories to learn and lots of reading to do in order to pass.

Very interesting class. He's a great teacher. The book is necessary. It is not a hard read, just dry. But you must read to get a good grade for this class. Tests are 50% lecture/ 50% book. Two papers, but easy to write. I would suggest this teacher for this class. He is easy to understand and willing to answer any questions. Quick to e-mail back.

I took this class in sp 08. Don't know what the big deal is why people are saying it was hard. You have to read the book!!!! A lot of the test questions come from the book, also I suggest printing the notes before coming to class it helps a lot. I got  90% on all my exams and the avg. was in the 60% range. Do what ur suppose to do and ull get an A!
This class is hard.  It's a lot of work.  But if you're getting a B.S. you have to take a class like this to graduate, and I suggest taking this one because social psych is interesting.

Going to class helps out a lot and a lot of questions are from the textbook and not discussed in class.  He is very clear in lecture on what he expects.  On the two short essays, follow EXACTLY. If you deviate or try to go "above and beyond" he will FAIL YOU!
DO NOT take his class

Psychology is my major and this class made me question whether or not I wanted to do it. He made the tests way too difficult and gave us a curve because most of the class did poorly. The only reason I passed was because of the good curve!
He was great. Exams were difficult, but there was a nice curve. I thoroughly enjoyed his class, and hope to take 520 with him as well.
fujita sucks. get another professor if you can. his tests are way too hard. it's like he enjoys watching you suffer through the exams. don't say i didn't warn you.

he talks way too fast and he likes to make his tests ridiculously hard.. like to the point where it's just unnecessary. READ YOUR BOOK; he likes to screw you over with questions from the readings. don't memorize definitions, but be able to understand the concepts and how they're applied. attendance isn't mandatory since he puts slides on carmen.

summary_comment: This professor is known for being one of the least demanding instructors, with exams heavily based on his slides, making it possible to achieve good grades without extensive studying or attending lectures. However, his teaching style is described as extremely boring, and students find him difficult to engage with.

Ratings.comment: Easy A. Don't buy a book (even though he lets you use the second edition which is like 10 dollars), you won't use it. You don't have to attend class because his exams are 75% definitions directly from his slides and the rest is application from the slides. He's extremely boring though.

If you want to get an A, take his class and study from the review slides. If you want to get an A, and learn something from this course, study the slides, attend classes (attendance is optional), and sit as close to the front as you can. His accent needs some time to get used to, but, overall, he's is one of the least demanding instructors.

ALthough the tests were easy to study for (came straight from his review slides(, he was very boring. He has a slight germanic accent, which wasn't a problem. Overall, I would not take this professor again.

summary_comment: The professor is known for her straightforward approach, offering three 100-point exams with attendance that can significantly boost grades through bonus points. She is an effective lecturer, remembers students' names, and creates a relaxed classroom environment, particularly on exam days when she provides candy.

Ratings.comment: Super straightfoward class:3 100-point exams (the final is just the 3rd exam.) Attendance isn't required, but you should go because you can get up to 30 bonus points for attendance, which can save your grade. You NEED to study for her exams, but she's a good lecturer,super chill, learns your name, and brings candy on exam days.

summary_comment: Dr. Beck is generally well-regarded for his engaging and interesting lectures, despite some organizational issues. Students appreciate his enthusiasm for the subject matter and find the class manageable with a good study routine. However, the class can be challenging due to its reliance on outdated materials and random, often unrelated statistics, which can make it frustrating for those seeking a deeper understanding of psychology.

Ratings.comment: I enjoyed this class. He posts slides on carmen, but does add more informations  during lecture. While lecture is not mandatory, I would recommend attending for the extra information. He has lots of stories that relates with the material. The test are from both lecture and books. It's not a bad class to take and has a nice curve.

I really enjoyed this class. Dr. Beck is a little disorganized but his lectures are interesting. His tests are from both the book and the lecture material and he loves testing on statistics. If you're interested in psychopathology you'll like the class. I recommend it.

His statistics are a lot of times way off but you need to know them for the exams anyways.  You can get an A fairly easily if you read the book and attend class....but if you are really interested in Psychology- his class is frustrating because lecture doesn't relate to Adjustment at all.

Dr. Beck is a very nice guy who is interested in his field BUT I would caution you not to take the class. He uses outdated materials and information. If you choose to take the course make sure that you read the textbook cover to cover and write down every random statistic he says in class.

This class is not as bad as it may seem. He is a practicing psychologist so he lectures on what he thinks is interesting and then you are responsible for what is in the book for the exam. He loves statistics so pay close attention to them while your taking book notes. He also gives a pretty big curve which helps a lot. I got an A fairly easily.

The tests in this class were ridiculous, they are made up of totally random questions from the book. I found the lecture parts of the test to be quite easy, but his lectures are boring and the research is outdated. There is no new info to be learned in this class if you have already taken counseling psych and abnormal psych.

Dr. Beck was extremely spacey, disorganized and dull. His lectures sometimes have information that is incorrect and misleading. He relies HEAVILY on insignificant details from the book. If you read the book then that part of the test is fine, but the lecture section is ridiculous. The paper, however, was easy.

Dr. Beck is really nice but I would caution everyone interested in taking his Psych 681 course. First, he lectures little to nothing from the book and you are responsible for the book and lectures on the tests (they're often opposing information). He is spacey, extremely unorganized, his tests don't make sense, & has lectured incorrect information.

The class was interesting and he was a pretty good lecturer. A lot of people didn't come to class but if you go to lecture and read the book thoroughly it is easy to get an A. He doesn't cover the reading in class so you have to be motivated to do it on your own. He seemed like a really nice guy and had a lot of good stories from his clinical work.

He makes mistakes on his own exams, makes you choose between what he says in class and what the book says, and if that's not enough, you spend half the time trying to figure out what the questions are asking. Nice guy, but extremely spacey, making for an unreliable professor.

Dr. Beck is obviously a caring man, but he is just not the best teacher. The class was unorganized and it was hard to get questions answered. You must read the book very closely! and the topics assigned for reading will be different than that discussed in lecture. The class is so frustrating it's not worth taking even if you're highly interested.

The class is not hard if you life cold hard stats. Half of exam comes from the book (which you never go over and is indep study) and lectures that are based on date he has found on diff. subjects. He comes off anxious and is pretty scatter-brained, unprepared. His off the cuff style does not work. 3 exams and a an easy paper. Take only if needed.
This professor constantly generalizes about disorders, uses outdated research, and is super terrible at writing exams.  good luck, i would not recommend him, he needs to retire

I just recently graduated from OSU and this was one of my favorite classes...and it was even in the early morning.  Dr. Beck had some really interesting things to say and if you went to class, he gave hints for the tests. Very intelligent, educated and fair prof.  Hightly recommended!
I like the guy but the test are tough.

This was my first class as a non-trad student after being out of school for 8 years. I found Dr. Beck's lectures interesting and relevant to the real world.  He uses a lot of stories which were interesting to me.  Half of the tests are from the text, so there is a lot of reading involved.  If you go to class and read the text, you can get an A.

Attendence is not mandatory but I would definitely recommend going, since part of the exams come from the book. Dr. Beck is an amazing professor. He knows his material and is very passionate about all of it. Lectures were very interesting. I don't get up for many 9 am classes, but I hardly ever missed his!
No Comments

This is a must to take psych class!! Dr. Beck makes an hour and 48 min seem like half an hour. His lectures are outstanding, applicable to real world, nothing obscure. But careful!His tests have a lot of stats and are long. Even so, its a well balanced class and very informative and entertaining. Overall is great, study and you can easily get an A.

This man has no buisiness being a college proffesor. If a student asks a question which he doesn't know the answer to, he just guesses, often times wrongly. The subject matter is very easy to master, yet it is nearly impossible to get an A.  This is because his tests include many random and irrelavent statistics from the text book.

The lectures are very interesting and very informative.  However, the tests are just random obscure statistics from the textbook.  I learned a lot in this class and recommend the course, but beware the exams.  Dr. beck is a nice guy and knows his stuff.

Book has nothing to do with the lectures.  Lectures were interesting - he tends to go off on tangents, but they're not too bad.  Easy class - one short paper, 3 exams.  Just know the book well and go to class and you'll be ok.  Lots of statistics to remember.
No Comments
