His lectures were very good. Exams- very hard, you practicaly speaking have to memorize the book! and his lectures. Book is not covered in class which makes it hard- you have to study the book on your own! Still, I liked the lectures and learned a lot.
He is a great teacher.  I would definitely recommend taking his course.
Great teacher, very clear, and helpful.  I recommend every psych major to take his class

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for being flexible, grading fairly, and offering ample extra credit opportunities, though some students find her lectures can be slightly dull. Despite this, the overall teaching quality is strong, with a fair workload and a highly recommended class.

Ratings.comment: Could have engaged class more.

Very interesting class, although Ingrid's lectures can get slightly dull. However, she is a GREAT teacher! She is flexible, grades fair and gives out a ton of extra credit opportunities! The work load is fair, definitely not too much, highly recommend this teacher!

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded for her approachability and enthusiasm for teaching, with many students finding her classes enjoyable and beneficial. However, some criticize her for being overly nitpicky on exams, lacking knowledge in her subject area, and having inconsistent grading practices. Overall, while she is viewed positively by many, there are significant criticisms regarding her teaching style and fairness.

Ratings.comment: Very approachable and friendly. Can tell she enjoys her job and sharing it. Gives good examples about patients.
Graded the "bonus" questions, so be sure to include the wrong answers to your questions too.  Talks about her patients with enouogh detail to identify them.  Unethical, bad teacher!

Psychologists should NOT teach. I needed one more point in order to graduate on time and she refused to give it to me (even after she failed to count my extra bonus points for the quarter!). Unless you are a brown-noser, don't expect anything from her. Tests were way too picky for her vague teaching style. There are much better classes to take!

Nitpicky 100-question exams w/ many Q's only from book. NOT knowledgeable at all about MA in counseling but seemed to have low opinion of it - not helpful if interested in that field of study. Boring lectures. Consistently badly dressed & bad hairdo.
I learned a lot from Dr. Srsic and enjoyed her style of teaching a great a deal.
Friendly, committed to teaching, open to students' bringing in new information.  She is an awesome teacher and I highly recommend taking any class she teaches!
I LOVED her so much, I took any class she was teaching. She is so approachable and will help you if you need it.
Very nice and helpful, but very strict on grading.
GREAT Professor, and exams are just memorization
She's awesome, I absolutely loved her and learned so much from that class. I definitely intend to take more of her classes!
Helpful and fair.  Does a good job of explaining material.

summary_comment: This professor is widely regarded as ineffective and challenging, marked by overly complex explanations and difficult-to-follow lectures filled with jargon. Students found her tests confusing and her classes monotonous, with many needing to correct her during lectures. Additionally, the lack of alignment between lectures and textbook material and unpredictable pop quizzes further detract from the learning experience.

Ratings.comment: She was EXTREMELY boring and difficult to listen to. She likes to use big words to describe simple things so it makes it very difficult to understand right away. She asks confusing questions on the tests. attendance is not mandatory but suggested bc she will throw in pop quizzes and wont always follow the book. good luck,

She was a horrible teacher who did not know the material before teaching it. The classes were incredibly boring and students were constantly correcting her. Many test questions came out of the book but were not even discussed in lecture. This class would be extremely interesting with a different teacher, so definitely avoid her.

summary_comment: This professor is known for delivering midterms that are relatively easy but grading papers with high standards, making it challenging to achieve a perfect score. The class can be somewhat dull, but attentive students are more likely to perform well.

Ratings.comment: Midterms are really easy, however he grades the papers really hard. Impossible to get 100% Class can get somewhat boring however you must pay attention to do well.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is low, as students find the homework largely irrelevant to lectures and extremely difficult for a 200-level class, with minimal helpfulness in posted notes. While the class is described as easy with overlapping content with another course, it is also considered boring and lacks effective preparation for exams.

Ratings.comment: Almost no review of what will be on the homework. Goes through the slides way too quickly and the notes he posts later online are not at all helpful. Homework is almost entirely irrelevant to the lectures and is unbelievably hard for a 200 level class.
Cute. Looks like Daniel Faraday from Lost. Class is pretty easy, but boring. Overlaps a lot with 220. Drops 3 lowest homeworks, but make sure to do the first 3, because they're the easiest.

summary_comment: This professor is knowledgeable but has poor lecture relevance to exams, and his examples are often unhelpful. Students generally recommend self-study through reading and notes, as attending lectures is largely unnecessary. His thick accent makes understanding challenging, and many students found success by using materials from other sections or relying on textbook readings.

Ratings.comment: He knew what he was talking about but a lot of what he covered in lecture wasn't on the exams. His examples as far as videos and stuff were entertaining but not very helpful.
dont go to lecture other than quiz/exam days just do the reading and take notes and cram right b4 tests i ended up with a B+ franks a good guy but his english is not

Can't understand Frank. He goes on and on about EVERYTHING. I think he did go over a lot of things in a class period. A lot of things he did not need to spend time on, others he needed to spend more time on. I went to friend's review sessions for exams. That's how I passed.
had for psych 100. does not speak English very well and hard to understand. for me, going to class was completely pointless i just did all of my reading and did pretty well.

Frank is speaks with a very thick accent.  I was frustrated because his outlines are hard to use to study for exams.  I used notes from friends that were in other Psych100 sections to study for the exam.  He tries to give good examples in class, but they don't help the information stick at all.  Avoid Frank if possible.

The quizzes for this class were based off of vague points from the text and information that we had barely went over in class. But, to his benefit, he was always willing to answer questions that we had to the best of his ability.

Really hard to understand. I hardly ever went to the lecture and i got a B+ in the class. If you read the book and study the notes (on carmen) you will be fine. He used good examples in class but they didnt really help.

Nice guy, but not a very good instructor. Spoke with a heavy accent, and was boring to listen to. Many students attended other lectures to do well on the exams. His notes are all on Carmen, but aren't much help for anything but his quizes. Must read the book for the exams, and found that getting outlines from friends in better classes works best.

Heavy accent. Not a good professor at all. I would think you would get the hint when half your class walks out after a quiz and more than half the class attends different lectures. Don't recommend him at ALL.
Speaks w/ pretty heavy accent and nothing on the notes helps w/ exams. quizes are based off notes and exams off book.
No Comments

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her engaging and relatable teaching style, often incorporating YouTube clips to enhance understanding. While her lectures can be somewhat straightforward and occasionally monotonous, she is clear and concise, making the material accessible. Students find her quizzes manageable and recommend her as an effective instructor.

Ratings.comment: She is young, relatable, and nice. She gave out candy in an 'experiment' once. Youtube clips keep things interesting. Her quizzes are easy if you were paying attention at all. The exams weren't too bad. I would recommend her as well!
Good teacher, uses a lot of videos especially youtube to demonstrate concepts...a little boring at times, but she speeches clear and to the point...I would recommend her.

summary_comment: The professor is known for stringent grading, particularly on written work, where students must adhere strictly to specific guidelines and definitions. While some students appreciate his clarity in lectures and helpfulness, others find his class extremely challenging and unhelpful, citing harsh grading and a focus on rote memorization over genuine learning. Overall, his teaching style and grading criteria appear to polarize student opinions significantly.

Ratings.comment: I did not find the exam material difficult at all, but he is stringent with papers. You need to learn his guidelines and preferences for written material (e.g. you should not refer to mankind in general as "we")
He's not as bad as he looks on the first day or 2. He grades harsh. His class is not very hard if you study your book before attending lectures. he explains things very well.

Dont take this class, he is one of the worst instructors ever! grades papers too harsh and you have to know his definitions. i didnt learn anything in his class and i ended up dropping his class to save my GPA. Dont take his class!!!

I thought that this class was a difficult one, but it was more because of the restrictions that the departments had put on the english gecs.   However, I thought that he was a really nice, helpful instructor, and I really liked the class.

Interesting that he has such low ratings on here. I found Nathan to be intelligent and helpful to those who would help themselves. His powerpoints were clear and well put together and he spent a lot of time grading the papers. Every point I got counted off in that class was because I deserved it. Definitely not an easy A but a worthwhile class.
Don't take his class ever never ever. You dont learn a thing and you fail after all those studying. I wish I droped it at the beginning, but now too late.

Does not grade on whether or not you learn the material, but to what extent you memorized his exact wording of precise definitions. Aside from his grading, he's a very rude, childish man who refuses to accept any opinion that is not his own. He fulfills all of the negative stereotypes that surround Psychologists.

The harshest grader I've ever had. Takes off points for trivial things, even though the assignments aren't worth many points. Do not expect to get full credit unless you memorize definitions and concepts basically word for word.

Worst prof I've ever had.  I can't believe they pay him to stand in front of people and read off a slideshow.  going to class is useless but mandatory.  If you can, avoid taking his classes, he's the strictest grader i've ever met and useless in and out of class to talk to.

summary_comment: Courtney is highly regarded for her detailed and knowledgeable approach to teaching psychology, drawing significant interest in the subject among students. She emphasizes key information in lectures, ensuring good grades, and is praised for her enthusiasm, willingness to answer questions, and ability to apply concepts to real-life situations. Students consistently recommend her for her motivation, approachability, and effectiveness in the classroom.

Ratings.comment: Detailed, Very Knowledgeable, Draws interest to her subject
She is the best professor and tells you the very important key informattion attend the lectures and you are guaranteed good grades

Courtney is very enthusiastic about teaching psychology. She is always willing to answer questions and knows her material very well. I had doubts that psych 100 would be just another boring class, but with Courtney as my lecturer I am actually interested in psychology now.

Courtney knows her stuff and gives a lot of application to real life situations.  Attendance is not mandatory, but if you do not show up for class you will miss out on a lot.  I would recommend her to any one. Very motivated, approachable,and extremely helpful. If you take good notes you will not need the text book much.

summary_comment: The professor is generally well-regarded for her teaching quality, though some students found it challenging to maintain concentration due to her striking appearance. Overall, the class was considered good.

Ratings.comment: Nice professor.  Class overall was pretty good.  Seriously, though, it was kind of hard to concentrate, because Dr. Camillus is one of the most beautiful women I've ever seen.
No Comments

summary_comment: Alison is an effective and engaging lecturer who makes her class interesting through various teaching methods such as incorporating pop culture references and interactive content. However, she is known for being a strict grader, particularly on papers, though she often curves the class to a B average. Students generally find her approachable and helpful, and many recommend taking her classes.

Ratings.comment: Really eash for an honors GEC.  Just go to class and pay attention and you should get an A.

She likes to mix things up by bringing in clips of Friends, demonstrating concepts on our minds, and sometimes assigns really interesting articles. She likes to teach and she made my writing much better.:)
Alison is super nice and super helpful and tries to make the class as interesting as possible but she is an extremely tough grader.

Yes, she grades the papers tough, but if you look carefully on the rubric it tells you EXACTLY what you need to write. She's really nice though, very willing to help, and keeps lectures interesting. If you have a choice, I'd recommend getting her.
Great lecturer, interesting class, but a tough grader.  She has a really good lecture voice and isn't too hard on the eyes either.

The class really isnt too hard...but its just total regurgitation of the slides on the exams. Its not really that exciting, most days are boring but she tries her best to make it interesting...theres more than 2 exams and 6 papers. Shes a stringent grader and shes kinda weird...pretty hyper but pretty excited about psych...its not a hard class

She was a really good teacher. She loves the subject matter and is always very excited for class. Exams are all essays, but they are pretty easy if you study the concepts, theories and definitions. She grades the papers a little rough at first, but she curves the class so that the average is a B. It really isn't hard to get an A though.

shes really awesome and sweet.extremely into what she does and really willing to help. tries her best to make you interested. tests are easy if you study. pretty easy paper grader. would recommend and take another class with her if i could!

Awesome lecturer.  Exams are completely essay format, but come directly from the class material.  Office hours help a ton!  367 writing class, so it takes effort and work, take it during a quarter where you can give some time to this class; you write 6 papers plus 2 exams and the final.  Easy A if you do the work.

Seems generally concerned about her students. The class is relatively hard, but if you go to her office hours she helps you out a lot. Exams are straight forward. Class was boring sometimes cause it's mostly just lecture, but shes very good overall. Take her class if you can!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her friendly and approachable demeanor, which contributes to making the material accessible and straightforward. Students appreciate her fairness in grading, noting that while exams are challenging, the curve is generous, often allowing for strong performance. Her dedication to student success is evident through her extensive use of helpful materials and engaging teaching methods, making the class both enjoyable and manageable.

Ratings.comment: She is very friendly and helpful. She makes everything fairly simple and clear. Her tests are not very hard. She doesn't give a study guide but it is really not needed. The book is not necessary. She says she will take questions from it but it ends up being a bonus and even if you read the book you will have to guess. OVERALL She's pretty great!
Even without the curve still got an A. The exams are exactly what she tells you to expect. Grades papers unnecessarily hard, but with the curve everyone does well (B- class average).

She's a great teacher. Genuinely  interested in the students and getting them to understand the material. She grades tough, but gives great feedback and there is a sizable curve (B- is the class average)

having had friends who took Psychology 367.01 who hated there teachers, I'm telling u get Alison. EVeryone griped and moaned about how there teachers sucked.. Alison is the rare breed of teacher who wants to see students do good. She goes above and beyond helping, she grades papers tough but the curve is huge.. a must have for a hard class!

This teacher was awesome, she is by far one of the best teachers. If you don't want to sit in a boring lecture taking a thousand notes, should definitely take her class. The examples and powerpoinrs she uses are great and she really helps prepare you for the exams.

ok if you have the choice PICK LUBY FOR PSYCH 100!!! she is super super easy and makes a 2 hour class pretty bearable. she definitely put more effort into class(her slides are nicceeee!!) and posts on carmen than all my other friends professors. super helpful lecture notes on carmen. class isnt necessary but helpful

She is awesome! She gives you pre-typed guided notes where if you just follow along to her powerpoints in class you can fill in the blanks. They are super helpful and I do not know of any other psych. professors doing this.

Allison is awesome. She tries very hard to make class fun for the students and makes the class as easy as it can be. She let us use notes on quizzes, showed clips from Family Guy and the Simpsons in class, and is just a really funny, cool person to take a class from. If you need Psych 100, definitely try to get her as your teacher.

this is one of the easiest classes I've taken at osu but it all depends on the professor.  My roommate who didn't have Alison for psych ended up getting a b- while i got an A doing pretty much the same amount of work.  she made the class as interesting as possible, and the midterms and final were ridiculously easy if you read the lecture notes.

alison is a nice lady and the material she uses really hammers home the material she puts in her powerpoint slides. the four papers are not extremely difficult and she is a very tame grader. the multiple choice exams are somewhat difficult but if you prepare for the exams you will do fine. overall, i'd say she is one of the nicest teachers i've had

Alison's lecture's are extremely interesting. i love how she puts in clips from seinfeld, the simpsons, and friends.  her tests can be a bit challenging, multiple choice but she puts it into real life situations.  but i guess thats what we really need to know!! Homework's easy.  great person and great class all around

Alison is a phenomenal educator with a personality fitting for a Social Psychologist.  Her classes are informative, she is always well prepared, and is always willing answer questions.  I would recommend Alison to anyone who has the chance to learn from her.  My favorite OSU Professor.
Very enthusiastic.  Very helpful.  Highly recommended.  Not bad on the eyes either!  (... and she's Canadian to boot!)
An awesome teacher and an even nicer person. Take her.

She outlines the material extremely well. Each class begins with review questions from the previous class with questions styled just like how they are on midterms and the final. In addition, she tries to make the material fun by throwing in video clips.
wonderful person and genuinely wants to help. lectures are great and extremely interesting. I would definitely take her again.
A great teacher all around.  Very enthusiastic about teaching in class, and always willing to help you understand the material.  Highly recommended.

she is a wonderful teacher who gives accurate descriptions. she prepares u well for exams and even has outlined notes so u don't have to write anything if you don't want to. u can do fine without a book too. i would suggest taking her!
Good teacher!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her deep knowledge of the subject matter and her ability to effectively communicate complex ideas. She engages students with humorous aids and is known for providing thorough class outlines that facilitate independent learning. While some note that she occasionally veers off-topic, her overall approach is praised for making the material enjoyable and accessible.

Ratings.comment: One of the best teachers I have had. She really knows her material, and she tells students when she isn't an expert in a certain area and if they have a question she can't answer, she talks to her collegues and immediately gets back to them. She really knows how to relate to us and shows us funny clips to help us a concepts understand better
She explains material well, but sometimes goes off on tangents.  Friendly and engaging.
No Comments
she makes it fun and gives you the notes to just fill in

don't need to go to lecture, just do her outlines and read the book and you'll be fine. however, she does give a lot of helpful hints during class (from what i hear). i went to class 4 times the whole quarter and got an a. the practice tests are not a good indicator of how well you'll do on the real thing, becuase they cover different material.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his teaching quality, demonstrating exceptional effectiveness despite being new to the role. Students remember the material vividly and often recommend his classes, praising his helpfulness and ability to impart knowledge effectively.

Ratings.comment: When I had him it was his first time teaching.  I think he did an amazing job.  Its been almost a year since I was in his class and I still remember a lot of the things I learned. He is very helpful.  I recommend everyone to take his class.

summary_comment: Based on student comments, this professor has a mixed reputation; while some find the material interesting, others criticize his teaching methods, noting that he frequently had guest lecturers and did not develop his own tests. Students also express dissatisfaction with the grading system, which they found unfair and difficult to understand, as the professor did not share class averages.

Ratings.comment: No Comments

He travelled to Sweden or Germany or somewhere practically every week. Always had someone guest lecture and tests did not come from anywhere! would not recommend this, though he is an interesting speaker.

The material is interesting.  However, he did not test over what he taught in class.  He also did not test over the book.  He admitted at the end of the quarter that he didn't even write his own tests.  The grades were so bad he wouldn't even post the averages.

summary_comment: Based on the available student comments, there are no specific remarks about the professor's teaching quality or performance.

Ratings.comment: No Comments

summary_comment: Professor Leif is highly regarded for his engaging and humorous teaching style, making complex topics accessible and interesting through real-world examples. While his quizzes can be challenging and attendance is randomly taken, the class structure offers significant opportunities for easy points through reflections and attendance, making it relatively manageable to achieve a high grade.

Ratings.comment: Great guy and class was overall easy but the quizzes were sometimes oddly hard and specific and attendance was randomly taken.
Class was more difficult than expected. 3 quizzes, 10 questions each where cumulative... final exam was only 20 questions, cumulative off of 18 chapters. you HAVE to study 24/7

There is random attendance, you have three exams which are 10 questions 20 points, the exams are easy though, and you have reflections (3 sentences max) based off your exam. Half your grade is basically attendance and reflection so easy points. I think this class is easy and would recommend it! Despite my bad grade, I think it's easy to get an A

He is good at presenting lectures but his slideshows are short and the readings are mandetory. His quizzes are pretty difficult and you have to do a project with a large group. He wants his students to succeed and has valuable experiences he shares during class.

Leif has been my favorite professor at Ohio State so far. He is hilarious, he makes lectures and the learning topics interesting, and he uses stories from his real world experiences to help us understand various terms or topics. He genuinely cares about students and wants everyone to do well.

I loved Leif's class his lectures are funny and engaging. He tells stories from his real-world experience and it really brings the already interesting content to life. The class isn't easy but it's not too difficult either. He wants us to truly learn the content which I appreciated. Couldn't recommend him or this class enough.

Leif is a professor who will always make sure to grab your attention. His lectures can teach difficult topics in entertaining and understandable ways. The "midterm" quizzes are very short and most of the class grade is made up of attendance and easy reflections. Overall, amazing and funny professor and I'd highly recommend 3331 with him.

I loved this class so much! Leif is an amazing professor. There are 3 ten ten-question quizzes which normally take less than 20 minutes to do, 3 reflections that are super easy and make up like 25% of your grade, and 5 attendances which are also 25%. Just show up and you should be okay, I barely studied, just know your terms. Offered so much EC!

This course was overall intellectually stimulating. I wish Leif taught more courses because I would take all his classes. He is a fair professor and cares about his students. He makes class very enjoyable and fun. I had this class at 9:30am, I commute, and I always looked forward to coming to his class. I wish all professors were like this!

Dr. Smith is a very funny professor who gives pretty engaging lectures. Quizzes are difficult at first because he likes to trick you with his questions, but once you know his testing style they become fairly easy. Attendance is random and you need a doctor's note if you claim to be absent because of a sickness, which he can be a stickler about.

As a psychology major, I think this class is incredibly important to prepare for the future. The class isn't hard, all grades are based on quizzes, reflections (easy points), attendance, and the final. I personally wouldn't take a class with Smith again mainly because of his teaching style. It doesn't work for everyone unfortunately.

Amazing class and professor who had some great stories from his own experiences. He made the class fun and engaging. Attendance matters as he takes it randomly throughout the semester, but I had a great time so never skipped.

Leif himself is great! The class is very interesting. Class consisted of 9 quizzes, 4 attendance grades, and group project. He takes attendance at random so make sure you show up to class. The quizzes were short (5 questions) but they left no room for error. Great class if you're a good test taker, but don't take to boost your grade.
Leif makes class enjoyable. He has some challenging quizzes, but as long as you study the material and take notes during lecture you should be able to keep a manageable grade.

W/ Leif ATTENDANCE MATTTERS. 5 quizzes (scheduled), 5 attendace & 5 reflections (both not scheduled & taken in class. in my class in the last 4 weeks, which was annoying), & final only 200 points total (not weighted.) He promises hella extra points but only offered like 5 points. He has cool stories from clinical experience. show up & you'll pass.

w/ Leif, ATTENDANCE MATTERS. I didnt like Leif's class because lack points (nothing is weighted). 200 points in total, 5 quizzes, 5 attendance and reflections (separate things primarily taken in the last 4 weeks of the semester), and the final. Everything is cumulative. With that said, if you attend and pay attention, you'll pass also cool stories.

Leif was not my favorite professor. he was entertaining at first, but he began to repeat his stories a lot and let students get off topic. Lectures took longer than they needed to. Not graded on many things (5 attendance, 5 reflections, 5 quizzes, and a final). quizzes were 10 mcq, but were cumulative and some were a bit challenging.

For such an early class, it was the one I never wanted to skip. His lectures were always equally as entertaining as they were informational. His experience in the field and his advice were helpful to anyone considering becoming a psychologist. However, his quizzes are a little difficult so make sure you study! Attendance is also SUPER important!!

If you do decide to take his class, make sure you show up for every class because he makes attendance basically 50% of your grade. There's no debating your missed attendance situation unless it's severe enough to warrant a doctor's note.

Super harsh grader with no feedback. I would expect that if he wants us to be creative, he would be as well. Instead, he made us regurgitate the information in a "new" way for most of the assignments which was not helpful to learn the material. However, I did not watch one lecture and still got an A-, so do the discussion posts.
Dr. Smith is a fun understanding professor. Just be upfront with what is going on in your life and he will work around you. Showing up for class is 50% of your grade, so make sure to go.

Dr. Smith is the best lecturer I've ever had at Ohio State. His lectures are so interesting and I could listen to him talk forever. However, he gives 6 cumulative exams (not counting the final) throughout the semester, so be ready to study a lot! The questions can also be a little tricky. But overall, Dr. Smith's humor and wisdom make up for it.
The real life stories were the most helpful. Dr. Smith is the best instructor I've ever had. The people who don't show up and don't complete the work will not do well, but that's on them.

Took this class because I had open credit and I thought it would be an easy A. 9 quizzes make up a majority of the grade in the class, but every quiz is cumulative, so you pretty much take a 5-question final exam every week or two. The only other points in the class are from attendance and a group project, so you have to do well on the quizzes

Love this teacher. Kind of hot in my opinion. haha, anyways, he's a really great instructor. Lectures are pretty interesting, and he's not the type that has to go to the last minute. When he's done with the powerpoint slides, he's done with class. Gives great advice for school, and life in general. Also, explains his past experiences, which are fun

Dr. Smith keeps his lectures funny & fresh. He is very easily accessible via email, text, or Carmen and is willing to help students at reasonable request. It's important to show up to class because he will randomly hand out an in-class activity for EC. Show up, pay attention, take notes, review lecture slides & you'll pass with a stellar grade.
Dr Smith is the best instructor/professor I have ever had in my whole life. He inspires me to be better. His examples help make learning easy and fun. Please take his classes and you won't regret it.
The best!
Dr. Smith is an amazing professor. He uses personal examples to make us understand. I would recommend him to everyone. Best professor I have ever had!
One of the best professors I have ever had. Super passionate about what he teaches and he cares about his students achieving the best grade they can.

Leif is actually one of the best teachers I have had at OSU so far. He is extremely clear with what he expects and wants you to be prepared for exams (he has awesome review sheets and a review day). He does not want to trick you and what you see is what you get- study the powerpoint and you'll do great!!

summary_comment: This professor is renowned for his exceptional teaching quality, characterized by his kindness, passion for both the subject matter and his students, and dynamic presentations filled with positive energy. Students highly recommend taking any course he teaches during his graduate program.

Ratings.comment: one of the kindest human beings while also being so passionate about the material and moreso the students that he's teaching. fantastic energy and presentations with a great attitude. if you ever have the chance to take a course with him while he's in his grad program you really should

summary_comment: Dr. Deshpande is considered challenging due to her verbose teaching style and less effective slide presentations, making her lectures less engaging. Despite this, students who are highly motivated and complete their homework can achieve high grades. However, her teaching methods are not universally praised, with some finding her classes and materials difficult to follow and often boring.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Deshpande should not be your first choice when learning Psychology. She is very verbose and her slides do not cover the material well. Her lectures are not very engaging, but if you are super interested in the material and do the hw (which is not that bad) you can finish the class with an A.
She was great and tried to answer abstract questions to the best of her ability. The practice forms are tedious but easy if you do the reading. Overall would take again for another class.

From my experience with Ms. Prurtha, she's a very sweet and caring professor. Her lectures can be a bit boring, but the class is easy and there's a lot of opportunities for extra credit. I have had her for both 3310 and 2300. I struggled 3310 because her teaching was confusing, but I'd recommend her for 2300 for an easy A and not much work
This professor cares a lot that students are actually learning the subject matter. I got a lot out of this course and now feel much more confident about reading research.

I'm really enjoying this course with Prutha. The research articles she picks for the practice forms are always interesting, and the forms although a lot of work have helped me understand the concepts better and do well on the tests.
It's her talent that she can make such an interesting class so boring

Professor would talk in circles, and her lecture slides are all graphs!! She doesn't explain things well, and it's incredibly difficult to take notes with her rambling. The majority of the points were from the 3 exams and one small project. Be prepared to read the textbook and teach yourself all the concepts. Interesting topic, terrible professor.

Super slow grader. Grades the reviews that are supposed to help you study for the test a month late and the exams are nothing like class. When you do ask questions or go over homework, she gives complicated and unclear explanations. In order to get credit for your homework you have to be present in class, but other than that going is useless.
She seemed like a nice person but her lectures are extremely unengaging. I could never focus on what she's saying. The forms are easy though

This professor really cared about whether students understood concepts and explained things several times if students were still confused. She encourages students to ask questions and come to office hours. I recommend that you attend lectures, instead of having extensively information on the slides, she verbally elaborates on concepts.

Tests were very poorly worded. Her lectures were painful to sit through and she speaks very monotone and *maybe* 2 people out of the 80 in the lecture would answer her questions (she asked a lot) and it was very awkward and cringe. I tended to just zone out in that class and get annoyed. I stopped going to class in the end, not worth going.

This class is not the easiest with this professor. Making sure you read the textbook before class will help in order to understand the lectures. Professor does not seem engaged in the material and the lectures are confusing and hard to understand in class. Attendance is not mandatory. Exams are not the easiest. I would take with another professor.

This class isn't particularly difficult if you read the textbook and attend class. But the lectures are just truly painful. She is very quiet and asks many questions, but she is not engaging at all, so the class has so many awkward silences. She also kind of gets upset when nobody participates. She only uses pictures in lecture slides.

Ms. Prutha is an awesome teacher! She is so sweet and nice. Her class is easy, there are no homeworks! You should however show up to class because the notes are very helpful for the exams! The exam is not timed and is open-notes, so be sure to be in class. This professor is a bit shy, so interact with her and answer the questions. I recommend her!

I have her for Psych 1100, Shes such an easy grader, honestly you dont have to try to hard for this class. Just take the notes and youll be fine. She does open note exams and she gives out extra credit also. The only thing that I didnt like about her was how she sometimes seems confused about what shes teaching. She has lack of passion.

Shes a very timid person but also very kind, and knows what shes talking about. PArticipate in class otherwise its so quiet and awkward. The tests aren't hard, but if you don't read over the materials you won't do well. Don't assume this is an easy class because its psych. Part of the points are given if you just do it (like the REP experiments),

I had Prutha for her first semester teaching and loved her and her class. She is incredibly helpful and dedicated to her teaching. The few times I emailed her, she responded within hours with very detailed answers. Her class calls for a lot of note taking and term memorization but she gives great examples for remembering the material. Recommended!!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining teaching style, with students noting his friendliness and sense of humor. However, his grading can be challenging, particularly for the papers, which are graded harshly but curved to maintain an average B. Students should also be prepared to write six 2-page papers and avoid using passive voice, as exams are fair but require thorough understanding of the material.

Ratings.comment: He's a really great teacher. He's super nice and friendly and tells lots of good jokes to keep you entertained. Some people struggle because the papers are graded harshly but he curves the grade so that the average is a B at the end. Do yourself a favor and don't buy the book either.

Dont buy the textbook he will tell you what you need to know in class.Great lecturer but a very hard grader.dont use any passive voice at all.midterms arent bad he will tell you whats on them.avg grade is b-.young so he jokes around alot.

Great teacher. Extremely helpful. You have 6 2-page papers to write throughout the quarter. He grades the papers hard but he is pretty clear about what you have to write about and gives out rubrics. For midterms/final he was pretty fair and has review sessions. Just know the concepts and pay attention and you'll be fine.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his helpfulness and engaging lectures, which are filled with humor and useful notes. His comprehensive PowerPoint presentations, available on Carmen, serve as a valuable resource, though some students note that he primarily reads from them. Despite this, his teaching style is generally enjoyable and effective, making the course manageable yet informative.

Ratings.comment: Very nice and helpful, he had good notes to fill out in class with engaging/funny lectures that helped with the exam. I didn't really read the book but I paid attention to the lectures and definitions, I remember it being mostly term based exams.
The book helps if you miss a class because he gets all his examples from there. Not a hard class, just a good amount of information.

He provided all of his power points on carmen.  The only issue was that he literally just reads off of the power points and he got all of his examples from the book.  His notes were better than other teachers, and he was pretty fun to listen to.  I was glad I had him when another teacher came in to sub for him one day.. man was she boring

summary_comment: Dr. Billings is generally considered a competent but challenging instructor, known for making research ethics interesting through humor and personal anecdotes, though the material can be dry. Students find his lectures helpful, especially for those who attend regularly, and appreciate the extra credit opportunities. However, his grading can be tough, particularly on tests, and some students report feeling put down during class discussions.

Ratings.comment: exellent teacher. very clear and organized as he managed to make research ethics interesting. very fair grader.

As long as you read the text or go to lecture, the tests are cake. I went to lecture more than half the time, but it wasn't really necessary. He was pretty funny and the lectures were not bad at all. Do the 3 hw assignments just in case you bomb a test. He doesnt curve your grade, so you get what you get. Great professor though.

As many others have stated, not the most exciting material, but not the worst, either. He does try and throw in a few anecdotes (many about his cat or his wife) to try and make the material relevant. But, when he asks questions (during lecture) he will only agree if you give the answer he wants.  Overall, not too painful.  Notes are posted online

Pretty good teacher. The class itself is pretty boring but it isn't difficult. Going to class def makes it a lot easier. He gives an opportunity for extra credit that can really help your grade if you do it.

No matter who teaches this class it's going to be a boring class. Dr. Billings tries to make it as interesting as possible. He cracks jokes, and tells interesting stories. It's not too bad. Him and his TA helped me a lot in their office. They will be happy to go over exams with you, and explain anything.

This class was bad, I had to drop it! The information is sooo boring and Dr. Billings was a very stiff teacher. I felt like he wasn't approachable at all. He told us to refer all questions to the TA! Tests are soo hard. Only good thing about the class was the optional surveys or paper for 50 points extra credit. Dont take unless life depends on it.

Dr. Billings is a hard teacher.  I would not recommend him.  When he asks questions in class and students answer the question wrong he puts them down and makes them feel dumb.  He does offer extra credit though, and the homeworks are not that hard.  Watch out for the tests they can be killers.

Pretty hard class but totally doable, but like someone else said, it's extremely easy to get the 50 bonus points, and they do matter since your grade is out of 1000. I thought the class was extremely boring, and this is the first class I have ever taken which you could definitely get an A without going to class; Everything you need is online.
Good prof. Clear when explaining course material. Very helpful. Worth taking!

He is by far the most effective teacher I have had. Regardless of the material, he does a really good job explaining. I actually learned everything in class just my listening to him. Really good at explaining things.
Tricky class, make sure you understand his testing style and what he thinks is important.  He does give extra credit to help if you didn't do so hot on an exam, but exams aren't easy.
This class wasn't the hardest but it wasnt the easiest...the tests werent too hard but the paper was a pain. The class was soooo boring and i'm suprised I made it as much as I did!
The class is really boring but really easy. Just read the book and the notes and you will be fine on the tests.  Can get an easy 50 bonus points which makes getting a good grade even easier.

made lectures very interesting considering the material. homeworks very easy & offers easy extra credit. do need to spend some time studying for exams though. overall really good prof. would take another class with him again.
Billings was not the most exciting guy, but he was very helpful and the class was pretty easy.  Just don't take it in the morning, or you will never go to class.

You can tell he's genuinely interested in the stuff he teaches. Unfortunately the material is still very boring. He puts all the notes online so going to class is purely optional and it really won't hurt your grade to skip as long as you read the notes before the midterm

The material is dull, but easy to understand.  He gives you the notes online.  50 bonus points if you do some surveys.  I thought this class was much easier than psych 100.  If I recall correctly something like 75% of the class got C+ or above.
He is kind of arrogant and extremely boring- class not recommended.
The material was horribly boring, but he actually made in enjoyable.  He has a great sense of humor.  He gives you every opportunity to do well.
Great teacher!  Tests are all essay, but he grades them very fairly.  But bring a pillow on presentaion days, that's a bore!
Very helpful, tries to keep lectures lively, very friendly & great guy.  I'd highly recommend any of his classes.

summary_comment: The professor is effective at ensuring students understand key concepts but is often described as monotonous and boring, making long lectures difficult to follow. Despite this, the material is generally easy and the class can be managed with consistent attendance and studying. Overall, while the teaching style may not be engaging for all students, the professor is accommodating and helpful, and the class can be successfully navigated with effort.

Ratings.comment: Most boring class ever.  He is extremely monotone and impossible to listen to for over an hour.  However, it is still possible to get an A in the class without going all of the time.

I think he did the best he could with the most boring class material ever. There is no way any teacher could make this class interesting. It was common sense so tests were extremely easy. He was a boring lecturer, but I don't think it was his fault.
Really makes sure students understand the concepts.
Lectures are kind of boring, but material is pretty easy. Not a lot of points available in the class, so it's important to do well on quizzes. Reading the book was helpful.

Prof. B is a good professor.  The subject matter is clearly communicated through the powerpoints and he is very accomodating.  I didn't buy the book to this class, but still did fine.  A bit monotonous at times, but overall a good class.
Overall easy teacher if attendance is maintained and material studied.  I genuinely enjoyed this class.

Great straight forward teacher,he's very clear,and his material isn't hard. As long as you go to class and listen to the lecture you'll find it really easy to grasp the material. If you go to his office h;s more than willing to help. He does give extra credit points. Test are normal,3 Tests,1 short paper, and submission of 3 v.short hw

Ryan is very nice and friendly and knows his material very well. The class involved a lot more work than what I thought though. Not only did we have to write six papers but we had two midterms and a final too, which were all short answer and essay questions. Go to class everyday and read the book.

Very good at explaining concepts, shows clips of popular shows to illustrate the concepts, very helpful out of class, bit repetitive when speaking, fair grader.. not too hard but not too easy, always gives good feedback on papers so you can improve

Knows his material and explains it well. Moderately hard grader (but seems to have softened a bit since past comments.) The curve wasn't particularly helpful in my class, but it wasn't really needed. Must read or go to class to do well on tests. Don't let the study guides fool you, study everything.
He grades the papers really hard but knows the material!! Its a given that you will do horrible on the papers no matter how much time you put into them.

He repeats the same thing for literally 10 minutes. Very annoying. He knows the material but is a really hard grader on the papers.. but the curve is amazing because D is the average grade he gives on papers, so don't be surprised when you get one!
He is very redundant and lectures will put you to sleep!  He grades papers very hard, but there is a curve at the end.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their engaging and humorous teaching style, combined with deep knowledge in the subject matter, making the class both enjoyable and informative.

Ratings.comment: Funny and knowledgable. Very enjoyable class

summary_comment: Dr. Simon is a friendly and knowledgeable professor with a distinctive Australian accent, though his lectures can be boring. Students find the class easy, with exam questions often directly from homework, and some appreciate his efforts to help those who struggle. However, lecture materials are sometimes considered unhelpful, and the class is generally described as unexciting.

Ratings.comment: Simon is a very charismatic professor, in my opinion. The class itself was very easy, but the lectures were boring. I almost never went and still got a good grade. Plus side: He has an Australian accent. It makes him a little more interesting to listen to.

Class is very boring, but Dr. Simon is one of the most friendly professors I have ever had. He is genuinely interested in the subject matter and it's obvious that he knows what he's talking about. The exam questions are verbatim from the homework, but the TA graded the extended response questions insanely hard. Overall it's just an okay class.
His lecture slides are seriously the most useless things ever.

I only went to class three times and received an A+. Everything on the exams is verbatim from the homework so as long as you study you will be fine. Also, I recommend getting both of the textbooks, because the second one explains almost everything in his lectures that is confusing.

To be honest, this is one of the more boring OSU psych classes. However, Dr. Dennis is legitimately one of the best professors I have had. He tries through every medium possible to explain the material to you if you don't get it. He is very approachable and tries to be fair in grading. He even gives an easy extra credit assignment. Great teacher.

This professor was good. The lectures were very very boring and it was often times difficult to stay awake. But he was a good professor who did everything he could to explain the material if you didn't get it.

Somewhat boring class.. Every lecture felt like it was the same.. However, Dr. Dennis is very organized, a helpful professor, and very knowledgable. Also, the exam questions are taken verbatim from the homework, so just memorize the homework. But, again, psych 3312 is not very exciting.

memory & cognition class. SO easy, he gives you all the test questions & essays, you just have to memorize them and he picks randomly which ones to include on the test. he makes cognition vey interesting. and he has a great australian accent! great teacher. very helpful.
Very organized course!

summary_comment: The professor is perceived as inconsistent in quality; while some students find her approachable and invested in their success, others find her lectures repetitive and boring, with a focus on self-help that feels unengaging and redundant. The class requires significant personal reflection and attendance but offers little challenging content, making it easy to pass without much effort.

Ratings.comment: The material itself is interesting, but she reiterates a lot of what she says, making classes boring and redundant. Easy to get a good grade, but a chore to enjoy. She can also be condescending when answering student questions.

This class focuses a lot on applying what you learn on yourself, which is a lot different from the usual psych class. The work is very simple and easy although it does require you to attend to class (to get the notes and do the exercises) and do a lot reflecting on your behalf (since it is about you and your personal situations).
Extremely invested in students' success.  Could not possibly be nicer or more approachable.

Incredibly boring instructor. Feels like a self help section more than a university level class. It's not difficult so long as you keep up with class material, but doing so feels like a chore. No textbook, readings online (and all more interesting than the lectures), but you do have to pay $10 for a folder full of useless charts. Do not take!

summary_comment: Lassiter is an effective and approachable professor who generally makes lectures engaging despite the occasional dryness of the material. Students appreciate his clear communication and willingness to assist, though some find the class requires significant self-study due to limited online resources. His teaching style improves over the semester, and he provides helpful outlines and reviews to support student understanding.

Ratings.comment: Lassiter is a pretty good professor. The material can get a little boring at times, but you can tell he knows his stuff. The only thing that really bothered me about this class was that he never posted the lectures online, so if he didn't get to material in class, it was more work on your part, and there were things left not discussed.

Lassiter is pretty cool. He's super nice and is really chill about stuff. The class requires a lot of studying of terms, but not anything abnormal. Attending class is not required, and Lassiter is really kind of boring at the beginning of the semester. He gets better throughout though.

He is a very cool guy that is very good at making lecture interesting. It may be a kinda boring class but lassiter makes it kind of entertaining. I never read the book but was still able to get a B in the course. The two midterms and final are pretty straight forward.

He gives you outlines of the notes he will do in class for each day. Notes are easy to understand and to apply for the quizzes and midterms. Makes lectures enjoyable when he can. Does reviews when possible, and helps whenever he can! Great guy!

The material for this class is extremely easy and as long as you do the work and study a little you'll get an A. Speller communicated everything clearly, is a really funny guy, and was always willing to go above and beyond to help.  I would recommend him to anyone.

summary_comment: Dr. Cheavens is highly regarded for her engaging and enjoyable teaching style, making complex topics accessible and relevant to students' lives. She is praised for her passion, down-to-earth personality, and ability to keep lectures interactive and fun, leading to high student satisfaction and strong recommendations. Students find her classes both interesting and manageable, with useful content that extends beyond the classroom.

Ratings.comment: I looked forward to this class; it is interesting, informative, and unique. Dr. Cheavens knows her stuff and has fun teaching it. She is a great professor to get to know: down-to-earth, friendly, and passionate. A fun class that is not too difficult but not too easy either. If you interested,  psych major or not, take this class.
Cheavens was a great teacher. She made the lectures interesting and fun. I enjoyed her class.

Dr. Cheavens is one of the best professors I have had at Ohio State. Her lectures are fun, hilarious, and interactive. Her exams are also relatively easy if you prepare before. I would HIGHLY recommend doing the readings, as the essay questions on her exams almost always pertain to them. I would take another class with her again if I could!

Dr. Cheavens was awesome! This class was defiantly a class that people wanted to go to, because everything we talked about could be related back to our own lives. Overall a great class, and I would recommend this class even if you are not a psych major, because you learn so much useful information.
I love Cheavens. She makes the lectures interesting and enjoyable. Take good notes during class and read the textbook and you should do pretty well in the class.
Great professor!  Keeps it interesting and interactive.
Dr. Cheavens is a great teacher. She is interesting and fun! The class isn't too hard, just pay attention and take notes.

She is an amazing teacher. Come prepared to talk about material in class. She doesn't like to just lecture at you so be involved. Read the material and come to class. Hello this is college do the work. She is completely awesome.
GREAT teacher! This class was so interesting and she presents the lectures in an interesting way! Tests are not hard if you just pay attention and do the readings.  I definitely recommend it.

She could have given me 1 extra point on an essay, but instead decided to stop me from graduating because of ONE POINT. I lost my job teaching at OSU, lost my admissions to graduate school, and was forced to take out an extra loan... over ONE point.
Dr. Cheavens "Heavens with a C" is a really great teacher who seems to really enjoy what she does.  Even when our class doesn't always feel like participating she doesn't lose her energy and spunk!!

Dr. Cheavens is smart, presents the material in an interesting and straight forward manner and extremely helpful to her class.  In addition, she is STUNNINGLY BEAUTIFUL, has a great sense of humor and is apparently a huge sports fan.  Being in her class  was quite possibly the best classroom experience of my college career.  WOW, is all I can say.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her knowledge, passion, and engaging teaching style, often praised for inspiring students and encouraging critical thinking. However, some students find her class unorganized and difficult to follow, citing frequent changes to the syllabus and unexpected assignments. Overall, attendance is crucial for those who value her storytelling and additional insights, while others can succeed without attending regularly.

Ratings.comment: She is very nice, knowledgeable, and she truly cares about her students and the topics in class. She is a true inspiration..

This class was so much fun! She always had stories about the researchers we were talking about as well as her own experiences with chimps. They can get a bit long, but they're really fun to listen to. They may seem irrelevant at first, but she always brings it back. Pay attention and you'll do fine on the exams. Talk to her and she'll help you.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! She can't seem to adapt to semesters and will change the syllabus almost weekly. SHE doesn't stick to it but you're expected to. She won't stay on topic but the tests (she swore and yelled at us before the first midterm) pretend that she did.She also added an unnecessary research paper which she doesn't explain well. AVOID

Maybe because it was a summer class, but this class was just awful. Thankfully the midterms were takehome, because most of the stuff on them we hadn't even lectured over yet, and went over AFTER the midterm. Most classes we watched movies and she also decided the last week of class that we need to write a fullout APA paper. Got an A, would not rec.

The class is very unorganized, I did not attend after the 1st test, and still received an A. You can get all the information you need from the slides she posts on carmen and by reading the assigned books. Also, anyone who had an A after the first two tests did not have to take the final.

It is worth it to go to every class, just to hear her stories. She is very good at explaining concepts and encouraging you to think for yourself instead of just passively reading about and accepting results from studies.

Fantastic prof! One of my favorites ever. Class isn't mandatory, but if you show up and listen, you'll do fine on the midterms. It's worth it to go to class just to hear her stories, she's hilarious. Also as a bonus to graduating seniors, the final is optional. Five star professor, all the way
Great prof!

Take this class! She is hilarious and knows her stuff. If you don't mind hearing her funny life stories you will love this class. Better than any other psych class i took as an undergrad. Sally is so helpful and her tests are easy if you study a little. Such an interesting professor!

I really enjoy prof.Boysen's class. Its interesting and enjoyable. I find her teaching style refreshing. Its nice to be in a class where a teacher treats you like a person and not just some annoying student.
Fun class.  Awesome professor

This was the easiest psych class I took here believe it or not.  The stuff is interesting!  She is one of the top 50 women in science and she is super intelligent.  She's sure passionate, but she's engaging and a good teacher.  Great class!
Really knows her stuff!

The woman is crazy. Has a lot of experience and is knowledgeable but definitely crazy. If you don't go to class don't expect to know what's going on in regards to test dates/ info because she doesn't seem to know either... Just pieces things together when students raise their hands in confusion.

Dr. Boysen is an awesome teacher. She is hilarious and very intelligent. Her class was very challenging and difficult but it is worth taking if you work hard at it. I would definitely recommend taking her as a professor.
She is very passionate about primate cognition. She definitely can keep the class's attention with her expressive language and detailed stories.
she's great. definitely take a class with her. you'll learn so much, and not just what the syllabus outlines...
Hilarious. Simply hilarious. And the subject matter is really interesting. She tests fairly.

Dr. Boysen is an extremely knowledgeable person. She made class interesting because she always had stories that would relate to what we were learning. Almost all of her stories have to deal with her chimps that got taken from her. Overall easy class. She gives study guides and that's what's on the tests!
Best prof ever!
great
Amazing woman!  Incredibly passionate about her work!
Very Easy. All test open books and open note
Crazy.
No Comments
class was fun, but very unorganized.  impossible to know what was going to be on the test.  expect lots of laughter in her class though.  overall a decent professor.

Dr. Boysend is indeed crazy but I think that is what allows her to work with the chimps so well.  Her class wasn't particularly useful bit I was happy to go every time just to sit there and get my does of laughter for the day.
Professor missed several classes - very haphazard.  No organization

Crazy/Brilliant.  Obviously very interested in her own research.  Lectures when "on task" where very informative, however she went on a thousand tangents, and was disorganized.  Most of her stories relate, if you listen closely.  Tests were super easy.  Highly recommend any class by her.

When I took her she did spend a lot of time talking about personal stuff, her lab, and Jane Goodall but we learned everything that we needed to know.  She was very understanding as well, I had to go into the hospital while taking her class, and she made it very easy for me to make up what I missed.

She spent most of class time talking about her personal life instead of teaching.  Made the class fun, until exam day.  Very unclear about what she wants and how the tests are going to be set up.  Not helpful at all.

Dr. Boysen is crazy...she spends more time talking about her personal life than relevant materials...disorganized and doesn't even bother to come to her own exams, instead sends TAs that don't attend the class...more interested in her research than teaching

I enjoyed her class. She knows alot about primate cognition; although she does get off track quite a bit. Her tests are the esiest I have had at OSU; so her class is a way to get upper level credit essentially for free.

I have enjoyed her class so far. She likes to have class discussions that get a bit off topic sometimes, but it makes it more interactive. Her material is easy for the most part and she is fair on her questions.
She is crazy and I love it! Interesting class, although there was lots of side stories, but less material to know for tests right?

If you attended lecture, took notes, studied the notes and did the assigned readings,you were pretty much guarenteed an "A" on the test.Extra credit was offered too. The classes were very fun and interesting. I loved them.

Often got sidetracked and didn't cover material. The Graduate Students she had teach everyonce in a while were far and away better teachers and funny too. Boysen may tell stories, but she doesn't teach the material.
Sophisticated sense of humor, usually wasted on geysers who don't believe a woman should be ALLOWED to be intelligent and witty. Sign up for her class, you won't regret it!
I dropped the class, because it was so boring.  She may have changed in the past few years, but when I had her she seemed conceited and arrogant.  I'm a guy and I didn't find her the least bit hot.
Class fun and informative, good use of humor as method of instruction and memory aid. And I guess she might be hot, I don't know- I'm a woman.
Very funny and informative. Tends to get sidetracked a little during lectures but is one of the most amazing profs I've had.
extremely interesting class, lots of humorous personal experience stories

summary_comment: Eric Shaeffer's lectures primarily rely on Powerpoint presentations available on Carmen, making note-taking redundant. Exams are straightforward and closely follow the lecture material, though reading the book is still beneficial. Despite the ease of exams, some students find his teaching style monotonous and his expectations for group projects and writing overly stringent, leading to frustration and poor feedback.

Ratings.comment: His lectures are straight off Powerpoints, which he puts on Carmen, so there's no point in taking notes. All his questions come from the lecture, but reading the book is still very helpful. His exams are straight from the Powerpoints, are relatively easy if you put in enough work.

Shaeffer is VERY clear with what he lectures about to his class. All his notes are on Carmen at he end of every week so there is no need in taking notes. Most exam questions have you relate a real-life situation and guess what term that situation applies to rather than guessing a straight-up definition.

This was the easiest of all of the honors psych classes, but I still feel like a learned a lot. Tests are easy,  he grades fairly, and he puts his power points online so I never even took notes, although it does help to go to class.
His videos and examples really brought the lesson to life and made it interesting. I suggest his honors course to everyone.

I would recommend taking this class with a different teacher Eric is the only 508 teacher still doing the group project.  Eric can be somewhat helpful sometimes but refuses to actually listen to what his students say. He is a very arrogant teacher and Ive never heard a more boring lecturer. He definitely knows his material but doesn't teach it well

Eric Shaeffer is terrible. His expectations are beyond impossible. He expects perfection in the writing of his undergraduate students. His group project is ridiculous. Never gives feedback until its too late, same for exams. Pretends to be so nice and care so much but he couldn't care less, he should be in some lab somewhere not teaching students.

Material is interesting and it's obvious he has spent some time creating the power point presentations.  Seems like a nice guy, but terribly meticulous grader.  Takes forever to give tests back and is not open to discuss any mistakes he may have made while grading.  Make sure your test answers are not ambiguous.

One of, if not the worst teachers I've ever had. Everybody was so excited about the research projects at first but his expectations are ridiculous and he never gave feedback on time (most were weeks late). He expects you to write like a professional researcher and the stats analyses we are expected to know are absurd - most people were lost.

Such a ridiculous grader. Seemed like a cool class at first, but his expectations and grading made it impossible to succeed. Gives vague directions, and then expects you to know every little detail he expects from us. Would not recommend.

eric looks like a hedgehog. absolutely useless teacher. you would think he is teaching aerobics by how much he sweats. eric has a real monotone voice that sounds like nails on a chalkboard after awhile. really tough grader. class average is typically a B-. never enters grades. you find out what you get on the last day. would never advise taking him

impossible grader. pretends he is soo nice and really cares about how you do and then craps on your papers and tests. tests can be easy but make sure your answers are PERFECT. he takes off points whenever he can. this guy is a stain on psychology as a whole

Professor is OK, however I would not recommend him for taking writing level classes. He seems so quite and shy, but when he grades he is total EVIL!!!!!!!! His tests consist of only questions, which seem easy to answer. However when you get you test back the grade is BAD, and essays grades are also BAD!! He has his own made up grading criteria. NO!

I am in the class right now, and eric does a great job. His tests are fair, and although our average was low, its because most people dont show up to class. if you show up and study, the exams arent that difficult. and he is fair with grading. recommend the class too. very interesting if you like psychology and the social environment

Eric was a nice guy but thats about all you can say about him. His lectures made it a struggle to stay awake and he is extremely critical on papers. Grades were never entered on time. Not a class I would advise taking.
He made the class fun. Doesn't take attendance but you have to go to pass the exams. Highly recommended!
Eric is very excited about psychology, but at times I became really bored sitting in class.
Very very helpful examples are given in his classes and he's very good at explaining. He's enthused about psych and makes you feel interested in it too.

Loved this class.  Eric is so helpful.  He is willing to proofread papers.  Class isn't the most exciting but he does the best he can.  The slides are very detailed...no need for a book.  He basically gives you all the possible questions he will ask on tests on the review sheet.

If you bring him a draft of a paper, he will essentially grade it in front of you and talk with you about the structure, word choice, efficiency of writing, etc. I think he's funny. The first paper was a bit tough, but once you knew how to follow the rubrick, the rest were a breeze. Peer editing was hilarious.

This professor is very helpful when it comes to office hours, but he still sucks when it comes to grading.  If you don't write how he wants you too, then your grade will suffer.  Same goes for exams, if you don't answer the question in his way, then you will loose points fast.   The information is very easy, but the way he grades is just too unfair
Great great great professor. So helpful at office hours. Let me use his computer to print out a paper. Very clear and fun in class, adds quarky jokes. Fun time. Likes chipotle.

all you need are his lecture notes, which he posts online. i never used my textbook. tests come directly from outlines, but he's a pain in the ass when it comes to essays. overall, i'd reccommend the class to my friends.

summary_comment: Tabitha is an outstanding instructor known for her interactive teaching style and strong organizational skills. She actively engages students in discussions and offers extra credit opportunities, demonstrating a genuine care for her students' success.

Ratings.comment: GREAT INSTRUCTOR!!! Tabitha was absolutely awesome, and was extremely helpful. The class is taught in an interactive format, with no Powerpoint type of stuff. If you like discussion based classes, this is great!
Organized, helpful, gives extra credit, and cares about her students.

summary_comment: This professor is generally perceived as easy, with many students finding the classes and exams straightforward, though some note that the material is poorly explained and the tests are often confusingly worded. While the professor offers extra credit and is described as nice, there are concerns about her comfort with the subject matter and her ability to effectively teach the course. Students also report that lectures can be boring and that the professor struggles to clarify information consistently between lectures and presentations.

Ratings.comment: Easy class. I've only had her for Creativity, but it's virtually impossible not to score an A on her exams. Offers tons of extra credit as well.
Very easy class. Teacher was very helpful if needed help. Hardly ever used textbook. Each exam had so much extra credit, and only 1 paper throughout the course. Overall VERY VERY easy!

She is nice. The class is easy. The tests are poorly worded. One problem: she seems uncomfortable with the material like she doesn't know it well enough to teach the course. She seems intimidated by the class and I feel sorry for her. Don't be so hard on her.

I have her for behav. neuro and she is terrible at explaining. Shows us almost irrelevant videos and doesn't understand questions asked. Very vague with concepts - students have to explain to other students about the material. Has an annoying and nervous habit... do switch out if you get her.

This class was the hardest to go to by far. She would say one thing in lecture but have something completely different in the powerpoint, then never clarify which was correct. Her tests were very vague and could have had multiple correct answers, leading to even more confusion.

By far my least favorite class. Test questions were badly worded and over the most specific details we might not have even discussed. Lectures EXTREMELY boring. Not to mention the fact that she is kind of annoying.

Super easy class. Just go to lecture, take notes, skim the textbook and you'll be fine. Isn't the best a explaining things or understanding questions. Usually get a few extra points on tests because of a poorly worded question. Super easy paper, not a bad class if you don't care about actually learning psych.
Had her for an evaluaion. Could not give any basis for diagnostics. Not even able to come up with valid reasoning for her professional opinion. Maybe the class should be teaching her

Psych of Creativity. She wrote the textbook. The topic borders on pseudoscience/pop psychology. The data in the textbook has clear biases and many faults in methods of attaining the data. She doesn't seem to understand any questions we ask and gets preoccupied with her opinions, without ever answering the questions, even objectively. Overall: UGH.

Needs to take the basics of teaching..she is not a professor, but rather a self indulged ****. On numerous occaions she refused to answer questions that our class asked and would ignore certain people's raised hands. I would tell anyone that I know to take another professor due to incompetence and ignorance.

She's kinda weird and not the greatest at explaining things or understanding what you are asking. Also she's a really bad test writer, especially true/false questions, our class always managed to get sever questions thrown out because almost no one in the class got them right because we didn't understand them.

She is quirky but fun. She is very quiet, so try to sit in front. 3 tests, no final and a 2 page (easy) research paper. Atten is mandatory and worth a 100 point, easy grade boosts. All notes are posted on carmen and test are straing from the notes, I hardly looked at the book. Exams are MC, TF and some easy fill in the blaks. Lots of ex cred.

She is very quiet, you need to sit in the front row. She is the most nervous person I have ever come into contact with. Tests are so-so and come from the book and lectures. Lectures are mandatory and count for participation points.

summary_comment: Salvatore is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and dedication to student learning. Students praise his ability to foster critical thinking and engage them with relevant examples, making complex material accessible. His approachable nature and willingness to offer additional support through office hours and extra study sessions contribute to his positive reputation among alumni.

Ratings.comment: I really struggled in this class early in the quarter, but Salvatore was so helpful during office hours and held outside study sessions for the class. Miss this cutey! Hope he's doing good. XOXO

Now, after finishing my degree from Ohio State, I can say thinking back that Salvatore was one of the most memorable and gifted professors I had at OSU. He really got me to think critically required much more than simple memorization. Loved this guy!
Fun, intelligent guy who really enjoys what he's teaching. Good at bringing examples from outside class and does NOT just read the textbook to you, like some instructors.
Excellent instructor. Funny, caring guy who's very pleasing to the eyes.
just believe him and study well, it will be okay.
Good guy who actually cared that we learned something. Not an easy instructor, but a very good one.
i took this class two years ago i dont remember well most of them and i dont go to osu now but i firmly believe he's nice.i almost forgot really.

This prof. was really knowledgeable. He's pretty much a genius, and really actually puts some effort into his teaching.  You can tell its almost a little hard for him to dumb down the material to our level. He makes some funny wisecracks every once in awhile. Be ready to take notes nonstop if you get him!!!
One of the best teachers I've ever had. extremely intelligent and makes class fun. very entertaining. he makes clear even the most difficult things to understand. definitely get him if you can.
The best teacher ive seen. goodlecture[!]
DEFINITELY one of my best profs last year! Nice guy. really hot but a real wise #*& ! Might be a genius, but he's not arrogant. What's with the last rater?!
good prof. may be too smart for his own good. he likes to brag about how he's a genius
Nice guy who gave really good examples, although he may be a bit advanced for some students. Quizzes were hard but fair. Super cute & crushworthy...
This guy was awsome. I loved his class. He made lectures very entertaining. He really cares about making sure everyone knows what he is saying. I highly recommend him.
great teacher! always seems interested in people understanding.  fun, goofy guy.
