Good teacher, notes were pretty clear.
Cute teacher who always tried to make sure his lecture was clear ...I just wish that he had take home quizzes (like some of the other teachers have) instead of those really hard in-class quizzes.
No Comments
No Comments

ok this teacher has really good notes but he just cant explain it to college kids.. i think he is too smart for his own good and cant explain things at a teaching level. make sure you study the notes like mad. i hardley used the book to study, most people didnt.

summary_comment: The professor's class is perceived as quite easy, with multiple-choice exams and minimal homework that takes only a short time to complete. However, students note that getting a higher grade than a B requires putting in more effort. The professor, who is a graduate student, provides online note outlines and bonus opportunities, but many found the class boring and opted to skip it.

Ratings.comment: Boring class. Exams are very specific. Easy class, could get a B with no effort but have to put in more work to get an A. Definitely need the textbook.

This class was really, really easy. Gillie is a grad student and really young. Most people skipped. Tests were multiple choice with a few fill in the blank. There were 5 homeworks, but they took like 10mins each. No writing assignments. You can also earn bonus. He posts note outlines online.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her clarity and humor, though some find her lectures too fast-paced. Students appreciate her willingness to help and find her entertaining, despite occasional organizational issues. Overall, many consider her one of the best teachers they have had, noting that while there are minor inconsistencies, her dedication and sense of humor make her classes enjoyable and manageable.

Ratings.comment: Although she comes to class about five minutes late, she always explains everything as clearly as she can during notes. Guided notes are provided and she tells hilarious stories to help you remember the material. Most awesome professor I've ever had!
She is always hurry in class. She goes so fast that you cannot write down the notes. Her lecture is unclear in many parts. Her class is not interesting to me.

She is a good teacher and is ALWAYS willing to help you when needed. She sometimes gets thing mixed up and is unorganized at times, however, she quickly fixes herself and makes everything understandable. Go to class because the notes she gives you have to be filled out in class. Also, she is very funny and makes the lectures entertaining.
she is the best teacher ever.

its an easy A and alisha is really easy to talk to. she isnt always on top of everything. sometimes the notes arent online until the day of class but she tries to keep things interesting. she is really nice and does a great job teaching

She is great! Gets a tad confused sometimes and teachs the wrong thing for one concept when it should be for another but ALWAYS corrects herself and it never comes too late! Very funny and genuinely seems to care! If you do what you're supposed to do, you should have no trouble in this class or passing!

summary_comment: Dr. Wagner is highly regarded for his effective teaching methods and engaging approach, making complex material accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate his approachability, personal connection, and commitment to helping them succeed. However, some find the workload demanding, particularly the frequent assignments and extensive study guides.

Ratings.comment: I loved this class! Ben was nice, helpful, and very approachable.  I had him freshman year and it was nice to have a friendly and reassuring professor.  The material was interesting, and easy to follow.  My only complaint would be that sometimes class moved too slow and I would get bored, but for a freshman honors course that's not a bad thing.

I had Dr. Wagner for honors psychology my freshman year and he was great. I was worried that an honors course would be too much work, but he just made the class much more discussion based and really got to know you on a personal level. I would recommend him in a heartbeat! Take his class, you won't regret it!

I loved attending this class. He made the material really interesting, and easy to understand. He's probably one of the best professors i've ever had. There's no point in buying the book, everything is in the slides. I would definitely recommend him!

One of the best teachers I could have hoped for for my freshman year. Had him for Intro to Psych Honors and he was wonderful - always concerned about what he could do to help us. The entire class loved him. Made learning the material so fun by doing interactive things with the class and watching movies. If you try in the class you'll be fine.

Gives good notes and does an excellent job of teaching. The only thing that makes the papers difficult is attempting to fit everything you need into two pages. Holds a review session before each exam and is always willing to help. As long as you pay attention in class, you'll be fine.

the class is ridiculous for a gec. we have 5 2 page papers and a revised paper which is paper 6. and 2 midterms and a final so you have something due every single week. it requires more effort to pass then major classes. the study guides for the exams are 3.5 pages long. he means well, but i wouldnt take it again, or recommend it.

summary_comment: Vibh is highly regarded as an exceptional teacher at OSU, known for her genuine interest in student well-being and passion for psychology. She goes above and beyond to ensure students understand the material through various teaching aids and extra review sessions. Her cheerful demeanor and dedication to student learning make her a standout professor in the psychology department.

Ratings.comment: Vibh is one of the best teachers I've had at OSU. She always has a smile on her face and is genuinely interested in the well being of her students. She is so passionate about psychology and does all she can to make sure you know the material. I highly recommend her to anyone!

Class is very Easy. Vibh truly cares about the material. Goes out of her way to explain the concepts with videos, audio files, slides, notes. She holds extra review sessions. Psych department creates exam not her. She does everything in her ability to help students learn. Great professor.

Vibh is super nice, very cheery, and is genuinely interested and excited about Psychology. The exams are written by the department and not the individual instructors, so read the textbook as well as her personal class notes which are posted online. The section points and quizzes are helpful and easy. Also, there are plenty of opportunities for EC

summary_comment: Matt is an exceptionally enthusiastic and dedicated teacher who genuinely enjoys imparting knowledge, making class attendance more engaging for students. While some find the amount of material challenging, indicating high academic standards, Matt is committed to helping students succeed. He is widely regarded as a great teacher who ensures students meet these high expectations.

Ratings.comment: You can tell Matt really likes to teach and he is extremely enthusiastic. I actually wanted to go to class. I think some students thought he gave too much material but I just view that as having high standards. Matt is definitely not an easy A but he will do whatever he can to help you get there. Matt is a great teacher.

summary_comment: Professor Arkin is highly regarded by many students for his care and friendliness, willingness to help, and ability to provide detailed feedback on papers. However, some find his lectures overly rehearsed and lacking in depth, with tangents that can detract from the main topics. Despite this, he is generally seen as an engaging and supportive instructor, especially for honors students or those willing to put in extra effort.

Ratings.comment: He really doesn't talk about anything related to international security and the entire lecture is memorized, it's like he's giving a speech. It's still interesting but I didn't learn anything from lectures that was relevant. The books are mediocre. It's mostly interesting without any real substance. And it's too rehearsed.
Great professor, easy course. Goes off on tangents sometimes, but he will make you think. Take this, especially if you are an honors student.

Arkin is amazing.  Attendance isn't mandatory, but going to class really helps, even though he posts the slides you need to go to get ALL the info. He's always willing to help. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. If he knows who you are and if you've done well on the paper he will take that into consideration while doing final grades.

Dr. ARkin was awesome. The lectures were a little confusing becuase they are scattered, but you can still get all the info from them. I would strongly recommend going to class and without a doubt put a lot of effort in the paper. He spends a lot of time disussing it, so he is looking for good work.

Great guy. Confusing at first but if you go to class and study it isn't bad. Put work into your paper, go to office hours, and show improvement and you'll be fine. I got a 78, 86, and 97 on the exams and got an A in the class. He really cares about teaching and while he does go on tangents, it makes it interesting.  Just show up, read, and study.

How can anyone NOT like Arkin? Arkin has been the best professor I've had at OSU and the most helpful. I have never heard him "soapbox" about anything. Sounds like someone is bitter about doing poorly. Easy tests (assuming you GO TO CLASS and DO HW) and a friendly class atmosphere conductive to learning. I would def recommend Arkin for this class.

Arkin is great! He seems to really care about his students and is cheerful and friendly. There were well over 100 people in my class and he was still willing to edit everyone's paper prior to turn-in. I like his grading, too: he curves & gave me an A+ on a paper I probably did not deserve. I learned so much more because I didn't stress about grades

Miserable class. Course material is dry at best, and Arkin is insufferable. I am clueless as to why this is a required course for IS majors. Take this only if you want to hear someone soapbox about their political agenda, tenure, and family for two hours a day twice a week. Just awful.

He LOVES what he teaches and it really comes across in his lectures. If you are engaged, which it is not hard to be with him, you will do well in the class. He is very good about boosting your grade if you show improvement/work hard or the paper (2 page). Take any class he has! Awesome guy!

MOST AWFUL PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD. DO NOT take this class with him if you can avoid it. You have to read both books if you want any information at all about anything. He rants about nothing all class and tries to shove 3-4 lectures into the last class to make up for it. Tests are hard and poorly written. Bottom line he is awful.

It is striking that a tenured professor would yammer his way through a REQUIRED class as he does. MANY personal references are made during class, relating to nothing and provide no accent to the material. I do not recommend this class. I hope the department head soon replaces him as primary instructor of this course, as others and I have recommende
He tries to make things fun, sometimes it works and other times it doesn't.

He does talk a lot about his life, but it is all interesting stuff. He talks about his tenure a lot, but he is clearly joking. Very interesting guy who has been doing this for a long time. Class not really relevant for IS majors, but still very interesting class. I recommend!!

By far one of the best professors I've ever had. Sure, he rants a lot during class, but he has good ways of teaching. GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS. It helps so much. When he sees you putting a lot of effort into the class he'll take that into consideration for the final grade, especially if you've come to office hours.

Thought it would be random, but turned out to be great. Read the books, they are on the exam but not in the lecture. If you memorize the slide materials you will ace the exams. Choose a good topic for the paper, and you will get an easy A. you cant scrape by in this class. its 500 level so you need to put alot of effort in. and it will pay off.

He always randomly talks about his family and how he has tenure so he can talk about whatever he wants. It took us 4 lectures to get through the first ppt presentation. Tests are on all of the reading, not much at all from lectures. Books are interesting, but I didn't learn anything new. I also didn't learn anything about personal security.

Always late to class, yet visibly gets irritated when others come in late. Goes on 15 minute revelries about things he remembers in his own life, often coming back to lecture topics having forgotten what he was talking about. I dont know why this class is required for IS majors. 80% of material is covered in other courses most of us take.
He talks a lot about things that have nothing to do with the class, but is very nice and very friendly. This can lead to confusion come the test if you are not careful.

Awesome professor. I was tempted to drop his class after reading some of his previous ratings, but I'm glad I didn't. Sure, he goes on tangents, but they're interesting and they make you laugh. He really gets you thinking and makes coming to class enjoyable.
AWESOME IN ALL ASPECTS!

Some interesting material, dumb mandatory class for international studies majors, put in the effort on the review questions (like 300) for exams and multiple choice questions are easy, not really sure where some of the essay questions came from, easy 2 page paper.  I wouldn't take the class if I didn't have to, but you can get a B with some effort.

Very interesting and knows what he's talking about.  The material IS related to class.  Easy if you read the material!! The reading material was very interesting and sucks you in. Rewards those who attend class. Easy to relate to in everyday life. I recommend!
Great Prof.  Interesting lectures

Pretty cool teacher.  Pretty laid back and all.  He just talks a lot as others say but I thought it made it easier to deal with the class rather than him just standing and lecturing to us.  His papers were pretty tame as well as whatever homework I recall him having us do.

very interesting class!! You actually wanted to come to class and listen to what he had to say.  It was a hard class but kept your interest.  There was a lot thinking and input involved.  I would love to take this class again if I could.
The reading material was very interesting, tests were pretty easy if you read the material, Arkin was interesting and I actually stayed awake in his class!

He lectures like a Baptist preacher and I think he enjoys listening to himself talk. His exams are really tricky for being a self explanatory class. I would say he's not the best teacher I've had but not the worst
Arkin is insufferably arrogant. Sitting through class is a real challenge. Avoid, for your own sanity.

Like others have said, very disorganized. We usually wasted atleast a half hour at the beginning of every class. Bounced around a lot and most of the required reading was unrelated to the class. Tests were fair, but overall Arkin wasn't great. Review sessions were a help because he'd basically tell you the essay questions.

Totally unorganized.  Didn't even have the reading assignment planned out until about Week 6 of the quarter!  Always goes of on tangents which are totally unrelated to the class.  Readings and lectures are totally unrelated.  Tries to be funny, but just comes off as annoying and arrogant.  Tests mostly made up of student submitted questions.
Likes to go off on tangents.  Really get back what you put in.  I studies my ass off, but got an A.  rewarding in its own right, but I would advise to choose another class that isn't as much work.

First time this course was offered, I think he did great considering.  The reading was difficult, and lecture material not always related.  You definatly get back based on the work that you put in.  Prof was kind and made great effort to be helpful whenever possible.
Tends to go off on tangents and the lectures are unrelated to the textbooks.  Hard to take notes.  He's a nice, fun guy but it's hard to know what material is important.

Interesting class and reading materials, tangents anecdotal,the TA taught the material way better, has subtle insensitivity to issues that effect women and doesn't see need to cover gender at all, unless to joke or deride, women writers not only opposition to Freud's **** envy theory.

has a policy of not teaching the books that he assigns, so you have no idea of what to study for. at the end of a 2 hr lecure, you will have 3 things written on your paper as being important.  class takes forever to get rolling and gets out early.  Waste of my time...avoid, avoid, avoid

Great guy, absolutely hilarious.  Definitely hard to  take notes in class but his lectures definitely stick with you.  if you put forth the effort, you got the grade you deserved.  Always willing to help out.  It is a privilege to learn from a guy like Ark.

Very funny! Interesting, does go off on tangents but not so hard to follow if you just pay attention. Tests were kind of hard to study for but fair. Very helpful if you just go talk to him. Great guy to know both in and out of class.
he knows his stuff in social psychology...not very organized, but gets the job done...i learned a lot and laughed a lot
Knows his stuff! Fun class!

A big-wig in the field of psych and a good guy to have on your side.  Challenges you, but I got an A in his class because he made it so interesting.  If you pay attention, you'll learn a lot from this guy in and outside of class.
Nice guy, but goes off on tangents...very hard to take notes from.  Hard to listen to for 2 hours...tests have nothing to do with the yammering in lecture.
Fun professor!
Best teacher at OSU
Very difficult tests but interesting lectures.  Tough class.  He is unorganized and hard to follow at times.
His humor gets you through the two hours!

summary_comment: Zach is highly regarded for his friendly and enthusiastic approach, making lectures engaging and the subject matter more interesting. While his exams require thorough preparation and note-taking, students find his classes valuable and enjoyable. His assignments, particularly the initial paper, help build essential skills, and attendance is recommended for a comprehensive understanding of the material.

Ratings.comment: Zach is super friendly and nice! This is the first psych class I've taken that I've had a teacher that actually makes lectures interesting. The papers are hard, but they get easier as you continue writing. Midterms and Finals are written which makes them harder but if you understand the concepts you will be fine. You do have to study and prepare

He is super friendly and lso enthusiastic about the topic, which helps make it more interesting. The lectures aren't too long but you need to take notes because the lecture slides aren't very informative. There is one paper at the start of the semester, and he makes the tests so I would recommend going to lecture to get a good understanding.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and clear explanations, making complex psychological concepts accessible and engaging. She is known for her approachable demeanor and willingness to help students, though some find the course covers a lot of material quickly. Overall, students strongly recommend her classes and find them valuable and enjoyable.

Ratings.comment: Amazing teacher. She's very down to earth, makes learning psychology so easy. Helps students prepare for midterms.

She was an amazing teacher! I love psychology and I'm even more interested in it now apter taking her class. Very clear and helpful, no pop quizzes, very sweet, easily understand, great concepts and examples :) I highly recommend you take this class :) its well worth it
I took her at Spokane Falls and I would not recommend anyone take this class. Too much information for this introductory course.  Great person

Great introductory class!  Sparked my interest even more.  Explanations were great, no pop quizzes, clear voice and notes!  Please take this class!  I did not read but maybe 1 or 2 chapters for extra understanding, no homework, pretty fair class!  Tests are very conceptual with few straight definition questions, so make sure you understand concepts
The easiest class I have taken & one of the best TA's I have had. She explained concepts thoroughly & made them easy to understand. She does a wonderful job at giving examples for the vocabulary.
Very helpful, makes class interesting, no pop quizzes.

Very nice TA to get. Always willing to help.  She explains the material very clearly, and only goes over stuff that will be tested.  Moves at a very fast pace, but is willing to slow down if you need her to.  Definately try to take her!!!!
Very nice and informative, always willing to help.  Really enjoyed the class and she was never boring to watch, even at 9 am.  Would love to have her again.
Really helped me understand the inner workings of the mind and psyche.  Thanks.
No Comments
HOT, HOT, HOT!!!
She was a very nice teacher, went at a pace the class could follow, helped me with anything I had trouble with, definitely take her for psych 100 if you can
i didnt go to class much but i wish i would have because she is hot!!

summary_comment: Kristie is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for her clear teaching style, thorough slide presentations, and application of real-world examples to enhance understanding. Students appreciate her supportive approach, including extra credit opportunities, review sessions, and easy grading as long as the work is completed. She is described as kind, understanding, and genuinely passionate about psychology, making her classes both engaging and memorable.

Ratings.comment: Kristie is so kind and careful. It is so great to take her class.

Kristie is by far the best professor I've had at OSU. Her slideshows are thorough and she provides ample real life examples to help students better understand the concepts. There are plenty of opportunities for extra credit and she holds review sessions before the exam that are really helpful because the practice questions are like the exam.

I LOVE Kristie! As long as you go to class and get the notes you're fine! Mostly memorization of material. I know she helps make the exams so this is a plus. Very nice and easy to approach. Definitely recommend! Attendance not mandatory but there are pop quizzes (easy) and only way to get notes.

Teaches so clearly and makes lectures interesting. Applies material to real world examples and is a very nice and understanding professor. Easy Grader as long as you complete the work. Genuinely loves psychology and cares about her students. I would definitely recommend.

summary_comment: The professor is generally viewed as approachable and enthusiastic about her subject, making her lectures engaging and focused on conceptual understanding rather than rote memorization. However, students note that her grading can be stringent, and tests may be less aligned with the lectures, requiring significant self-study. Reviews are mixed, with some finding the class manageable and others criticizing her lack of preparation and support during exams.

Ratings.comment: Unsure why she has so many bad reviews, her class was one of the easiest 4000-levels I've taken. Laura's a fun person who loves what she does, and her class is about learning concepts and thinking for yourself, not spitting up rote facts. So maybe if you're a memorize-the-study-guide-for-the-test type, she'd be bad for you?

Lecture is interesting, she makes it very clear what is important to know from the readings/powerpoints. On the tests, however, it's a bit more/ a lot more confusing. She doesn't give study guides or anything, so you're basically forced to memorize. She doesn't always make it clear on tests/homework assignments exactly what she's asking for.

Class was professor's specialization and she was very enthusiastic about it, yet did a good job at presenting things from multiple perspectives without bias. She is also approachable, helpful, and accommodating of circumstances. She can be a tough grader, but if you need help or an extension she is more than willing to accommodate you.

Class wasn't too hard and she puts lectures online so you can print them out. There are quite a few homeworks but they are mostly easy and you get 2 tries on them, so they just boost your grade since the only others are the 2 midterms and a final.
She doesn't show up to exams and it comes off as though she has very little interest in teaching. Tests have little to do with lectures and can be tricky
She is very arrogant and does not want to help students... avoid her!!
this class was horrible. we didnt even use the book in class and all she talked about was her beloved lab. i wouldnt recommend her as a teacher to anyone.

She was a HORRIBLE teacher. Gave no notes compared to the text that was covered. No study guide. The class was based on three exams and the extra credit was a joke. She was lazy; that's why we didn't have a study guide AND she never even bothered to show up to give her own exams. I think she needs to be limited to the lab, what she cares about.

I liked Prof. Wagner's class. Her lecture notes were on Carmen and matched the book. Exams questions could be a little tricky, but she gave opportunities for extra credit points. I would recommend Psych550 with her.
Good teacher. Easy class, didn't use the book at all, but really good information.
A really great, interesting class.
Wagner is the best.  I really loved this course.  She is a great teacher and I really learned a lot.

This class is NOT hard.  One midterm, three one page assignments, 40% final.  Go to class, skim the book, notes online.  She is easy to listen to and presents the material in an interesting way.  Easier than some of my GECs.  Would highly recommend.

This class is NOT hard.  One midterm, three one page assignments, 40% final.  Go to class, skim the book, notes online.  She is easy to listen to and presents the material in an interesting way.  Easier than some of my GECs.  Would highly recommend.

This class was interesting but I just couldn't stay awake a lot of the time. Anyway, teacher does a good job of explaining concepts and trying to get you to understand the big pictures. Multiple choice tests with couple essays makes for a reasonably easy class if you come and pay attention. She also offered extra credit which was nice.
she was hard. the tests were even harder. the material was interesting but test material hard. lots of reading and testing on book material. did not like the teacher either.

Maybe I took this class too early in my college career, who knows. Even though I was greatly interested in the subject matter, I got something like 60, 67, 66 on the two midterms and final, which constitute 100% of the grade. Class is actually interesting, but the multiple choice is really, really difficult. Actually made me change my major!
No Comments
No Comments

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Applied Psychology: Human Behavior in the Wild

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Cognitive and Developmental Bases of Behavior

summary_comment: This professor is highly recommended for her clarity and engaging teaching style, though her lectures can be fast-paced. She provides comprehensive class notes on Carmen that are easy to study from, and she keeps students engaged with real-life examples and extra credit opportunities. However, some students find her tests challenging due to the wording of questions.

Ratings.comment: Liz was very clear and concise. Her tests were a little hard to study for because of the wording of the questions, but she is quick to respond to any inquiries and very helpful. I recommend her highly.

This class wasn't too horrible. But it wasn't great either. She goes through the lectures VERY FAST. Her exams are pretty straight forward but since there is so much information on them usually people don't do too well. It's a pretty average class. There wasn't anything about the class or teaching that made me excited to go, by any means...

She gives class note on Carmen that are 30% filled in. You don't need to go to class if you fill in the outline and study it because that is all that is on the test. I had her for a 2 hour 18 minute lecture and it was long but she kept the class pretty interesting for the most part. Class is helpful if you can stand to stay interested. Nice GTA
She did a great job keeping my attention and teaching the course.

She is really helpful, the notes she puts on Carmen are awesome...easy to study from, and you don't have to write a lot. If you go to lecture, you don't really need to read the book. I HIGHLY recommend her! She also gives extra credit assignments for every quiz. And puts up multiple-choice practice tests for midterm and finals

Probably the best professor I have had so far. She was always really prepared for class and knew so much about the subject (and when she didn't know, she would look it up for us and talk about it  the next class). She made the class really interesting, showing video clips and providing lots of real life examples to help us understand. Recommended!

summary_comment: Christine is highly regarded for her ability to explain complex material clearly, but her assessment method, consisting of just two exams with ten essay questions each, has been criticized for being overly strict and limiting in evaluating students' understanding. This approach has led to significant dissatisfaction among a third of the class, with many students seeking to file grievances with the department.

Ratings.comment: Christine was great at explaining the material she covered in class, but the class (WI12) only had 2 exams w/ 10 essay questions where she was VERY strict on grading. Of all the material we covered in the quarter, it was tough to show what we learned in 20 total questions. About 1/3 of the class is trying to file a grievance through the department.

summary_comment: The professor is known for being either extremely helpful through ample extra credit opportunities or a boring lecturer who struggles to keep students engaged. Students appreciate her willingness to assist and her comprehensive slide-based teaching method, but some find her classes challenging and uninteresting, particularly if they don't actively participate.

Ratings.comment: she's a very boring lecturer, so i found it hard to pay attention..but she offers a TON of extra credit which helped me pass the class.
She's fun and quirky. Typical quirky nerd girl. She's relatively well versed on the subject and is very willing to help. Hardly EVER opened the book. I'll prolly lightly use it for finals.

Didn't do well in the last 2 exams but still got an A.. due to the awesome extra credit. She might not have tons of jokes to entertain you, but if you really listen, the class is actually interesting. she is very nice and helpful too. the exam are not super easy, but read the slides, you will be fine.

Even though the class was super easy, especially with all the extra credit, I hated every single minute of it.  She's a boring lecturer and goes on and on about the easiest and most self explanatory concepts.
If you are not a psychology major there is NO point in taking this class. The tests are HARD and badly worded. I'm dissapointed on how little I learned from this class.
3 tests, 5 pop quizzes (1 dropped), so many extra credit opportunities. never read the book and i still got a B+. everything is off her slides. shes really nice and fair. loved her class.
I relied solely on the lectures and pulled an A-. She just got her master's, but she is a really good teacher. Very hot too!
She was extremely friendly, interested in the material, knowledgeable and was always willing to help her students. I had her in abnormal psych and I hope to have Laren for another psych course!
No Comments

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for their exceptional teaching quality, delivering clear and comprehensive lectures along with detailed notes. Students find the class manageable and rewarding, with opportunities for extra credit and straightforward quizzes that can be easily prepared for through simple note-taking.

Ratings.comment: Fantastic class! The best Pysch teacher at OSU!! Great notes and great lectures!

Great teacher really easy and quizzes are easy as well. Gives extra credit on quizzes to bring up scores. Not hard at all and class is mandatory just make note cards over definitions and you should get an A.

summary_comment: Cooper is widely regarded as an exceptional teacher, known for making classes engaging, humorous, and easy to follow. Students appreciate his passion for the subject, his ability to relate to them, and his willingness to help, often learning his students' names. His lectures are well-prepared, consistent with exams, and supplemented by extra credit opportunities that enhance understanding and performance.

Ratings.comment: Cooper is an AMAZING teacher. Keeps the class interesting and funny. He's a grad student so he can relate to students. Extra credit takes less than an hour total. Midterms follow about 90% from notes given. Also a short paper but it is beyond easy. Take this class if you can, it is worth it and I learned a lot. Easy A if you study.

He's hilarious! & really nice, he helped me find psych research  clinics & learned everyone in class by name. also, he's an amazing lecturer bc he's passionate, clear, answers questions and has discussions. I found the material & tests kinda hard bc I didn't take Psych 100, but all the extra credit really helped me make up
One of the best teachers around. Really helpful and has a passion for what he does.

Cooper is a great professor.  He really makes the class interesting, and his exams are very consistent with his lectures.  The book is helpful, but you could probably get by with just the slides.  Definitely take his section.

Pretty easy class, attendance not mandatory but random participation assignments are even throughout quarter. He really has a passion for the material and keeps you entertained while teaching. One of the only classes I have looked forward to going to. Class requirements are 2 MT, a final and a small paper. Extra credit for discussion boards too.
Best teacher! I love his jokes about Canada.. and he is always willing to help you. Take AC!

I though that Cooper was an awesome teacher.  He had all his powerpoint lectures online and was prepared for class everytime.  He has a great sense of humor and really cares about his students.  (He learned each of us by name!)  He is a great teacher and I encourage anyone who has the chance to take him.  It is a great relatively easy course.

I, being a movie lover, really enjoyed the way he related almost every concept in Psych100 to a memorable movie character.  Even if you're not into movies, this approach puts an ambiguous, conceptual subject into perspective.  It also doesn't hurt that he's absolutely hilarious.  I actually looked forward to this class, even on friday, no lie!

I'm extremely lucky to have had cooper as my prof. He explained things well, had interesting lectures (that kept me awake), and was always available if help was needed. He goes above and beyond most expectations I have for a teacher and recommend him to everyone! Seriously, take his class!
Awesome teacher! Take him if you have to take Psych 100. Hilarious and really good teacher.
FUNNY. have to take a lot of notes, as you do with every professor. he would be my top pick over the other professors easy.
One of the funniest teachers I've ever had! I found my self chuckling every class. This guy will work with you one on one if you need it and is helpful@

summary_comment: Dr. Smith is widely regarded as an effective and approachable instructor who provides ample opportunities for extra credit and lenient grading criteria. While some find his lectures occasionally boring, most students appreciate his availability during office hours and the straightforward nature of the class, which is generally easy and offers a path to earning good grades with consistent effort. However, the class requires a significant amount of daily work and can be demanding, particularly for those with heavy schedules.

Ratings.comment: Good instructor. Class is very easy and Dr. Smith gives plenty of opportunities to miss work and extra credit. Overall good instructor

Professor Smith is a really good professor and he will always be there for you. Visit him during his office hours, he is extremely helpful! His lecture can be boring sometimes but overall his grading rubrics is very reasonable. I would recommend him!

Very easy A. Online quizzes (which you will see again on exams) daily learning activities which are annoying but easy points. Exams 12 mc 12 written. Overall a normal class, not horriblenot great, but nice not having to study a bunch.

The class was very easy. Yes there were daily activities but they contribute a good portion of your grade and they are simple assignments. Opportunities to do extra credit. Tests were fair but sometimes lecture was long. If you skip class on a regular basis, don't take this class.

Really glad I had this lecturer. You do have to go to class because there is an in-class assignment nearly everyday, but it's easy points. Online quizzes have unlimited tries, and the multiple choice questions from the quizzes appear on the exams literally WORD FOR WORD. He is bad at responding to emails which is the only bad thing about his class.

There are a ton of assignments in this class! There are daily attendance activities, questions that you have to submit, a huge paper based on a book you read (but it goes step by step), and weekly quizzes. If you do all of these, you will get an A. There are also opportunities for extra credit. Do not take this course if you are taking 18 cred hour

Material is easy, but you have to jump through a lot of hoops.  Bunch of work, and stupid daily assignments that get graded.  Daily assignments are essentially just busy work and don't contribute to your learning at all.  Don't expect a quick reply from this professor (if you even get one at all).

Doesn't seem to really care about the class and can sometimes confuse himself in the middle of the lecture, but it's an easy class and the subject material with him isn't bad. Just definitely read the textbook.

These reviews belo me are a bit unrealistic. When all is said and done, Psych 3312 is an incredibly easy class. 20% of your grade is in class activities! which when missed! Professor Smith allowed me to make up during his office hours which was quite helpful. The Carmen quizzes are a joke and can be retaken until you get 100% on all of them.

Doesn't respond to emails. Attendance is mandatory because each class you do an experiment that counts toward your grade. You make the questions for your quizzes - the quizzes are awful because so many of the questions are downright wrong or so poorly written that you can't understand them. You'll have to take them many times. He's nice just lazy.

Easy class troy smith is just very boring hard to stay awake in his class. Took two weeks to reply to my email. Did not get my first exam essay back until after the second exam. Just a really boring teacher.

Honestly a terrible professor. He will change due dates for assignments, be disrespectful to students and you won't be getting your exams back until about a month or two after you take it. The class is mindless dribble and is really uninteresting. Do yourself a favor and do NOT take this class.

This guy is by far the worst professor I've ever had. Straight up disrespectful to students, sets ridiculous time parameters for assignments, never responds to emails, gets 1st exam grades back to you AFTER you've taken exam 2,the class material is mindless nonsense, and he's extremely insensitive to students. Never take a class with him.

Just awful. Know's what he is talking about, but cannot teach. He spends 1/3 of the class time talking about nothing, and doesn't get back to students e-mails. Unclear when teaching and unwilling to help students in need. Only interested in the research he does at the university. Don't take a class with him if you don't have to.

summary_comment: Dr. Bruno is widely regarded as an exceptional lecturer who deeply engages students with his passion for neuroscience. His classes are challenging but rewarding, fostering genuine learning rather than mere memorization. While his lectures can sometimes veer off-topic, he generally returns to the main points and offers thorough explanations when needed. However, his availability outside of class is limited, and some students find his tests particularly difficult due to their complexity.

Ratings.comment: Bruno is a smart guy but he's kinda losing it at times. He can become hard to follow as he drifts off topic.  He usually catches himself.  He shakes a lot and is clearly trying hard to compensate.

Is very clear in his lectures.  Does not provide "notes", so must attend class if you want to do well.  Very passionate about the subject and wants his students to be.  Usually willing to offer help or re-explain something, unless your question is too dumb.  Tests are difficult, but if you attend class there are no surprises.

Dr. Bruno is a great lecturer. His exams can be tough but you at least feel like you are learning something in that class instead of just regurgitating information like you have to do for most classes. If you actually want to learn neuroscience then take this class.
best lecturer I've ever had.

He's one of the best teachers for neuroscience. He's a great lecturer. One bad thing about the class is that there is not enough points in the class. If you don't attend lecture, you'll probably fair. Be warned, his exam questions can be convoluted.

This guy is in need of an honest review. No doubt, he is a great lecturer but he is never available. I'm pretty sure his office hours don't meet the university's minimum requirements. The class structure is inherently flawed as it is only out of 80 points. His mult. choice questions aren't hard, they're merely convoluted. Most over rated professor.

Best professor I've had at OSU, very helpful and approachable and great sense of humor. Tests are near impossible, he expects you to think on the level of grad students, which is not unreasonable for a high level course, but still takes you off guard.

I had Professor Bruno for Psych 501 and H613.  He is a phenomenal professor and his lectures are awesome (I hated missing his class).  His courses are definitely no cake walk, but you can really learn a lot from him.  He is also very fair with grades and will say that he prefers to reward people for taking hard classes (like his).

He doesn't take attendance, but it is impossible to do well without attending lecture. If you attend lecture, pay attention, take good notes, and study hard you can do well.  This isn't an easy class and not really psychology. It's studying the advanced physiology and neuroscience of the human brain and neurological disorders. Loved it and the prof

He is a great teacher and you will learn a lot.  However, it is an EXTREMELY difficult class.  I took it while taking 24 credit hours and I simply didn't have the time to do well in the course.  Only take it if you have LOTS of time to dedicate to the class.  Also, he doesn't require attendance, but you have to go to pass.

Had him for 501 and H613. Very hard courses, but if you are good at integrating information, getting the "big picture" and knowing the details he emphasizes, you can pull off an A. It takes a lot of effort though. TONS of reading for 613. I recommend him, even if it slashes your GPA!

His class is pretty hard, especially if you are a psychology major. It is not as difficult if you have a biology background, but still watch out for his multiple choice questions! But he is an extremely engaging teaching and loves what he is talking about. I would highly recommend his course. He is very approachable and pretty cool dude.

This class was too difficult; I am not sure that he realized it was a GEC and not an upper lever Neuro-biology class!  Class seemed interesting but for the same amount of work I put in to getting As in other classes I was getting a D in this one.

Fabulous teacher.  SO difficult, but made my whole experience at OSU worth it.  He will challenge you to your limits.  He seems curt sometimes, but he is really nice, just not the best at expressing it.  Be prepared to be called on in class to answer impossible questions. Don't take his classes if you aren't willing to work your butt off for an A!

Multiple choice exams VERY difficult. An awesome class none the less. I learned a lot. He once said that even if you get a C in his class you will know more than the average layman about PD and AD, and he's right.
Wonderful professor.  Very informative.  His multiple choice tests are extremely hard, but you learn so much.

Dr. Bruno is very tough, no doubt about that.  But, you can learn A LOT from him.  His multiple choice exams are infamous for their difficulty, but if you go to his office hours, he'll point you in the right direction.
Not only a passionate and challenging teacher, but an awesome person too.  Helpful in and out of the classroom.
Excellent teacher, brilliant person. he expects a lot but he is very helpful to anyone who really wants to learn
he expects a lot out of you, but in a good way

summary_comment: Christina is highly regarded for making her Psych 1100 lectures engaging and informative, often using videos and clear examples. Students find the class manageable with consistent note-taking and attendance, though they note a significant amount of material to memorize. She is praised for her approachable nature, willingness to help, and the potential benefits of completing extra credit assignments.

Ratings.comment: Psych 1100 isn't generally considered a hard class, but I did better than my friends who had other profs. Christina goes over a lot of material, but for midterms just study your notes. The final however I am pretty sure was made by all the psych 1100 profs so some material we didn't cover was on there.  And do the REP extra credit, it helps so much

Took her class over the summer; she made the material interesting and engaging with videos and examples that are pretty intriguing.  The class is pretty easy if you take notes and attend lecture, but it is a lot of memorization.  You'll get what you put into it.

Her lectures are so interesting!!! She always shows videos and give clear examples of the situations you're going over in class. The tests are straight from the lectures. However, there's a lot of information thrown at you so be prepared to have to know a lot for each test.

Took her Intro to Psychology over summer and she was GREAT. I actually looked forward to going to class. She has interesting lectures and tries to make class fun by showing interesting videos! She will help, and met with me to go over missed test questions. Give extra credit, and she's super adorable! Take her class!!

summary_comment: Professor Kelsey is an effective and engaging instructor who covers a vast amount of material, using real-life examples and videos to enhance understanding. She is highly accessible, willing to discuss topics further both in and out of class, and her teaching style is complemented by her sweet voice. Professor Bush, as another strong educator, significantly transformed students' perspectives and is noted for her attractiveness.

Ratings.comment: Lots of material to cover in this class. Lots. Tests were pretty difficult for me because of this, so I didn't do super well on them, but I know that's not Kelsey's fault. She often includes real life examples of things relating to psych and uses videos which help a lot. She's always willing to talk after class, too. And she's just so cute.

She is a very amazing teacher, who always use vivid example in class to explain the concept on test book. She gives guide note before class. However, she does not allow us to take pictures of her slide in class and do not put her slide on carmen.  She is always ready to help her student in class or outside class. BTW, her voice is very sweet.
Professor Bush was the most transformational teacher of my undergraduate career. She inspired me and is HOTTTT

summary_comment: The professor's classes are generally considered easy with accessible online resources, but many students found the lectures and material unengaging, leading to poor retention and performance unless supplemented with independent study. Students appreciated the convenience of online notes and quizzes but often felt the class lacked depth, resulting in a negative impact on their interest in the subject.

Ratings.comment: The class was pretty easy, but his lectures were really boring.  You need to study for exams.  If you have the chance to take Psych 1100 with another professor, I recommend that.  i loved psychology before I took this class, then came out of this class really disliking psychology.

Fairly easy GEC class. Professor was nice but there were multiple times that he emailed us canceling class right when it should have started. He also canceled the final review session 5 minutes before it should have started. So I don't think I did as well as I could have in this class, but it was interesting.
The class is super easy, but it's hard to say engaged in the class, but sometimes it is interesting. Study for the exams.

Very easy GEC class!class used laptop/iPad during class. lectures powerpoint available online. assignments included a small # of online quizzes, 2 tiny papers, and REP hours(participating in psych "experiments" or write more papers(one or other)REP's were interesting. Used vids and fun examples to make info clear. Overall interesting intro class
He gave notes online for every lecture so it was not necessary to attend class. He gave short, very easy, 5 question quizzes at the beginning over every other class. Good teacher.

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as either excellent or terrible, depending on the student. Some find her class engaging and her teaching style effective, praising her interest in making the subject matter interesting and providing well-curved exams. Others, however, express extreme frustration with her grading practices, late feedback, and unresponsive communication, describing her class as one of the worst they have experienced.

Ratings.comment: I've never been so frustrated by a professor in all of my life. She is the kind of prof that likes to give bad grades because she is in charge, it's only a power trip for her. She doesn't grade anything in a timely manor and she does not even let you know what you missed on papers that she graded. Don't bother trying to contact her, she won't reply
Great class but even better instructor!
worst class ever.  boring.
I hate it, learned nothing.

Dr. Rumble is an excellent teacher. She makes this class very interesting. The paper assignments are not bad at all and the topics covered on them are great. This class is highly recommended. The exams are all essay but she curves everything. great teacher.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is widely criticized, with students finding lectures unclear and directions for assignments vague, leading to confusion and frustration. Despite offering extra credit opportunities, many students feel the grading system is arbitrary and unhelpful. Overall, the class is described as difficult and unengaging, with some finding it one of the worst they have ever taken.

Ratings.comment: No rubrics are given for papers or assignments and lectures are very unclear. Do not expect any clarity or meaningful communication, you are on your own. She offers a good amount of extra credit, so pulling an A isn't too hard.

I'm baffled by other reviews.  This class is one of the easiest A's I've ever had.  Exams are super straightforward and you only have to write a few short papers.  Sure the lecture notes are incomprehensible on their own but Dr. McKoon is plenty clear during class.  Paper grading is also a little arbitrary, but bonus assignment makes up for this.

Majority of the final was related to memory/priming etc., rather than what we were supposed to learn; research methods! As a senior psych student, this is one of the worst classes I've attended in my academic career. Away like the plague as they say.

Worst class/professor i have ever had in my college career. Grading scale is out of no where. Little to know feed back to even know why you are being deducted points. Late assignment returns which leads to repeaqted mistakes. Generaly she seems as though she doesnt care at all. Aviod this professor if possible.
Unclear directions and whimsical grading system. Assignment instructions do not match how they are graded.

This class is by far one of the worst classes I have ever taken!!! Like the comment below she will make you turn in assignments before getting the prior assignment back so you are unable to change the mistakes for the next assignment. Her tests include information that is clearly irrelevant to the material!!!!

Lectures were incomprehensible, but you better take notes to do well on the exam. She waits until you have done your second paper before handing back the first, so the same mistakes are made. She turned what should have been an easy A into a class you have to struggle in. Eventually she decided to give extra extra credit, which may redeem my grade.

Avoid this class at all costs. It is the most boring and useless class I have ever taken. While the class isnt super hard, she jumps around the entire lecture and hands out notes that mean nothing making class basically mandatory. Lab isnt bad though, always get out in like an hour. Avoid taking if not required, not interesting at all.

The exams are very difficult to study for. In lecture she skips around so much it is hard to stay awake and follow what she is saying. The TA would tell us things opposite to what Dr. McKoon said. Neither were that helpful. I would stay away from this class unless you enjoy being stressed and have to. I still received an A after a huge huge curve.

Going to class is crucial other other wise the notes she gives mean nothing. She likes for people to do well so she alters the grading scale. For lab we never spent the whole time only an hr at the most.

summary_comment: Jackie's teaching quality varies significantly according to student feedback. Some students find her highly effective, noting her responsiveness, organization, and ability to make the material engaging and relevant. However, others report that her class was largely unhelpful and disorganized, with too much busy work and insufficient support for understanding the material. Overall, while some appreciate her teaching style and efforts, many find the class experience frustrating and not particularly beneficial.

Ratings.comment: Jackie did not answer questions clearly, was not helpful in classes, did not allow enough time for in-class assignments, was impatient when students needed help, was unorganized, and overall the class was horrible. I am SOOO glad that she is not my advisor and that I will be done with this class in a few weeks.

Jackie did not help me when I asked for it. She is not smart with electronics and is not prepared for class. She is funny however, but it gets annoying. The class to me is pointless in itself but it is mandatory. There are group projects and meaningless lectures. She does have you plan what classes you'll be taking all 4 years which is helpful.
She's really nice, but the online section was full of busy work, and it was a nuisance. She put a lot of videos up that you had to watch which sucked. I wouldn't recommend the online section.
Jackie is great teacher! She always responds quickly to questions and gives great examples and really helps students out with understandings.
She had great examples in class and very organized in her lectures. The lectures math the exams very well and all the exams were online. Highly recommend.
She loves teaching and gives great examples in class to help relate material to the real world. All exams are online, and there are a few papers to write.

I took this class online...and don't recommend doing that with this class.  Jackie was great at keeping my attention, however, I found it difficult to "get" what she felt was important enough to be on the midterm and final.

Jackie is wonderful she makes class interesting. There is a lot of work/papers. All exams are online. Jackie allows you to get to know her by offering activities outside the classroom. She's very funny and easy to approach. I would recommend her for psych 340!

I missed about 2 lectures, but they were definitely not boring! She is enthusiastic about the material and very helpful if needed for the papers. The exams were fair-about 1/2 from the book and 1/2 from lecture notes.

Im really going against the grain, but I thought she was horrible & I got an A. I learned almost nothing. Exams were open book, if they werent youd never know the answers she wanted, & I read & went to class. Tests are online & often have flawed questions, but you get no points back. Many assignments out of class too, including a 10-15 page paper.

This class was awesome. Lectures were optional, but there was extra credit for going on days that were low attendance. Exams are open note/open book. 2 papers, (3 pages and 10-15) Great class, competent instructor, quick to answer emails, but takes a while to grade things.
Loved this prof. Her lectures were so interesting and fun. Her test were all multiple choice and very easy. She gives outlines of the notes and that is all you have to study.
She was very helpful and interesting. She related everything to real life. The material was easy as long as you study the notes and attend every lecture. The book is not necessary.
This class was boring and kind of useless. She highly recommended getting the book, but definitely did not need it.

Jackie truly made Life Span Development fun.  She would always get through the material, but would present it in a unique and exciting way that made is accessible, and relatable.  Exams not too difficult, but do test more on compression as opposed to simple memorization of definitions.  Not the greatest at returning emails, so talk to her in class.

Jackie was amazing! I loved this class! She makes class very easy as long as you go and take notes. Any question you had she would answer and if she couldn't do it right there she would get back with you. She is highly entertaining and I always left the class laughing at something!

She is an amazing teacher, she truly knows her stuff and if she doesn't know the answer to a question she makes note of it and will look it up after class for you.  She really encourages her students to think critically. Tests not too hard, not too easy, they really do test your comprehension not your ability to memorize definitions. Take her class

She was great! Made class interesting and used good examples. Fairly easy tests, easy papers, no need to read the book really. She also puts a note guide up before class to print, which makes note-taking sooo easy!
She was one of the first professors I had when I started my Freshmen year and she was great! I understood her teachings and was able to pass with an A.

I really enjoyed having Jackie as an instructor. She brought in a lot of guest speakers to talk about the disorders we were studying and she made everything really easy and consistent. She's EXTREMELY hard to get a hold of; you pretty much have to talk to her boss to get some contact. Lectures and readings are very important too.

Wow!!! Can u say AWESOME teacher!!! her lectures were fun and very interactive...definately would take it again if i could. A lot of terms, and review them just before the exams and u'll be fine... Great start to freshman year!!!
Really knew what she was talking about. Very candid and gave a lot of examples. Exams were relatively easy? Definitely do the extra credit!

EASY and mildly entertaining. 3 non-cumulative exams, 5 papers (3 are extra credit) are a joke and I'm convinced she doesn't read any of them. Last 3rd of the class is pure common sense, if you've ever had parents or friends, you're good.  and email? unless she's replying to let you know she got the paper you sent her, don't hold your breath.

loved this class! jackie is so much fun and she's clearly enjoys teaching this stuff, even if it does get a little boring sometimes. one thing though - she's ridiculously slow about posting grades and if you email her with a question, don't expect an answer. she NEVER EVER EVER EVER EVER responds to emails. otherwise, great person and great class.
Funny prof. Easy to understand, keeps information very basic. Multiple choice tests of pretty easy questions. If you took Psych 100 it will be a breeze.

She amazing! I had her for Psych 100 and 340.  She is a great teacher, posts notes to print off before class, and makes all of the topics so interesting.  Attendance is not mandatory, and the book is helpful but not completely necessary because her notes are so good. Take her whenever you can!

Even more than being an engaging teacher, she was such a sweet person! If you go to her office hours she will help you out with whatever you need. She is extremely fair in grading, and all the material she goes over in class relates to the exams! I RECOMMEND HER TO THE FULLEST!

This was definitely an easy A.  Her notes were exactly what you needed to study, the postings on Carmen were interesting to talk about so the homework wasn't painful whatsoever and she never tested us on anything we didn't go over in class.  Sometimes the class got a little boring, I still recommend taking this class if you want an easy A.
OMGOSH...She's amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I'm so glad I took her class!!!!!!!

Her class was so organized. She gives guided notes to help you narrow down what you'll need to know. She doesn't post her notes online though so you either have to go to class or get them from the book. She's not boring, fun to listen to and has good examples for things she teaches. Overall, great teacher!

Her class was so organized. She gives guided notes to help you narrow down what you'll need to know. She doesn't post her notes online though so you either have to go to class or get them from the book. She's not boring, fun to listen to and has good examples for things she teaches. Overall, great teacher!
she uses a lot of examples to help explain better- not just boring facts. she is great!

She was a little spazzy, but in a good way. she provided lots of examples to keep class fun and interesting. its an easy a if you just study the GUIDED notes she provides. so far i've used to book twice to look something up, you dont need to read it to pass the class if you plan on attending class
she was an awesome teacher, she made class fun and very interesting

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods, with students praising the clarity of her instruction and the organization of her slides. While some found the occasional attendance checks to be annoying, most enjoyed the class due to the use of engaging videos and interactive activities.

Ratings.comment: Loved the class!! Videos were very helpful and the instructor was very clear.

Her slides are very organized and make it easy to learn. Just study from them and you'll be fine. She takes attendance 10 random times a semester, which was annoying, but other than that the class is easy. She plays a lot of videos in class and does fun activities so I enjoyed it.

summary_comment: Holly Brothers and Dr. Brothers are highly regarded for their effective and engaging teaching methods, making complex material accessible and enjoyable. They are known for being approachable, knowledgeable, and genuinely invested in their students' success. Students consistently praise their clear lectures, fair testing practices, and ability to incorporate current events and pop culture into their courses.

Ratings.comment: Brothers is a great teacher. I didn't do as well as I wanted to but thats my fault. She was beyond helpful when me and the other students had questions. Doesn't trick you on exams, just make sure you study!
She is very relatable, makes the material fun. Only three grades (the exams), final grade is curved significantly. Overall, good class.

Holly was a wonderful professor! She made lectures fun to attend and she was very clear about what would be tested. Her tests were very straightforward and not designed to trick you in the slightest which is a huge plus. She made learning the material fun and easy to remember. Would take her again in a heartbeat.

Holly is an amazing professor who cares so much about her students. Her lectures were always relevant, hilarious, and engaging. It was always worth it to show up everyday. She is also super accessible outside of class and makes a great effort to really get to know her students. One of the best profs I've had at OSU!

Holly is one of the best professors I've ever had.  She is very knowledgable, down to earth, and one of the most open persons ever.  Lectures are always interesting, she incorporates relevant current events, is open to class discussion, and learns and listens to her student.  I found the material interesting to where studying wasn't a chore.

Absolutely loved this class! It was really interesting and Dr. Brothers made it even better by adding current events and pop culture. Brothers is a great professor who is super funny and cares about her students- you can tell she loves to teach! I rarely went to class, but it probably could have helped (not necessary because it's all in the slides)

Your grade is determined by three exams. She is an amazing professor and truly cares for her students. I 100 percent recommend her. Her exams are difficult but she only tests you over lecture material on her slides which are provided online. If you need to take Psych 3313 take it with her!

This is an excellent teacher. Very straight forward, teaches but then also learns from her students, very down to earth. You will not go wrong with this teacher. Sad I am not taking another course with her.

I think this was the first semester she taught this. Sometimes struggled to explain a topic or would teach it incorrectly and have to go back and correct it.  She generally knew what she was talking about and it will only get better as she teaches the class more.  Willing to give you help during office hours. Curve helps some. Loved the class

summary_comment: Dr. Hothersall is highly regarded for his passionate and engaging teaching style, which keeps students attentive through his storytelling and unique accent. Students find his exams fair and based on lecture content, making them manageable with focused preparation. While the course is challenging and not easily passed, many praise his dedication and willingness to help students understand the material.

Ratings.comment: In love with his accent.

Dr. Hothersall is amazing! He is incredibly passionate about Psychology and his passion is contagious. His wit and accent keep you engaged during lecture. He is quite a storyteller, and he treats the history of psychology as such. Exams are primarily identification, association, and essay-based, which is refreshing after taking tons of Scantrons.
not an easy A, especially when compared to other psych 100H sections. you do learn a lot though

Really nice and genuine. Although this is only my first quarter, I cannot see myself getting a better teacher that cares so much about his subject (especially the brain). Not an easy A, but just go lecture, pay close attention, and cram a lot the night before and you'll get an A.

Dr. Hothersall is a great teacher.  He will answer any of your questions and loves to teach. He can hold your attention even early in the morning.  His tests are lecture based so if you go it's a moderately easy A.

Just had to comment upon the comments: I had David Hothersall for 2 classes in the 1970's, and he was absolutely fabulous then, and by far the best teacher in the department. I'm so gratified to see he has aged like a fine wine.
Best professor I've ever had! Passionate and engaging; The best part is the stories and anecdotes he tells in class.  I'd repeat the class in a heart beat!

This guy is fantastic. He's passionate about what he's teaching and does all he can to help students become passionate as well. So helpful, very understanding, and overall a great guy. Flexible and not a super tough grader. Loved the class, it was worth getting up at 8:30 for.
Really easy and interesting class. One of the easiest honors classes to take, as long as you can keep up with the reading, you should do fine.

Dr. Hothersall was a nice British guy.  His midterms are fairly easy, although it's difficult to get a perfect due to the fill in the blank section.  Fun class, easy to understand, and if you go to lecture, easy A.  Tests are lecture based.

Put it this way: the class ran from 8:30-9:48, and everyone was there pretty much every day.  Dr. Hothersall was incredibly interesting and really helped me retain information about the subject...I was just taking it as a GEC, but now I'm considering a Psych major.  Highly recommended!

Dr. Hothersall may be the best professor I've had in college. He was extremely clear, very funny, very much willing to help, and very fair. If you keep up with the reading in the book (which is also very helpful) and study, an A is very likely.

I love his class.  He's funny and very enthusiastic about the subject matter, which makes it much more interesting.  Grade is based entirely on 2 tests, but his grading is flexible.  Also, he has a fun English accent.  Overall, great professor!  Take his class!

Dr. Hothersall definitely knows how to hold your attention at 8:00 am, he's definitely a teacher worth studying under.  Keep up with readings, pay attention to key details and know your concepts.  With a moderate amount of studying, this class isn't a tough A.

Awesome guy, extremely nice, but I did not like the class.  Discussions are interesting enough, the project is easy, but the exams suck.  They cover an enormous amount of information and it's difficult to know exactly what to study.
No Comments
Dr. Hothersall made class so fun and the assignments were not difficult at all. Has high standards, but very willing to help and explain. definitely take a class with him!
this dude is the only teacher that can hold my attention at 8 in the morning. we get alot done in class and he makes it interesting. greatest teacher i've ever had in my life.
I'm a 100% hetero guy, and this man is adorable.  He is so animated and his accent just makes you pay attention to everything he says, pretty much my favorite class to go to ever.
Great professor! He makes history of psychology so interesting with his sense of humor and his text full of stories. Tests are easy. Beautiful British Accent.
GREAT PROF.  Interesting stories, great presentations, fun assignments.  Always excited to go to lecture.  He is one of the best at OSU!
best class i've taken at osu!  tests are tough, but class is well worth the effort.  i HIGHLY recommend it.
Amuses (and educates) his students on a daily basis through his refined sense of wit. A great professor, if there ever was one.
Incredible man, incredible teacher.  He's been there for a long time because he likes being there.  He has a lot to offer, not to mention he's halarious!

He made history sooo interesting. I always came to class and looked forward to it,and I hate history.I came away with this class knowing so much about psychology's roots.This class should be a requirement psych majors.Study the notes well for tests!
Cute man!
Ditto- history was the last course I took as a grad student and was absolutely the best. He was a genuine inspiration for my teaching style, I only -wish- I could get even 1/10 as good.
Could listen to him all day...made history of psychology truly fascinating, even at 8am.
Great guy - I could listen to him read the phone book.  Has a genuine desire to help, to teach, to guide, and to positively effect.  Would love to take more classes with him.

An excellent lecturer, very enthusiastic about his topics, he's been teaching for a loooooong time, but unlike some guys, he's only gotten better. He teaches the honors section, so his tests are sorta hard, but it's still a great class with him in it ....

summary_comment: The professor is widely regarded as highly effective, with many students praising her engaging lectures, willingness to help, and responsiveness to feedback. However, some caution that exams can be challenging, particularly without consistent practice, and that the grading can be stringent, especially for assignments. Overall, while there are mixed opinions on the difficulty level, most agree that she is a caring and dedicated instructor.

Ratings.comment: It was horrible class.
I did very well on the homework, but the tests are impossible.
Took this class with Hoover and failed it--took it again with Roberts and aced it. Definitely would think twice about taking a class with Hoover.
Interesting class subjects, nice enough professor. Make sure you never forget an assignment though!! She takes off mad points for that. Try and you will get an A or B.

She can be nice and personable. But be careful when you take PSYCH 2367, the writing course for social psychology. It taught me nothing about writing. Class is structured with 5 papers (graded ridiculously harshly) and 3 written exams. Not worth the effort if you are taking this class as a GEC. Low participation points are given as well.

One of the best professors I've had! Exams are all multiple choice. Questions are a bit tricky, but she puts at least 5 extra questions on each test. Lectures were always interesting. Everything you need is in the slides. Papers were easy. About 40% of the class got an A and she's constantly looking for student feedback. I'd highly recommend her!
Easily the best teacher I have ever had. She is interested in what she is teaching and readily willing to help. She responds quickly to emails and encourages class discussion.
Great Professor and cares a lot about her students. If you're able to take her for major or GEC, then CHOOSE her!! Fairly easy class and she's one of the nicest professors you'll ever meet.
Class notes were clear and she gives great examples to make the material relatable.
Professor is easy to understand, but slips into talking to the class like they are young children defining terms like apply.
Great professor. Notes are interesting and class is fun, she is young and relates to students. Exams are multiple choice and fairly tough questions, but overall a great class

Ms. Hoover is very particular about details. It is obvious that she puts a lot of time into preparing material for the class. When it comes to papers, grading is very particular. If you take this class be prepared to spend a lot of time on the papers.

summary_comment: The professor's class is challenging, particularly with rigorous memorization for exams, which some students found difficult. While the material initially sparked interest, the high difficulty level led to a decrease in enthusiasm among students. Attendance is not mandatory but impacts exam grades, emphasizing the importance of self-study through the textbook.

Ratings.comment: This class was pretty difficult. Going into this class, I was very interested in the material that was being taught, and I enjoyed learning it throughout the semester. However, I found the exams really really hard. It was a lot of straight up memorization. Also, upon finishing this class, my interest in that area of psych had definitely decreased.
Going to class is not mandatory, but it does affect your exam grades if you don't keep up with the material. Reading the book is extremely helpful.

summary_comment: Matt is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for his fairness in grading and clear, organized presentations. Students describe him as one of the best instructors they've encountered, praising his ability to make classes engaging and fostering independent thinking. He is strongly recommended by multiple students.

Ratings.comment: Matt is an awesome professor! I don't think he's teaching this class anymore unfortunately. Very fair in grading and very straightforward and organized in his presentations and exams. Definitely recommended.
Matt is one of the best instructors I've had at OSU! Made class extremely fun! Encouraged independent thinking and was always there to help. HIGHLY RECOMMEND taking his class :)

summary_comment: Alison is perceived as a stern and unforgiving instructor who often lectures in a manner that feels dismissive and unapproachable, despite being younger. While some students found her explanations clear and appreciated her thoroughness, many complained about her fast pace, frequent use of filler words, and lack of responsiveness to student inquiries, particularly regarding important deadlines. Overall, her teaching style and grading practices were divisive among students.

Ratings.comment: The most frustrating thing about Alison is how she talks at you. She is young so you want to talk to her as an equal but she teaches at you like she's above you or something. She is very stern and unforgiving. She isn't student friendly. I will not take a class with her again.
She speaks way too fast that you cant even process. She seems younger so youd assume shes more understanding but she is totally NOT. Least favorite "professor" here at Ohio State.
Pick another professor. She makes the course material much harder than it should be. We had "pop quizzes" EVERY. SINGLE. CLASS.

Aliosn was awesome! She does a magnificent job explaining everything and has a review that I woudl recommend going to before every exam. The papers are easy as long as you follow the rubric and have a slight sense of good writing styles. I would recommend this prof to anyone that asks.

Took her class after I decided to picked Psych as a minor and Young was terrible. In class and on exams i was fine but she weighted too heavily on those 6 papers and she would answer/send emails late so NOONE got questions answered in time.My class average for the papers was in the D-C range. not a good class if u need good examples/instruction

Great professor, interesting class. Papers are easy and you do well if you follow the rubric. Exams are all essay which is unfortunate but they're not too hard if you use the study guide to prepare. I really enjoyed Alison's class.

she is helpful, except I emailed her a question sat morning before a very important midterm on monday and she did not get back to me until around 12 am sunday night for the next morning. She talks very fast, and says "right" a lot when explaining and this can get confusing. She is a tough grader on the 6 paper for the course, but gives feedback
