summary_comment: Adam is highly regarded for his engaging and entertaining teaching style, making complex material enjoyable and accessible. Students find him friendly, clear in his presentations, and supportive, often recommending him as an excellent choice for the course. His laid-back approach and effective use of resources contribute to a positive learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Adam was awesome! Would totally recommend him: friendly, helpful, and makes the material fun!

Adam easily scores as my favorite professor for first semester of freshman year - he's friendly, presents the material in an entertaining fashion, and the requirements / assignments / expectations are all presented in a clear fashion. The content was difficult at times (lots of memorization), but Adam definitely made it bearable and interesting.

Adam is an awesome guy. He is hilarious and really laid back about stuff, plus he's a great lecturer. Lectures with him were always interesting and clear. 2 midterms, one final, all quite easy. Puts fill-in-the-blank notes online, so print those off and go to lecture and you should get an A without a problem. Take Adam, he was amazing.

I had a huge lecture for this class but he was a good speaker, always very clear in understanding the material and kept class interesting at times. Also very helpful and understanding for those who cannot grasp the material.
Great proffesor. Print off the guided notes, go to lecture, and you will get a good grade.
Great guy who makes a long lecture interesting and fun.
If you're scheduling psych 100, you cant go wrong with Adam. I loved being in his class. SCHEDULE ADAM.
Adam is a great guy．I enjoy going to the lecture.Go over his note and read the textbook,then you can get an easy A.
While going to class wasn't required, Adam definitely made the material easier to learn and understand.
Interesting and very informative teacher. I highly recommend him but you have to read and take notes to do well.

Adam is one of the best teachers i have meet here on campus. He enjoys teching and is always ready to answer any questions. His examples were very down to earth and helped in understanding the material. IF YOU TAKE PSYCH 100 SCHEDULE ADAM!

Adam was a great teacher.  He was truly interested in the material he taught and he went out of his way to help.  He provided real-world examples that made the material more comprehensible, and he's a really nice guy.
great teach-uh

Adam is a very nice guy. He is fun loving and you can tell he enjoys what he does. The material of the class is very interesting, but there is a lot of it. If you do the readings and study for the midterms and quizzes you should do well.
Has the mouth of a sailor. I love you Mr. Osth.
Osth is the MAN.  Best professor ever.
Interesting class. He gives clear explanation of class material. His quizzes help a lot when preparing for exams.

Very young and fun. Class is never boring, gives very good notes and goes over all the material you need to know for quizzes and exams. Makes material interesting. I would definitely recommend  him if enrolling in this class.
He's very understandable when teaching, and cares about whether you know the information or not. I would recommend him to anyone that was considering enrolling in a class of his.

summary_comment: Cassee is widely regarded as an excellent and enthusiastic professor, known for clearly explaining the material and ensuring students are well-prepared for exams. Her classes are generally considered easy if students review terms and attend lectures regularly. Students consistently praise her teaching methods and dedication to helping them succeed.

Ratings.comment: Cassee is a GREAT professor. She explains everything well and tells you exactly what you need to know for exams. She's also very enthusiastic about the subject! As long as you attend class and pay attention, you should get an A.

Cassee is AWESOME! She makes learning psychology fun and interesting. Make sure you review terms, since thats what the midterm and final are on. The only downfall is she gives LST assignments (pop quizzes over the lecture from the previous class) that make you come to lecture. It REALLY benefits you on the quizzes and tests.
Easy class as long as you review the terms and definitions. Cassee explains the material clearly and is enthusiastic about teaching.

She is a fantastic teacher. The course itself is easy and as long as you study the terms you should do fine on the midterms and finals, but Cassee explained the material very well. She is a confident person who gets her point across well and seems genuinely interested in what she does.

If you fail this class then you need to try harder in life. Easiest class ever with the best teacher ever. She knows her stuff, shes very fair and goes out of her way to help students. Easy A! Also shes one hot tamale! :)
Very good teacher and instructor. Material is well organized and taught clearly. No complaints about the class
Best teacher ever

She was a great teacher. Just make sure you study because there are alot of terms to remember. Dont let her appearance full you she is a strong woman who gets her point across. She is also one of those people that can insult you and have a smile on her face.

Cassee is an awesome teacher bc her lectures cover most of the materials in the book, so you don't need to read. Her quizzes are difficult, but it really prepares you for your 2 midterms & finals; also, when she offers extra credit, do take advantage of it because it really helps you on quizzes & overall grade for the quarter.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her fairness and comprehensive teaching approach, providing detailed guided notes that closely align with her lectures. Students find her exams straightforward if they attend classes, take notes, and study the assigned textbook thoroughly. Her methodical approach ensures students are well-prepared for assessments.

Ratings.comment: This professor is very fair! She gives very detailed guided notes that follow along with her lectures. Her notes are everything that you need to know for the exam! The exams are super easy if you study and actually go to class and take notes. The textbook helps too if you read the pages she gives you. I highly recommend taking her class!

summary_comment: This professor maintains an exceptionally well-organized and engaging classroom environment, keeping discussions on topic and consistently interesting. Students highly recommend her for Psychology courses due to her effective teaching quality.

Ratings.comment: She keeps the class well organized, as well as always on topic and interesting! Definitely recommend her for a Psychology course.

summary_comment: The professor demonstrates high-quality teaching by providing valuable lectures with examples and videos that enhance understanding, though lectures are not strictly mandatory as the content is also covered in the book. He shows significant care for his students, offering extra support during paper-writing sessions and engaging frequently outside of class. His teaching approach is effective, and he benefits greatly from active participation, which he encourages to boost his confidence.

Ratings.comment: Lectures aren't really mandatory if you read the book but helpful because he shows lots of examples and videos that help to remember the content. He talked to students outside of class a lot, especially when we were writing our 2 papers. He cares a lot about each student. He gets quiet and insecure if you don't participate in class so help him out!

summary_comment: Professor Jeon is known for her supportive approach, offering extra credit and office hours to help students improve their grades, which has led to significant grade boosts for some. However, her teaching style and materials are often criticized for being confusing and poorly organized, with frequent errors in lecture slides and homework problems. Despite this, a few students managed to perform well, indicating that while the class can be challenging, assistance from the professor can be very beneficial.

Ratings.comment: I did ok on  psych 2220 but I was kinda worried about this one. But the prof tried to make sure we did well. Quizzes and extra credit helped me with my grade.

She was a bad professor, the textbook was useless, and I learned nothing during lecture, despite paying close attention.  That being said, I got a 99% in the class, it was an easy A, but it was poorly taught.  I got a 710 on my math SAT, though, so I was able to figure it all out on my own.  Not everyone could.

Professor Jeon was always helpful when I visited her office hours.  She gave out a bunch of bonus credit assignments to bump up my grade. So I got a C in the first exam but ended up getting an A for the class.

Within weeks of taking this class I wished I didn't have to take it. She took attendance, gave pop quizzes and her tests were tough - not a class to coast through. I almost gave up until i asked for her help. Glad i did. Jeon was really helpful and gave a lot of ops to make up and get extra credits.  Let's just say I didn't get an A but I LEARNED!
many errors in lecture slides and homework problems, you basically have to look for errors because everything won't make sense until you do, least organized professor ever

She doesn't speak the language.  Half the things she says in lecture are wrong, not to mention that her lecture slides are wrong as well.  She gets confused about whats on her lecture slides and confused about what she is saying.   Most of the material was review and it still didn't make any sense when she tried to teach it.

summary_comment: Dr. Currence is known for making classes more challenging than necessary, particularly through his detailed and sometimes confusing lectures and tricky exams, though he is generally fair in grading. Students appreciate his passion for the subject and his real-life examples, which make the material more engaging, although some find his teaching style and class structure overly demanding.

Ratings.comment: The class material is not hard, but Currence makes it more difficult than necessary. His exams are primarily essays, but he's a fair grader. There is a semester long project that is extremely unclear and unnecessary.

Dr. Currence was one of my favorite teachers! He is really passionate about the subject and he has a lot of stories from his private practice to go along with what we learned. He's not strict about attendance but I actually wanted to go to class so that wasn't an issue!

Dr. Currence was a very nice and funny teacher!! Very approachable but also stern because he wants his students to learn. Attendance is a must! His  lectures have blanks that can only be filled in during class! Tests are tough but if you study you should be fine! One big group presentation that is easy if your group members cooperate!

Dr. Currence is an awesome teacher.  His courses usually are made up by 3-4 tests and 1 or 2 hands-on presentationsprojects.  He wants all of his students to be comfortable with the information, so don't be afraid to ask.  I personally didn't use the book that much this semester, but other kids did. Just depends on how you learn. He's hilarious. I would recommend him to anyone.

He's really funny & super nice, he owns a private practice so he often gives real life examples to make lectures more interesting. Exams are fair, as long as you studied well you will get good grades. Very easy grader for papers & other assignments. Gives extra credit for random things during the semester. Great prof & class! Never used the book.

He makes tests, and just the whole class in general, so much harder than it needs to be. He's extremely boring and expects so much from this class despite it being an elective course. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS.

Dr. Currence is very clear when he lectures and will repeat anything if needed. He makes sure you understand each point before moving on and engages students in lectures (but not too much). Overall, I've learned a lot in his class and if you study and go to class, you'll get an A. However, he likes group projects.

Professor Currence is a nice guy, but the lecture is horribly boring. He over-explains things - sometimes to a point of confusion. The quizzes and homeworks are fairly easy, but he likes to make his exams tricky for no reason. The examples he chooses are sometimes convoluted, so pay close attention to detail.

Dr. Currence's class is really clear-cut and straightforward. He emails powerpoint outlines a few days before class so you can print them and take notes easily (laptops weren't allowed though). For exams, his questions are pretty specific, so you basically have to memorize a lot of information. If you put in the work though, you should get an A.

Lectures were informational and he tried to make bland information interesting. Said he offers EC throughout the semester, never happened. Exams are a poor indicator of what you learned in the class. I knew everything on the study guides and still didn't do well on the tests.

Tests are hard. I had memorized the notes and review guide and still did poorly on both exams. Not much help to the student either. As a professor, I think he is fine but try to take this class with someone else if possible.

I went into this class prepared to actually learn about research and hoping to do well, but he is so particular with the answers on his exams I did terribly on both, and it's not like I didn't study. Some of the things he teaches are so similar it's almost impossible to differentiate the two. If you can memorize, take it, if not, find someone else.

He is an AMAZING professor. If you have the opportunity to take a class from him, DO IT! I absolutely loved going to his classes, he made the material entertaining and easy to understand. He is also a really funny and nice guy. Loved him!
He was always straight forward in lecture and mixed it up a bit with panels and activity days. Exams were a little difficult b/c of detailed questions but decent class overall I got a B.

Dr. Currence was a boring teacher, but the material is easy. Don't buy the textbook for his class; all info you need will be on the slides. Go to class and you can get a B. Put a lot of effort into studying and you can get an A. He is picky with his group project grading and exams. Be prepared to MEMORIZE exact definitions and be clear. I got an A.

The material in the class wasn't difficult. He was a little bit of a stickler with grading, make sure you study every single bit of information on his slides. Also, he likes to use cliches, (I kept track all quarter) like "as an aside" (said x15 time), "Don't throw the baby out with the bath water" (x7 times) "At the end of the day" (x15 times)
He is a good teacher.He is very clear and provides good examples. Read and take notes on the power points and quizzes and exams will be fine.

Dr. Currence was not the most interesting teacher I have ever had, but I felt that he was clear about what he expected and had great experiences relevant to counseling psych. There are 3 exams and a short paper. Book is unecessary. Read the slides.
Enjoyed having him as a teacher. He makes notes for lecture and the material is very clear. Study what he teaches you in lecture and you'll do fine

dr. currence was really easy to understand and he let class out early a lot. his assignments got a bit tedious, and you have both a final project and a final exam, but the project wasn't hard to do because you do papers relevant to it throughout the whole course. good guy.

I wasnt looking forward to taking Psych 300, but found it to be more interesting than I thought. The lectures were well organized, and Dr. Currence was always willing to explain. I dont like group work, but I found value in the research proposal project. Overall, he was a great professor and made this class bearable!
The class material was boring, but Dr. Currence did a great job trying to spice it up and was interesting to listen to during class. I think he did a great job
He did really well with giving the information. His exams were a little difficult but as longs as you study it should be fine
Professor Currence did a great job of trying to tie knowledge into action. I appreciated the research proposals we had to make because it solidified the material. He was always willing to help!!!

Dr.  Currence was very helpful in learning material.  A good portion of the tests were extended response so a lot of memorizaion was required.  Sometimes he tested us on what we went over in lecture which was unfair because you can't study what you went over 3 weeks ago unless you have perfect notes.  He doesn't post past lecutres on carmen either.

I really enjoyed Dr. Currence's class. He understands its kind of boring information and does his best to make it interesting. The final was cummulative though even though he made it come off in class as if it wasn't. Go to class, a lot of his information comes from lecture and isn't in the book.
Class was kind of boring, but Dr. Currence attempting to make it interesting. Very organized!!
Dr. Currence was a great prof! He was extremely organized and very helpful when I had questions.

Dr. Currence was a pretty great professor. You would not be making a mistake if you took a this class. Hardly did any work and I got an A. Just attend lecture and take his notes and you should be fine.
Dr. Currence is an amazing professor! Take his class, without a doubt. His information is very clear and straight forward. If you know the terms you will get an A. Absolutely loved this class.

He is a good prof. very organized and knows what he is teaching. The material itself is kind of challenging (you have to memorize all the stuff from his slides). But he was trying to make it easy for his students. And buy an exam packet from the bookstore. That will help you to get good score on exams.
Excellent professor! I would highly recommend him.

15 ppl in the class didn't turn in the first paper on time even though he clearly stated his assignmment policy. THIS IS COLLEGE. He was not the best professor, but he presented the material in a scholarly matter without guilt tripping people b/c they were born white. I rate Dr. Currence (8/10). You have to work hard but overall its an easy class

I cannot believe the comments that I am reading below. No lie, we had a whole bunch of whiny, single-minded, underachieving people in our class. PPl cried for a review sheet. ITS A 500 level class and I know we dont go to Harvard, but one day we should all be professionals and the students in this class dont cut it. Im not brilliant but I got an A
The class was the most annoying part. Being told every day that you're a **** and there's no way not to be, isn't pleasant.

This class was worthless. The average for the final was a D+....which is unheard of in psych. I studied for 2 days straight and got a B on the final. The material isn't hard, Currence just doesn't know what he's doing. He mentioned several things throughout the quarter that he never followed through in doing. don't take this class!!!!
Dr. Currence seemed nice enough, just a little long-winded at times. He was unclear about several assignments which resulted in the deduction of points and that bothered me.

He may have been good for Psych 100, which he continued to mentioned throughout the class. Talk mainly about black and white multicultural settings. Introduced things as continous that we never mentioned again( the movie for the FX show black/white). Doesn't explain assignments well. Quarter long project and a final exam. Busy work assignments. :(

he was great, my roommate took the class and because of his teacher was really bored. Dr. Currence was great he made it a very enjoyable class. I would take him again, his notes are fantastic and really helped me prepare for exams. I got an A and hardly did anything. take Currence if you have the chance, he is a lot of fun.
The class was boring, but he was decent at explaining the material. The quizzes were slightly challenging and the midterms required some studying. Overall, he was an OK teacher.
Awesome teacher. Easy to understand. Easy to get along with
Dr. Currence was a great prof.
Excellent teacher, goes the extra mile, great notes, wants you to learn.  Would take again!
Dr. Currence is nice, entertaining, helpful, understandable, and so are his power-point presentations. I thoroughly enjoyed his class.

Dr. Currence is a terrific teacher.  He explains everything thoroughly and is really easy to understand. In Psych, the teachers are not responsible for much of your grade, the grade depends on midterms and the final, and he prepared us well for the final.
Fantastic teacher, completely prepares you for exam if you do the work, will go the extra mile for you, would take class again!

Great Prof, but he spends way too much time letting people reveal there personal stories and lives to the class... at times he gave one on one consultations that really took away from valuable lecture time. Overall a nice guy and good instructor.

Eric had great outlines, a loud, charismatic voice, and would discuss subject matter in depth.  He'd go over policy information at the beginning of each class, and he was accessable and very helpful.  He helped me with the citing for my extra credit paper.
One of the best lecturers I’ve had, made the subject matter interesting. I’d take a class of his again.
He was great! He made it easy to study, and lectures were interesting. Gave out great outlines!!
No Comments
He made the best out of boring lectures. If you were having problems with the class he would go out of his way to help you pass. Just make sure you study, it's mostly memorization of terms.
This class was pretty easy.  He made the lectures bearable.  Most of the info is common sense and the rest you can memorize.  I aced it.

summary_comment: Dr. Sederberg is highly regarded for his clear lectures and willingness to help students, though some find the class challenging without consistent effort. His tests are described as fair and straightforward, with additional resources like study guides provided. Overall, students find his classes engaging and recommend him as an instructor.

Ratings.comment: I had literally no interest in this class so I struggled a lot, but at the same time I still got a good grade. If you put your head down and do the homework and show up every day for the multiple pop quizzes then you're going to pass.

Dr. Sederberg was an amazing professor. Lectures are clear and he is more than willing to answer questions during class. He missed a few days due to traveling (career related) so he gave us extra credit! Tests are fairly easy and he tells you exactly what you need to study. I would recommend this class and this professor to anyone.

Dr. Sederberg is very knowledgeable and does a good job keeping the lectures interesting. His tests are relatively easy as long as you do his study guides. He is a very laid back professor and never rushes through material.

One of my favorite classes at OSU, Lectures are interesting and informative and Per really knows his material.  Will go in-depth in a topic you are interested in even if its not in lecture.  There are "pop-quizes" at the end of class, but after you complete them the rest become extra credit.  Straightforward class beginning to end.
Dr. Sederberg is a great guy!  Take him if you get the chance

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, effectively connecting theoretical concepts to real-life applications, which greatly enhances students' understanding. She is described as very helpful and friendly. However, students emphasize the importance of thorough reading, as the course is largely exam-based with no homework or quizzes.

Ratings.comment: She is probably one of the best professors I've had, she connects terms to real life applications to help understanding. She's very helpful and very nice! But reading is a MUST or failing is your only option. No homework or quizzes in this class, pretty much based on exam scores.

summary_comment: Jaret is highly regarded for his comprehensive knowledge and ability to guide students effectively for exams. His extensive personal experience in the field enhances his teaching, making him a relatable and humorous instructor who creates a positive learning environment. Students strongly recommend his classes.

Ratings.comment: Jaret is an overall great guy, he is very busy and very immersed in his studies so he has a great amount of personal experience to share. He is very good at directing you what to study for tests and does his best to ensure you have a painless path to success. He is very relatable and funny and I always enjoyed being in class. Highly Recommend.

summary_comment: Dr. Belding is highly regarded for her engaging lectures and dedication to teaching, though her classes require significant effort and preparation. Students find her supportive and willing to help, but note that the coursework, particularly the reading and exams, can be challenging. Some students struggled with grading and found the class demanding, while others appreciated the depth of information covered and the opportunity to improve their writing skills.

Ratings.comment: Dr Belding is really a good teacher! You won't be regret to take her class. But, yeah, the reading and exam is tough. You'll probably need a lot of time and effort to get A
Amazing lectures! Great fun! Though exams are tough. At least bout 40 pages(sometimes 70) reading every week.

Jenn is kind and always eager to help you. If you try in the class, it's really not that bad. It's the APA style that throws people, once you get used to it, getting an A isn't so hard. Be sure to talk to her if you need help! She's pretty cool
Jenn really cares about teaching.  Although she's a tough grader, if you are motivated, you can do well in teh course.

This class was very interesting and very good information but Jennifer is the worst teacher I have had at Ohio State. She was evidently the most judgmental person in the class and it was about prejudice, discrimination, and stereotyping. She is extremely disrespectful and WOULD not ever take another of her classes.

This was a very difficult class but I feel I learned a lot about social psych and my writing improved. Jenn did a great job of cramming so much information into a quarter while still making the class interesting. She's also very helpful outside of class.

I took this class as my second year writing/social psych requirement. Never in my life have I had as much difficulty writing papers as I did in this class. Pop quizzes for participation and exams were not hard at all but when you're receiving 4/15 or 7/15 on papers there's a problem. She even told us we're probably going to fail the first paper!

summary_comment: This professor offers a flexible approach to attendance, emphasizing interactive and engaging lectures that are enhanced by in-class discussions which are straightforward to participate in. While the lectures can sometimes feel dry, she actively encourages student input and feedback to improve her teaching, making the overall experience enjoyable and informative.

Ratings.comment: You don't necessarily need to go to every lecture, but there are some in-class discussion points that you need to earn, but they're SUPER easy to earn. She always takes questions and takes suggestions on how to improve her lecture. Lecture can get a bit dry, but for the most part, she makes it interactive and fun.

summary_comment: James Todd is perceived as knowledgeable but challenging, with mixed reviews on his teaching style. While some students find him engaging and interactive, others describe the class as boring and difficult, with poorly communicated material and tough exams. Overall, many recommend taking this class with a different professor.

Ratings.comment: I'm starting to sense that James Todd doesn't normally teach Psych 1100H. He always used other people's slides, which were very outdated. With the study guide, he makes the class doable, but TAKE THIS CLASS WITH A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR. There are lots of other great intro psych professors, so just avoid him.
Nice professor, but hard tests. Take this class with some other professor.

Dr. Todd knows a LOT about the subject he is teaching, which he makes clear by how much he talks about his own research. Despite this, I found him interesting and engaging, and I liked the course material so I did not find it boring. As long as you pay attention in class and study the study guide you'll do well.

I loved Professor Todd. Yes, his exams are difficult but it IS possible to do well. Pay attention in class, take interest in the material, and go to his office hours. He barely tests to the book, it's all in his lectures so you always have the information you need for the exam. Pretty interactive class. If you make an effort, he will help you out.

Take this class if your only other choice is being water-boarded at Guantanamo. So boring.  You don't have to go to class.  All tests are essay form.  He gives 10-15 essay questions from which he'll choose 6 for the test and you have to answer 5 of those 6.   Course content is confusing.  At the end of class you feel like you blacked out for 50 min

This class was awful. Horribly boring material. He says all you need to know is what's on the study guide for tests but I would thoroughly complete the study guide and still didn't do well on tests. If you don't have to, DON'T take this class!
Perception professor.  Very knowledgable, but the material was too hard and not communicated well.  Attendance wasn't madatory, but necessary.
Terrible.

Got a B+ and only showed up for exams. Allows a 1/3 letter grade extra credit by end of quarter for a 10-15 page research paper. Attendance is helpful; a lot of the notes he adds to his lectures are not in the book. I had to google answers for the study guide. Still, a good grade is possible if you study for the 3 exams (only grades for the class.)
Pretty nice guy but very boring lecture.  As long as you THOROUGHLY complete the studyguide by using the textbook and powerpoints posted on Carmen you should be able to get a good grade.

professor todd is a likeable guy and is pretty clear. he trys to incorporate interesting things in lecture and i actually enjoyed this class but you really have to study for his exams. he usually cuts class short and sometimes just cancels them, so thats nice. i'd recommend taking this class.

Warns class at the beginning that it may be difficult.  Curved everything but class average was still C+/B-.  I skipped every lecture, and went over the vocabulary definitions in the book about an hour before each test and got an A.  Depends a lot on your learning style.  He doesn't emphasize this enough but - USE THE BOOK, not just his notes.

This man is awful. The material isnt that bad, but the way he teaches does not inform students of any useful information. You have to take initiative to learn the material on your own. Often he answers ?s incorrectly or doesn't know an answer even though this is his specialty in psych. His tests are impossible and so is he.

i really hated this prof. he was one of those teachers that knew the info but cant explain it. he never returned my emails. he told me once that he was "too busy" to be bothered about making a study giude. I studyed alot and still stuggled.
todd

I didn't enjoy the class.  His exams require students to know detailed information combined from the readings and his lectures.  These two tests are all essay and make up your whole grade!  He seems a bit hung up on his own research, but he has many great demonstrations.

VERY HARD CLASS!!! I took this class even though it doesn't count toward my major and got royally screwed.  Heavily weighted toward lecture material...I am an honors student and I went to every class/studied a ton and still got a C+  Avoid if at all possible.  2 midterms and a final.  Curve and 10 page extra credit paper (for 1/3 letter grade).

class wasnt too bad, i skipped a lot of lectures, the first part with the hearing section is kind of difficult, but the visual section is really easy, i think thats why he did the hearing section first. I got an A, not a bad class

Interesting material, but difficult.  Go to every lecture, you'll be fine.  Curve was due to inexperience teaching course and writing exams for it.  Will blow you off if you ask a question and he doesn't know the answer.  Get used to hearing, "I'll get to that later" and never getting your answer.  Very well-organized lectures.

Dr. Todd's class is extremely hard.. the only poitive thing is that he grades on a curve. and our class and the class right after mine 2/3 of the class were either failing or recieved ds on the tests. thats not good.  his tests are extrememly hard. i do not recommend anybody take his class.
Interesting lectures, and very cute too!
Very Boring.
Jim's class is highly entertaining.

summary_comment: Kevin is a passionate professor who effectively uses multimedia to enhance learning but relies heavily on the textbook for content. His classes are clear and engaging, though sometimes lacking in clarity, and require consistent reading to succeed. While he offers substantial extra credit, the course demands a significant investment in time and resources, making it less than ideal for some students.

Ratings.comment: Kevin was genuinely passionate about psychology. He used lots of videos during class to make class easier to sit through. Class itself was based on textbook.
Very charismatic and understanding but not always the clearest. The class is on what is in the book, not his lectures or online notes. To get an A, you must read!

You must buy the expensive, OSU edition textbook and you will use it every other night. Most notes are covered in lecture, but several times, he will skip over material and tell you to read about it. You should go to class since there are "pop quizzes" to gauge class attendance. Only good thing is the amount of extra credit. Not recommended.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her caring and understanding approach, making the class accessible with opportunities for extra credit to boost grades. Students find her easy to learn from and would strongly recommend her.

Ratings.comment: Really good professor. She is very caring and understanding. Not too hard to get an A, especially if you do the extra credit. Would definitely recommend!

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her engaging and supportive teaching style, making class both enjoyable and easy to excel in with minimal effort. Students appreciate her humor, clear explanations, and numerous opportunities for extra credit. While exams can be challenging, her approachable nature and willingness to help ensure students feel well-prepared.

Ratings.comment: I loved her! She's so sweet and caring. She'll help you reach your goals if you work with her. Tons of bonus point opportunities and even some for showing up to class. Exams are really easy if you know the definitions for everything. I've received 100% on all of my exams, including the final. The class was also interesting. Take psych with her!!

She makes going to class enjoyable! She has a book she wants to have but everything that we need to know we go over in lectures. Class isn't mandatory, but if you don't come you will miss out on new notes and updates. 10/10 would recommend taking her class!
Loved her personality and very easy to get along with.

I LOOOOOOVVVVEEEEE Dixie. She is so funny, and I especially love how she swore all the time. Her class was a breeze. She literally gives us the answers to test and quizzes. And even if you miss class lots of the material is common sense. But she only gave out extra credit if a bunch of people didn't show up which was practically every class.
This class is an easy A if you read the book and pay attention in lecture.  The exams aren't bad but i heard the final is pretty hard.  Come to class for bonus and pop quizzes.
Be prepared, the exams are hardest thing you'll have to do in this class.

She is so helpful and tells you what you need to do to get an A. If you read the assigned readings (exam questions come from them) and come to lecture, you should pass the class easily. She is always open to help you if you need the help. Very fun and interesting lectures with lots of stories and videos.

Only amazing things to say about Dixie! She is upbeat, hilarious, and I never got bored during lecture. She makes the information easy to follow and enjoyable to learn. Lots of extra credit opportunities, but the exams are more difficult. I got an average B+ on the exams, but the article reviews, extra credit, and in class points boost your grade!

Dixie is so outgoing and goofy. She does a good job lecturing. I don't love the exams, but they are written by the department, so it's not her fault. It wasn't a hard class though. She plays a lot of videos that will make you laugh to help you understand a topic. I definitely would take this class with her again.

Dixie Hu was by far the best professor I have had! She made the course extremely interesting and fun. She has a great sense of humor which kept the class enjoyable. Only thing, she doesn't post slides online, so you have to go to class, but she is so wonderful you won't want to miss classes anyway!

Great Instructor! Made all the material interesting! Tests are easy as long as you read the book and go over her lecture notes! The last test is somewhat cumulative; but she lets you keep old tests which she just takes questions from them for cumulative section! Easy A class if you try!

Dixie was awesome in this class! Her PowerPoints were extremely helpful, but she did not put them online so go to class. She is very good at explaining the information and if you are confused she very helpful. Dixie is also really approachable and was able to make this class my favorite of the semester. Only 4 MC exams, very straight forward.

I always knew Dixie was great, but didn't know how much I really appreciated her until we had a sub due to the birth of her daughter. Dixie teaches from the book and her slides are organized and concise. The workload is pretty minimal if you attend class and pay attention. She's pretty funny and always gives great, relateable examples.
Great Professor.  Notes not online, so be sure to go to class! She's super nice and funny!

Dixie is the best professor I have had yet! She is very thorough and makes sure you understand is is the sweetest thing ever.  She also gives candy for participation, HUGE bonus especially for those Monday classes.
She is awesome and i would take the class again

She was amazing! Teaches basically out of the book but she give information in class that you won't get out the book. There are no papers, only four MC exams. She provide GREAT study guides. Gives plenty of EC opportunities! You will enjoy the class, even if the information is dry! I would recommend her with any class.
My favorite professor! She is so funny and extremely helpful. I enjoyed going to her lectures and she made the material very interesting to learn.
She is definitely my favorite professor i've ever had. She makes learning the material easy if you go to class, and keeps it entertaining with jokes, pictures, and videos. I definitely recommend her!

She slides are very interesting and clear.And I think it becomes very easy to learn.The textbook is required but you won't use it unless you gonna prepare for quizzes and exams.She would sent reminder email on quiz and exam attached with review outlines.Simply recite the concepts and understand their meanings.

summary_comment: Vishnu is generally well-regarded as an effective and engaging instructor who makes the class enjoyable and helps students succeed. However, he is noted for being a tough grader, and some students find the course challenging despite his clear teaching style and willingness to assist. Overall, students appreciate his passion for the subject and his commitment to their success.

Ratings.comment: Vishnu is a tough grader compared to other psych professors. The curriculum is the same throughout each teacher, so if you have the chance to take another professor, do it. I still managed to pull out an A, but it was stressful towards the end. Overal professor grade: C
He is a great instructor. He is willing to help you.
Could not have asked for a better instructor as a freshman! Very quick to respond back to emails and very willing to help!
My favorite teacher. He made the class very enjoyable and he actually cares about his students succeeding. One of the best instructors you will get so take him if you can.

Vishnu was a great instructor. This was one class that I looked forward to going to because he made the class interesting due to his obvious passion for the material he was teaching. If you go to class and read the book, getting an A should be no problem
Vishnu is a very kind, helpful and down-to-earth professor! Learned a lot just by coming to class. Very interested in making sure students succeed.

Vishnu is an excellent Psych teacher. Very clear and covers most of the material on tests without reading. Exams are easy, and minimal work. For exams just go over your notes, the terms, and read over the chapters a few times and you get an easy A.

I had Vishnu for Intro to Psychology. He always had Power Points prepared for class and even handouts to go along with the Power Points. He always gave hints on what to study for the quizzes. He's very laid back and easy to listen to. If you memorize and understand the bold and italicized terms in the book, then you'll be fine!
If you go to class, read the assigned pages from the book, and do the REP and paper assignments getting an A is easy. Vishnu is very helpful

Visnu is GREAT!  I love him and he was always there on hand when you needed him and made sure to put the students first.  He's great and makes sure to tell you everything you need to know, regardless if it is in the notes or not. Makes class very prepared.

Vishnu is an excellent instructor. His lectures are very descriptive and informative; while reading the book is encouraged because he can't get to all of the material in class, you only have to skim it because he does an excellent job of covering the important material.

He gave us guided notes, looked to us for feedback on how we wanted him to go about teaching us.  He was a very relaxed instructor but despite that I didn't abuse this and skip class all the time because he kept it interesting.
Vishnu was great!
Enjoyed listening to him!

Vishnu was great! He made guided notes before lectures so you wont have to write everything down and you can focus on what he is saying! Lecture was interesting and he always had good videos to go along with ppt. Very good class
Vishnu is awesome! Favorite teacher I've ever had.
Vishnu is awesome! His lecture is interesting and he prepares you really well for exams. He is always willing to help if you have questions and he cares a lot about his students being successful.

Vishu is an awesome professor! He interacts perfectly with the classroom and really prepares his students. Class isnt so difficult and we basically cover everything need from the book in class. He is very knowledgable and one of the best professors, i've had so far.

summary_comment: Maggie is an effective and easy-to-understand professor who genuinely cares about her students. She provides comprehensive guided notes for each lecture, making it easy to prepare for tests. While lectures are not strictly necessary, they offer additional in-class points. Tests are straightforward, and with minimal effort, students can achieve high grades through consistent work and extra credit opportunities.

Ratings.comment: Maggie was a great professor. She genuinely cared about her students and even typed up guided fill-in notes for us to use during lecture. Attendance is not necessarily mandatory, but you could be missing out on in-class points if you choose not to go. You do not have to use the textbook much if you pay attention in class. Tests are average.

Very easy teacher whose tests were equally easy. Provides guided notes for each lecture which tell you exactly what to study and know for exams. Personally did not find lectures useful and simply read textbook which contained everything needed for A on test.  Several assignments and extra credits throughout.  If you put any effort in its an A.

summary_comment: This professor effectively maintained student interest through engaging stories and videos, and provided clear exam content through pre-announced pop quizzes and study guides. However, some students found her exams to be unpredictable and overly challenging, with non-cumulative final exams and ambiguous multiple-choice questions causing frustration.

Ratings.comment: She kept the class interested through her stories and videos. Everything on the exams were clear. There were three pop quizzes that were usually announced beforehand. The special topics assignments were graded the hardest. Exams are multiple choice and the final is not cummulative.

she was able to keep the students interested with her stories, showing videos and through group participation. if you go to class, read the textbook and follow along study guides you will do fine! The study guide are helpful and if you attend class she will let you know specifically what you should focus on for exams.

I wouldn't recommend her simply because she didn't structure her 3 exams off of anything in particular and especially not off her lectures. She put extremely random, specific questions on her exams and made more than one multiple choice answer seem correct just to argue with students about it later. The class was boring and not worth the headache.

summary_comment: The professor's teaching quality is generally poor, as evidenced by students finding his lectures boring and largely irrelevant to the material tested. Exams and assignments are described as extremely difficult, with many students struggling despite extensive preparation. While some students appreciate his focus on practical applications and real-world examples, particularly in abnormal psychology, the overall consensus is negative due to the challenging nature of the course.

Ratings.comment: this class is impossible. he's a nice guy but his lectures are BORING. he often veers off onto personal stories. Also his "extra credit" is a joke. No one got any of his extra credit points because the questions he asked were impossible. the exams were impossible too. i studied for weeks for them and still managed to barley pass.

He is the only Psych 100H professor to require an 8 page research paper, which is ridiculous. He flat-out told me that his exams are based on the book and that he just talks about whatever he wants during lecture. He is never on campus. His tests are 75-90% multiple choice and not easy. He says he is eager to help but is not helpful at all.
Doesn't lecture from book, goes off on own lectures and test are next to impossible with extremely detailed questions.

Excellent Psych professor. He is a clinical psychologist, so he teaches the class with a focus on practical applications and on abnormal psychology, instead of focusing on research/academic psychology.

summary_comment: Aaron is highly regarded for his engaging and enthusiastic teaching style, which makes the class enjoyable and easy to follow. Students appreciate his clear explanations, use of effective examples, and ability to keep the class engaged. Overall, he is praised as one of the best teachers in the quarter, providing an excellent learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Aaron is nice and enthusiastic. He makes the class very enjoyable. The class itself is incredibly easy and while there is a text book, you don't really have to read it. Recommended for an easy A with a good instructor.
He's an awesome teacher. Gives great examples, makes the material easy to remember and understand. Is clear in giving lectures and I never felt bored. Best teacher I had this quarter.
Really interesting class! He gives great examples and keeps the class engaged to understand the material.

summary_comment: The professor is knowledgeable and engaging, though some find her lectures boring. Students generally dislike her for being unhelpful during midterms and exams, and for strict grading. While some appreciate her fun teaching style and use of young child examples, many do not recommend her due to the difficulty and precision of her assessments.

Ratings.comment: Class has 2 midterms and final. Along with 3 pop quizzes (attendance). And she is no help with the midterms and exam.
I like her!
Definitely do not recommend..if possible try to avoid having her! Too hard and too precise with grading on papers, etc.
Very nice prof, very knowledgeable on material.  Lectures can get boring at times.
she fun, very centered on young child examples but she gets the point across.

summary_comment: This professor is generally praised for his approachability, helpfulness, and ability to make statistics engaging. Students appreciate his clear online notes and his genuine interest in teaching the subject matter, even though some find the exams challenging. While opinions vary, many recommend him for his supportive attitude and effective teaching methods.

Ratings.comment: Come to class and read the book and you will be good. His extra credit on the final was "Tell me a joke that has to do with statistics." Super helpful on homework and very approachable.

The tests for this class are really random and the questions are more on why you choose something instead of testing if you know how to compute the actual statistics. He is a nice and definitely has a passion for teaching the material. Lab TA was foreign and had many barriers to communicating which made it tough.

I'm split, the exams got progressively harder, he's not a bad prof. online notes are pretty clear and so is he, I just wish his exams weren't so hard, i don't feel that I learned the mixed/multiANOVA's very well, the "labs" kinda help you use SPSS but they aren't structured well, HW takes about 20 min max with SPSS, 7/10

A boring subject, but Nygren's genuine interest kept it bearable.  He's extremely nice and very helpful, and posts a lot of helpful stuff on Carmen.  Not a difficult grader.  If you find him unclear, reading the book helps tremendously.  I recommend him.

Not very helpful on an one on one type situation. SAID you would NEED the book but you don't at all. Way of grading is weird. overall average, if you're competent enough to ACE the tests and figure some things out for yourself.

I recommend this teacher, and I'm a tough critic. He made the subject of judgment and decision making interesting and also its  useful for life, I actually learned a few things, he made math simple and fun, who does that?! Its not that hard, take your stats before it though.

This guy is a complete ****, I got A's on both tests and an A- on the final presentation. He didn't like me so he docked my partcipation points so that my grade ended up being a 92.9%, and he refused to give me an A. My friend didn't say a word the whole quarter, and got full participation points. He's dull a hell, and class was excruciating

Excellant teacher... posts the answers to homework assignments before they're due, but just working through the problems and going to class will prepare you for exams. Very helpful, and actually makes the subject interesting while it could be very boring. He's also rediculously intelligent, which you realize the second you start talking to him.
I've taken three honors classes with him and am sad that I can't take three more. He is hands down my favorite Psychology professor and he's also one of the nicest people on campus!

Nice guy.  I took H321 and H508 with him, and both classes were pretty easy.  Tests were mostly subjective, and the averages were really high.  He wants everyone to do well, and it's not hard to get an A in his classes.
Easy class and very nice guy.  I think the average on our first midterm must have been around 90%, even though it is all essays.  Meeting basic requirements will get you an A.

A real sweetheart! Always willing to listen and help. Get in good with him and he would LOVE to write a letter of recommendation for you. All essay exams, but grades fair. Would definetely recommend him!

It's stats, and therefore it's boring. He tried to make it interesting though. More often than not, not many people followed anything he was doing in class, but the tests weren't bad at all. It's the kind of class I've come to expect from the Psychology department.
so nice, will always go out of his way to help students.  class was not too hard, and he even though it was stats, he sometimes made it interesting

Dr. Nygren was the best professor I ever had! So nice and interested in teaching. Halped change my grade from an A- to an A so that I was able to graduate on time. I would take all of his classes if I could go back!
he even made the tests fun because of extra credit questions like, "guess what song he listens to while jogging and why"

Tom is a very nice guy and somehow manages to be interested in ANOVA. However, the tests are very difficult, particularly the take-home portion of the final. Be prepared to spend at least 5 hours on it.  That said, the content of the course is very useful for your actual research.  The bottom line: since you don't have a choice of professors, just be prepared for the course to take up a lot of your time and plan your winter schedule accordingly.
He's very nice and really willing to help with anything.  He doesn't realize when he is being unclear, but if you call him on it, he's more than willing to explain again.  Tests aren't too bad.

Very kind and fair professor.  Sometimes unclear in class lectures, but always willing to expain things further.  The TA grades homeworks and exams, but Nygren is lenient - if you are even partially right, he'll give you all the points back, so don't be afraid to go in and argue points!
No Comments
No Comments
I had Nygren for Psy. 320, 321, and 508. Sometimes his lectures are hard to follow b/c he goes off into lala land.  Overall he's a fair and good prof.  I would recommend him
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Prof Rohrbeck is an excellent teacher who genuinely cares about her students' learning and is highly recommended. She makes the class engaging and finds effective ways to facilitate understanding. Students find the material accessible with open-book online tests, though attendance is crucial to fill in gaps from the online resources.

Ratings.comment: Prof Rohrbeck was a great teacher. She was really interested in helping students and genuinely seemed to care about helping us learn in the way that was best for us. I'd recommend this class to others for sure.
Very nice lady. Must go to class to fill in the blanks from the powerpoints posted online. Open book tests are taken online at home. Made the class interesting and fairly easy!

summary_comment: Jeremy is generally considered a nice professor who engages students with in-class activities and provides thorough PowerPoint slides. However, his lectures can be monotonous, and his tests are often confusing, particularly in the multiple-choice section. Students appreciate his willingness to help but find his feedback on papers and speeches vague and his grading standards strict.

Ratings.comment: I have mixed feelings about Jeremy. He is very nice and is willing to help. However, feedback can be vague and unhelpful and he is very picky in grading papers and speeches. I did enjoy the three minute break that he gave in the middle of lecture. Overall, it is possible to succeed but pay close attention to rubrics and demand specific feedback.

Had Jeremy for social psych 2367, he's a pretty cool guy, and makes a lot of corny jokes. Overall easy class, barely used the book since the powerpoint slides are very in depth and great for studying. Had 5, 2-page papers that were not bad at all. Exams fairly easy.

He's the nicest professor you'll ever have. Maybe because he's Canadian...? xD Anyways, if you have him for intro to social psychology, DON'T GET THE BOOK. It's pretty much useless. His powerpoint slides are very thorough, so I just learned from that. Didn't open the book and got an A in the class.

Jeremy was a nice enough guy but he is extremely monotone. He does a TON of in-class activities which I found to be profoundly annoying and his test questions are always confusing and he constantly interrupts testing to clarify things. Grades are based on 4 exams and participation. He definitely knows his stuff but I would try to get another prof

Jeremy is a really nice guy, however, his tests on the multiple choice section are extremely confusing. Always knew all the information for the exams and was never able to get an A on any of them. Attendance is mandatory because he gives a participation grade. Overall, his class wasn't terrible but I would try to take it with another professor.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality and genuine care for her students. She consistently offers multiple extra credit opportunities and maintains a positive, engaging classroom environment. Her lectures are described as fascinating, and she is known for her fairness in testing and willingness to provide additional support outside of class hours.

Ratings.comment: An amazing teacher, if she is teaching a class I would definitely recommend you take it. Genuinely cares about all students and offers multiple extra credit opportunities. Her lectures are super interesting as well. Her tests were somewhat challenging, but completely fair.

She is one of the best teachers I have had at OSU. She is nice and always has a positive attitude. She was also willing to meet up with me outside of class time even though she has a very busy schedule. Her lectures are interesting and she always asks if anyone has questions after she covers a topic. There is also a lot of extra credit offered too.

Had her for abnormal psych, and she cares so much about her students. I'd feel comfortable asking her any questions, her lectures are wonderful, and she encourages class participation, but it isn't mandatory. Assignments are easy and well-explained, and the tests are fair. Really knows what she's talking about, and wants us to succeed in her class.

summary_comment: Dr. Nelson is a highly respected professor known for his engaging and informative lectures, though some found his explanations could be clearer. Students appreciate his availability and the usefulness of sample exams and review sessions. While some found the class focused heavily on hormones and animals, many praised its quality and recommend it, especially for those interested in the subject.

Ratings.comment: Sometimes wasn't the most clear, but definitely not the worst prof I've had either. Pretty dark sense of humor that I found funny.
This class requires time but it is not at all difficult if you study, do the sample midterms and put forth a little effort you should be just fine.

Dr. Nelson's class was great.  The lectures were very interesting.  His classes weren't mandatory.  The review sessions were very helpful and he gives out sample exam's which is highly recommended you do because they are very helpful for the midterms and final.  And don't bother getting the textbook he only tested on the lecture slides.

Great professor! I would recommend Dr. Nelson to anyone. There is a long term paper but you are able to select your own topic related to hormones, so it's not terrible. The quizzes are easy (he gives you a sample - DO IT *hint*) and the midterm is a take-home!

Dr Nelson is one of the most respected  professors in his field, and he knows his stuff - he even wrote the book for the class. His lectures were amazing, and he provided any and all tools necessary to succeed in our final paper presentation.

Was a little edgy going into this class because I didn't think I'd find the material interesting, however, Dr. Nelson completely changed my mind about it! Class was always fun and the power points very clear. Dr. Nelson makes himself very available to students in office hours and via email, so questions get answered quick! Great guy, great class!

Did not like this class at all. The class was completely about hormones and animals rather than humans, exams were fairly easy if you do the practice exams, but the essay questions are subjective & points will be taken off on a whim, and the info was pretty useless. I would not recommend this class unless you love the topic of animals and hormones.
This class rocked!!
Amazing course!  This class was a seminar, and it really encouraged students to think for themselves.  And yet it was very easy and fun!!  Definitely worth taking!!

Awesome professor!!  Definitely the best class I have ever taken!  He will keep you laughing the entire quarter, and his exams are easy as long as you attend class and do the practice exams.  He's incredibly intelligent (come on, he has 2 PhDs), loves talking to students, and really enjoys teaching.  Don't graduate w/o taking one of his classes!
An outstanding professor with great enthusiasm.  I learned a lot and it was a joy to find a professor who so much loved teaching.  He also wrote the textbook so he really knew his stuff!

This was an Honors college course on the Biology of Aggression.  He was an excellent lecturer--and very enthusiastic about the topic.  He took time to answer questions in class and was very helpful during his office hours.  Very responsive to email requests too!  A really great prof.  You'll love this class....I certainly did.

He's great!  Dr. nelson has a wonderful sense of humor that kept me laughing all through class.  It was wonderful that he wrote the text for 644, it really helped to learn the material.  His only downfall is that he is often difficult to hear when he lectures.  Wish they all were like this.
Outstanding.  And he wrote the textbook for 644.

summary_comment: Stephanie is highly regarded for her friendly demeanor and engaging lectures, though the material occasionally becomes tedious. She excels in providing thorough feedback on essay assignments, making the required three essays manageable despite their number. While the exams are challenging, students find them fair and not overly difficult.

Ratings.comment: Stephanie is very friendly and gives good lectures. The material can get boring at times but she's good at keeping your attention. She gives excellent feedback on essay assignments, since this is a writing course you do have to do three essays but they're split up well and it doesn't feel overwhelming. The exams were a lil tough but not terrible.

summary_comment: Tiffany is highly regarded for her effective teaching methods and caring approach. Students find her lectures engaging and her focus on clear, essential material makes the course manageable. She encourages participation, offers ample extra credit, and provides detailed guidance for exams, making high grades attainable with effort.

Ratings.comment: Tiffany was a great lecturer. She's very chill and makes learning psychology so much easier. A lot of definition based material for exams but other than that, pretty easy. If she ever has to teach another intro class, I highly recommend picking her course up.

I got an A in this class with no issue. There's many extra credit opportunities. She's super cool and funny and really gets to know her students. She wants you to get an A so she makes assignments and grading so easy. For other psych 1100 classes, you may use your book, but with her, I didn't even touch it. Just be sure to study for midterms/final.
Tiffany is just awesome, she truly cares about her work and students. It really shows that she want everyone to learn and pass.

I loved Tiffany. She really cares about her students and really wants you to get an A. She tells you exactly what you need to know for the midterm/final and offers tons of extra help before exams. She counts participation but makes it so easy to participate. Tells a ton of stories which makes it easy to relate to her! Highly recommend!

I took Psych 1100 with Tiffany and she definitely wants you to get an A in the class. She tells you exactly what you need to know for the midterms and finals, offers a lot of extra credit, and doesn't grade toughly at all. I often would not pay attention in class, but study the night before the midterm and get an A. Definitely would recommend!

summary_comment: Aimee is an knowledgeable professor who enriches the curriculum with additional insights beyond the textbook and shares her personal perspectives. While she is a rigorous grader, particularly with five papers assigned, her tests are manageable for those who attend classes and study. She also offers opportunities for extra credit.

Ratings.comment: Aimee is a good professor and knows her stuff. She adds in extra stuff outside of the textbook and gives you her personal opinion on matters. She is a heavy grader and there are 5 papers in this class. The tests are alright if you studied and came to class. She does give extra credit though!

summary_comment: Dr. Aldao is highly regarded as an exceptional professor, known for her engaging lectures filled with interesting examples, personal stories, and relevant media. Her classes are generally considered easy with minimal homework, though attendance is important for pop essays that contribute to the final grade. Students consistently praise her humor, accessibility, and fairness in testing, often noting that her classes are both enjoyable and beneficial.

Ratings.comment: She left, but I'm leaving this here in case she comes back later. She was AMAZING! Her lectures were interesting, she used modern and old examples (as well as personal stories), and the work load was pretty good. Pop quizzes/essays were pretty easy, and the extra credit was worth 10% of the final grade. This class convinced me to minor in psych.

Very easy GE! You just have to pay attention and take notes in lecture, which are very interesting (only problem was that it was at 8am). Literally no other work!  Amelia is so kind and funny and she gave an extra credit option. I feel lucky to have been taught by her. Unfortunately she is leaving academia :(

Dr. Aldao is a great teacher.  Tests are not at all hard.  Attendance is mandatory as there are random pop essays that account for a quarter of your final great.  She does also give generous amount of extra credit at the end of the semester.  Great honors GE if you are looking for a fun and easy class to take.

Dr. Aldao is my favorite professor! She's hilarious during lecture; I had it for an hour and a half and I wished it went longer. Always has an answer to questions and encourages discussion. She has the powerpoints online for easy-access. No papers, just 3 exams, which are easy if you pay attention and study a little. Laid-back and approachable.

You pretty much always have to go to class to make sure you complete all the pop essays she gives which then count as 10 points of extra credit for you in the end. Other than that, she posts all powerpoints on Carmen and I would just go to do the essays. I rarely paid attention because she was honestly really boring. The material was interesting.

I took this class as an honors elective and thought it was great. Dr. Aldao tells funny stories in class and shows videos relevant to the material. Exams were fair and questions were thrown out as needed. I was able to get over 100% in this class without studying much at all. I would definitely take a class with Dr. Aldao again.

Professor Aldao was an awesome teacher.  This class consisted of two midterms and a final exam.  The tests were all multiple choice and very straightforward.  Pay attention in class and read the PowerPoints and you'll be fine. She gave us pop essays for extra credit that added up to 10 total extra credit points.  Great class and great teacher.
She has a great personality, and I really enjoyed her class.  I would definitely take another class for which she was the instructor.

Dr. Aldao is both brilliant and charming. She is also super-accessible and makes great obscure pop culture references. Dr. Aldao is absolutely one of the most personable and easy-to-work-with faculty in the entire Psych department. Can't say enough great things! She's also a bit of a wunderkind in the field of emotion regulation :)

One of the most entertaining lecturers I've ever had. She promotes discussion in class and shares a lot of interesting videostidbits from her clinical experiences. She's always willing to help students out, even though she's crazy busy with her research-- which is super interesting by the way. I would definitely recommend taking her class.
Although the material of abnormal psych is hard, Aldao made it somewhat easier to manage by relating most topics to her real life research experiences.

Dr. Aldao is an extremely enthusiastic professor. She talks fast, but if you do the readings and attend class keeping up is not a problem.  She knows a lot about emotion regulation and always has great examples from pop culture. Lots of good youtube video examples! She is very accessible to help when there are questions.

Dr. Aldao is an amazing professor. She's a well-respected expert in the field of emotion regulation and has excellent insight into clinical psych, so whether you take her emo reg or abnormal class you will learn an incredible amount. Her class is super easy- show up and pay attention and you'll get an A. Extra creditattendance points offered

She reads directly off powerpoints at 9:30 am with the lights off. Your entire grade in the class is based off of 3 exams and nothing else. When it comes time for the exams, she gives you a study guide which she does NOT follow at all. The amount of info you have to know for the exam is EXTENSIVE, yet her questions are over tiny details. HORRIBLE!

This is one of easiest psychology or honors courses you can take at OSU. Aldao is very sweet, and you get bonus points for attendance. The slides are all posted online and all of the information from the tests comes from those and the book. 3 exams are the only grades.Incredibly boring lectures, but if you're interested in Abnormal Psych, maybe not

Dr. Aldao was great!  Class was very straightforward, just 2 midterms and a non cumulative final.  Her lectures were fun and she really knows her stuff.  Reading the book wasn't necessary.  Attendance can only help you as she gives pop  essays for extra credit.  Not a hard class but I did learn a lot.  I highly recommend her.

summary_comment: Professor Shatzer is highly regarded for her caring and approachable nature, often going above and beyond to engage with students and create a positive learning environment. She is known for her clear communication, willingness to help, and ability to make complex material accessible. Students appreciate her positive attitude, extra credit opportunities, and occasional treats, though some note that while exams are not overly difficult, they require attentiveness and participation for optimal performance.

Ratings.comment: I absolutely LOVE hannah! she is such a sweetie who you can tell really cares about you and what she is teaching. homework is very little and very easy, as were exams for me. She baked us treats too! she is my favorite professor !!! ugh you will be so lucky if you get here i love her so much!!!

Nice teacher that will bake us goodies. Participation isn't necessary and you don't have to turn up to class but there are in class activities that are a small part of your grade. Note for psych 1110 there's a REP program where you can participate in research but if you aren't 18 you have to write essays. You can study off the textbook for exams

Professor Shatzer is such a great person. She is always in a good mood, and is so caring towards everyone. She is more than willing to help you if needed, because the class does cover a lot of material. Plenty of resources to pass this class because so many students take it. Oh.. and she baked amazing deserts for all of her students on Halloween!
Shes very cool and super nice. Memorized every single persons name and face in my 70+ person lecture.

Mrs. Shatzer was very clear communicating the material in her lectures.  If you show up and take decent notes you really shouldn't have any issues doing well in the class.  Lots of opportunities for extra credit if you participate.  She was always very available and the exams weren't all that challenging.  And she always had a bubbly attitude.

Good class. Not a Psych major, but I feel like I learned a lot. Hannah did a good job at presenting the material in ways that were easy to understand. Exams were reasonably challenging, but other assignments were pretty simple. She does offer extra credit, so an A is definitely within reach even if you don't ace the exams.  Participate in class!

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for her friendly demeanor and teaches an exceptionally easy course, where students can achieve high grades (A or A-) by simply focusing during class and completing the provided packets.

Ratings.comment: She is very friendly and the course is super easy. Just fill in the blanks in the packet she gives out and focus in class and you ll get an A or an A-

summary_comment: Dr. Cudeck is perceived as a knowledgeable but challenging instructor, with mixed reviews overall. Some students found his classes engaging and appreciated his sense of humor and flexibility, while others described them as boring and overly difficult, particularly for those without a strong background in statistics. His teaching style and approach to grading vary widely among students, with some praising his efforts to make statistics interesting and relevant, while others found his lectures and assessments confusing and unfair.

Ratings.comment: His classes are super boring and slow. If I wasn't pretty good at stats going in, I would not have done well. He isn't a very good teacher, but he's a nice guy and very flexible.

one of the worst teachers I've had- incredibly confusing & boring. Makes it ten times harder than it has to be. 3 exams and weekly homework are the only grades. too many questions on the exam for the time given and asks you to calculate things he gave you in hw examples so you have no idea how to do it. SPSS is hard to get at first but gets better

For someone who has no interest in stats, I thought he taught it well.  He is very quirky, but it made things interesting.  Homework is very challenging.  8+ hours per assignment, one a week.  Overall, not bad.

This class is useless for research and Dr. Cudeck is more worried about how to make figures look a certain way than teaching the class about the data that make the figure.  This course hasn't changed in several years and it is clearly missing the mark for what graduate students need.
One of my favorite professors. Quirky as hell, interesting as hell, hard as hell. SAS is tough, but he's very responsive to email questions. A very nice guy.

Prof. Cudeck reached an 'impossible' goal: interesting and contextualized stats classes! His solid knowledge and didactics are impressive. With a witty sense of humor he associates funny stories and course contents: that helps us remember this arid subject. SAS is hard but he is most helpful and always extremely polite with everyone. Excellent!

Dr. Cudeck is a brilliant psychologist.The only downside is that is attempting to teach statistics to psychology kids, who can't do math to save their lives.His class is challenging.SAS takes a while to learn, and the homeworks are tedious.Model your assignments after his notes. Most folks are just bitter about their grade, should've tried harder.

Awful teacher. Easy material but he seems more interested in sharing his life than in teaching you anything. Highly subjective grading even if you get all the answers right (aesthetic is the main criterion) and no explanation is ever provided. Avoid!

Funny/nice guy but class was so boring. Stopped going about halfway through. All he does is hand you a 10 page packet of notes and then read them for two hours. Tests all multiple choice and you are allowed to make a cheat sheet. If you can catch on to SAS and pretty much just copy the codes he uses in lab the hmwk will not take you 8 hours, just 2

Awesome teacher. The homework takes time and you have to learn how to edit the codes he gives you if you don't want to spend 8+ hours on each assignment. He lets you bring a page or two of your own notes for the midterm and final.  The notes he gives you are amazing- I only needed to look at my book once or twice.
Hard class and long homeworks. Need to be willing to put time into studying for midterm and final. Homework usually averaged 8 hours and required SAS code understanding. Office Hours helpful!

Very disorganized. Always late to class, never graded things or put out assignments on time. You don't really have any idea what your grade is. The assignments aren't too hard, though, and some of the lectures are more interesting than others. I think this will help me later in life but the class was just so disorganized it was frustrating.

Very intelligent teacher but forgets others have little stats background. Notes are handed out in class but are quite confusing. The book is the best way to go to learn material. SAS is like hell if you don't understand computer code (8 hour hw). Not always helpful in class but if you go to him and  express concern he'll be more than helpful.

Funny guy, but no one can make stats interesting.  SAS is a pain, but all you have to do is copy the codes he gives you, and then modify it to your problem.  He answered all questions in class, and he frequently checks his e-mail.

Do NOT take this class. He's rude, refuses to answer most questions--when he does it's in an unhelpful manner. He does not explain things well either. On the tests the questions ask for things that are different from what he wants, you have to be practically psychic to pass. The grading is unfair and sporadic. Worst class ever.

RIDICULOUS! Unless you love SAS do NOT take this class. The program apparently can't be put on Macs or Vista, so you're basically screwed. He's completely unfair, and rude. This was the worst class I have ever taken!
Cudeck is wicked funny.  All these other commentors wouldn't know a joke if it jumped up and bit them.  If you don't like the lecture, go to office hours.  He's great.

He avoided answering questions and was generally disrespectful. He did a terrible job explaining SAS and took off points on the homework for things not even specified on the assignment. The textbook was TERRIBLE and so hard to understand. I got a 95 on the first midterm and a 54 on the second midterm so watch out. The final wasnt bad.

Definitely try to get the other teacher.  If Cudeck is your only option, try the homework first and work with SAS.  Then, take your questions to him at office hours!  He will help you so much and at the end of the quarter, the visit will boost your effort grade!  He is a really friendly guy and likes to tell stories, he's just bad at teaching...
