Classes are completely unorganized. He can be very unclear in explaining the material, and often dismisses students questions and concerns when raised in class. Grading is rather unfair, as he takes credit off for frivolous reasons and even admits that he is unfair, but does nothing to change it. Easily one of the worse educators I've ever had.

Prof. Cudeck was the worst prof I have encountered at OSU.  His class was disorganized and uninformative; he was just plain rude.  Students were forced to fly by the seat of their pants, never knowing when the next assignment or exam would occur; due to a lack of a  syllabus.  If learning is your goal in college, I suggest you avoid this professor.
2 words to describe this professor: unorganized and disrespectful.  In my experience, he even turned peopel down when they asked for help.
Incredibly disorganized.  His syllabus was a joke for this class.  He is also arrogant.  One of the worst classes I've ever taken.

Not a very good prof. Class was often interesting but, as the previous poster said, he did not know how much stats we has already been exposed to.  He did not adhere to syllabus.  When we asked him when our second midterm would be he scolded us. Terrible text.

It seemed like the prof didn't really have a grasp of what exactly he wanted to accomplish in the class, or where his students were in stats... if you like having a syllabus that tells you when tests and hws are, don't take him.  Very hard to plan around his haphazard schedule and grades weren't returned in a timely manner.  Funny guy though.
Good prof with lots of amusing stories.  This class was really easy, and for an honors class it went way too slow.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for delivering engaging and entertaining lectures that incorporate relevant and humorous content, making the class enjoyable and straightforward. Attendance, while not mandatory, is recommended as it aids in understanding the material through slide-filling exercises. Overall, students find the course easy and likely to result in good grades.

Ratings.comment: I enjoyed this class a great deal.It was very easy.Attendance was not mandatory but it was needed because she has you fill in the slides.The lectures were interesting she involves the class and shows many funny videos that relate to the material.Over all I think it was an easy A.

summary_comment: The professor is highly regarded for his extensive knowledge and passion for the subject, making complex topics engaging. He assigns substantial material but is approachable and helpful, often curving exams generously. However, his lectures can be dense and challenging, requiring significant effort and dedication from students.

Ratings.comment: Amazing teacher! He was up-to-date on current research not even published yet, and extremely knowledgeable about all disciplines, not only emotions. Tests hard, but a curve is given. Very interesting and passionate teacher, makes an interesting subject even more interesting. Highly recommended!

He teaches a pretty rough class, but as long as you pay attention you'll be okay. I didn't even buy the textbook; the test material is all in the slides. Class isn't absolutely mandatory, but if you want to understand the course, you should probably attend. He's approachable and has a good sense of humor - I enjoyed the class overall. :)

I have to disagree. His tests were difficult, but he tries to help people understand the material prior to and he still curves every exam generously. You definitely have to put in effort, but if going to class with the printed notes is too much for you, stick to 101 classes. He is very personable and funny. I really enjoyed him!

This class was ridiculous..he would assign 70 or 80 slides a lecture and then on top 5 chapters that he would take 2-3 questions from but could be an essay.  Would not make a study guide.. too much information and no guidance on which info to concentrate on.

I completely disagree! Class wasn't the easiest but he tried so hard to help students understand and be successful. Extremely helpful, and pretty generous grading/curving. Eager and willing to help, very amusing, one of the best profs i've had! If you are a  student serious about school and being successful take him! :)
I have nothing nice to say about this guy.  Boring.  Difficult.  The most NON-concise speaker EVER.  Loves to hear himself talk.  He means well, but his class was miserable.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her exceptional teaching quality, characterized by friendliness, humor, and an ability to make classes both engaging and enjoyable, keeping students entertained and involved throughout.

Ratings.comment: She's super great, end of story. Friendly, funny and makes the class interesting. Keeps class engaged and laughing. Lovely lady.

summary_comment: Kendea is highly regarded as an excellent instructor, particularly for Psych 100. Students appreciate her comprehensive PowerPoint slides, which serve as a sufficient study guide for exams, and her engaging teaching methods that include movie clips and visuals to maintain interest. She provides thorough review sessions before midterms and finals, contributing to students' success.

Ratings.comment: Kendea is a very good TA.  She gives you powerpoint slides that you fill in during lecture but those slides are the only thing you need to study for the test.  All the answers to the test are on it and she does a good review before the midterms and final.  I think she is the best teacher for Psych 100.  You should definitely get an A-, if not an A

Kendea is a great. She's a grad student who teaches a lot better than most of the arrogant professors in college. Great slides and very helpful. She uses movie clips and pictures to keep the class interesting and relevant. Her quizzes aren't too bad and every teacher uses the same exam and she does a good review.

summary_comment: Professor Levin is committed to her subject matter and offers fair tests, though her lectures can be dry and difficult to engage with, which may lead to confusion for some students. Despite her efforts, the class can feel challenging and uninteresting, with some students finding the content hard to follow. Overall, while the exams require minimal studying, the teaching style is not particularly engaging or dynamic.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Levin's lectures were awkward and dry at times, but what can you expect from a research psych class?  Her exams required almost no studying if you come to class/pay attention. She offers extra credit, too.

She was clearly committed to the material at hand. She had energy during the lectures and was sometimes pretty funny. Only complaints were she didn't know how to answer and lot of questions and the class dragged, though being an hour and 48 minutes that isn't really her fault. Tests were pretty easy.
She's a very nice lady. I have found the class to be challenging, yet I've done extremely well in her class. She grades fair/easy. Not an interesting lecturer.

Anna is a very nice woman and often shares her dry sense of humor. That is the extent of nice things I can say about this class. Even as a Psych major, I completely lost interest in this class. Lectures are painfully boring and she assumes that her students understand what she is talking about while most of us sit there in confusion. Fair tests tho

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for his exceptional care and support for students, with a particularly effective grading curve that allows for generous adjustments. While some find his lectures and teaching style somewhat boring or convoluted, many praise his deep knowledge of the subject matter and his willingness to help students understand complex concepts.

Ratings.comment: The nicest prof I've ever had.  Honestly cares about his students and will go out of his way to help anyone.  His tests are fair and he curves well.  Knows everything about memory.

His curving system is amazing. You could bomb 1/3 of the exam and still get an A on it. Tests are easy and straightforward and the short answer questions from the notes are the fairest and shortest I've ever encountered. Subject matter is interesting as long as you can pay attention. Highly recommended.
Nice guy, but boring

Extremely nice teacher who seems to know everything about memory. Although the lectures can be boring if you don't know what's going on, they are very interesting if you know the material in the book. If you read the chapters and take notes, it's nearly impossible NOT to get an A. Got over 100% in the class

this class was really boring and half the people stopped showing up. However, this man is the best CURVING teacher at OSU. I know ppl that FAILED the midterm and final and still passed his class. So although he is boring he will HELP you out and really cares about passin students

Nicest man ever.  He's old and drifts off sometimes, but very good at what he does.  Has an awesome grasp on the material and can answer any question.  Lectures are a little convoluted, but read the chapter beforehand, and it all makes sense.  Tests aren't bad.  Know the book and you'll be fine.

Professor Johnson is a wonderful person.  He is so helpful and is available whenever you need to talk.  He'll do whatever it is you need to be able to understand and learn.  His lectures are a little bit unorganized but he'll always elaborate if you ask.
The test were really hard and you need to go to lecture.  But if you read the book and attend class you will get an A because there is a huge curve.  Only a midterm and final in the class for grades.
yeah talk about boring. i get a little frustrated with him in lecture because he babbles so much, but we will see how the midterm goes.

This class will seem difficult in lecture and the midterms will seem tricky but the curve is quite large. I got an A but make sure you really read the text because that is where the majority of the questions come from.

He is a very boring professor, but his class is easy.  I got an A, all you have to do is attend lectures and read and note the book.  The tests are the best tests, very straight forward.  Boring class, but easy moderalty easy A.

summary_comment: This professor is highly regarded for her engaging teaching style, which includes interesting video clips and extra credit opportunities, making the class enjoyable and often easier than expected. Students appreciate her dedication, helpfulness, and ability to explain concepts clearly, though some note that additional reading from the textbook may be necessary. Overall, she is consistently praised for transforming the material into an interesting and enjoyable learning experience.

Ratings.comment: I had her for a 8:00 AM lecture and it still was not that bad. Makes class very interesting with plenty of video clips and extra credit opportunities. Very dedicated to the course and students. As mentioned before, not too bad to look at either!!

This class will probably be very easy no matter who your proffesor is but she makes it intersting. If you go to class you don't have to read the book too much really. Shes very easy on the eyes as well.
She's really awesome! She explains things well, but there's a lot of reading from the book because there are some things that she doesn't cover in class.
Very helpful and a very fun class...one of my favorite classes
Melissa is amazing. She is so helpful and very understanding. I am so glad I had her.
Awesome professor that makes the material more interesting.  I am so glad that I took her class.
An excellent teacher! she gives a lot of examples that make learning easier.

summary_comment: The professor is generally considered effective in making the class material engaging, despite initial reservations. Students appreciate her approachability and ability to simplify complex concepts, finding her lectures both interesting and easy to understand. Overall, she creates a positive learning environment that resonates well with the students.

Ratings.comment: I'm not a big fan of class, but there are some cool clips to tv shows that make this class material interesting.
I was extremely mad to have to be taking psych, but cristan's class is interesting and even fun sometimes.
She aight
She's super nice and actually makes class interesting!
She made the class very and easy to understand and since she wasn't much older than other college students, she was more on our level. I learned alot from her class.
No Comments
No Comments

summary_comment: Based on student comments, this professor is widely regarded as poor quality, with multiple students describing her as arrogant, unhelpful, and difficult to approach during office hours. Students also criticize her exams for being unpredictable and not aligned with course materials, and many warn potential students to avoid her classes.

Ratings.comment: she was horrible! during office hours she made her students feel stupid for asking questions. isn't that what office hours are for? she thinks she's better than everyone and gives you a bad grade if you can't read her mind. DO NOT take class with her. i always get A's in psych... it's my major.I got a C in her class!

One of the worst professors I have ever had. I do not doubt she is intelligent however her job is to teach... and at this I give her an F. She seems arrogant and god forbid you miss a class... she is not helpful. I found her rather rude.DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER.

Never know what is going to be on exams - there have been times I've tried to look up questions after the test and either couldn't find them at all in the lecture notes or text, or they came from chapters not even covered yet.. Also a rather rude/superior attitude..
Most of what you need to know is in the notes.  Maybe 1 or 2 questions on the exams from the book. Brilliant women who loves her work...but not a great public speaker.
Pretty easy class, just had 3 tests and 2 small assignments.  The textbooks aren't too dull.  Just come to class and pay attention, and skim the books, and you should be fine.

summary_comment: Aita is highly regarded as an excellent and understanding professor, known for making psychology accessible and engaging. His classes are generally easy, with open-note exams and online assignments, though attendance is important for avoiding zeros on certain activities. Students praise his ability to connect course material to real-world examples and his genuine enthusiasm for the subject.

Ratings.comment: Aita was a great professor, everything is very straight forward. While attendance is not mandatory, there will be top hats or in class activities that you will get a zero on if you don't attend.

100% would take it again it was the easiest A of my life, he is very understanding and most assignments are online. Lectures are a little boring but push through and go because there are random quizzes to check attendance.
Absolutely loved having him for Psych 1100. He connected info in lectures to modern, real-world examples. He is understanding and easy going. I definitely would recommend taking this class with him.

Easily one of my favorite professors. He is very helpful and very clear in his lectures. I had never really been too interested in psychology before this class, and he completely flipped that. There are some classes that I never want to go to class, but for this class, I never want to miss it.
He is such a caring guy. Class was super easy but I did learn some. Definitely take him for Psych if you can.
Aita is so cool and chill. He actually loves psych. This class is easy because exams and quizzes are open note and online. Aita is super funny too. 10/10 recommend !!!!!!

Amazing person and teacher! I loved this class and coming to class every MWF. The class material was interesting and easy to digest. I found this class to be very easy to understand and a great first class for psychology!

He is the best!!!! So understanding and is here to genuinely help you succeed. Psych is easy in general but he truly made the class a breeze. It is pretty lecture heavy but the weekly discussions are really engaging. He is pure and great!!

summary_comment: Professor Supe is highly engaging and passionate, making her lectures memorable and well-organized. However, the class is challenging, particularly due to tough exams that make up a significant portion of the grade. Students recommend utilizing study tools and attending lectures to stay on top of the material, though some find the weekly recaps and exams demanding.

Ratings.comment: Professor Supe is engaging and passionate, but the class is quite challenging. Expect tough exams that make up most of the grade. Utilize Unstuckstudy and other study tools to stay on top of the material.

I had heard great things about her, but absolutely not for this course. Every week we have knowledge recaps to complete that are supposed to be based on what we learned in class that week, BUT she NEVER finishes the content. I'm talking 100+ slides and maybe gets through 20 and then leaves you to fend for yourself. I have to spend HOURS on them.
Dr. Supe was a great, personable professor who incorporated lots of fun examples & interaction in her lectures! As long as you go to class & engage thoroughly with the material, you'll be fine.

Dr. Supe was great! You definitely need to go to lectures to understand the material, but if you do you'll find clear explanations for concepts described in interesting ways. Class is largely exam based but she lets students use notes so tests are pretty easy if you come prepared.

Might be different in person, but I am taking this class asynchronously and enjoying it. Dr. Supe is a great lecturer and obviously very passionate about her field. Her quizzes are straight forward as long as you can apply the material you learned.

She is a great teacher, is very funny, and is open for comments and questions. There were some assignments but the exams were worth a large portion of the grade. They were very difficult and the averages were usually C's. I had to work very hard to keep an A.
Super memorable lectures. Very caring Proff. Exams were MC and very easy. 10/10 would take again.

super engaging and well-organized class, attendance not mandatory but i found myself coming every day bc of interesting content and delivery. also tests are really based on lectures + lecture slides (posted on carmen), not the book - even tho ur grade is really dependent on how you perform on tests, if u listen + go over slides youll be fine!

She was an amazing professor! I personally would not take the class if you aren't the best test taker, as your grade is primarily your exam scores. It definitely isn't homework heavy at all and she's very accessible, but it isn't a show up and pass kind of class, you have to definitely put in the effort.

In addition to learning foundational concepts of the course, I learned a lot about teaching -  and about teaching online specifically - from taking Dr. Supe's Online Behavioral Neuroscience course at Ohio State. She considers not only content delivery - which she does exceptionally well, but also how students learn to learn. A rockstar educator.

Pros:Is an engaging lecturer and assignments are reasonable. 
Cons:Believes she is more accommodating than she is. Students are able to turn in homework or quizzes three days late twice, not the worst extension policy, but she frames it as being so understanding even though three days is not a lot of time when you're really going through it.

I would recommend taking Dr. Supe for an upper level neuro class! She is really fun and assignments are pretty easy. Three group projects throughout the semester, but all very manageable. She's very accessible outside of class and fair grader with clear expectations.

She is so awesome she made me switch to neuro, she is hilarious so passionate about her subject and a super engaging and sympthetic professor. I would normally hate a professor if I didn't get an A but I just cant hate her she is an awesome lecturer and makes the material funny and engaging. I'd recommend her to anyone!

Extremely well set up online course. Sends out weekly reminders and wants students to do well. Wants to get to know you when you drop by office hours. If you watch all the lectures, it is pretty easy to get an A. Be prepared to spend about 10-20 hours watching lectures per week, though.

Great prof, she's an excellent teacher. Great at breaking down complex topics and approaching potentially sensitive topics thoughtfully and respectfully. This class was group-project heavy, but it's full of overachieving neuro majors, so you should be fine. There is an emphasis on the real-world application of knowledge and science communication.
I would recommend taking this class because its really hard. The teacher is nice but you will most likely struggle.
Amazingly knowledgeable and informative. Notoriously difficult core class, wasnt so hard online and asynchronous but not sure if it asynchronous still

I had Dr. Supe for both PSYCH3313 and again for PSYCH4501, and she is just as wonderful. This class is themed around sleep and the brain, and there are no exams -- just three group projects and weekly Carmen quizzes. She cares a lot about the wellbeing of her students and is one of the most understanding professors I've had at OSU.

Dr. Supe is a very kind lecturer, and I enjoyed Behavioral Neuro! The notes are extremely long, however, and tests are difficult with little time to complete. If you are struggling, Dr. Supe is a great person to access and is understanding. The coursework is very time consuming, but if youre interested in the topics then its really not horrible.

Phenomenal professor. She really understands her students. Class was very organized and consisted of two assignments, a quiz and a video essay each week. The quizzes come straight from the PPT, the video essays are very simple and are only like a minute long. The assignments can be reading research papers to doing infographics. Cool class too!

Her class was the most challenging one I've taken as a psych major, but it got better later in the semester. Most of the content was learned from the lectures, which could get lengthy. Textbook was optional. Homework/discussions were pretty easy. Biweekly quizzes were worth many points and could be stressful because of time constraints.
The lectures were A LOT, especially for online class, but if you kept up and took good notes her exams were a breeze. Open note, open book (although I don't use the book) and no surprises at all.

Class was completely online and done on your own time. There is a quiz every other week that's worth a decent amount, however, there is a decent amount of extra credit that really helps your grade if you do it. If you have questions office hours can be very helpful. They told many stories told and videos can get tedious but overall decent class

Took this class during the times of Covid so it was all online with pre recorded lectures. I found it very difficult to pay attention during these lectures especially when each module had at least 10 lecture videos. Professor Supe seems like a great professor, but I wish she would have cut students a little slack during these hard times.

COVID-19: Class was asynchronous, gave lots of opportunities for points via quizzes, assignments, discussion boards. Great lecturer, enthusiastic delivery of material. Assignments could be busy work and somewhat insulting to collegiate level students (scavenger hunt activities?), but fine for the points. Be prepared to keep up with lectures.

So funny and lively! A bright and warm person who keeps students engaged and feeling cared about. Always looked forward to the energy and chuckles. Her exam questions are typically "what does this do, what is its structure, what is its function" or "what would happen if this structure/system was impaired". Know all that and you'll ace :)

Professor Supe was an awesome professor. I had her in Summer 2020, so things were a bit odd with the new online schooling but she made everything you need easily accessible. It's important to take notes during lectures and can take a bit of time if you take a lot of notes. The lectures and notes you take are important to study for exams.

I have to say, I was nervous to take this course online and dreaded it being one of the harder core topics in Psychology. However, Dr. Supe makes it really informational and fun to learn. You can tell she loves teaching the topic and has a big interest in aspects of the brain. Would recommend 100 percent. Pay attention to lectures and do the work!

i LOVE dr. supe!!! shes so energetic & truly makes difficult topics easy to remember through tips, tricks, acronyms, and real-world scenarios. her tests are easy as long as youre attentive and attend her lectures. cant get an A if you rely on just her notes. however, she gives hints on what to study & is always open to questions after class

Supe cares very much for her students and is passionate about the material she teaches. She is on top of emails and willing to meet with students however she can. Three exams and a research project are the major grades. The project isn't bad, but the exams can be difficult if you don't study. Attendance is not mandatory, but I would recommend it.

Supe is incredibly passionate about her students and subject matter. She responds to emails incredibly quickly and is always accessible. She even went to Oxley's three times a week so we could chat with her (it was an online section). The exams are difficult, and you need to watch all the lectures, but if you prepare, you can pass. 4 exams

Dr Supe is my favorite professor so far. Shes incredibly knowledgeable about the class and you can tell she genuinely cares about both what shes teaching and her students. Everything on her tests she covers in lectures so the textbook wasnt really needed. If you want to take an interesting class with an amazing professor take this one.

My favorite professor at Ohio State. She is so funny and makes lecture so enjoyable. If you review the notes and attend class her tests become fairly easy. I wish I could take another one of her classes again.
i did online psych with supe and theres SO MUCH extra credit. its definitely not a hard class but don't be stupid and not try
You'll learn tremendous things in Dr. Supe's class. There is quite of bit of reviewing required to be successful in this course but it is one of the most rewarding lectures I have ever attended.

Dr. Supe was a fantastic professor. She made lectures exciting and engaging, and is very communicative with her students if you need help. The class requires a sufficient amount of studying, but if you put in the effort this class is very doable. You can tell she is super passionate about the field and does a good job at spreading this passion.

I took this class online, which made it a bit more challenging because it's your own initiative to watch the lecture, but the recorded lectures are super good and helpful, and the tests are pretty much just off the slides (I never used the textbook). The assignments are a nice grade buffer, and you don't have to do all of them. Great class!

Dr. Supe is one of the best professors I have experienced in my first year at OSU. She is honestly a wonderful person and really cares about the success of her students. She does go very fast through lectures but you definitely get used to it. Anyone who has to take 3313 should take it with her :)

Brings an amazing energy to every class. Cares a lot about the material and cares for each individual student. Super accessible outside of class and will remember you a long time after you take the class and check up on you. Tests arent too hard if you Review the PowerPoints and show up for class to pick up the key sections. My favorite professor.

I received a high A in the course but stopped going to lecture after a month. She constantly brought up her kids when it wasn't necessary and over complicated easy concepts. I walked out of her class feeling much more confused than when I started. Exams are straight from the slides, but it doesn't hurt to read the textbook.

Supe doesn't drop grades, offer study guides/reviews, or more than 1 extra credit assignment. Exams cover a LOT of material. Supe is a really great lecturer, but when other OSU profs are known to be easier and it's your grade vs. theirs, I'd definitely recommend trying to take this class with someone else.

Dr. Supe was a really good professor. This class was super interesting and I looked forward to going to class. She did a good job of making the information clear and understandable. You can tell she is very knowledgable. The class is fast-paced so if you skip lectures you will be lost. I studied a lot but it felt very rewarding to do well.

Dr. Supe is the best professor I have had yet! She is such an entertaining lecturer and if you go to lecture you will learn so much and enjoy doing so. Shes so caring and very motherly However, attendance itsnt mandatory and if you study her slides well and you should do fine on the exams. The exams are the majority of your grade, though, so STUDY

Supe knows this class very well. You will learn TONS of information very quickly which is what makes this class so difficult I CANNOT stress enough how important it is to review outside of class. Be ready to take good notes and pay attention because a lot of the information is base level for the rest of the class. She gets a bad rap but good prof.

I believe her reputation is unwarranted. She was arguably one of the best lecturers I've had and I would definitely recommend taking her class. She is passionate in what she teaches and her lectures are very interesting. Her exams are fair and straight forward. Very much enjoyed this class. You do not need the book.

She's really funny (even if she doesn't always mean to be) and it's clear she's really passionate about what she does and what she teaches. It moves pretty fast and is honestly way harder than I was ready for, but she keeps the information interesting and throws in some strange examples that get lots of laughs. If you need this class take hers.
Very good.

She's nice and you can tell she understands the material... However, she flies through the material and gives no indication as to what will be on the exam so you just end up studying hundreds of slides per exam. Exams are impossible I literally studied for HOURS and failed almost every one. Honestly if you need a neuroscience, take cognitive neuro.

Dr. Supe was a pretty good professor and gave useful comparisons and mnemonics for concepts. She tells you right away that you don't need the book and everything is based off her slides. Exams were pretty fair and easy, but if you don't understand something prepare to be patronized. I would definitely go to another professor for help.

Dr. Supe was an amazing preofessor! She told us she typically teaches neuroscience and that it had been awhile since teaching psych 1100, but she did a fantastic job of making sure we covered the basics and giving us thorough background information to help us understand. Lectures were hilarious. Would definitely take her again!

If you love neuroscience/ psychology then you will love this class. She made things so interesting and was clearly very passionate about what she does. That being said studying is a must for this class. A little tip: get a white board to draw out some of the brain mechanisms. I went from a C on the first exam to a A+ on the second with this method.

I took two of Dr. Supe's courses, 3313 and 3310. This was a mistake. One of her courses (3310) was much easier than the other. Her content is lecture heavy, you do not have to go to class, but the textbook isn't used so its helpful to go. Grades are all exams with no curve and no extra credit. She also doesn't offer much if you are struggling.

She is very passionate about the material she teaches and tries to make the class interesting. The exams aren't too hard, and she is very helpful in office hours. She emphasizes the importance of learning over straight memorization.
Solid choice in professor, IF you are willing to put in the work for it. Go to class so the lectures make sense. Best advice is to read lecture slides ahead of time since they are posted online.

Took this class with her & dropped it after 3 midterms because I still had a C after studying like crazy. Dropping was the best decision I made, I retook it next semester with someone else & got an A. SoI dont recommend her to anyone. This is the first neuro major class, & I know so many people who switched their major after taking it with her!

She is awesome. Her class was super hard and had to retake it, but it's due to difficulty of material. She is super flexible about meeting to help you, she gives lots of examples in lectures of concepts she discusses. She refuses to curve unless literally everyone does poorly. Would recommend her to anybody!

Just reads off of slides. Gives no study tools - practice questions, study guides, etc. Exams are online, & makes you show her your score when you finish and basically judges you to your face if you do bad. It was so embarrassing. Bad at answering questions, leaves you more confused. I studied more for this class than any other, & had to retake it.

Probably the worst presentations I have ever had from a professor. I understand that textbooks provide better detail to material but her online lectures were pretty awful. Quick, didn't write down what she was wanting to say on the slide.

Dr. Supe is a wonderful professor. Make sure you come to lecture. She provides PowerPoints, but they wont make much sense if you dont go to lecture to hear her explain them. Dont buy the book. I got an A without using it. The exams are fair, just make sure you study the PowerPoints. Shes really funny. Highly recommend her as a professor.

I've had Dr. Supe for two classes now and enjoyed her lectures each time. The book is not needed for this class as all the information that will be on the exam is covered in the posted PowerPoints. The exams were all multiple choice and online, meaning you would see your score immediately at the end. Great teacher, would for sure take again.

Dr. Supe is a funny, but her lectures are pretty dull. Make sure to bring coffee to class. Be prepared to takes notes on your laptop. We do entire chapters each lecture, so you won't have time to hand write notes. Study hard. Don't worry about the textbook. Exams are all based on her slides. Dr. Supe is nice and understanding, so don't be afraid.

I loved Dr. Supe, you can tell she is passionate about the material. I found the course to be super interesting but be sure to study for exams ahead of time(I recommend study groups). Exams are going to be pretty straightforward and only cover material from her lecture ppts. It's definitely not an easy A but if you put in the work you will be fine.

The course is set up for neuro majors even though psych majors are required to take it too. Your grade is very dependent on your exam scores. This is easily the hardest class I've taken and had to retake it because I failed the first time. The second time around, I am still struggling to get a passing score because her exams are so tough.
Bad course structure

Dr. Supe is easily most amazing professor I have had at OSU. She is really knowledgable on the subject and really tries to get students curious. She is so funny and really keeps you entertained. Don't buy the book unless you're a neuro major. If you skip class, you will fail the course. The tests are difficult but fair.
She wasn't necessarily hard to listen to but be prepared to fly through material, and have a lot of studying on your own to do.

Supe is a great professor. She makes lecture interesting and you can tell she genuinely loves what she teaches. Her tests cover a lot of material and require a lot of studying, but the information comes right from the slides. Lecture is not needed, but for some of the harder concepts it helps to hear her explain it.

Huge ppt lectures, each 40-80 slides. She covers about 5-7 of these per exam. Tests are based on slides, over random details. Not accessible, office hrs are appointment only. Rushes at end of class after going off topic constantly. No extra credit, study guide, or practice questions. Can't drop 1 exam like every other 3313 teacher. Many dropped.
Exams were easier than what I expected. Use powerpoint slides to study. Covers a lot of material in lecture but just get the big picture to do well. Cares about her students!

Each week there are two small assignments, a small short answer (sometimes opinion based) and a short quiz that can be retaken. The midterms and final are in person and very easy as long as you read the night before.
Genuinely cares about the material which makes for engaging, easy-to-follow lectures for difficult information.  Also, friendly and understanding of students' difficult schedules.

One of my favorite professors at OSU. This class is extremely detail-oriented, but lectures are engaging and Dr. Supe is very enthusiastic. Find what works for you. I found reading the book very helpful - some test questions are based specifically from the book however, the book isn't absolutely necessary to pass class. Overall, A+ professor

There is a lot of material covered in this class and it's a little hard to keep up during lectures, but there is a study guide and the test is straightforward. Homework is easy and book wasn't really needed. Supe was really helpful and gave a pretty substantial extra credit assignment.

Not a hard of a gen ed, but I put little to no effort in it admittedly. Lectures were a bit boring. You can skip this class and pass if you have good test taking skills and go over basic concepts, but there are in class points to receive that'll likely make you go anyway. Didn't respond to my emails either, but overall is pretty clear.
She is very caring and helpful. Her lecture uses examples to clearly explain the definition in the textbook.

Kristin Supe is awesome!! Her lectures are interesting (I actually paid attention), and I loved how she explains concepts clearly and includes relevant examples to go along with them. Tests are over a lot of material, but memorize all the info on the lectures and you won't need the textbook. Can get away with skipping occasionally. Easy homework.

You don't need the book to pass, but I advise paying attention and going to lectures. I printed out all the slides in advance, and that helped me a lot, but she is very good in explaining everything and gives study guides for her exams

One of my favorite professors. Enthusiastic about the material and easy to talk to. Very straightforward with her lectures, if you go to class and pay attention you will be fine. Her tests are pretty much straight from the slides, and you can pretty much cram and be okay on the exams. The final isn't cumulative either, which is a plus.
GO to lecture and follow with notes posted on carmen. DO the study guides. Fair tests. Tries to make lectures interesting.  Grade consists mostly of four exams including final.

The BEST behavioral neuro professor. She loves what she does, her lectures are clear. The textbook is helpful but you really don't need it. Go to office hours, she's great to talk to. The tests are detailed but by far the easiest of all the introductory neuroscience professors'.

Incredible professor! She cares so much about the content and makes it really interesting, so go to lecture. She makes a really complex topic more understandable to the general public and has fun while doing it. Study her LECTURES and ask questions. Make practice questions for yourself to study and you'll do great!

VERY good professor. Definitely knows her material. Tests are pretty specific and you will need to study, but that aren't horrible. Lots of information but she makes the class fun. Puts the slides online so attendance isn't necessary but does 5 random checks throughout. Overall, great teacher and good class.

The class is tough. It is a ton of material to cover so the lectures are fast-paced and overwhelming. However, Dr. Supe does everything she can to make it better. She is hilarious and a great person, she's super excited to help with the class or with life in general. Slides are online, but attendance is a good idea because it's a hard class.

Dr. Supe is by far my favorite professor so far at OSU. She gives very thorough lectures, makes the information interesting, and is really genuinely interested in her students doing well. Her tests aren't extremely difficult, but you have to know the information pretty well. If you study and work at it, an A is easily achievable.

She was ok. She was definitely entertaining. I took her for an upper level course (3000) and it was a challenge. You really have to put in work when it comes to exams. I didn't know what to study for and with the large amount of  material and limited questions and didnt know where to focus, which is painful when you have 3 other classes

I really enjoyed this class. I was skept to take it at first bc I thought it would be hard. She provides a lot of info so know how to take good notes. Most exciting thing we got to do was touch a human brain. Final isn't cumulative so that's a plus. You'll be thankful you took her class.
Amazing, amazing, amazing... did I say amazing

One of my favorite professors so far. She makes class enjoyable, all exam material is covered in lecture, questions are straightforward. Study with a friend and quiz each other. Don't lose hope if you don't do well on the first exam, because they get progressively easier (don't get cocky and not study, either). But youcan get an A just by cramming.

This professor truly wants her students to succeed, and if you are going to take Psych 3313, she is the professor I would recommend. The information in her slides is more than enough and she allows time for questions on lectures before and after class. Be ready to study hard for the tests, if you do so, you will succeed!

Kristin is a great professor. She truly wants every student to succeed and will give you the materials to do so. She provides organized notes to follow, and attendance is not mandatory. I recommend attending each lecture, however, because they are interesting and helpful.

Definitely a LOT of material. Her lectures and ppts. are super organized so you don't have to go to class, but it's worth it to go because she makes it so interesting. Hardly any HW, grade is based pretty much on the tests but they aren't hard (if you study!) one of the most knowledgeable teachers I've come across. Take her if you get the chance!

Professor Supe is one of my favorite professors I've had at OSU. She's very funny and engaging. You don't need to go to her lectures but most people do because they are so enjoyable. You definitely have to study for this class as the tests cover tons of information. I would definitely recommend you choose her as a professor.

She is an amazing professor. Her assignments aren't hard and the exams are straight from the lectures. Go to her lectures because she will tell you what you dodo not need to know for the exam. Also really helpful if you ask her questions after class and is genuinely interested in getting students to enjoy her class! Very engaging, great professor!

Very good teacher. Very easy tests too. She gives 2 midterms and a final. She's fun and makes the material enjoyable. I went to all the lectures and got really good grades (A), but you don't even have to go to lecture as she puts all her notes online. Very easy and would recommend 1010.

Dr. Supe is hilarious and engaging without trying too hard. She understands that some of the material is boring so she switches things up and interacts with students a lot to keep lectures interesting. I really felt that she wanted us to succeed as opposed to those professors who try to trick their students, and the tests are fair. Take her class!!
Supe is cool. She does a great job lecturing. Not much homework. Come prepared for exams and stay on task with the readings and you should do ok.

Overall great professor. Very organized and clear about what you need to know. Tests are pretty detailed but straightforward and mostly memorization. You don't need to attend class to do well in this class but lectures are interesting and helpful. Would definitely recommend taking her class!
Awesome lectures, fun test questions (integrated hermoine and ron into a few questions on the final), don't have to go to class at all but she makes it fun and its easier to learn from it.

Best professor I've had at OSU.  Great presenter, well organized, and made lecture fun and interesting.  If you can, make sure you take a class with this woman, because quite honestly I consider my experience with her a treat.

hilarious teacher and really enjoys teaching. presents info very well. makes information very clear. taught anatomy and biology to me better than any bio professor at OSU. take this class, but be prepared to study. worth it.
she was such an awesome teacher and made dry, difficult material simple and easy to understand! absolutely loved her.
She is the best psychology professor I have ever had and explains the material so clearly and so well--take her!
She's an awesome lecturer and makes semi-difficult material super easy.  I loved her.

She is really nice and easy to approach. Her quizzes are easy, her class is overall easy. You dont have to go to lectures all the time because it is easy to catch up but the midterms are slightly trickier so study for those. But she is an amazing teacher and makes the class fun.
Solid. As a sophomore I've only had two other good teachers. I enjoyed the class. She showed funny and interesting clips pretty much every day.
Love her!

Kristin was awesome! She was is my favorite teacher thus far. If you ask her a question, she'll give you different examples to make it clearer. She was really nice and really funny. Her notes are very organized and easy to study.

Kristen is an awesome teacher! Coming into college I was extremely nervous but she made the transition to my first Psych class very smooth.  Her quizes are super easy, and if you know the vocab, you'll ace all of the exams. She's always open to talk to and she is easy to approach.  If you have the chance, definitely try and get into her class!

She is very kind and helpful. Her lectures are all based on ppt and there will be class nots to be distributed every class. Attending the class is not necessary, reading the textbook in dorm is enough. but it definately helps to listen to her lecture, cuz it ll be so boring to read the textbook everytime. her lectures are full of funny stuffs!

Kristin is alright. Her lectures are all ppt and she uses a lot of videos. Her lectures are fun and all, but they get to the point where it's TOO fun. Her quizzes are ridiculously easy but are nothing compared to how hard the exam is since she doesn't make them. It's gotten to the point where I'll rather teach myself the material than go to class.

Awesome teacher! Class is pretty much 100% from the book, and so are all the quizzes and tests. READ THE BOOK! If you know the bold and italicized words and key concepts, you will ace the class. It's not always necessary to attend if you read the book, but in harder sections it definitely helps, and sometimes she gives extra credit just for coming!

summary_comment: Professor Miller is highly regarded for his kindness and engagement, though his challenging yet supportive approach requires active participation and resource utilization. Students appreciate his willingness to answer questions, provide extra credit opportunities, and stay after class to assist with understanding complex concepts. His genuine care for student success is evident in his teaching and interactions.

Ratings.comment: Professor Miller is an incredibly kind and engaged instructor. While the class can be challenging, he cares deeply about student success and offers ample support. Using resources like Unstuckstudy alongside the textbook has proven very helpful for exam prep.

Lectures are easy to follow and representative of class exams. Gives lots of extra credit so attend classes and use learning lab hours. If you pay attention in class and do practice problems you're all set.

Great professor! Always in a great mood, willing to answer questions, and has been nothing but kind and welcoming. Genuinely cares about whether students understand the material and whether his teaching methods are fair and useful!

Seth Miller is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is radically welcoming of questions and feedback and makes sure that he is fully answering the questions that you're asking(So many profs struggle with that) He stayed after class multiple times to help me fully grasp concepts. He genuinely loves teaching the class and it shows. W prof.

Dr. Miller is an amazing professor and one of the kindest people I've ever met. He truly cares for his students and wants them to do well. He takes somewhat difficult material and explains it really well. Extra credit for attendance at times. 100% recommend.

Professor did not allow open notes on exams like other sections and often left off equations on midterms. Difficult class if you've never taken stats before. He does not give example problems and his "study guides" are just a list of concepts. Overall, he's a really nice person outside of class but not good at lecturing imo

The class information was very uninteresting to me, but Seth Miller did an amazing job teaching the material. He provided tons of extra credit and encouraged students to go to his office hours and ask him questions. He always reviewed harder chapters with in class activities as well.
This course is incredibly easy, and Quizlet will be your best friend to prepare for the exams. There are three midterms and a final.

Unlike the other sections, the exams are closed-note and in person. Personally I do not really think this is fair, as it is far easier to have notes accessible for this course- without them get ready to actually put in a good deal of work. Dr. Miller is really nice, but I would look for another section.

Miller was the most caring professor I've ever met! He genuinely cares about all his students and will go out of his way to help you succeed. His lectures are fun and engaging and he thoroughly explains any questions we have. With that being said his exams are a but difficult because you have to remember many equations and understand all material.

Dr. Miller is a gentleman. I almost couldn't make it to a midterm because I was stuck in another state, but he let me know we could work things out. I also didn't go to class that often but still got a good grade. As long as you put in the effort, you'll get an easy A for sure.

SO NICE. You can tell he REALLY wants you to succeed and will do anything in his power to make that happen. Class participation is important as it lets him know what he can do to help and also shows that you're listening but he is so, so nice. He deserves professor of the year honestly

He is very passionate and cares about his students and teaches in multiple teaching styles so that everyone can understand the content. There's opportunities for extra credit and resources to do well in the class.
Was the sweetest man I have ever had as a teacher. Very understanding and class was great and easy.

One of the kindest people I have ever met. I don't think I've ever been more excited to attend a class than I am his. If you have him, you are blessed. He is open to literally any questions, moves at a pace that is good for everyone, and truly wants to get to know you. Truly the embodiment of a professor who is aware of mental health.

I had this professor for research methods and data analysis and enjoyed both of them! This is one of the best professors I have had at OSU. Professor Miller really cares about everyone and is ready to help if you have questions. The class is also really organized and super clear. Not too much homework and the tests were fair.

I was excited to take Professor Miller's class because of his good reviews but I was very let down by him. He is extremely hard to ask questions as he does not give you a straight answer to be "fair for everyone". I tried asking questions for clarification but it never helped me so I gave up on asking him. I wouldn't take any of his classes again.
Awesome guy, awesome teacher, peal of professing abilities

GOAT in human form. I truly do not know why this professor doesn't have a perfect rating. He is knowledgeable about the content and truly cares about his students. Dr.Miller is a paragon of virtue among a sea of miserable, overworked, and on-edge professors.
GOAT in human form.
He TRULY cares about his students

I was blown away by how compassionate Dr. Miller was, and by how open he was to questions. You can tell that he legitimately cares about his students and making sure that you understand the material. The class can be tricky but Dr. Miller structures lectures so that everyone has a chance to ask any questions, and he works hard to answer them.
Professor Miller is awesome! He really cares about his class and making sure everyone understand the materia thoroughly. I would 100% recommend and plan to take another class with him in the future.

professor miller is easily one of the best profs ive had at osu. he is super caring towards his students and genuinely wants nothing but success for his students. he always strives to make sure that everyone is accommodated.

Seth Miller is an amazing professor and you should definitely take his classes. He is extremely clear and really wants his students to succeed. Asking questions after class and taking advantage of office hours is a good resource for his classes because he is super helpful one on one. Test questions are clearly worded and he gives tons of resources.

Hard to fall behind. Go to class, ask questions. Not necessary to read textbook-he covers it all in lecture. Debatable if I'd take again as it was painful to stay awake in class. Miller is so thorough I couldn't pay attention to his lengthy explanations. Not sure it's a bad thing that he covers material at snail speed though-made class very easy!
Love the class!

Dr. Miller is great! The class was pretty easy as long as you study the formulas and do your work. The only time I struggled a little was for the final, but I still ended up with an A. He gave us chances for extra credit and if you did all of that you could earn up to 5% added to your final grade which was awesome. I highly recommend him!

Seth is a great professor and is out to help his students. I found this course to be sometimes tricky to follow as there were different websites for each type of assignment. There also isn't much graded!

I do warn anyone signing up for psych 4508 that it is a statistics-heavy course, which I somehow did not gather beforehand lol. However, Seth is great! Even online he was very clear and accessible with online lectures, feedback, and review sessions before the exams. As always, highly recommend him as a professor!

The best professor I have ever had thus far at OSU. He is very eager to help and cares about his students. I was nervous about this class being difficult but Professor Miller is excellent at making his topics clear and concise and explaining things. Everyone should definitely take a class with him!

Professor Miller is one of the best professors I've had, not only in my psych major but at OSU overall. I had him for 2220&2300. He really cares about his students and makes it clear he is always happy to help. He sends a lot of reminders out about upcoming assignments which is nice. I would 15/10 recommend him as a professor.

Probably one of my favorite professors so far. Good at explaining the concepts and goes above and beyond to help his students succeed. Assignments and exams are fairly easy, and there is extra credit as well. I would for sure take Dr. Miller again and would recommend him to anyone.

By far one of my favorite professors on campus so far. He is extremely clear and easy to understand, and always makes sure to clarify or help if needed. He also gives nice examples and walks through each step to make sure concepts are well-understood. The class was also extremely lax, and although easy, was very important. 10/10, definitely choose!
amazing prof who really cares about his students.

Dr. Miller truly wants his students to pass. During COVID his class is online and is entirely asynchronous aside from optional review sessions. He sends out reminders about tests and homework. I have taken him for two different classes and for both his lectures covered all the content and I never had to read the books. No complaints from me!!!

Dr. Miller is hands down one of the best professors I have had. There aren't many assignments so missing a few can really hurt your grade but they're all easy. He has great recorded lectures & is amazing at explaining things in so many ways. Responds to emails quickly & gives great outlines for exams. I cannot express how much I enjoyed his class.

He is such an angel. Replies to your emails in rapid timing, and he literally explains everything in 10 different ways. He's extremely understanding, and his tests are pretty easy. The textbook is basically in the lectures. He is also a great online teacher, and his recorded lectures are relatively short. Gives you tons of practice, too.

Professor Miller was a great professor. He gives extra credit just for showing up to class. He is constantly checking up on his class during lecture to make sure everyone is understanding what is happening, he answers emails very quickly, and he is overall a very nice guy. I definitely recommend him! I had him for both Psych 2300 and Psych 2220!

Hes a really nice professor and you can tell he cares about what hes teaching. He often pauses lectures to make sure everybody is on the same page. His exams are easy if you go to lectures. He also quick to answer emails.

Dr. Miller is a good lecturer and he really cares about his students. Sometimes he overexplains and makes the material more confusing, but overall he is a good professor. This course is test heavy, but I don't think it's hard as long as you read the book and go to lecture. His exams are reasonable, not difficult. I think it's an easy class.

You can tell that Dr. Miller really cares about the content of the course and also helping his students. However he is a little inflexible when it comes to extenuating circumstances. There are few opportunities for grades outside of exams and all of his 'extra credit' assignments put together are worth less than 1 point. His exams are unnecessarily

He is a wonderful professor who really cares about teaching. Hes extremely easy to reach and explains everything well. However his class is easy but unforgiving. Exams count for 70% and there are only 3 exams. The homework isnt a guaranteed 100% since the questions can be really tricky. Take it with Yocom, she gives a lot more extra credit.

He is a very fair professor who cares a lot about making sure his students understand the material. You will hear him ask if theres anything he can do to clarify like 15 times per class lol. Exams are straight from the slides and practice problems. Absolutely would recommend!

Explains things very well, all slides available online, and the textbook is useful if you don't understand what's going on in class. Like other users said, we only have 3 exams and 6 HW. The extra credit he offers is useless. If you study well though and understand definitions/content, you'll do very well. I missed class a lot and got an A, so dw

Dr. Miller is great. He consistently offers up the opportunity for students to ask questions during lectures and answeres those questions well. The only frustrating thing about his classes is they are graded by very little ( 6 homework assignments and 3 exams), leaving very little room for mistakes to be made.

I LOVE DR. MILLER!!! one of the nicest, most caring professors I've had!! You definitely need to go to lecture, even though he post the slides, he always thoroughly explains concepts and makes sure everyone understands. he always says "does that make sense?" before moving on. homework is easy and the stat learning lab is great! good class!
Dr. Miller gives really heavy lectures with a very robotic voice. He is really good at answering questions and clarifying topics.

He was great and class wasn't hard at all. He's nice and is very happy to explain things again if you're confused. There's 6 easy HW assignments and 3 exams total. Honestly, I skipped class a lot and did very well. The lecture slides are good enough, but some topics are harder, so the textbook helps if you're confused! Overall, I recommend.

Prof. Miller is really knowledgable and wants his students to succeed. His exams are very straightforward (he doesn't try to trick you). His lectures can be a bit boring but it's more the material than his teaching. There's not much we're graded on so it's important to do well on the exams but the exams aren't very hard.
A great professor. Lectures can be really boring, but he wants students to understand the concepts and succeed in the class.
Amazing professor. Very clear and super nice. Lecture and notes are enough to pass the class without the textbook!

The nicest professor that I have had. Going to his office hours helped me do a lot better on his exams. He is there for you as long as you have questions. There is homework but its generally pretty easy. He gives a study guide before exams and random attendance extra credit. Overall a pretty chill guy.

Prof Miller is the nicest professor I've ever had. The lectures can be dry and boring but he's very good at explaining and making sure you understand the material. Exams are a big part of the grade but he gives good study guides. He gives extra credit but it doesnt do much. The material is stats so its still hard but if you have to take it take him

He is one of my favorite professors here at OSU by far! He is so kind and caring and always smiling! He is willing to go the extra mile to make sure his students understand. If you study the information he gives you and study the review guide you should be set. He is very clear on what you need to know. I highly recommend him!

He is a really nice professor and he cares his students a lot. He would like to help his students even the questions are not from his lecture. His lecture is a bit boring, but easy to understand. He provide about 2% extra credit for participate in class. The exams are not hard at all. We all like him and m taking his 2300 this semester.

I hate statistics, and I am bad at statistics, but professor Miller really does his best to assure that everyone understands the material. Seven homeworks and four exams; exams are all multiple choice and the homework is cake, but if you forget to do one your grade is doomed. He is super energetic, and you can tell how passionate he is about class

Seth Miller is absolutely fantastic! He shows a genuine interest in helping his students be successful and offers extra credit for attendance some days, so I suggest always going to class. Gives out good practice activities in class to help better understanding of concepts. Lectures can be a little boring, but very informative and clear.

One of my favortie professors. Can be pretty robototic sounding at times but one of the most genuinely caring teachers Ive had. Material is clear and the study guides posted helps a lot when studying for exams. This class is not hard. Once you get a couple concepts down, you are bound to pass. Highly recommend Seth Miller.. easy A for me!

Seth is the most kind-hearted, welcoming soul. He's honestly been one of my biggest role models in college, as Ive had him for 2200 and 4508. He will do everything in his power to help you succeed and get as much as you can out of the class. You NEED to take a class with him before you graduate!

Seth Miller is the most caring and thoughtful professor I have ever encountered. He stops and asks "does that seem fair to everyone?" as well as "any questions or concerns, or anything I can do to help out??" and genuinely appreciates questions. He has always answered my questions on Carmen or email promptly and with great detail.

Very nice guy. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he does take attendance randomly for extra credit. Tests aren't that hard as long as you study a little bit. He is very robotic and reads off the slides, but does his best to answer any questions you have.

Seth Miller is the best professor I've ever had! He is smart, caring and very encouraging. He truly cares about every student in his class. He makes the concepts of this (already pretty easy) class very clear. If you have to take Psych 2220, make sure you take it with him.

Seth is VERY nice. He's kind and caring (yes, boring too & reads the slides), but there were so many people who didn't use a graphing calculator and struggled. PLEASE. USE. THE. GRAPHING. CALC!!! Goddamn, I can't stress this enough. He's nice when explaining things though :) Tests you really gotta study for, but they aren't "hard", just medium

Seth is one of the most thorough professors I've ever had. He definitely loves his job and he makes sure that students' questions are answered fully. Although attendance is not mandatory, he does offer extra credit throughout the semester. The exams are extremely easy and if you pay attention to the lectures, you'll be sure to pass.

Professor is a great guy. Kind of acts like a robot but really cares about his students. Quizzes every couple units are easy 100s. Exams are MC and really straight forward as he gives a review for each one. Lectures are boring, occasional attendance for extra credit. TAKE HIM!!!!!!

Easiest class ever, but Dr. Miller is EXTREMELY robotic and boring. He has you read the textbook outside of class, but everything from the textbook is covered in his lecture slides so it's not needed. Super easy class though, so if you're okay with a boring professor he's a solid choice.

The material for the class is unbareably dry, but Prof. Miller does his best to make it interesting. You can tell that he is passionate about what he teaches and truly wants his students to enjoy and understand the material. He occasionally takes attendance for extra credit, but showing up isnt necessary to do well. Just do the exam study guides.

Prof Miller is such a caring, goofy guy. He's incredibly helpful, his homework questions are important for your grade though, but the slides make passing very very easy. He's also very transparent and willing to hear criticism/have discussion. Extremely respectable & respects his students in turn.

Seth is alright but the class set-up is HORRIBLY. The way the class is set up, each homework question is weighted just as heavily as each EXAM question, and EVEN MORE THAN EACH QUESTION ON THE FINAL EXAM. The homework is usually about 10 questions long and 5% of your grade, making it impossible to learn from your mistakes and get a good grade.

He is the most caring professor I have ever had! If you ask him a question, he will make sure you understand it and even will make examples for you. His lecture is not so fun probably because data analysis is not a fun class, but he manages to make all things clear and easy to understand.

Seth makes everything extremely clear. Hes a little awkward but it truly works to his advantage in this class. 7 quizzes, 4 exams, some reading to aid with the quizzes but i never read the full chapters. Quizzes are very easy but make sure you actually do them because there arent very many and they have a large impact on your grade (5% each).

Really nice guy, always eager to talk to you and help you out. Tests are fair, and everyone usually does really well. If you study then you'll do fine, but you do need to study. Participation extra credit at random, so show up! He doesn't grade on a lot of things, so your extra credit will actually help boost you a lot. One of my favorite profs!

Important to go to class for extra credit and in-class activities that really help with material. I did not buy a textbook and did not go to review sessions, but I did fine. I really enjoy Seth's teaching, as he is very caring and committed to students' understanding. As others have stated, he is quite robotic in nature, but in the best way.

One of the best, kind hearted, genuinely interested professors I've had at OSU. He will take a lot of time out of his lecture to make sure you're understanding and makes the environment a welcoming place. I went through some personal troubles and had an exam the next day, but after emailing him he let me take it the next day. Genuinely cares.

such a nice guy! the material was super challenging, but he really tried to help and make it easier. have to study a ton for his exams. gives review sheets and in class practice to help. had lots of time to do the online homework, made that as simple as he could. material is just plain old difficult, but would take another class with him any day!

Prof. Seth Miller is AMAZING. I absolutely adore him. His lectures flow logically and he breaks down all the concepts with examples, repetition and questions so you learn and retain them. He will go above and beyond to care for all his students and make sure no one gets left behind. Don't take this class from any other prof. 11/10!!

One of the best professors I've ever had. Tests/HW incredibly easy & straightforward. Lectures nonmandatory, he reads directly off the slides & gives EC for attendance on days w review activities. Weird dude but so kind/understanding. Once gave me 3 pts back on an exam where i wrote the right answer and circled the wrong one. 10/10 would take again

NOT TAKING ONE OF HIS CLASSES IS DOING A DISSERVICE TO YOURSELF. I had optometry school interviews & family emergencies whilst in his class, and he could not have been more understanding & accommodating. In a culture of professors who couldn't care less about their students, he will undoubtedly go the extra mile for you. (also no attendance grade)
Class is pretty boring but Seth definitely cares about his students and makes sure they understand the material. Probably the most caring professor I've had yet.

Pretty monotone lecturer and dreaded going to that class everyday because of how boring it was. Class is relatively easy and extra credit is sometimes given out for attendance. Do the homework and end of chapter problems for exam practice and you'll be fine.
I've had several classes with Seth, he is the best. He makes sure that everyone understands it all. Tests need some heavy studying, but not impossible. He's great!

You can tell he cares about teaching and likes what he does, but he doesn't necessarily care about your progress in his class. Lectures are extremely boring, and usually not very helpful as far as learning the material goes. It's easier to teach yourself the material and pray for the best on the exams.

He is super caring. I don't know what other people are saying. Data analysis is a boring class, yeah it's gonna be monotone but he's one of the most caring profs I've ever had. He deserves way more credit than he's given.

Seth was one of the nicest profs I've had. He really cares about his students and always asks if anyone has any questions. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he often gives extra credit for showing up. Would recommend!

Run awaaay! Dr. Miller is a good guy, knowledgeable, and enjoys his job... but, maybe to a fault. There is no sense in going to class because he will trail off topic or give you information he will later tell you that you "didn't need to know." The tests are hard and time in class is insanely boring. You can tell he's sweet so I hate to rag, but no

Dry lectures. He tries to be funny, which is respectable. Super nice guy, and loves his job. He also cares a lot about students doing well which is really nice. Overall if you study the lecture notes and come to class to learn stats you'll do great. He's a really great guy

Professor Miller loves the material and loves teaching.  Class wasn't too bad, 3 exams each worth 25% and homework worth 25%.  Final was cumulative, but the class average was a B.  Would definitely recommend, one of the most passionate teachers I've had at OSU and very interesting subject to learn about.

Overall not an extremely hard class if you read the notes very carefully. He reads directly from the slides but it is still worth going to class because he gives extra credit for attendance and the in-class activities are super helpful. Seth is very enthusiastic about stats, easily accessible, and wants to help! Best professor for PSYCH2220.

Dr. Miller is great! He is super nice and although his lectures can get boring he is very caring/open to helping anyone who is having trouble. Grade consists of 3 Exams (65%) and a few online homework assignments, which definitely require attention to do well (35%). Extra-credit for attending class too. Study and do homework well and get an A.

He is quirky and kind of weird but he's a nice guy who cares about his class. Sometimes the quizzes and tests seemed harder than they needed to be, but overall the material was just way denser and more math based than I expected. Seth is very into it though and tries to make you interested too. He is defintiely willing to talk and help if you need.

Seth is an incredible guy! He does his absolute best to make sure he's explaining everything clear enough so that everyone understands. He is definitely the kindest professor I've had so far. He explains his grading style in depth so you understand why you got the grade you did. He's great and I would love to take him again!

Dr. Miller is so friendly. He is a bit boring but he is so kind and is extremely approachable. He always makes sure everyone knows what is going on and is encourages people to challenge him and ask him to explain things differently. Awesome professor.  Some pretty simple homework assignments and tests are totally fair.

He is such a great guy! He cares a lot about your grade and loves to answer questions. He is very helpful. There is weekly homework, which I thought was a little difficult but overall it was an easy class.

Take a class with Seth Miller if you want a teacher who will go out of their way to help you understand the material. Seth is super friendly, has a positive attitude, and truly enjoys teaching. Also, he posts grades faster than most instructors I've had and is very fair -- if an exam question is subpar, he'll make it bonus points.

Go to class, he gives random extra credit just for attendance. He's kind of a robotic lecturer, but in a good way. It's like watching an extremely well rehearsed ted talk. He's a very fair grader, very nice, and obviously wants students to pass. Only two midterms, a final, and a couple HW assignments determine the grade though.

Random in-class attendance for extra credit. I never went, I hate stats. He is strange but cool, this is my second class with him. I had to study extra from the book just because it's math. He does a good job at getting practice for the people who go to class.
Would never be able to focus in class. Reads word for word on slides and I can never pay attention.  Very dry lectures and doesn't do enough in class activities to help us understand the content.

Professor Miller is helpful and wants you to pass! If you have problems with homework or have a question about anything you can go to his office hours and he will sit down and do your homework with you or walk through whatever your question may be. He gives extra credit for attending class so I would recommend you go for easy points.

He's very excited about teaching and his enthusiasm makes the boring material bearable. He wants to make sure that every student understands the material before moving on and answers all questions very well. I really liked having a teacher that actually looked like they enjoyed what they were talking about, instead of just blandly reciting words.

I really, really like Seth's class.  Great lecturer, with youthful enthusiasm and a genuine interest in his subject and teaching.  I'd definitely recommend him for anyone needing to take 2300, which all psych majors at OSU need.

Dr. Miller was an incredible professor and a genuinely great person.  He really cares about his students.  His lectures are a bit dry, but his positive, outgoing attitude makes them bearable.  His class is very straightforward and to the point.  The best professor I have had at OSU, thus far.  This man is an angel.

Content is boring but if you study hard for  the tests you should be able to pass with at least a B. If you attend class tests are definitely easier and material is easier to review. Text book questions are sometimes in the homework, but I did not necessarily need it to study for the tests, his power points are pretty helpful.

Despite his dry sense of humor (which I enjoyed), Dr. Miller is a good teacher. His lectures are extremely informative, the exams are straightforward, and with minimal studying (maybe 2 hours per exam), this class is an easy B. He does take attendance grades about 10 times throughout the semester, so be ready to show up. Textbook is a must, rent it

Dr. Miller is a little awkward but definitely a great professor; the material is just incredibly boring. He takes random attendance with a couple drops allowed, so I stopped going to class after I got the credit. All I did was study the notes before the exams and got a solid A in the class. Never bought or had to use the book.

Nicest professor I've ever had. The material for this course is rather boring but he tries his best to make it interesting...I struggled to stay awake in class. As long as you read the book before the test you will be fine!!

Dr. Miller is a great professor who works hard to make sure students understand the material he teaches. He is obviously very passionate about psychology, and it helps make the dry material more interesting. I would definitely take him again.

Great instructor. He regularly asks if anyone has questions. Homework & exams are straightforward. The material is really dry but professor Miller does his best to keep students interested during class.

He is a great teacher! Most of the time you feel bad for not paying attention in class, because of his  enthusiasm and love for the subject. Respects, and treats the students as equals. Very fair. Tests are not tricky, if you study, you will do great! If you mess up the homework but he sees that your thinking was correct, you'll still get points.:)

Lectures are very clear. He stops for questions regularly, so nobody gets lost. He really makes an effort to make the material bearable, and is aware it's dry. Gives activities with the option to work together, but doesn't force groups. Everything is straightforward- no surprises.
Very sweet guy. Really wants you to understand. Material is very dry but he tries to make it less so.

Seth Miller is very nerdy. He is also very nice. His class wasn't difficult and I would take it again and recommend. It is boring, but that just comes with the material. You can easily get away with skipping class the entire semester and just go in for the exams if that is what you are looking to do.
