His tests are extremely difficult and lectures are very boring.   All he does is read from the power point. I recommend taking this course with a different professor. After the first exam 15 students dropped the class.

This class itself was boring, but Seth really tries his best to be clear and helpful. If you have any questions, go to office hours or email him and he'll respond right away. Attendance is taken at 10 random times throughout the semester. The textbook isn't absolutely necessary, but if you don't go to class often you should get it and read it.

Straightforward test questions, if you know the basics of the material then the questions are super easy. His enthusiasm makes up for the dry material. Always looking to be as helpful as possible. Going to class helps at the end, but the participation grades for the 10 activities throughout the semester

Professor Miller was by far my favorite professor of this semester! He was super clear in lectures and would answer any questions with great feedback. I especially admired his enthusiasm towards trying to make a dry topic bearable. He really goes above and beyond for students. I'd recommend his class to anyone needing a Research Psch credit.

Really, really nice guy. The material isn't too difficult to begin with, but he walks you through anything that could pose a problem. You can tell he enjoys teaching and is happy to help any student. The class isn't too interesting, but I think that would be the case regardless of who was teaching it.

The subject matter is a bit dry, but he really does his best to communicate it well to the students. Sometimes I think he gets caught up and might make it seem a little more confusing than it is, but that's rare. He is incredibly helpful, always encouraging questions, giving great responses and always willing to help you understand the material.

His research methods class basically saved my semester. He wants his students to understand the material and is more than willing to go over the material again or in a different way to explain it. Exams are super easy. The class is a requirement for psych majors, but I would definitely recommend taking research methods with Seth over someone else.

summary_comment: Dr. Leber is highly regarded for his straightforward teaching style and fair exams, which closely follow the study guides he provides. Students find his lectures engaging and often entertaining, with clear grading criteria and minimal coursework. While some note that the class pace can be slow, the overall consensus is that it is an easy A for those who put in the necessary effort.

Ratings.comment: It is an easy A if you put time into learning his study guide. Dr. Leber creates his exams based on the study guide he provides in class. His exam is straightforward, no tricky questions. He loves to put on some silly, funny answers on the exams as well. Grade is based on 2 MTs with 40 questions each and one cumulative final with 80 questions.
super super nice! i loved dr. Leber, he was super kind and understanding and extremely clear in what will be on exams. everything is straight forward!

Dr. Leber is a great professor! Truly one of the smartest and kindest professors I have had. He has clear grading criteria and his exams are very fair-2 exams and one cumulative final (all MC). Very little coursework. He explains difficult topics really well and is more than willing to go over anything. Def recommend!

Dr. Leber is a very enthusiastic and caring professor. His 80 minute lecture tended to drag on a bit, but overall was a fun course. The exams were very fair, and the quizzes and paper are essentially graded for completion and take up a decent percentage of the grade. If you pay attention in lecture and do assignments, it's a pretty easy A.

All the lectures are recorded which is a lifesaver!! 60% of the class is divided between 3 exams but if you study they aren't difficult I had a 99% literally the whole class until the final which dropped my grade to a 97% because I didn't study much for the final. He makes class interesting so the lectures aren't hard to listen to at all.
Grade is mainly test based and communication outside of classroom is not that great.

Dr. Leber was awesome. Genuinely enjoyed his class. He's so funny and his sense of humor is perfect for engaging college kids. Attendance isn't mandatory and lectures are recorded which is great. Exams are all multiple choice and totally fair. Easy class for Neuro majors.

Dr. Leber was such a great professor! You can tell he is very passionate about what he teaches and ALWAYS answered student questions. The pace of the class was very manageable (sometimes a bit slow but I can't complain about that) and he gave helpful study guides for exams. As long as you attend lecture and do the study guide, it's an easy A!

Dr. Leber is funny and just a very welcoming person in general. I was never scared to ask him a question! His quizzes and exams were very fair, and he graded papers very leniently too. I was not a big fan of the weekly breakout room session, but I understand why he did them.

We did group discussions (breakout rooms) that were worth a lot, but it was basically if you showed up and submitted something, you were fine. Tests were fair, he's honestly just such an awesome guy. So understanding during the pandemic, definitely the teacher I'd recommend for this class!

legit a dad figure. Such a great guy. I will take any class he offers because he makes class so much fun. not only is it fun, he makes neuroscience easy to understand and is always super helpful. He tries to make his class a "sanctuary" and it really is. Seriously though, love this guy. You won't regret taking his class.

The class itself is not terribly hard, however, IT'S SO BORING. His voice is monotone which makes paying attention to the already boring material very hard. He claims he only tests on material from his study guide and then puts random material on his exams that were not from the study guide. Good guy, BAD teacher!
I LOVED DR LEBER!! I always recommend him to anyone. I just studied the slides and I was fine. He's really not out to get you.

He's really cool, passionate and interesting. Recommend him. His lecture consists of: 50% jokes (ehich I really cannot always get) and cute puppies or some other animals, 20% about personal experience, mostly academic experience, 30% real lecture which is awesome. Class is not hard, just pay attention and rebiew carefully, then you'll ace it.

Dr. Leber is amazing, he's a really cool guy, and he reminds me of Shaggy from Scooby-Doo. Psych 3513 was literally a joke. Just read the slides and make sure you know all the terms on the study guides he gives and you'll get an A.

Professor Leber is very passionate about cognitive psychology, and would often share personal research stories, which definitely enhanced the course. His exams were based off the lectures, but it helped to look up things in more depth in the textbook, as the exam questions sometimes required a deeper level of understanding.
Great guy, explains everything well. Does call out people for cell phone usage but he is genuinely a great lecturer. Not many assignments and exams were very doable. Great class!

I LOVE Dr. Leber. He plays animal videos before each class and he's just such a pure human. He really enjoys psychology, and he does his best to make the material interesting. This class is very simple and he posts study guides for each exam. The final is cumulative, but fill out the study guide and you'll be fine. He cracks jokes a lot too.
His lectures can be a little dry, but the class is super easy to get an A in.

I loved having Dr. Leber! He was super interested in the subject material and made a long lecture fun with his humor. Tests are super fair, he gives a study guide and as long as you understand the material, you should have no problem doing well. With a slight curve, I got above 100 on one of his midterms. He's a really nice guy, too.

Let me at least give hime this: he's a super nice guy. However that's where the list of positives ends. His lectures are dry, I could barely make it through the class and dreaded going to it every day. Half way through the semester I stopped going. He obviously tries, but this was the single most boring and hated class I've ever had.

Leber gives lectures with really interesting examples (often old psych experiments) and is funny and a very cheesy way. His tests are fair but have some questions that you would only know from in-class lectures. He had a few HW articles with short quizzes that were really just checking if you read the article.

He teaches the material well because he's an expert in the field (he has a lab, does experiments). Relates things to real life and his in class demonstrations help in remembering for the exams. Has quizzes, papers, and midterms. All are reasonable. You will learn from his class.

Professor Leber is a really nice guy and always plays cute animal videos before class. He seems to genuinely care about the class and although Cog Neuro material can be dull, he does his best to keep everyone somewhat engaged.

He knows a lot and will help you if you ever need anything. Lectures are not too fast, has powerpoints online, grading is straight forward, you will want to take him again. (keep an eye out for his jokes, subtle at times but hilarious if you get it) plus he's tall and kinda cuute..

He was a super nice guy! Always started class with a cute animal video. Lectures were kinda long and dry, heavy focus on research studies. Had a few essays and discussion posts on studies. Exams weren't bad, always had a few fun extra credit questions (ex. think of a clever psych related pun or joke)

Dr. Leber is a really really nice person, but not the best lecturer. His class can get very dry and he seems to talk about some other things instead of focusing on the materials. He also forgot about things or couldn't fully explain everything  clearly, but he is always there to help and there is a curve for the grades! Yeah! Nice guy!

Dr. Leber is wonderful. He starts off every class with cute puppy videos and tells a lot of funny bad jokes through class. He tries to be as helpful as possible and is pretty approachable. If you go to class you won't need the textbook (and if you must have a textbook, the old addition is fine). Good guy, and good class!

May just be my learning style, but his explanations were confusing to me even with knowledge from other psych courses. Maybe because he often gets sidetracked. Probably will still get an A but not one of the clearest profs. Dry sort of humor. Does give quizzes and DB postings on 4 articles throughout semester. Can't fail quizzes if read article.

Dr. Leber is funny, interesting, and knowledgeable. I loved his class, but the lectures could be very dry at times. If you don't like Psych classes that focus on experiments to teach, you won't like the class. Overall, very good.
He makes some classes very interesting and some extremely boring. Study guides are very helpful and if you do them you will do well on the tests for sure. I would definitely recommend this class!

Teacher is very nice, he does give you a study guide that was useful to a degree, don't expect a curve or additional extra credit. His exams are worth alot of your grade, so if you fail one your practically screwed. I wouldn't recommend unless you have a basic understanding of the subject already. Also his lecture s are very boring.

Dr. Leber is an insanely nice dude and his lectures are genuinely interesting. He often started days with a video of puppies to cheer everyone up. Quizzes are straightforward and provides a comprehensive study guide for the exams, but the content is difficult. Would still highly recommend him!

summary_comment: Dr. Wegener is highly regarded for his kindness, passion, and genuine concern for student success, though his teaching style can be challenging for beginners due to his tendency to overcomplicate explanations. Students appreciate his willingness to help and the variety of assessment methods, but find his lectures difficult to follow and often recommend being self-reliant and resourceful.

Ratings.comment: Professor is very nice and is caring and wants everyone to feel comfortable asking questions and is very approachable. However, he tends to overcomplicate explanations of different concepts. He doesn't know how to simplify it for someone who's a beginner. It is important to be self reliant  and resourceful in order to be successful.

Dr. Wegener is a fantastic professor. He explains the topics really well and is always willing to answer questions. Only grades are 4 exams (not cumulative) and 13 open-note assignments (can drop 3 worst). Definitely one of the kindest and smartest professors. He truly cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. Definitely recommend!

Dr. Wegener is very kind and passionate about what he teaches but his lectures are very hard to understand. He seems to know what he is talking about but does not explain it in an understandable way. He also grades on a Z-table. He also uses many symbols interchangeably without telling us they are the same thing. nice guy, but not the best lecturer

He is nice but not a good lecturer: explains things in abstract, confusing ways. 3 exams and 1 written assignment make up your grade. Each question is worth 3 points, with 3 short answer questions (16 pts). The mean for the first exam was 66/100. Attendance is not graded, but slides are not helpful. Textbook may help, I didn't use it.

Dr. Wegener is a very competent researcher - but not a phenomenal lecturer. His tests can be really tough and the material isn't always explained effectively. He implements a curved grading scale on assignments because most people don't do very well. Not that recommended unless you really want to learn about Attitudes and Persuasion.

Professor Wegener made the material as interesting as he could!! Tests can be tough! So read and re-read the books and his vague lecture outlines! He gets very specific about theories and major experiments discussed in class!
Dr. Wegener is fantastic, but a little boring to listen to at 8 a.m. He is an expert in the field of attitudes and persuasion, and it's easy to learn from him.

If you have taken some stats before, maybe you'll be fine. If this is your first taste of stats, good luck. He said that he would stay away from math and deal with "concepts".  That seems to have amounted to: you don't have to memorize formulas.  But we NEVER get anything explained using concrete ex's. it's always abstract.

wasnt bad definitely better than what youd get if you took STAT 514 instead His first exam took about 1 hour 30 minutes longer for us to finish than he had planned. He acted shocked that we werent done, and kinda insulted us saying his undergrads get the same LENGTH of test, which means nothing.

This class is basically stat for psych majors, and I'm so glad I took it!  I hate stat, but Dr. Wegener made it so easy to understand and he cut out a bunch of the stuff we were "supposed" to go over, because he said we'd never need it.

dr. wegener was teriffic.  he has an amazing amount of knowledge and experience in this subject.  he communicate very well and teaches in an exciting manner.  he makes sure that everyone can understand and master the materail.  i would recommend taking a c
Yeah he was very cool.  He was always pleasant to deal with and seemed genuinely interested in student's concerns.
No Comments

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Quantitative and Statistical Methods in Psychology

summary_comment: Professor Cheavens is highly regarded for her engaging and entertaining lectures, which make the subject matter accessible and enjoyable. Students appreciate her approachability, passion for the content, and willingness to help, often recommending her class enthusiastically. While some note that attending classes is beneficial due to additional announcements and pop quizzes, her overall teaching quality is consistently praised.

Ratings.comment: Prof. Cheavens is a bright teacher that cares about her students and the subject. I would have no problem taking her again. Beware that she posts an abridged version of the slides online and showing up to every class will help because it's where online pop quizzes are announced and the exams are pretty tricky that contain fairly specific questions.

AMAZING professor. She is extremely intelligent and is the author of the textbook needed for class. There are some exam questions from the textbook not covered in class, but I did not read it in much depth and still did well on the exams. She will also curve the exam if the average is low. Lectures are fun and assignments are graded very easy.

I'm obsessed with this woman. Do I want to be her protege? Do I want to be her bestie? Do I have a crush on her? Yes all of the above... it's very confusing. I know this says absolutely nothing about her teaching, but I do highly recommend everyone take positive psych with her she's great.

Prof Cheavens was one of my favorite teachers I've had at OSU! She is so funny and makes it so easy to pay attention and participate in her class. She made everyone feel welcome to speak up and share opinions during lecture. Final grade was made up of quizzes, a group project and light homework. Would recommend to anyone!!

Easily the best professor I've had at OSU. She is fun, outgoing, and passionate about the content she teaches -- not to mention the material is fascinating in general (coming from a non-psych major). Huge fan & would absolutely take the class again!

My FAVORITE professor at OSU. She is extremely approachable, fun to be around, entertaining with great lectures, and helpful/understanding with any concerns you may have. Always in a great mood and has never come off as standoffish to me. 10/10 would recommend taking one of her classes before you graduate. She is AMAZING!!!

Nice, but personality is standoffish, extra credit of 15 points optional at the end of the semester. attendance non mandatory but she will randomly take attendance throughout the semester the points. 4 papers that can be on anything, only one page, super easy 20 points. Not much reading.

Jenn is by far my favorite professor I have had in college so far. She is funny, engaging, and shows the BEST videos in class. Very willing to help at office hours. Tests are fair, so you have to study if you want a good grade! Attendance is not mandatory but she does do random attendance quizes. Would HIGHLY recommend her to anyone!

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Personality Disorders: Classification, Etiology, and Treatment

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Personality Disorders: Classification, Etiology, and Treatment

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Personality Disorders: Classification, Etiology, and Treatment

summary_comment: The professor has received mixed reviews; some students found him highly engaging and effective, praising his interesting and humorous teaching style and well-organized slides, while others criticized his tardiness in grading and reported receiving lower scores despite hard work.

Ratings.comment: This professor was absolutely horrible and late when it came to grading assignments. Get ready to get low scores on everything if you put in hard work, because that is what he does unfortunately. I was really bummed when I read his reviews because I thought they would be helpful but boy was I wrong.

Prof Wagner is one of the best Psychology professors I have had at OSU. He makes sure to make class interesting and engaging with humor and his knowledge of the subject. The projects for this class are also very engaging and fun to do. I would recommend this class 100%.
Dr. Wagner's class is often interesting and stimulating. The slides are well organized and help a lot with note-taking. Very easy to listen to and learn the materials.

SEI.Subject: PSYCH
SEI.Class Name: Techniques and Topics in Cognitive Neuroscience

summary_comment: Dr. Kays is highly regarded for his engaging and caring teaching style, making his classes enjoyable and manageable despite sometimes dry content. Students appreciate his down-to-earth approach, his willingness to help, and the flexible policies on exams and assignments. While some initial confusion with online setups was noted, his overall impact is overwhelmingly positive, with many students recommending his courses and expressing high satisfaction.

Ratings.comment: I have taken 3 classes with Dr. Kays now and he is my favorite professor at OSU. His classes are so interesting and he actually cares to teach rather than read slides verbatim. Super down to earth and has so much knowledge and experience... I highly recommend taking one of his courses to anyone!

I took abnormal psych online with Dr. Kays. The setup of the course was a bit confusing at times and communication seemed to be lacking. The coursework itself was really easy to manage. There was only one assignment due per week and the exams were very easy if you have read the textbook and watched his lectures! Would take again!

Dr. Kays is such a kind professor. He truly cares about his students, and is very informal with his lecture style. He explains the topics well, and makes the class very easy with open-note midterms and one assignment per chapter (which you can keep doing until you get an 100). Also, his thursday meditations are so calming.

Beginning of the semester was rough just because of exterior things going on but Dr.Kays always tried to make his material as engaging as possible! He was extremely helpful and kind about any situation with his classes. Exams are open note online, and homework you can do till you get 100%. 10/10

A rough semester at the start due to reasons other than academics, but Dr. Kays seems to be a great person and instructor based on his talked about experiences. Very down to earth and informative! Material wasn't the most exciting but not much he could do about that. Favorite part was the meditations before class!
The content is dry but the class is easy and prof Kays has good insight from his experience.

He's an extremely understanding professor! All exams are open note and you have one homework assignment per chapter *but you can do it till you get a 100* super easy class and attendance isn't mandatory!

Dr. Kays was an amazing professor. He truly cares for his students and has been the most personable professor I've had at OSU. He admits that that the material can sometimes be dry for this course, but he makes it as interesting as possible. He doesn't make the course harder than it needs to be. Open book and note exams with all MCQ questions!

Online lectures went suuuper slow and were not all that useful for me. he begins them with mindfulness meditation that he asks questions about on his exams. I only went for those and then left the call and ended with an A. If you do his study guides, it is almost question-by-question correlated to his exams. Easy A. homework is learning curves

Dr. Kays has a lot experience in the field. Ive taken 3 of his classes because I love how he takes the course and applies it to his real world experiences in the field. He listens to concerns about grades and exams. He will modify exam dates and give points back to exams if you email him and think a question is confusing. Exams are open book

The entire grade for this class is based off of 3 exams. They arent very hard & open book, but if you actually want to learn about counseling, he barely teaches. The entire course is reading the book and taking exams with occasional audio lectures. Also, at the end of the semester he put in final grades wrong, which was very stressful.

Dr. Kays is a great professor and you can tell he really cares about his students. At the beginning of every class we do a different meditation to help us relax. There are only 3 exams which are very easy if you fill out the study guide, and other than that your only assignments are inquisitives. Would highly recommend Dr. Kays.

Dr. Kays is one of the best professors I've had. This course not only teaches you a lot about the subject and how to implement it into psychology for patients but also for yourself. I used to be so stressed w school and personal issues but when I went to his Positive Psy class the stress would just go away. Journaling was huge in class! LOVED IT.
Dr Kays is engaging and really knows how to relate to students. Follow syllabus read textbook and enjoy his expertise

Dr. Kays was the greatest professor ever. He teaches the subject matter VERY well and clearly, and makes hysterical comments to try and prevent students from falling asleep. He had the class laughing almost every class period. I highly recommend Dr. Kays. He is one brilliant man! Note: Read textbook for exams. Exams aren't too bad at all.

There are a number of great psych professors at Ohio State and he's one of the better ones.  He doesn't just know the material, he's got a lot of experience in .it, as well.  Always has a good story to tell.  Read the book and go over notes and you'll be fine

Very laid back and nice guy. Attendance is not mandatory, he posts the slides on Carmen and they are extremely helpful. Read and outline the book alone and you will get an A on every exam. This is a very easy honors course, I highly recommend it.

I think he was a temporary professor for psych 100 honors, but honestly I love this man. He keeps it simple and clear, exams are pretty straight forward. I would highly recommend this class, do the readings and you will definitely get an A.
Interesting material presented in an engaging manner...really liked the class and Professor Kays. Bonus is he's a hottie!

Took him for Psychology in Sport, and the class is extremely interesting if your interested in athletics, duh. 2 exams and a final and that was it. Go to class and study the powerpoints. I suggest this to anyone interested.

summary_comment: Dr. Supe is highly regarded for her engaging and entertaining lectures, which help maintain student interest throughout her classes. Students appreciate her clear and organized slide presentations, which facilitate exam preparation. While some find her assessments challenging yet fair, others note her availability and genuine interest in student success, though interactions can sometimes feel one-sided.

Ratings.comment: Attendance isn't required, however there are in-class assignments (that you get credit for if you are there, just points for attending those days). Her lectures are entertaining, and she keeps you engaged the full hour. Most of your grade is off of 3 exams. I earned an A on all three. Show up, pay attention, study a little -- you'll do well.
She is very kind and funny. Her slides are well organized and easy to follow. They make it easy to study for her exams and as long as you study you'll do well.

While she appears to care about her students, I personally did not have many good interactions with professor Supe. She did not seem enthusiastic about helping when I asked her about how I could improve my grade, and any time I talked to her outside of class, I felt like I was burdening her with my time. Some might benefit from her, but I did not.

Just the best. If you have the chance, take her. She's funny, kind, and genuinely cares about the class material and her students. Lecture information is very easy to assimilate, and tests are pretty easy if you pay attention.

Dr. Supe is amazing. I'm a junior and she's the best prof I've had so far. Her lectures are engaging. She helps to make the content relevant and easier to conceptualize. Her exams are the perfect mix of challenging but doable.  I loved this class.

Dr Supe taught a frankly useless class (Gen Ed) in a really cool and helpful way. She played a lot of funny clips to keep us engaged. She was also genuinely interested in us and our personal lives. I had hardly any work outside class.

She's honestly an amazing prof, her lectures are interesting and her tone is engaging. She's the only PSYCH 3313 prof that gives exams, so watch out for that, but I feel like I learned a lot and would absolutely love to be in her class again.

I love Dr. Supe!! Her lectures truly were engaging and fun to go to. Attendance is mandatory in that she does a random, once-weekly TopHat, but it isn't a huge part of the grade. Group projects were manageable, and the weekly Carmen quizzes were application-based. She genuinely enjoys teaching and cares about her students!

Biweekly quizzes for grades and quite a few homework assignments, but very doable. If you watch her lectures and put in a google doc, you can command f to help on quizzes. it is a lot of info but it is not necessarily hard info. be ready for application-based questions more than just facts.

Dr. Supe is genuinely very sweet and caring. I was lucky to have her for launch seminar, which is a pretty boring class, but she made me look forward to it. The assignments are mostly busy work, but the few ones that make you think, she will stay after class to help you if you need. Try to have her if you can, she made 1201 actually bearable.

It's like she wants students to study during breaks (I had exams the day right after fall and thanksgiving break) when they should be with their families/friends! Plus, the course material is pretty hard but she doesn't do anything to make it easier to get a decent grade. Yes, she is a good teacher but honestly, she seems to lack compassion.
Taking 3313 online and asynch and it is not bad. lots of short (

Material was difficult at times for sure, but she was always so kind in the emails if you needed help or had a question. If you take good notes and do decent on the tests, you should be able to get a decent grade. Easy assignments, lowest test dropped. Probably gonna be easier for neuro majors more so than psych majors.

Amazing professor. Explained the material well and was always willing to help with questions. Lectures were prerecorded which sucked. Exams were decent, but some questions were not covered in lecture. Be prepared to study, although its interesting material.

I took Dr. Supe's online psych1100 last spring and had a good experience, so I took psych 3313 this fall- again, I'd recommend her class! While I didn't like this course as much, it was still engaging and easy to manage atop a busy schedule. Modules are organized and you can finish the course early to leave less work during finals.

Dr. Supe is great about encouraging outside learning and is the most understanding professor I've ever had. Her lectures actually make sense and is very willing and able when it comes to questions. Classes can be pretty group work/discussion heavy.

hands down, the nicest professor I have ever had. I had to get accommodations and miss a few weeks of school, and she was such a big help and incredibly understanding. Class is really hard, but she is more than willing to help. Such an amazing person and teacher, and truly cares about her students.

Don't do it! Never make the mistake of taking her summer class, all of us in that class struggling to figure out whats all due in that given week. The readings you do through the chapters is not enough for you to pass the quiz. But it seems like its mostly hard for pysch majors compared to neuroscience majors, so if you are a pyshc major good luck

summary_comment: Dr. Gibbs is highly knowledgeable and passionate about psychology, but his teaching methods are largely outdated, with a heavy reliance on materials from decades ago. While his exams are generally easy due to provided study questions, his lectures are often seen as unengaging and not reflective of current research, making class attendance largely unnecessary. Despite some positive aspects like clear grading criteria and opportunities for extra credit, his outdated approach and lack of critical engagement with modern research limit the overall effectiveness of his teaching.

Ratings.comment: If you can, take this class with someone else. Dr. Gibbs is clearly very passionate about the material, but his teaching is BEYOND outdated. He'll regularly teach concepts that were disproven years ago, and refers to publications from 20 years ago as "recent." Only redeeming quality is that exams were easy as he provides study questions.

Although you can tell that he cares, Dr. Gibbs' class is very outdated. Don't expect to find your grade on canvas at all during the semester. Going to his lectures are pointless, as you can just study the questions he posts and quizlet and still pass the exams with a B. If I had the option, I would take this class with a different professor.

Dr. Gibbs was a great professor for Psychology of Adult Years. He is very knowledgable and caring about the topic, and genuinely enjoys teaching. He has many fun stories and jokes. The layout of the course is very simple, and high success in the course is very attainable as long as you show up to class and read the textbook. Dr. Gibbs.

Dr. Gibbs is incredibly knowledgeable about psychology and gives clear grading criteria/instructions on how to succeed in his course. He is an expert in his field and provides insightful feedback and comments on student work in addition to comprehensive lectures. Exams are fair and I felt well-prepared. I learned and retained a lot in this course!

I have pretty much nothing good to say. He's very passionate about the material and obviously knows what he's talking about (he's friends with half of the psychologists in the textbook it seems) but his teaching is super outdated and he just needs to retire. The exams are easy enough if you study a bit. Coming to class is pointless though.

Attendance was not graded, but he did take it every day to see who actually came to class. Final grade is only based on the three exams and there is opportunity for extra credit. Lectures were insanely boring, if you read the book and use the study questions he provides you will do fine on the exams.

I can tell he's passionate about the subject. But as often as I try to smile and pay attention during lectures, I can't help but feel frustrated when he starts ranting off track. His answers are often really long and vague. Even if you study the 70+ study questions, there will be a lot that he never brought up in class or mentioned on Midterms.

Bless his heart but man he is too comfortable and uncritical about his knowledge and beliefs. He cites single study from 1990s to make confidence causal claims, ignoring the on-going "unrepeatable" crisis in psych research. His old-news-video-collection excludes experience of ppl who aren't cis straight white or well off. Sad and frustrating.

He is a nice guy, don't get me wrong, but he needs to retire. His content is extremely outdated and lectures are a waste of time as you're only tested on bits of it. 95% of everything you need to know is in the textbook, which is hardly covered in class. He takes attendance only to see who is coming to class (he won't help you if you don't attend).

Terrible. Avoid at all costs this class is basically self-taught. You have to read chapters from a textbook since the test is over all of it, but he spends each lecture on around 2 pages. Lecture is WORTHLESS and his lecture really just feel like an old man rambling on without clear idea of what he wants to get across. DO NOT TAKE IF U CAN

Nice guy and all, but not great professor. The reason I gave three stars was because I love studying Adolescent Development (and did well before this class). Very very outdated material is taught. Also uses old school teaching styles, which is fine I guess but dont expect anything on carmen or really for him to use the internet. But he is caring.

Slides and information are very outdated and honestly, problematic. He cited a study that was used to promote conversion therapy, cited another study that claimed that gay adults feel unsatisfied with their life, and used the term transsexual in class. Very little of the material was published within the last 5 years. Information is useless today

AVOID! (grad and undergrad). This class was incredibly frustrating. Read the book or you will not get above a C (that is as low as he goes at least). Lectures consisted of nothing but boosting his own ego & showing clips of "moral exemplars" and "What Would You Do?". Only grades are a paper, presentation, 3 exams, and "discussion Qs" NOT optional.

Obviously knows his stuff, he literally "wrote the book" on developmental morality. However, can be a bit vague and confusing at times, lecture slides do not give much info, and I had to rely on the textbook to really get the necessary information for the exams. Great genuine guy and solid professor

Gibbs is a really great instructor. He really cares about his students and hes really accessible. The content is awesome if youre into developmental psych and its a really laid back upper level psych course since exams are straightforward, easy, and dont count for much of the grade. Highly recommend him if youre looking for an easy A.

There were 3 exams, all multiple choice with 70 questions. Going to class and buying the book are pointless. All you have to do is go on quizlet and study the study questions from the powerpoint he post on Carmen. If you study those it is an easy A. Also does an extra credit book review which is optional.

Okay so the class is super easy if you have taken any basic psych classes before this. I literally tried with every thing in me to pay attention during lectures but they are excruciating. Only grades on 3 exams but has an extra credit paper option. Hes old and his class reflects old psychology methods, etc. Easy A if you dont mind boredom.

Lets just put it this way, hes old. Doesnt curve exams even if no one is getting perfects and no one got a perfect or even within 5 of a perfect on any of the exams. Would avoid him as a professor again or any class he teaches. Even my advisor sighed when I told her I had him lol.

Is not clear when trying to teach; teaches his own views and research instead of what is in the textbook; does not answer questions well; lectures are very boring but he shows a lot of videos; only graded on three tests including final but gives an extra credit book review that saved my grade; READ THE TEXTBOOK; gives study questions for tests

He is pretty long-winded, so lectures last the whole time. He has 3 exams which are based directly off his powerpoint and study questions during lectures. He takes attendance sometimes and will boost grades if you are a regular attendee. He is pretty understanding and if you miss a lecture, you can go to his office hours for a review of it.
He only has three exams and that is it. I liked how he gave us the questions but they were broad compared to the ones on the exams. His lectures were very boring.

Dr. Gibbs does not teach modern psychology. He teaches old psychology that is much more similar to armchair philosophy than modern, scientific psychology. For the love of everything holy, if you take a class from him do not believe that what you are learning is actually psychology!
Lectures were boring, but he gives you study guide question which are helpful for the exams.  Definitely have to read the textbook to pass

Gibbs could be a hot mess. Usually wears a mic that is torn off his shirt every ten minutes because he continues to step on the cord. At least it's a bit of a shock to wake you up from his boring lectures!!  Big mumbler; No need to attend class. Read book, fill out the study guide and you'll do just fine.

Was super boring but somehow got away with an A by reading the book the week before the exam. Don't need to attend class.. there were no participation points given just taken if you need an extra bump at the end of the class. Could've literally fallen asleep in his class

Don't know how its possible but he never actually taught. He talked about what he was going to talk about for 90 minutes!  must read the textbook in order to fill out the study guides. Only ever went to class to get the participation points. extra credit was amazing! reading a book and writing a review can bring your grade from a B+ to an A- exc.

I was not the biggest fan of Dr. Gibbs' class. He seems very nice, and was always very helpful if you had questions. But staying focused in his class was a huge challenge for me. He just wasn't a very engaging or interesting lecturer. Exams were okay, as long as you prepared.

Dr. Gibbs is charming. He wants you to succeed and will help you if you take the time to ask for it. If you the reading beforeclass it makes his lectures much easier to follow. 3 m.c. exams, definitely managable. He is understanding and down-to-earth.

A subtitle for this class: how to live the best life as long as possible. This class was more about adult growth and development than adult psychology. Gibbs is a brillant lecturer and I enjoyed his class greatly. Exams are 90% book reading, 10% lecture. Exams are specific, so do all review questions. Textbook=necessity. Extra credit=available.

Nice guy and easy class. I wish he would have been more engaging and that there was more discussion; he had all these interesting discussion questions on the syllabus but then never really asked them or one person would say something and he would move on. I personally really enjoy discussion so it was a bit disappointing. But overall interesting!

I loved this prof.  He's such a nice guy that cares about his students doing well.  He gives fairly good study guides (tons of work though-70 questions on each one).  His tests really weren't that hard, but you do have to study some.  He gives an extra credit option as well. Grade is based on 3 exams. No comprehensive final. Highly recommended!
He lets the students run the class, as is appropriate in a 600-level course.  Good class.
Really easy class if you do the readings and the paper. Three quizzes, which he gives you all of the questions ahead of time.  Really nice guy and extremely helpful

Prof. Gibbs is a nice older psychologist with a lot of experience in the field.  His lectures are boring, but the class is really easy.  3 midterms are the whole grade - they are 90% from the book, 10% from the lecture.  He gives really good outlines and study guides.  Extra credit opportunities. Minimum time & effort will = A

He doesn't teach anything, the entire class is based on presentations by your classmates.  He doesn't answer questions when you ask him.  He does give you all the test questions beforehand so it's easy but going to lecture is completely useless.
No Comments
I loved him.  He's incredibly intelligent, tells you what to study for, and makes you think.
Great professor, great person.  Helpful and likeable if you give him a chance
Horrible teacher.  Loves to hear his own voice.  Did not teach at all - but expected us to know the material.  Did not offer clarification when asked.

Dr. Gibbs leads an interesting class. You simply go over the assigned readings, & listen to classmates' presentations on papers.  Gives  the questions to all tests at beginning of quarter tho.  Overall, very cool.  His comb over will kill you.

summary_comment: This professor is known for delivering engaging lectures and making class material accessible through fill-in notes and PowerPoint presentations, though the subject matter itself may lack interest. Exams are straightforward and based heavily on class content, making them relatively easy to prepare for with minimal effort. While the professor is generally well-liked and approachable, some students note that attending class is crucial for success due to pop quizzes and the need to stay current with notes.

Ratings.comment: Great class. There is a midterm, 4 quizzes, group project, and an exam. He gives you fill in notes, so you need to go to class. He tries to make class fun, but the material isn't very interesting. Exams are all m/c, t/f, matching and very easy, as long as you put in a little time to review (the notes pile up.) Don't need the textbook at all.

Kim was a great teacher and keep me interested in psychology. The class is easy, but you'll need to study a little to keep an A. You should go to class to succeed. HIs accent is a little thick at times, but you'll find it much better than the math department at OSU. A research project is mandatory.
He speaks English very well and he is pretty funny. He sometimes promises to bring students who answer questions coffee. He is also a fair grader and lets you drop a quiz or two

Very nice, and sometimes funny. Pop quizzes are specific and kind of hit-or-miss. The midterms were easy if you study his lectures. Don't need textbook, since everything is based off of his powerpoint lectures.
He is very nice, but talks very quickly. You don't need your textbook for this class. Be sure to ask him for a study guide for the midterms and you will be fine. Exams are easy!
Average teacher. But study and you'll get an A

I bought the textbook for this class and regretted it. The tests come straight from his powerpoints. Attendance isn't mandatory but he'll give out pop quizzes from time to time that you can't make up. It's pretty easy if you just go to class. His english isn't the best but he's a nice guy and the class is pretty appropriate for an intro level.
He is a very kind teacher, but the most important thing is that his class requires extra work. I recommend him if you do mind the extra research project.

Difficult to understand, spend class feverishly filling in notes pages (can't pay attn to what is being said as you want to get down what you can since he does not provide slides). Quizzes, exams very difficult. Asks lots of questions & tells those that answer why they are wrong- quite discouraging! This class  diffused my interest in psych.

Tae Hoon is an okay professor, his English is a little rough especially when learning difficult subject matter. He is  nice though and attempted to help during office hours, nothing really got accomplished. Exams are a little difficult and class is spent filling in one blank per paragraph.. pretty boring for a class that COULD be really interesting

Tae Hoon was great. He does his best to get the class involved in the material. He is very understanding and will do his best to help you get a good grade. He offered some extra credit. He has a great sense of humor and knew everyone in class by name after the first few classes. He dresses really well and is pretty darn cute. Take him!
Very easy prof, all you had to do was show up and he gave you notes to fill in the blanks.  His English needs a little work but he is adorable and is always entertaining in class.

SEI.Subject: CIVILEN
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to the Finite Element Method
